Reviews.Title: “An Island of Calm”
Reviews.Author: Warriorwriter
Reviews.Content: In the sea of chaos that is Las Vegas, The Platinum Hotel stands out as a welcome reprieve from the flashing lights and noisy, smoke-filled gambling halls. Our room was a solitaire suite with a strip view, and it was absolutely amazing. Not only was the room spotless and devoid of that stale smoke smell that plagues so many of Vegas' other hotels, but the views from the large picture window in the bedroom, and from the balcony off the living room were fantastic at night. The mountains in the distance provided a lovely backdrop for the glowing neon and LED lights of the Stratosphere, Wynn, Encore, Palazzo, Venetian, Trump and other casino hotels. Our interaction with the staff was equally impressive. Each hotel employee we encountered was attentive and courteous. Everyone from the valets, to check-in staff, to bartenders, to restaurant waiters, seemed to truly care about the experience that we were having, and went out of their way to make sure every detail was just right. I have especially high praise for the bartender at Stir Lounge, Daniel, and the waiter/bartender at the hotel's Kil@wat restaurant, Brian, for their exceptional service and positive attitudes. The Kil@wat restaurant was a tasty, if pricey, option for breakfast/brunch, and featured mammoth portions of very well-prepared breakfast staples like bacon, eggs, and pancakes. They also have a limited lunch/entree menu, but we didn't order anything other than breakfast during our stay. We skipped room service due to the abundant food offerings available near the hotel. I'd recommend stocking your own bar with beer and liquor from the AM/PM Mart right next to the hotel or from the package store across the street rather than paying the crazy prices for room bottle service. When you're ready to explore the wilder side of Vegas, the strip is only a two-block walk from the Platinum Hotel. Ballys and The Flamingo are the closest major gambling casinos, with Paris, Caesar's Palace and the Bellagio another couple blocks away. With such a perfect location in the middle of the strip, and exceptional hospitality and service, the Platinum Hotel has assured a repeat visit from my wife and me.

Reviews.Title: “Consistency”
Reviews.Author: chirotine
Reviews.Content: This will have been our 2nd stay at the Platinum. ALWAYS easy access, friendly desk hosts, clean, and the service is amazing. Good food, secluded pool area which adds for a nice private touch. We won't stay anywhere ever again in the future. (and my family lives there!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place overall, but...”
Reviews.Author: abdelnero
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Platinum for a week. It was a good location; about a 10 minute walk to the Strip near the location of Bally's and Caesar's Palace. And there are multiple buses that go up and down the Strip from there (the Deuce, the Express bus; the 202 bus goes up and down Flamingo Rd). Taxis are accessible, as well. I loved that this was a non-smoking and non-casino hotel. The room was spacious. The kitchen was equipped with the basics. I did have to request some coffee mugs, but they were provided. Complimentary coffee filter packs were provided daily (just be sure to use no more than 5 cups of water, otherwise it's too weak. And use filtered water from the fridge.). The reception staff was very pleasant and helpful, as was the concierge. We had breakfast twice at the hotel restaurant and it was delicious. My only complaint would be the housekeeping staff--it was very erratic and should have greater oversight and supervision. On some days, our room was cleaned well with ample fresh towels provided and dishes washed (in dishwasher). Other days, I noticed a dirty coffee mug placed back in the cabinet and the coffee pot was just emptied and placed back in the coffee maker without cleaning. I did have to request (twice in one day) that the bathtub be cleaned and the room vacuumed (it was getting pretty dusty). It was eventually taken care of, but I should not have had to ask in the first place. I did notice lots of food crumbs between the cabinet and the refrigerator and some small stains on the carpet. This is a lovely hotel with lots of pluses. But the housekeeping does need improvement. We enjoyed staying at the Platinum and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very disrespectful”
Reviews.Author: margaret l
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel as terrible because my experience was nothing like those listed here i recenlty attend my nice wedding on the restaurant which i helped her pick, last saturday the food and the view is espetacular breath taking but the service was very poor first there was nobody around for about 30 minutes i asked a server for ice tea they never brought it, my plate was on the table for the longest all the tables look very dirty and they were very lound on the back they were dirty mouth talking and i asked for the supervisor to let them know about this issue and for my suprise she was the one talking i felt very disrespectful very disappointed they need to provide training to the supervisor to provide a better services and a better work environment i will never recomend this place for a wedding or a special event or for somebody to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephen c Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Outstanding strip facing suite on the 14th floor which gave gorgeous sunrises over Ceasers Palace of a morning and vibrant night time views of the strip. Suite was spacious with everything necessary for the recovery needed from the double jacuzzi bath tub to the ice making fridge, if there was something missing then reception would happily supply it.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal...close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: MDL229
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Platinum for the first time. The service was great! The suites were large, clean and comfortably furnished. I had a great view of the strip. The daily turn down service was great...clean towels, made beds and washed dishes! We arrived late at night and the front desk had everything ready for us in just a few minutes. They hailed cabs for us early in the morning for our return trip to the airport. My room had a full-service kitchen stocked w/ everything needed to make meals. The pool is small and only 4 feet deep, but the sun deck is private and has comfortable seats. We were a 10-minute walk from the strip (Paris Las Vegas). The hotel was quiet. No complaints...definitely would stay there again. This is a great price for the proximity to the strip!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis amongst the madness”
Reviews.Author: luvvacurry
Reviews.Content: High quality, off-strip hotel but without the glitz, glamour and tackiness of others. We felt like valued guests and that nothing was too much trouble. It met all our expectations and more. Good points: *we 'negotiated' on arrival to be upgraded to a high floor with a Strip view. Also a great view of the sun setting at night over the mountains. *spotlessly clean and modern *good size and well fitted suite with balcony - just perfect for sitting with a glass of champers whilst marvelling at the awesome, living, breathing, dazzling display that is the Strip *great welcome call once in room to check all was ok *prompt and courteous attention when I needed help with air conditioning and the safe *other guests were friendly *no noisy and rowdy guests keeping me awake at night *blackout curtains and sound proofing *fab bathroom with big shower, double sinks and double jacuzzi bath - great to share with a loved one or, if you just want to indulge, by yourself *great fridge with built in ice-dispenser (for late night cocktails!) and ice-cold water *breakfast in hotel was competitively priced and good quality *good pool area, with lots of sun-loungers, awnings, fire-pits, and excellent supply of fresh towels available - indoor/outdoor pool is heated *friendly and accommodating staff throughout the hotel *no queuing or waiting for anything (which seems to be the norm in LV) *complimentary local newspapers, apples, and cookies at reception *two minute walk to a Seven Eleven/service station for groceries, gas [petrol] *no smoking and no casino! Things to be aware of, but not show-stoppers: *about 10 minute walk to the strip - spotted one or two homeless people near a vacant lot a couple of times but encountered no problems. Anyway, you can go through Bally's and Paris hotels for shortcut and for shops/places to eat *the view of the Strip is separated by car parks and vacant lots so appears a little scruffy *didn't offer us a child's menu at breakfast and we only found out they had one by chance - so make sure you ask for it if you have kids *the spa was quite good but fairly functional and a little pricier than what I'm used to, but it is Las Vegas! Nice strawberry massage though.

Reviews.Title: “Peace”
Reviews.Author: Piolho
Reviews.Content: If you want stay away of the noise and lights of Vegas, this is the place. Its close to most attractions and you can sleep well and with no smoke at all. The room is spacious, small kitchen with all you need for a snack or cheese/wine. Staff very friendlly and free vallet park. The room could be darker if the curtain work better. The hot tub was fantastic. To set water temperature of the shower took so long. Don't know if it was a problem of my room or if it was a general problem...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpbatman
Reviews.Content: The Platinum Hotel in Las Vegas was wonderful. We have 2 children and this place was beautiful and the rooms were huge. We ordered the princess suite that had a washer and dryer and a huge kitchen. My kids loved the jacuzzi tub and the balcony. It does not have a casino and it was very easy to get around. All parking is valet. The pool is basic, but we also didn't have to go far to get to the pool unlike other hotels in Vegas. Room service was very reasonable and good. It was a great find and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “as good as it gets in vegas”
Reviews.Author: bobster
Reviews.Content: as far as my wife and I are concerned this is THE hotel in vegas!!! Everything about this place is 10 out of 10. From the suites to the pool to the bar and staff and pricing......Yes it's off the strip but only a short walk and a great walk at that. When we got back home we kinda talked about our trip and would we go for a strip hotel next time??? NO WAY....it's nice to be off the strip away from the crowds and characters that canvas the strip.....".did you know you can get a girl in your room in 20 minutes"?.....how many times did I hear that!!!! Do yourself a favor and look no further!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Platinum Stay at a Platinum Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patt G
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better stay - April 12-16. Everything was top notch, from the staff's help prior to arrival, upon arrival and while there. Very professional, yet caring staff. All requests were honored quickly. Some we didn't even ask for, like help with a fellow traveler who had an electric cart. The staff was right there to offer assistance when the taxi service didn't show up on time. And Thank You for the air quality, it was such a relief to walk through your doors and not be overcome by the stench of cigarettes. The rooms were amazing, spacious, we all felt like we could live there. Beds were very comfy and the balconies were a bonus with a great view of the city. Next time I would probably request a mountain view. I am not a fan of Vegas but I certainly am of your hotel. Congratulations on a well run establishment, hopefully your staff (and your boss) gets to read this this review. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “EPIC HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: mzdang3
Reviews.Content: I was referred here by my cousin and I must say it is by far my best experience in VEGAS! I've stayed at many places before but I for some reason I love the vibe I got from here! As traveller's I get overly exhausted with the crowd and traffic from the casino hotel on the strip. Being a non-smoking and non-gambling hotel was a major plus for me too. Lovely big apartment like rooms were fabulous for a five night stay and was another good reason to pick Platinum. My most favorite part!! Great kitchen and bathroom!! I directly booked with the hotel manager and he fantastic! Very helpful!! Thank you so much for the late check out too!! <3 The manger and staff were absolutely great!! Great service!! Loved having a washer and dryer available. Bar downstairs very convenient when just arriving in town and looking for a snack and drink!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous huge apartment”
Reviews.Author: McBridefamily
Reviews.Content: As travellers who had never visited Las Vegas before we were glad we had booked Platinum and not a casino hotel on the strip. Being a non-smoking and non-gambling hotel was a priority for us when choosing a hotel in Vegas. Lovely big apartment like rooms were fabulous for a five night stay and was another good reason to pick Platinum. Shame I booked on booking.com and not directly with the hotel as they were the only site to have available accommodation for the dates in March and I think that is why we were on the lower floors and no complimentary internet. Loved having a washer and dryer available. Staff were great, very helpful too. Would have liked a late check out as flight left late afternoon but hotel quite full of sporting teams. Bar downstairs very convenient when arriving back about 8pm looking for a snack, great "sliders" sort of mini hamburgers. Overall great choice but can't say I ever want to visit Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe I'm missing something....”
Reviews.Author: LaneTrane
Reviews.Content: I'm seriously dumbfounded by all the rave reviews for The Platinum. We were in town for 4 days for a soccer tournament and ended up here because it was a non-smoking and non-gaming hotel. The non-gaming aspect is a whatever for me personally but the non-smoking benefit is very nice. I'll start with the good stuff.....no smoking and the staff, as mentioned in other reviews, was very nice and friendly. And that's about it for the positives. Now for the not-so-positives....even though I made rsvp's 4 months in advance for a 2 queen room, we were given an ADA room. Typically, this would be just an inconvenience as the bedroom is tiny and the bathroom is huge but the shower in the room wasn't designed for both sit down and stand up use, as most are, and was only designed for sit down use. Since we were there for 4 days/3 nights, I asked to be put in the room I reserved 4 months prior. I was told they were sold out of the room type I had reserved. Really? We took a room with a King bed and a roll-away. The room left a lot to be desired. The carpets were filthy, in desperate need of a deep clean. The shower floor was nasty, with mold and peeling caulking. The TV in the bedroom was a CRT! When was the last time you could even buy a tube TV? And yes, the TV in the main room was a flat screen but with no HD. When was the last time you even saw programming in standard definition? Maid service was sketchy too. We had to call the front desk for toilet paper, fresh towels, and tissue...twice. Then came the valet service...again the guys were nice but completely understaffed. Keep in mind that there is NO self-parking. They wouldn't allow us to call down early and have the car brought around, we had to go downstairs first and wait, and wait, and wait. As the line continued to grow the lone valet started just handing guests their keys so they could go get their own car. This hotel hasn't been touched since it was built, original carpets, furniture, and technology. Definitely would NOT stay at The Platinum again. If you want to be near the Strip stay ON the Strip. If you want to avoid the pitfalls of staying on the Strip, there is a beautiful JW Marriott about 20 minutes north on 95.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family of 5”
Reviews.Author: sands3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a large princess suite for 2 nights and found the hotel to have friendly staff, quick car valet service, clean spacious rooms and a great location only 10 mins walk from the centre of the strip. Never felt unsafe with the location. Kids loved the pool which was warm, quiet and relaxing. Great to get away from non-stop hubbub of strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueMax01
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Everyone on staff that we encountered provided first-class service including the front desk, lounge, and restaurant. The suite was beautifully decorated (modern, but not overly so) and spacious. The bathroom was the largest I have seen with an oversized Jacuzzi tub and large shower. My wife and I were able to get ready at the same time without getting in each other’s way. It even had its own closet, so one person could shower and dress without disturbing the other. The kitchen was full-size with all normal home appliances, and the adjoining living room was also quite large with an attached balcony. The hotel was a short walk from Las Vegas Blvd near Caesar’s Palace and the Bellagio and all that the famous strip has to offer. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel and know that others will enjoy it just as much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ,off Strip Hotel /Spa”
Reviews.Author: mansions
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for just under three weeks.We had stayed at the VDARA the last time/as we didn't want a smoking place/or gaming place. This was a longshot and I'm pleased to say that it was an excellent choice. The room was large(1100SF)with a huge bathroom,kitchen/washer dryer and a lovely balcony!!! We enjoyed wonderful views of the mountains.The gym was top rate/the combination of the indoor heated pool/or outdoor pool was also a benefit.The staff were amzing...really really friendly and helpful.We had two spa treatments/the steam room was out of order(so that was one slight issue...and the gym also going out of order for the last week of our stay)The room service was also very good. My only complaint...was the music in the lovely bar area(where they have happy hour from 4-8) was too loud. We will stay there again next year as it beats the VDARA on price.

Reviews.Title: “Best and friendliest staff in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: starsher
Reviews.Content: I am retired and my wife and dog have stayed at many fine hotels.We visit Las Vegas often.No matter what offer we get to stay at another hotel in Vegas we will still only stay at the Platinum Hotel. The staff is not only polite, friendly and helpful but they really care. The management respects the staff and the staff respects management which makes one big happy place . This may sound corny but it is amazing. When we arrived, a bus load of people were checking in before us. The manager gave us each a free drink for the confusion. The water in the shower was fluctuating hot and cold. We called maintenance and James the maintenance man replaced the valve in the shower wall, then rewired a floor lamp. It turns out James is a professional eclectrician and plumber and a super nice guy. The food and staff for room service were excellent. They were fast and paid attention to detail. Everytime we needed something it was taken care of quickly and we always received a follow-up call to make sure we were satisfied. The managers were readily available and approachable. Our last night in Vegas I got food poinsoning from a local restaurant and was sick all night. We needed to stay an extra night because of this and asked the manager Joseph to help. He took care of this himself, booking us another night and we didn't have to switch rooms. This place is professional and takes care of business. This is also the fastest valet in town, we never waited longer than 5-10mins for our car. The valet staff is friendly and so efficient and address by name. Every person we dealt with here was outstanding! It's rare to visit a place where everyone takes such pride in their job.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Westlife101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in May 2011 and it is the best hotel in Las Vegas. We have previously stayed in the Bellagio and Treasure Island and the Platinum is definitely number 1. We stayed in a princess suite strip view and we were overwhelmed by the size of the room and the bath. Never seen a bath so big!!! Fabulous. The room even had a washing machine and dryer which was great to be able to wash clothes. The pool is lovely with fab sun loungers but the sun does not come over the pool area until 11am due to the height of the building as the sun comes from the back of the hotel first. As mentioned we stayed in a strip view room and when we go again, we will request a mountain view room as we could hear the traffic stopping and starting at the busy junction oustide the hotel. The eillis island casino next door has a great value buffet which is fabulous. It is only a ten minute walk to the strip and you can actually take a short cut through Ballys. The hotel do happy hours which are great value. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldBecky
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Platinum. The staff were all so friendly and helpful and made us so welcome. We were staying in Vegas for our wedding and the front of house staff acknowledged this with a bottle of bubbly and chocolate covered strawberrys deliver to our room! We stayed in one of the Solitare 950sq ft rooms with strip view and the room was massive, we had a brilliant view from the 16th floor of the hotels on the strip. It was lovely to have a balcony and the kitchen facilities. We had friends and family at other hotels on the strip and no one had any facilities to make even a coffee and were forced to eat out everyday at breakfast. It was great at the platinum to have a full kitchen so we could have toast and cereal every morning. We had room service a couple of times and found the food to be great value for money and very tasty (especially the platinum breakfast) The hotel is a block and a half from the strip so only a 10 minute walk to the strip. 1 tip though is to take some flat shoes as walking up and down the strip takes a lot longer than it looks!! We' d definitely return to the platinum, as it's a smaller hotel than the ones on the strip you feel like the staff remember and look after you so well - we were even given the hotel car and driver a couple of times to take us to our destinations rather than a taxi - what great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: topfan
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my wife and I have strayed in this all-condo, non-smoking and non-gaming facility and it has once again exceeded our expectations. Our condo was immaculate and very quiet. We spent a week there, getting to know many of the staff members at least by face. Without exception they were polite, friendly and always helpful. Everyone had something nice to say, and always with a smile. We used the pool area five of the days, and for the most part it's quiet and relaxing. This is not a party atmosphere; rather a respite from the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas. The gym facility is very well equipped and I never experienced a crowd there. We tried the bar for their happy hour only once. IMO the beer selection was not good and it was easier (and cheaper) to buy our own one block away at a party store and enjoy it in the room on our balcony. My only complaint was that the parking is valet only; no self parking. Although it's "free" one feels obligated to tip every time. On the up side, the valets were extremely efficient, friendly and some even learn your name after a couple of days. If I ever return to Vegas (four times is enough sleaze for me) I'll definitely return to the Platinum. Why stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Knowing what is important to you”
Reviews.Author: Steven P
Reviews.Content: I picked the Platinum because my daughter had asked me to get a larger room for our stay instead of the standard hotel room that we had booked in previous years at the Aria, Red Rock, Westin and Venetian. I always use Trip Advisor to help with my decision and try to select the highest rated property that offers the best value. The Platinum seemed to fit that criteria. If the main purpose of your stay is to have a great room for a reasonable price, the Platinum is hard to beat. The room is set up perfectly for anyone or a family that wanted a condo like feel, The kitchen is tops, it has a great bathroom with a large jacuzzu, a very comfortable lounging area and nice TV. Internet access was included in the hotel price and there were no resort fee. In addition to the great room the next best thing about the hotel was the incredibly attentive staff. The were very accomodating. Our one meal in the restaurant was good, but they appeared to be a little understaffed and we had to walk around some until someone came out to greet us. The lounge looked cute but was mostly empty. Now here comes the but! I own a housekeeping company and notice things that others may not. Like a previous reviewer named Steve, I did not feel that the hotel was clean. The hallway carpets were not edged properly, the carpet in the room very stained and when I walked on the large tile area in the room my feet got very dirty. This is probably what caused the dirt track from the kitchen area to the bedroom. In addition, there were many spots in the carpet. When I told the room attendent about the dirty rug she was quick to get someone up to address it. When I left that night for dinner, they came in and shampooed the carpet. Impressive, but the carpet clearly needed to be replaced. The floor mats in the bathroom were frayed and should have been discarded. The water in the shower kept changing temperature making for an unpleasant shower. It reminded me of the old days of taking a shower and whenever someone in the house turned on the sink downstairs, the water changed temperature. The pool area was nothing short of a disgrace.Thank goodness the weather was unseasonably cool so that I focused on doing things other than spending time by the pool. It was probably the worst pool area that I have ever experienced while staying in Las Vegas. The chairs were rickety and worn and there was not a palm tree, flower or anything that would enhance the area. Many of the towels needed to be thrown away or used as rags. We left after spending only one hour there and $32 for two drinks. The work out area was under construction and I did not find that out until I walked around the fourth floor several times and then had to call the front desk. I was told that I had to go to the Westin to work out. The walk to the strip was far enough and through less desirable areas that I drove or took a cab whenever I went at night. During the day, it was ok but not normally the type of area that I want to spend time in. I would have graded this hotel lower for me personally, but I needed to be fair. I thought I was getting a boutique hotel but the hotel really was more about the room The room was a 5 if cleaned, but the areas that were also important to me only a 2. I met my daughter's requirements, but clearly not mine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms much cheaper than off the strip”
Reviews.Author: paterpan
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a block away from the strip and very convenient. I stayed here during new years and since pretty much all main hotels on the strip were sold out or extremely expensive I stayed here. Room service was good, and rooms come with fridge and dishwasher which was perfect because i stayed for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Off strip great location..”
Reviews.Author: BuchananPlymouth
Reviews.Content: Three night stay at Platinum. What a great place wih enormous condo style rooms. We were on the Minh floor and had a strip view. With a balcony and a large bedroom window it was a great place to look out. The food side we never fathomed out, we tried to eat in the restaurant one night but we were told we could only get food at the bar and then to one area because of the 21 year rule. Food was snarky and expensive with it. Had breakfast in room so no news on that provided. Kitchen in room was superb and the space made it feel a real treat. We got around on the bus service but if you want to get to Fremont or somewhere exact go for the express rather than the Duece which can take a long time. If you go for the day ticket it is handy to know that on the other side of the street from the hotel on East Flamingo youcan catch the bus on the same ticket one stop and you are at the main junction with caesars palace / ballagio ect. Same way stop outside Ballys drops you right outside platinum so no 15 minute walk to main strip. Think it was the 202 or similar, only one that uses East Flamingo. Staff were very impressive and helpfull. Would definitely consider using this hotel again,no smoke, no casino and no hassle. Did not get tithe pool but it did look good.

Reviews.Title: “weekend in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel. Great customer service. Great location. I will go back

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay @ The Platinum”
Reviews.Author: fontana_CAHarleymama
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay and suite #203 at the Platinum Hotel and will definitely stay here again the next time we visit the area. Our room was tastefully decorated & clean and the bed was very comfortable. The front desk and room service staff were efficient and friendly. We were a little overwhelmed when we pulled up in front of the hotel and our only choice was to valet our vehicle. Plus the valet seemed to want us to just walk away from our car after we'd been on the road all day. We wanted to get everything of value out of the vehicle first. I must say we did leave some dollar coins and later Ray-ban sunglasses in the car and neither were touched. You gotta love honest people! Valet was quick to get vehicle when we needed it so never fear. Great destination for romantic getaway. We loved soaking in the jacuzzi tub for 2. The air conditioning worked awesome. Our room/hallway was so quiet and nice. Great burgers in the bar area and fluffy, delicious hot pancakes delivered to our room in less than 30 minutes. Great location just behind Bally's. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Register to be on their email list at Platinum Hotel website like I did and receive an even better deal. We stayed Easter weekend for only $99/night. Hopefully this is helpful info!

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK AND STAY AGAIN !”
Reviews.Author: Lk2Surf
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. The employees fall over each other to make you feel welcome and leave you with a good impression. Will tell everyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wildy29
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Platinum. We stayed in an Executive Suite which was HUGE and comfortable. The only thing that would stop me giving this hotel a 5/5 was that the pool wasn't as nice as it looked in the pictures and the jacuzzi bath wasn't clean so we didn't really use it.

Reviews.Title: “I Was plesantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M
Reviews.Content: My sisters and i recently spent a weekend in the princess suite. This was our first visit to the hotel and to be honest we were a little nervous about staying off the stip. We were impressed from the moment we walked in. The hotel has a cute boutique look and the customer service was exceptional. We had an beautiful room with a great view of the strip. We took advantage of the pool and the spa and enjoyed all of it. We are going back to vegas in September for a wedding and will definitelynstay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service, fabulous room, beyond perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Mary L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I choose the Platinum because it is off the strip and we perferred a more quiet stay. From the moment we stepped in, the front desk person (Paulo) was super cordial and made us feel welcome. We were very early and they allowed us check in early. We were asked to wait a few minutes while the manager personally checked the room before we were taken to .One of the employees, John Paulol, went out of his way to help me with a problem I had downloading some show tickets I had on stored on my new Ipad , after seeing me in the lobby. He approached me and immediately offered to help, and was able to download the tickets and print them out for me. The room itself was incredible. There was a fully-and I mean fully-equipped kitchen witha stainles steel full refriegerator, stove, mircowave and super coffeepot. The whirlpool tub was to die for.The sheets and towels were great, and the bed was beyond comfortable. Hubby and I could not get over how comfy it was,The cleaners did a great job and the entire hotel is immaculate. To top it all off, one of the nights we were there, a group of people in three separate rooms had a huge group party going on very late and were extremely noisy. I called the front desk to ask for a different room as I did not want to disturb the partiers. The receptionist responded "The Platinum Hotel is not a party hotel, We will send up security immediately". WIthin 2 minutes, security arrived-went to all three rooms, and ended the problem. Apparently they have a one warning policy where when a room is warned there will not be another warning. They do not tolerate wild parties in their rooms.The security team then came and assured us if there was any other concerns, to immediately call them. The room service was excellent-and the food was more than adequate. Every single employee in that hotel went out of their way to be pleasant and nice to us, and made us feel at home.Their pool in incredible-it is outside and airy, and the lounge chairs are super huge and comfy with umbrellas and the bar nearby. Thanks also go to the front desk clerk Lena -there on Easter Sunday-and the lovely waiter early in their restaurant on Easter Sunday morning who served us breakfast cheerfully as ever. I recommended this hotel to anyone fortunate enough to book there, They give new meaning to customer service and care.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For A Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Sally W
Reviews.Content: My nephew and his fiance choose The Platinum Hotel for their wedding and they could not have made a better choice! All the family and friends stayed here and everyone was pleasantly surprised at how great it was. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and the staff could not have been more accommodating and friendly. The food was excellent and very reasonably priced.We had our dog along and she loved all the attention she got from the staff as well as having other pet friendly people around with their dogs. I highly recommend this hotel and would always choose this for any future visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic as always”
Reviews.Author: NYC E
Reviews.Content: Every time we visit Vegas, we make sure to stay at the Platinum. It's always a great homestead for several days and the service is extraordinary. Special thanks to Joseph and the concierge for the arrangements made for our special wedding weekend, they were very helpful. Our family stayed there too and were very impressed. We'll all be back for sure. The location is great, only a block off-strip and conveniently in the middle of everything we had planned. Quiet, not smoky, great service, comfortable and homey. What more could we want?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: carrmanor100
Reviews.Content: Location Fantastic. Only a block away from the Vegas strip meaning peace and quiet when you want it but still close to the action. It lies approximately halfway in relation to the strip so ideal for going to any hotel/casino. Rooms Huge. Very modern. Ours had a massive kitchen, massive bathroom (double basin, jacuzzi bath). Evan had washing machine, dryer and dishwasher. Massive LCD TV and BOSE speakers. Very good sound proofing between rooms; we returned one night, sounded like next door was having a room party (no joke, I think they were) yet once inside our room, we couldn’t hear a thing. Only slight negative would be very noisy air con - I think it woke me up a few times during the nights. Hotel Unlike most of the hotels in Vegas, this one doesn’t have a casino so therefore a lot quieter. Nice indoor/outdoor pool and Jacuzzi. Looks out onto strip. If I were to return to Vegas, I would stay at Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: Ellen D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for our 1st wedding anniversary and we loved it! It was our first trip to Vegas and we had a blast. It was nice to stay a little bit away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, but close enough to walk everywhere. The staff was really helpful. We arrived early but were able to check in, and even got a room with a view upon request. We spoke with Micheal at the front desk about it being our anniversary, and he had a bottle of champagne waiting for us in our room when we got back later. He hand wrote a really thoughtful note--that made our trip! Our room was huge, and the bathtub with the jets was a great way to relax after a long day of walking the strip. My only qualm is the sheets on the bed were not super comfortable, borderline scratchy. But the bed itself was comfy so it evened out.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a gem”
Reviews.Author: jackoperth
Reviews.Content: After looking at all the top hotels in Tripadvisor for Vegas, I decide that this look like the best choice for us and boy was I right! We stayed here because we have small children and this ticked the boxes. This would be best described as apartments rather than rooms. Rooms have a kitchen and a lounge separate from the bedroom which was great to use when the baby was asleep. There is also a small laundry hidden in a cupboard. Gorgeous heater! Our room was on the lower level with a view toward the strip and overlooking the pool. During the day the view isnt pretty, but that is Vegas for you. There is a no smoking policy but clearly people abuse that as I saw plenty of butts on the roof just past our balcony. It was pretty cold when we went so we didnt venture to the pool but it looks inviting. We also didnt use the bar area but again that looks great. We did order room service once and the food was great (try the wings!) but pricey - having said that if your not on a tight budget its fine. No casino - which I loved as we dont gamble on a regular basis.The bath in the apartment was soooo big it was great. The staff are amazingly helpful and arranged a babysitter for us from Nannys and Grannies. We had an amazing lady called Kaye P who was on the granny side and i felt sorry for her to have to deal with my active kids!, She bought books and bubbles for the kids. small minor issues was that we had internet included in our package and that wasnt activated or presented to us upon check-in but I didnt ask either. Also, the housekeeping staff didnt knock on the door before entering a couple of times. I read some people saying it is so far from the strip - if you dont like walking for more than 1 minute or mobility impaired, you may need to look elsewhere but seriously the walk is not that bad. As far as feeling safe on the walk, I found walking during the day more daunting as there are a fair few homeless people in Vegas and they openly ask you for donations. I enjoyed the walk - especially after all the food we ate at Ellis Island next door! OMG the ribs...yum! While your here, check out and book in advance "Dig This" its amazing for men and women. Getting back to the Hotel, one night we went to see Jersey Boys (again fantastic) and the taxis were very slow so one of the staff drove us in the company car - gave them a tip which i would have given to the taxi - what service, we got there in the nick of time! This was our first trip to Vegas so we did checkout some of our other choices and guess what, we will be sticking to the Platinum and will recommend it to others. Well done Platinum, your doing all the right things

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay and good time”
Reviews.Author: Slowhand1527
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights, checking in on a Friday. The staff here are excellent. Everyone is kind, courteous, friendly, and very helpful in whatever you need. I had requested an upgrade if possible. Joe at the front desk was helpful in providing one on Monday. My suites were great, the first one was wonderful, but the Marquise Suite is awesome! I've stayed in it before, and had a great time again. The food and drinks are always good here as well, and there are stores and various things within walking distance. Cabs or the hotel car are available too. I know I'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kristesk
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Platinum Hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a fantastic room. Joseph who worked at the front desk was helpful and professional. We will definately stay at the hotel again when we are back in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Full - Kitchens!”
Reviews.Author: twins5300
Reviews.Content: Since my friend had a connection - we got the deal of a lifetime and stayed here. The 2100 sf 2 BR huge (doesn't describe it) unit with 2 balconies was wonderful. Since we got it for a fraction of the price I can't really complain. BUT if I were to have paid full price ($399 a night) for this unit I would have said I was extremely disappointed. Mostly due to it's appearances. I arrived on a Sunday morning to a beautiful modern looking facility, however the glass doors that greet you were noticeably smudged and finger printed all over - which a little windex would have cleared up in minutes. They were like that most of the day too. The door men stand around outside talking/smoking. Check in was great - they even offered me free wifi We had time to kill before the room was ready so we checked out the SPA and was disappointed - curtains and just a desk? You couldn't get a feel for it at all so we passed. We had lunch at the restaurant by the pool which as delightful - you could sit outside if you wanted. Friendly wait staff. The pool area looked as if the party around the fire pit from last night hadn't been cleaned up yet. Cushions have on/off and untied. Rather messy out there with cups and stuff blowing around - and it was 10am. When our room was ready (we got early check in) we headed up. As spacious as it was the cleaning staff had done a sub-par job. It smelled as if they used a dirty rag on the kitchen floor. Carpet was frayed at the edge where it met the ceramic tiled foyer. Cushions not put on the couch properly (zipper side exposed), lint on cushions as if they had just been flipped them over. We had a full/washer dryer in the unit - baths were huge and ADA ready. The curtains were coming off the hooks and several were broken and just darn right falling off their bar. They had nice sheers under the drapes so you could have some privacy without total darkness. The balcony had a nice little metal table and four chairs but someone had spilled a red-drink on the concrete and it was never cleaned up - and very sticky. There were also several beer bottles still sitting on the floor of the balcony. Cleaning never even bothered to go and look out there (obviously). I found several plastic things on the floor - that were pulled off new clothes (to hold the tag) so their vacuums did a very poor job. The bed skirt was hanging longer on one side then the other too. It just seemed like cleaning did a 1/2 way job and rushed. The hallways throughout the building needed vacuuming badly. It's unfortunate because the place just looks 'worn' for how nice it is. The place needs some deep cleaning, light painting and curtain repairs for sure. The next day cleaning stopped by at 5pm to clean the room! Unbelievably late in the day and we told her to just skip it - why bother! I think they are run on a small cleaning crew - otherwise the place would be immaculate. From what I gather it was a CONDO sales type building where you would buy the units but when all of them didn't sell they decided to make them into Hotel rentals. If you have kids and need great space and a nice kitchen - this is the place for you. It's 2 blocks from the strip and an easy walk, but you go through open area to get there (strewn with empty beer bottles and wrappers). One block closer would have been better but just a few blocks off the strip and it gets dirty We even saw a dead-beat sleeping under the bushes in the vacant lot next door (I guess that's Vegas!). The view from our balcony was very nice as the sunset and the strip started to light up (def want to stay on Strip side of building). I saw parking ramp/garage but do not know if it's additional money. The bar on the first floor looked high class - however, we never did stop in there. Overall - be prepared to get a lot of room but not a lot of cleanliness. Beds were great! Towels good - the normal ratings would apply to this place on that kind of stuff. Coffee Maker - dishes/silverware - large fridge, dishwasher/full oven and microwave. Granite countertops. Huge dining room table seats 8-10 people. Was done very high-end - but now is looking it's age!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough . . .very rough”
Reviews.Author: Eri H
Reviews.Content: The hotel feels understaffed and not well kept. The room configurations are fantastic. However, the televisions are outdated and unreliable. The housekeeping is careless and poorly done. If you're planning on staying a while, you may want to bring in your own cleaning supplies. The water that comes from the pipes smells like rotten eggs or sulphur. It certainly doesn't lend to feeling you're in a clean environment.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent stay, believe the reviews. Just consider the location”
Reviews.Author: theposh
Reviews.Content: Just had 4 nights here and pretty much all good. Must be my 25 ish trip to LV. Stayed at a few places over the years and also have had a separate night at the end of my trip in downtown for a different experience. As far as the strip area hotels concerned my last few visits have been New York New York and Signature. The latter being more comparable to the Platinum. All the reviews about the room quality are exactly right, the rooms are huge and well laid out. The massive breakfast counter was perfect for my notebook and laying out my stuff, loved it while enjoying a coffee or snack. I have the Princess suite but looking now at the floor plans they dont seem to much different from the solitaires so may do that next time. Having a washer / dryer in the room was brilliant, I work out at the gym 2 x day so being able to wash my own stuff was just great. The non smoking aspect is not to be overlooked and a big plus is a state that still is pretty open about smoking. Having free valet parking was good too and I never had to wait more than a couple of minutes. My only small gripes would be 1- The gym is ok, Startrac equipment but not in the best order and the cross trainers took a little work. I used to work with these so now what I'm doing. The entertainment system is a little poor to with just 3 channels to the tv's one of which was not working right. I was pretty much alone though so unlike some hotels where you're fighting for equipment there were no issues here. Its one of the few areas I can think that the Signature scores mush higher, its gym is exceptional. 2- I was on the 6th floor by the dreaded fans, these kicked in and you knew about it, otherwise there was no noise at all and you're not far from the pool and no issues, would have wanted to be a little higher. 3- Some may well be bothered by the location. The comment by a previous reviewer about 7/11 is spot on, you will pass a few folk that you really would like to avoid, shows the less glitzy side of LV and I never felt in any trouble but if I had my wife with me she would not be happy passing these people right by the hotel. Its about 10 minutes to Bally's the nearest main strip hotel. Most strip hotels it can take a while just to get to the front door / outside, at the Platinum at least you are not wading through acres of casino so I doubt the time factor was a huge difference. Again compared to the Signature you had a massive walk there to get to the strip but it was all covered and totally safe. So I'm not sure which I would go back to on a future trip. Alone - then the Platinum and with my wife then possibly the Signature but both are decent choices if you prefer to have a room with more ammenities than a plain hotel room and want to be just a little away from the actual casino.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spring Get Away”
Reviews.Author: twodadsupnorth
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at while in Vegas. We will definitely be back. We travelled with our 7 year old son, and it is so nice to have a smoke-free hotel to stay at with your children. We all loved the pool as well. The water was a bit cool the first day we were there, but then they warmed it up considerably for the remainder of our stay. We had a wonderful time in the pool. The rooms are remarkable--especially if you manage to get a corner room (they have expansive entry ways that make the room feel rather palatial). The shower and double jetted tubs are great after a day of walking around Vegas. The full kitchen is appreciated when traveling with a family, as is the in suite washer and dryer (How do kids manage to get so much food on their clothing so quickly?) You get a nice view of the strip if you are on that side, and I would recommend it. We were very pleased with the service at the front desk, and with the free wifi access. It is a quick walk to the strip--we did it daily with our son. We walked back to the hotel nightly as well and never felt unsafe at all. It is very fast to get on the monorail system as well--the first entrance to Bally's will get you very near the monorail. There are a number of convenience stores near the hotel where you can get items for your in suite kitchen--7/11 and another one across the street. As well, a few of the drug stores on the strip have fairly expansive grocery departments where we were able to stock up. We saw a number of shows while in Vegas on this vacation. All were wonderful for us and our son--Love, Blue Man Group and Le Reve. Thanks Platinum for a fantastic get-away. We will see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: JimB1966
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay at The Platinum Hotel in Las Vegas for four nights. My son's soccer team was playing in Las Vegas and our whole team was booked into the Platinum hotel. We had two queen sized beds, a full kitchen and a balcony overlooking the strip. The bathroom was spacious and included a whirlpool. It felt like I was renting a condo. They offer valet parking to a attached parking garage with the attendants speedy and very friendly. The restaurant hours seemed odd to me. They closed at 2:00p.m. I'd stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: PaulC01
Reviews.Content: Very nice suite, friendly helpful staff, excellent quality bed, beautiful big bathroom, no parking hassles. Breakfast was quite good at a reasonable price. The fitness centre is well equipped. Even the room service menu was good. The only thing that might be a consideration for some folks is the walk to the strip. It is direct and only a couple of blocks for about 12-15 minutes, but there is a short space past an empty lot that I didn't like at night. But cabs are quick and the trip is short, so we walked during the day when there were plenty of others on the street and cabbed at night. Our reservations were in place at the agreed price and check-in was quick. It is not a full service big hotel, so you have to expect a bit less, but for the price it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for an extended stay”
Reviews.Author: interplanetary
Reviews.Content: Yes there are many great reviews already about The Platinum Hotel.  I have a couple of things to add to what people have already said.   The hotel is very quiet which is fantastic as it is a perfect escape from the frenzy of the Las Vegas strip.  You will not hear a thing in your room and will have a great night's sleep here.  They are adamant about their non-smoking policy so don't even think about staying here if you plan on smoking.  You will automatically be charged a $500 fine even for smoking on the balcony and the fine is not negotiable.  For me, this was a fantastic policy as I suffer from severe asthma.  Most hotels say their rooms are non-smoking, but I always find them to smell of smoke anyway.  There is no casino which is a plus.  You really feel like you're staying in a quiet apartment building, it turns out that some of the units are actually condos.  This is far more than just a room, it is a one bedroom apartment with a full washer/dryer and a full refrigerator with an oven and a cook-top.  There are many supermarkets nearby, so you are not forced to eat out all the time which is also a great perk. There are a couple of cons that have been mentioned before, but not very frequently.  I do not recommend walking around this area at night.  The 7-eleven is next door to the hotel, so we ran over to get some supplies and were shocked at the people both inside and outside the store.  There were many edgy fringe characters on the street around the hotel.  I decided to drive the 3 minutes to the strip after this, even in the day time.  The second issue I have is just a matter of personal taste.  I disliked the decor in the room.  I know a lot of people have described the rooms as plain or neutral.  All I can say is BEIGE, BEIGE, BEIGE.  Every surface is beige, the walls, the carpet, the tiled floor all beige, it almost feels institutional.  The art in the room is sparse and bland as well.  The rooms are fabulously huge, the amenities incredible, they even have a Bose Wave radio in the living room and large flat screen televisions in the bedroom and the living room.  On the other hand a lot of people come to Vegas expecting a spectacle in their hotel room, instead this room is all about neutral and quiet.  I personally didn't like the taste in furniture or decor at all, it feels much more like furnished corporate housing to me. This all said, would I stay here again, absolutely.  I have stayed at all the fancy flashy hotels in Vegas and if given the choice I would definitely choose to stay at The Platinum again.  This was the first time that I've had a decent night's sleep on any trip I've taken to Vegas.  The convenience of having a full kitchen, massive amounts of space and absolute quiet is completely worth  it to me.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because of the decor and the nasty vibe on the street outside, also it would be great if the hotel had a shuttle to the strip. One last comment, the service here is incredible.  The valet parker noticed that we came into the hotel with groceries.  He immediately told the front desk to send pots and pans up for us to cook with.  A couple of minutes later there was a knock at the door with the delivery and then believe it or not, a couple of minutes after that, the front desk called to make sure that we had received everything we needed and if there was anything else they could help us with.  Everyone you deal with here is polite and thoughtful, such a refreshing surprise. (One important tip:  book through the website of The Platinum.  Not only do they give a AAA discount, but more importantly if you book through them you get free wireless internet in your room and also believe it or not an unheard of 2pm checkout!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Next time I will make no mistake, and stay here for my entire trip!”
Reviews.Author: barbsab88
Reviews.Content: OH MY GOSH. This place is to die for. It is off of the strip, but hardly! When I first walked in i was very impressed with the conversation I had with the lady at the front desk. She was very accommodating, kind and funny. I wish I could remember her name so that I could compliment her specifically, she had me so impressed! She offered late check out of 4pm without me asking. I declined due to a flight in the morning, but how nice that would have been if I could take it! Once we got settled with our keys my boyfriend I headed to the suite, opened the door and were instantly taken aback! It was so incredibly spacious with an absolutely gorgeous full kitchen with utensils, large living room, bedroom and beautiful bathroom - the bathroom had a jetted tub!!!!! and a shower. The jetted tub was perfection after all that you encounter in Vegas, my body was dying but the tub was the trick I needed - too bad I wasn't staying here my entire week and a half in Vegas! The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is quiet, looks brand new, no casinos, everything is spic and span. The refrigerator was so helpful with leftovers. It was annoying to have to pay extra for one at other hotels. My only dislike was the valet parking. I can't handle valet. I need to go to my car constantly and I want to get it myself. Plus I would rather get my own car than constantly tip different people to get it for me 5 times a day. I booked through a third party and got a low rate. I don't care what the rate is next time I come to Vegas - I will book through them at full price! AMAZING!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Real hotel...”
Reviews.Author: monkey567
Reviews.Content: This is a real hotel in Vegas, non smoking, no casino, great food, short walk to the strip with excellent pool and daily happy hour at the pool. Large clean rooms and great staff. Will stay there everytime from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: bella2130
Reviews.Content: Our room was above all expectations 1100 square feet of wow! The spa bath was to die for... Just a short walk to the strip but not amongst the hustle and bustle, which can get too much after a couple of days. Especially with children. The staff were always polite and helpful, especially the Manager Derek, who always went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one. Joseph at front desk was also fantastic, he was always smiling and very helpful. Would definitely reccomend this hotel to everyone! Will be back for sure :)

Reviews.Title: “Platinum experience”
Reviews.Author: Deborah97
Reviews.Content: A top place, friendly staff, lovely clean room and bath tub was sensational. It was easy to get to the strip and nice that bit was out of the noise and bustle. I would recommend it to anyone wanting a spacious room and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “You will want to return to this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrJamie
Reviews.Content: If you hate smoke, but love Vegas, stay here! Behind Ballys center strip, platium has no smoking and no gaming. We paid $99 for an amazing room and no daily fees. Valet parking was incl. and soooo easy. This hotel is super modern with huge rooms and expansive views. Bathrooms are super large, can b accessed frm livingroom or bedroom, have Jacuzzi tubs and glass enclosed shower. Seperate bedroooms, livingroom and full kitchen with everything you need to make meals snacks and drinks incl. big fridge w icemaker. Staff is great with checkin and whatever you need. Happy hour frm 4-8 in the lobby bar w live music. After drinks and appitizers, we took taxis to dinner and clubs so everyone could have fun. But when we decided we had enough, we came back to our big room in our quiet, clean hotel. Will def be back!

Reviews.Title: “You will want to return to this Smoke free, reasonable priced, modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DrJamie
Reviews.Content: If you hate smoke, but love Vegas, stay here! Behind Ballys center strip, platium has no smoking and no gaming. We paid $99 for an amazing room and no daily fees. Valet parking was incl. and soooo easy. This hotel is super modern with huge rooms and expansive views. Bathrooms are super large, can b accessed frm livingroom or bedroom, have Jacuzzi tubs and glass enclosed shower. Seperate bedroooms, livingroom and full kitchen with everything you need to make meals snacks and drinks incl. big fridge w icemaker. Staff is great with checkin and whatever you need. Happy hour frm 4-8 in the lobby bar w live music. After drinks and appitizers, we took taxis to dinner and clubs so everyone could have fun. But when we decided we had enough, we came back to our big room in our quiet, clean hotel. Will def be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth841
Reviews.Content: We were in search of a hotel that would accommodating a gathering of about 45 people this past weekend. My husband and I were married and we wanted to keep the cost down but still have fun. We looked around the strip for a suite that would accommodate this and were not able to find one till we came across the Platinum hotel. From the reservations to the check out they were amazing. When Jimmy walked us up to our room and opened the private entrance for us I was wow'd. The master bedroom and bath were so huge, well laid out and welcoming. The bed provided us the best sleep we had in a long time. Walking into the living space I couldn't believe how nice it was. I was ready to move in. The second bedroom was as nice as the master just slightly smaller. The bathrooms with double Jacuzzi tubs were over the top. Granite counters in the kitchen, huge couch and a view of the strip to take your breath away. Made for perfect group pictures that evening. The staff really did take good care of us, when we needed our baggage picked up I was surprised how quickly they were able to get to our room. My flowers were delivered and they had them and contacted me as soon as they arrived. Smoke free made it that much better. After walking through smoked filled casinos and the strip to come back for some fresh air was perfect. Thank you all Platinum staff for truly making my weekend perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: PMD34950
Reviews.Content: Very courteous and friendly service. Rooms were clean and amenities were well thoughtout. Not on the strip but within somewhat reasonable walking distance. Recieved timely taxi service when venturing out of the immediate area. Overall great experience. Would stay there on any future visits to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great off strip hotel for GREAT price!”
Reviews.Author: Hilliford
Reviews.Content: Booked a stay here for 4 nights during March. It was my first time to Vegas so i wanted to do it big. I wanted a hotel that had NICE 1 bedroom suites without a hotel casino. Hotels with casinos are too noisy for me. I booked the princess suite with a strip view. The room had a full kitchen a living room and a separate bedroom and a bathroom with jets. The room also came with a balcony with an amazing view (I was on the 17th floor) so you could go outside without having to go all the way to the first floor. This was was easily one of the best hotel rooms I have ever had, and with an average rate of $200 a night I don't think you can get a nicer suite anywhere in Vegas. I enjoyed every minute in the room and the hotel also has a bar and a spa and room service. The bell boys are real nice and hold doors and carry your bags and will hail a cab every time you ask for one with no complaints. The ONLY downside I found to this hotel was my steak I ordered from the restaurant in the hotel, it was burned on the edges. Also it is about a 5 minute drive or a 15 minute walk from the strip, so unless your're driving or ready to walk about 15-20 minutes to the strip be ready to pay a cab $10 per ride to and from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the big room and huge bathtub!”
Reviews.Author: travelhonu
Reviews.Content: At first they put us in a queen room, but once I talked to the front desk they were nice enough to move us into the king bed room, which I thought we had requested but maybe not. The rooms are huge with a living room and kitchen, nice balcony and the biggest bathtub I have ever seen. It's not on the strip, but it is within walking distance to go out at night. The room was very clean, and the decor pretty updated and nice. The pool area was sunny and inviting with a restaurant as well. Our room was at the very end of the hallway and it was SO quiet! Got a great night's sleep. Would definitely stay here again, especially since we got a good deal through SniqueAway.

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: geeman123
Reviews.Content: After reading for months on reviews of several hotels we finally decided to go with the Platinum for our 1st trip to vegas, March 15th - 19th. Mainly choose because of the smoke free, as wife has bad asthma and can't stand the smell of smoke. We arrived very late at the hotel 130 am...check in person "Mina" I think her name was very nice asked for a late checkout since our plane was leaving at 6 pm she gave us a 2 pm checkout awesome...we reserved a solitare suite with strip view. Hallways was nice, not sure why people complain about carpet. Pros Nice employees-house keeping was nice, saw her in the hall asked if we can have robes since room didn't have any she got some quickly, everyone you walked past greeted you.. Room- jacuzi tub, huge kitchen, balcony(was to cold to stay out on balcony to long, not used to cold weather) Location-liked the fact that we can get away from the madness of the strip and relax. Ellis island is right next door they have awesome food at the 24/7 cafe..best fish and chips i ever ate.. Used the gym on the 5th floor..was ok..lots of equipment..free weights..treed mills..liked being the only one working out..they provide free towel and head phones.. 7-11 next door..stocked up on Rockstar drinks and beers...lots of homeless around but they don't give you any problems.. Con's Got woken up at 430 am by the phone telling was my wake up call? I didn't order that..call front desk to ask whats up, said they will make a note that i don't want that. No apology nothing. do they do that for everyone? Order room service for breakfast..got the platinum breakfast eggs,bacon,pancakes.. wife got a omelette..food was horible..omelette was burnt, pancakes was cold and they didn't give syrup or butter..who eats pancakes with no syrup? didn't want to wait for any so i ate it. worst meal i had in a long time..and i am not a picky person but this was junk.should have went to ellis island.. Strip view was a bit blocked...straight ahead was a electrical lot..partial strip view was to the left other then those 2 things Platinum is a good hotel..i would stay here again but would like to try other hotels next time like signature,vdara..

Reviews.Title: “Over the top service.”
Reviews.Author: lakemom3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times now and still find it hard to beat. Location is close to my convention within walking distance. I like the restaurant with the view of the pool and Las Vegas strip. I can eat a healthy meal with quick service with a smile from Jeff. The service is fantastic. From getting show tickets to printing boarding passes. Why stay anywhere else? Plus always fast service. Clean no bedbugs and I check for that. So keep up the outstanding job. Would like to see coffee downstairs in the morning though. That would.be nice. I like the water with fruit though. Very spa like. Thanks for exceptional service guys.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: OGONTOUR
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days in the Platinum Hotel during Christmas and New Year. We had spent a lot of time researching suitable hotels in Vegas prior to our stay and finally decided on the Platinum ... with no resort fees, no smoking, no casino, within walking distance of the strip and great value rates it really was an easy decision in the end. We booked a Princess Suite Strip View Room. It was late evening when we checked in. It cost $20 incl tip for taxi from airport (no tunnel). We were allocated a room on the 16th Floor with amazing views of the Strip. Our suite was great ... good size kitchen and living space and balcony. Our bedroom was huge ... two queen beds and an abundance of space. The bathroom was even bigger with separate bath and shower, double sinks and closet space. A washer/dryer just off the kitchen. We really were very happy that it lived up to our expectations. There was also free WiFi. After we had a look around and freshened up we went to the 7 Eleven Store next to the hotel to buy some food for breakfast etc. It really was well stocked and we got all we needed. We really saved money by making our breakfast every morning in our room. I have a bad back and so I didn’t find the beds especially comfortable. On Christmas Morning there was homemade cookies and a candy can hanging from our door handle which was such a lovely surprise and a nice touch. We have been away a few Christmas and no hotel we stayed in has ever done anything like that. It took us no more than 15 minutes to walk to the Strip from the hotel. On one or two evenings it did become a bit of a pain to walk back again but once you got back to the hotel to the peace and quiet it was worth it. I used the gym once, I had great intentions but I think walking up and down the Strip is a work out enough! It was well equipped with treadmill, weights, stair master etc. Our room wasn’t cleaned on one of the days of our stay which was very odd because I took the ‘do not disturb’ sign off our door when we were leaving in the morning but when we returned there was another ‘do not disturb’ sign hanging on our door and the one I took off was inside where I left it. We had a great views of most of the fireworks on the Strip from our balcony on New Years Eve. It really was amazing. The fire alarm went off new years day morning at 4am and we had to evacuate the hotel – 16 floors and once we got to the bottom we were told it had been sorted. All in all we really enjoyed our stay in the Platinum. I would seriously recommend this hotel to family and friends if they were visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Our Platinum experience.”
Reviews.Author: Mary F W
Reviews.Content: During our stay at the Platinum was the greatest (smoke free)! Everyone we met was respectable & courteous. Our room was beautiful & spacious with a nice view. Food and room service (Alejandra & Juan Carlos) were amazing, making sure we were satisfied with service and the food was always nice & hot when delivered. Valet parking was the best too (Henry & Julian) handled our vehicles and took very good care of them (without a scratch). These 2 gentlemen were quick and courteous (opening & closing the car doors for us). They made our stay feel special. The Platinum staff treated us like we were first class. It will be our pleasure to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Quality and Service”
Reviews.Author: ts1052
Reviews.Content: We literally just got back from 4 nights at The Platinum and are very happy we discovered this property. Everything about it is first class, the service is amazing and we were treated like valued guests by everyone we encountered. We have been visiting Las Vegas at least once a year since 1986, and this is by far the most wonderful experience we have had. We were upgraded to a Princess suite and it was fabulous, clean, comfortable and had spectacular views. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious and Smoke Free”
Reviews.Author: TravCT2
Reviews.Content: Platinum suites are enormous and not having a casino or smoking you do not have to walk the gauntlet of smoke and banks of slot machines to get to the hotel. Had trouble with the main light switch in the room but the repair was made promptly. Breakfast was overlooking the large pool patio area and servers tried hard to meet the demand. Front desk staff and bell staff were helpful. Got a lift to the airport when taxis were scarce. Hotel is a bit of a walk from the strip but easily doable. Room was quiet and well appointed. All in all a great experience and would do it again in a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: The Innocent Man
Reviews.Content: The history of this building explains why the rooms are so large ... it was intended to be a high-end apartment block before the recession halted construction, and the building was subsequently converted into a hotel. Sadly, the internal finishes weren't installed before the apartment project was cancelled … the hotel chain provided basic, but not luxurious fixtures and fittings – I guess it’s like being one rung above an Embassy Suites on the hotel ladder. Nevertheless, the rooms are clean and well stocked for anyone wanting to self-cater, and the staff courteous and helpful. The location isn’t bad either … a leisurely 10 minute walk to the fountains at the Bellagio. Unquestionably, the best thing about this hotel is the cost of staying there … for Las Vegas, this hotel is exceptionally cheap and excellent value for money. Provided the pricing policy doesn’t change, this hotel will remain a popular choice.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS STAY”
Reviews.Author: azjd17
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Platinum Resort in Las Vegas, stayed 3 nights. Cannot say enough nice things about this property and the staff. We are seasoned travelers and stay at many, many 4 & 5 star resorts and this is the best place we have ever stayed!!! The condos are lovely and CLEAN but the staff is what makes it the best place we have ever stayed. They are helpful, knowledgeable, friendly and the best trained ever. Love that it is non smoking and just 1 block off the hussle of the strip, very easy walk. Stay here and you will not be disappointed. FABULOUS STAY!!! Planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Large, gorgeous suite for very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: OutdoorExplorers
Reviews.Content: Huge, well-appointed space with luxurious bathroom. Good room service food. Nice exercise and pool facility. Very pleasant and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Comfortable Retreat”
Reviews.Author: JCTNGAL
Reviews.Content: Our family booked a 1 bedroom condo (1605) for 4 nights in March 2012. Before arriving, I talked with the General Manager, Mr. Morrison, who answered all of my questions. Upon arrival, we found a very clean condo with 2 queen beds in the bedroom, a sleeper sofa in the living area, full kitchen, and large bathroom. What we enjoyed the most was the peace and quiet after a busy day on the strip. We didn't have to walk through a smoke filled casino and the whole property is smoke free. The front desk manager, Joseph McGovern, attended to all of our needs and so did the rest of the staff...housekeeping, valet, etc. Do not book here if you are looking to have loud parties. It is not tolerated! We were thrilled with everything at the Platinum. It is a half mile walk to the strip, but that was not an issue for us. Also, our view of the city was beautiful at night.

Reviews.Title: “I Wish Our 3-day Visit Were 30 days. Spacious, quiet, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cdiven23
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at properties up and down the Strip, this second visit to the Platinum pretty well convinced us to look no further. We stayed three nights and felt like we could have easily stayed 30 more. Having a full kitchen, big bedroom, living room with queen-sized sofabed, and a bathroom with jacuzzi tub-for-two and separate shower with easily adjustable spray made it feel much more like a place to live than just a place to crash. Did I mention the balcony that's big enough for a table and four chairs. We asked for an East-facing room, because we prefer the sunrise to the Striprise. Considering that we stayed over the weekend of NASCAR, NCAA basketball, and a big grappling tournament (not to mention a couple dozen minor conventions), it was as though we had the world to ourselves. The room was very quiet and restful, even though it's a 10-minute walk from the Strip. We hiked down the street to The Flamingo one evening for a light deli meal (eating by the flamingo fountain in the garden), then rode the Monorail up and down, just because it's there. We are former locals who ignored the Monorail for 5 years, but decided to try it as tourists. Got that checked off our list. Still it was a very easy walk back from the Paris/Bally's Monorail stop to the Platinum. This time we availed ourselves of the indoor-outdoor pool (on the 5th floor), and the nicely equipped fitness center. Since we last stayed at the Platinum, we had both become gym rats, and it was great to continue our fitness habits in between eating at our Las Vegas favorites. I lost count of how many pleasant, positive encounters I had with the staff, whether calling for an extra blanket for the sofabed, or with a question about the thermostat, the response was always friendly and professional. I think I met most of the parking valet staff over the course of 3 days, and they were also unfailingly courteous and helpful. The restaurant (for Sunday morning breakfast) overlooks the pool and deck, and we found the menu to be a little limited, but perfectly adequate. Our food was very tasty, well-presented, and reasonably priced, by Las Vegas standards. Bruno, the head server, made sure everything was right, even when he was obviously very busy. If you want noise and smoke and flashing lights and staggering patrons, then you probably don't want the Platinum. If you want spacious comfort, convenience to the Strip, unfussy elegance, value-for-money, and a friendly, attentive staff, then give the Platinum a try. Maybe we'll see you there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Large comfortable suite”
Reviews.Author: redwing99
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Platinum. We were looking for property and it was an ideal way to search various areas of Las Vegas. Paulo at the front desk smiled when we looked at several possible suites. Arriving on Wednesday night gave us many possibilities. His affable approach allowed us to upgrade to a strip view. The suite experience with spacious areas, the hot tub invigorated us, and convinced us to return in the future. We ate several meals in the room to enjoy the view .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not likely to return.”
Reviews.Author: Geoff R
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Vegas, and we had a group of 6 guys together for a bachelor party. We wanted everybody to have a bed, and to stay at a nice place without spending a fortune, and thought we had found the perfect place in The Platinum, as we got all that plus a full kitchen for $129 per room per night (Travelzoo rate). It was almost exactly what we had hoped for. Let me explain. The service at the front desk was fine. Checked in fresh off the plane at around 1pm with no problems (advertised check-in time was 4pm). Was upgraded to the bigger suites with washer/dryers in them. Non-strip view, but that was no big deal as the strip view from the pool was neat but nothing amazing. Rooms were nice, but the tube TV in the bedroom stands out like a sore thumb and the shower just would not get hot enough (this was an issue in both rooms). But those are nitpicks.
