No resort fees, wifi worked fine in the lobby, the beds were terrific, assortment of pillows, room temp. easy to control, blackout curtains nice for those hungover mornings, large bathroom, safe was easy to use, somebody brought us pots and pans up right away once we got up to our rooms, valet staff were really helpful, baggage storage on our last day was efficient, and they even took us someplace in their housecar (SUV) because we were going to have to call 2 cabs being a group of 6, as long as we took care of the driver with a tip, which we gladly did. The issue, and it's really the only issue, is the location. It wasn't even the walk (which is super easy- one crosswalk, then 400m to the Bally's side entrance) or the neighborhood (a couple homeless people outside the adjacent 7-11 almost every time we walked by, but they were harmless and thankful for spare change/stray can of Bud). It's that it's not right on the Strip. And yes, we knew this 100% going in, so it was not a surprise, and we were prepared for it, and I know it might seem silly to complain about it when there were numerous strip options available to us, and we picked The Platinum instead. It's just that after being in Vegas, we truly underestimated the advantages of being right on the Strip, as well as the quality of some of the so-called "lesser" casinos like Treasure Island, Flamingo, Luxor, Excalibur, NYNY, and some of the other lower to mid-priced options. We walked through all of those places and while they weren't The Mirage or The Wynn or The Cosmo or The Venetian, they were still way nicer than I thought they were going to be. The only room we saw was one we partied in at NYNY, and it was about on par with our at The Platinum, just smaller and without a kitchen. Yes, we would have had to pay resort fees and maybe get 3 rooms instead of 2, and we couldn't have made eggs and bacon in our room each morning, But being able to stumble down to any number of casinos/shows/restaurants from your room in less than 5 minutes would have been invaluable, for about the same amount of money. Bottom line, stay at The Platinum if you're familiar with Vegas and/or exactly where it's located. Or if you NEED a full kitchen for dietary reasons. Or if you know ABSOLUTELY that you don't need/want to stay on The Strip. Or if you're with a big budget-minded group of 3-6 people and want to split one room. Just know that none of our group would ever NOT stay on The Strip again, and that is not a strike against The Platinum. One more thing. Ellis Island Casino and Brewery is a gem. Don't miss the steak dinner special for $9.99, and if the outdoor grill is running when you're there, do that also. Half chicken/full rack of ribs/or chicken-rib combo for ~$15, with 4 sides. Awesome. The karaoke bar was full of goofy/drunk/local-Vegas energy, pus the home brews are crazy good. The hefeweisen is just about the best I've ever had. The casino is a little smoky, but they have $5 eight-deck blackjack that id dealt without a continuous shuffler, and the crew running the $5 craps table were awesome in teaching us the rules of the game as we played. So much fun- if craps intrigues you but you're intimidated about playing/learning, saddle up to Ellis Island and give it a shot. Never had so much fun gambling. It's a bit of a dive but there was just something great about it.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda B
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Platinum in Las Vegas and glad I did. Normally we always stay on the strip but found a good deal on the Platinum and thought will give it a try. Very nice new rooms which were big suites with nice view of the strip. All the staff was so friendly and accommodating. Very short walk to the strip. Hotel was right behind Ballys so good location in the center of the strip. I will for sure recommend this place to friends and family and stay again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Amazing Rooms, Really Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: Trevor G
Reviews.Content: Everything about the stay was great. We were able to check in early and they granted our requests of high floor and 2 queen beds. The room was soooo nice. I loved the jetted tub in the bathroom. The strip view at night is amazing. The place is really nice and I recommend it to everybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “We are going back!”
Reviews.Author: bowbelle62
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful hoilday staying at The Platinum in 2010 that we are going back in 3 weeks time and we can't wait. Could not find a fault with this hotel. So see you on the 31st Platinum cant wait.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shaun S
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great! The staff was very kind and helpful. Brian (pool) and Trinity (Concierge) really go out of their way to make sure you are having a great vacation! However, I do wish they would upgrade their beds. In most hotels, now days, you are sure to have a wonderful bed. It would've just been nice to have the sleeping experience been as wonderful as the suite and staff.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE APARTMENT”
Reviews.Author: MJRAust
Reviews.Content: Huge apartment, very well decorated. Separate bedroom and lounge room, washer dryer great after a few days on the road, in wall flame heater a nice touch. A 10 minute walk from the strip, keeps you fit, don't think I'd want to do it often in the middle of summer. Nice to be able to get away from the crowds on the Strip. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KarenArmstrong_BC
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decent sized apartment style hotel, close enough to the strip to walk most places. Valet is the only option but usually that means your car is safe. Check in was nice, only one person on duty though. Housekeeping service was perfect. Room was quiet. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that they have an energy efficient thing in the rooms so our lights, heating and a/c/ did not work. We called twice and the maintenance man had to disable the energy thing but then our room was freezing all the time. Pool chairs are gross. The bartenders were not friendly so we only had one drink there.

Reviews.Title: “No where better to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: stoneman56
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Platinum at the moment. Our 10th visit and never fails to live up to the high standards despite a complete new management team. The only niggle I have is that if you have a car you MUST valet it. Why they do this I have no idea. You look at a $3 tip every time you get your car out during the day, which in our case is around 3-4 times and it mounts up over a weeks stay. If you nee a cab be prepared to wait, not a lot of taxies come down this way so it does take some time to get one hailed for you. This is a completly non smoking hotel, not even allowed by the pool or on your balcony, bliss!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDvm
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Derek, Gita, Joseph, Nathan, and so many others, our visit was wonderful! Can't wait to return for the clean, relaxing atmosphere, hospitality of the employees, and good food. Enjoyed happy hour with Nathan at the bar, thanks to Gita for retrieving my pillow, and Joseph at valet. Thanks to Derek for the amazing suite. Hope to see all of you again soon. D&J

Reviews.Title: “A Suite Fit for a King”
Reviews.Author: mahalo2005
Reviews.Content: When we opened the door to our Princess King Suite, my wife and I both said "Wow, what a beautiful room!" The two room suite was very nicely decorated and extremely spacious. Unlike our friends who were staying at large hotels on the Strip, we liked the fact that we did not have to take a long walk through a casino to get our our room. Since our favorite attraction in Las Vegas is the free water show at the Bellegio, we liked the location (an easy 1/4 mile walk from the Strip and Bellagio). We were attending a trade show and did not visit the bar or restaurant, so can't comment on those.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: WidmarshSK
Reviews.Content: I ahve read dozens of terrific reviews and I agree that this is also my go to Hotel for all my future trips to LV. Being a small hotel with maybe 250 rooms total, you end up being treated like a person by all the excellent staff. When we checked in on Monday we felt at times like we were the only ones there, which made me extremely happy. I can't express how nice it is to retreat from the strip and find a quiet hotel and a peaceful nights sleep. We chose a fifth floor strip view and had a nice view of the strip from the East from MGM to Wynn. I have read that some people think it is too far from the strip, but we were able to get from the Platinum lobby to the Flamingo entrance of Bally's in five minutes. Do not have to worry about walking at night, as people from the Platinum, Super 8, and Tuscany are doing the same thing throughout the day. The things I appreciated about this hotel was the kitchenette for preparing a light Breakfast and Dinner, and being able to enjoy it from the table on our private balcony.To the Management and Staff of the Platinum, keep up the excellent work. I'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the strip but great service!”
Reviews.Author: OCTraveler3333
Reviews.Content: My godparents stayed here for a week and I visited them for two nights. we had a suite on the 17th floor - included a kitchen and a pull-out for me. This hotel is off the strip but close to everything. They also have a hotel shuttle that took us pretty much anywhere we wanted to go. The staff was friendly and always helpful - great concierge (Gita)! It's a very quiet hotel - no gaming, and not smokey, which is always a welcome change from the strip. The hotel restaurant prices are reasonable for a quick bite, but if you're looking for something really special head to the strip. This hotel has one of the few pools open over the winter - it's both indoor and out door and very warm. Nice pool side area outside too - if you don't have the perfect body and are intimidated by those slutty strip pools like I am.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Otis702
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a getaway just for the weekend, something away from the famous Las Vegas Strip, but within walking distance. We found the perfect hotel at the Platinum. From being greeted by name when we arrived, to the courteous service throughout our stay, we were simply spoiled by the attentive staff - truly five-star in my book. Our accommodations had a spectacular view of the Strip - a perfect vantage point to see the lights. Our room (and I might add all rooms are suites so it was a great value) was extremely nice with fine appointments and even a jacuzzi tub. We spent time sipping drinks at the fifth floor indoor/outdoor pool (which I might add has a great view of the Strip as well) and treated ourselves to spa treatments - simply perfect - it was just what we needed. Kudos to the Platinum for their wonderful hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum Las Vegas, Feb. 2012”
Reviews.Author: Nancy39571
Reviews.Content: Now I understand why Tripadvisor has so many rave reviews of the Platinum. This place is fabulous! We’ll never stay anywhere else in Vegas. During a 3-night stay in February of 2012, the staff was unfailingly solicitous and capable. Every area of the resort (our huge suite, elevators, pool, lounge, restaurant, fitness studio, spa) was clean, well lit, and in good repair. The kitchen of our beautiful suite was completely stocked, and the living area included a Bose radio. A few minutes’ walk puts you on the Strip, but there are few reasons to leave the Platinum! We had—without a doubt—the loveliest room and most beautiful view we’re ever had anywhere. If I had to find something negative to say, all I could come up with would be having to pay extra to access the Internet from our room. We can’t wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Mum's 73rd Birthday”
Reviews.Author: ET0703
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my mum to Las Vegas for her birthday and after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I selected the Platinum and I'm so glad I did. Room:- We had a Princess Suite on the 14th Floor with a Strip View and balcony which was wonderful, although as we went in February it was a bit cold to sit outside when it was dark, so we enjoyed the view from the lounge. The suite was spacious, nice furnishings, usable kitchen, a lovely bedroom with 2 big comfy beds and pillows, a lovely big bathroom and ample closet space. More than enough room for a mother and daughter. Some reviewers had mentioned that the t.v.'s weren't modern, we didn't go to Las Vegas to watch telly so it wasn't a problem for us. As we only have a snack first thing in the morning, the fitted kitchen with a toaster, microwave, over and hob was more than adequate for our needs, as was the massive fridge freezer. Facilities:- The hotel doesn't have a casino, it's completely non-smoking which is great. Coming from the UK, it was really strange to see smoking indoors in public areas and in some hotels/casinos the smoky smell is over powering. The restaurant food and staff were the same as everything else in the hotel, FANTASTIC!! as was the gym and the pool. Location:- It's proximity to the Strip meant that my mum and I walked to the Bellagio in 10 minutes, which is quicker than the time taken to exit the casino hotels on the Strip, due to casino, restaurants, and shops. Some reviews have stated that the area around the hotel wasn't great, my mum and I walked to and from the hotel day and night and never felt unsafe. Infact, I've been in scary places in the UK, any homeless folk we did see were not interested in us. Staff:- Everyone we dealt with was brilliant and they could not help you enough. When I wanted to use online booking for our flights home, the guy at the front desk did it for me and even printed out the boarding passes. Hints:- If you get a taxi from the airport, as the driver not to take the freeway, it's cheaper. If you have never gambled before, start at "Ellis Island" next door it's a small casino and the odds are good. Then when your ready, move onto the bigger Strip casinos. Get your tickets for shows from the discount booths. My mum really enjoyed her birthday and when we come back again, we will definitely being staying at the Platinum. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ruby Wedding gift to ourselves”
Reviews.Author: sue p
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading reviews on TA. We were upgraded to a Princess suite with a strip view which was amazing! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. It was also my Birthday while we were there and my son and daughter asked if they could buy some champagne or flowers to be delivered to my room. The concierge said that it would not be a problem but the it would be compliments of the hotel! I received a bottle of French champagne and a tray of huge strawberries dipped in chocolate. What a wonderful gesture. We did not find the walk to the strip a problem as you can walk through a shopping mall into Ballys or Paris.We loved returning to the tranquility of our suite pouring a drink and sitting looking at the strip as the hotels began to light up. Other great benefits are the fully fitted kitchen, plasma tv and fire, jacuzzi bath and laundry facilities. Our room was near the pool and lifts which we found very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: Siliobear
Reviews.Content: The Platinum is off the strip, doesn't have a casino and has a relatively quiet vibe. If you're OK with that, it's a wonderful place to stay. Much of the property is sold as condos, so the rentals are equivalent to a 1 BR condo, with full kitchen, jacuzzi tub and flat screen tvs in each room. My only peeve...parking is valet only so allow a few minutes to get your car and have a wad of tip money handy. Tip: Often The Platinum's normal rates will be less than what other hotels on the strip charge for weekends and holidays.

Reviews.Title: “So wanted to give 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Lincharl
Reviews.Content: Would have loved to give this hotel 5 stars but the furniture and rugs needed some TLC. Saying that our overall experience was great. Very fast check in and out. We were greeted by very friendly staff who called to make sure we were happy with the room and asked if we need anything to make our stay comfortable. Realized we had forgotten bathrobes and they immediately sent two up. Housekeeping was amazing, great attention to detail. Comfortable bedroom with two queen beds. Large bathroom with a soaker tub, loved that spotless every day. Room service the fastest I've experienced, so we ordered a good breakfast every day and enjoyed a relaxing start to our day. Enjoyed the balcony and the separate living room. Quiet hotel and after a long day and late night on the strip it was greatly appreciated. Most days we walked but when to tired took cabs. Thank you to all who made our stay so enjoyable..

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet/peacefull hotel. Loved the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: bestontop
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of the Platinum until I saw it on TA rated number 3. I really enjoyed my 3 nights there. We stayed at the ARIA before we moved and the walk from our room at the ARIA to the strip took longer than from the Platinum. Good: We had a fantastic room, they gave us the top floor (16) on the nw side. Out our balcony we could see from Mandalay bay to the Wynn. The room is big, the bed is comfortable, enough room on patio for table and four chairs, big, big bathroom, 2 person bathtub was great, fridge with icemaker and all appliances were nice, pool area had plenty of comfortable seats with two big fire pits, pool is heated (we swam at 55 degrees), loved the pool area (but more kids than you would see in a big hotel), stir lounge had 1/2 price appetizers (the burger sliders and wings were great, artichoke dip not as good), elevators were fast, you can get a quick taxi from here unlike the big hotels (longest wait was 3 minutes), the cleaning was done promptly for us and well. VERY quiet, always got a great nights sleep. Bad: Check in was difficult, we checked our bags since the room was not ready, was told they would call us, but they never did. We called them and it was ready. We walk a lot and have no problem, but at 1 am and a full day of walking the extra 10 minutes from the strip does stink after 3 days (not enough to not stay here, it was still easier to walk then trying to get a taxi most nights). They need more waitresses at Stir during happy hour. At Stir, they did not make very good drinks, we had the worst stawberry daiquiri we have ever had. The rooms are worn down some, the carpets need replaced and the TV's are very old (both did not bother us, but might others). The hot tub was extremely hot one day and had no heat the next day. Saying all of this we really like this hotel. I do not know if we will stay here often, but will be back. We have stayed at over 10 different hotels in Vegas and this would rate in the upper middle. My wife does not gamble, so this hotel stopped me from gambling (both good and bad) normally I would stay up and gamble, but did not want her to walk back by herself. There is no place to get groceries, the 7 eleven and gas station across the street only had eggs, nothing else to make. We bought wine and some snacks for our room. With the breakfast prices at the hotel and Ellis Island (right around the corner) I would just let them make it. The Wynn is a 20 minute walk, only walk that way during the day, I would never walk it at night. The walk to the strip is 10-15 minutes 5 minutes to the back of Bally's. Checkout they gave us a ride in their hotel vehicle to the airport, tip well. Next time we will just take more taxi's .

Reviews.Title: “just plain DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: Joannie65
Reviews.Content: Three night stay last week. The good: The staff were amazing. From valet, the front desk, to housekeeping. All really nice people willing to help with anything. The bad: The place is a dump. Filth everywhere. Do not walk anywhere barefoot. We bought house slippers just to walk around our room. And the room had the cleanest carpet in the entire hotel! The lobby and hallways were just disgusting. I guess they never been steam cleaned. The ugly: If you're on a budget, this still isn't the place. Try another dump for less money like excalibur, circus circus, or stratosphere. A third of the price with the same amount of grime.

Reviews.Title: “The Platinum is Platinum”
Reviews.Author: barbedwirebunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nites, wanted to see "Phantom". Smoke free, excellent complimentary valet service, huge clean suite, comfortable bed and a nice dark room. We slept like babies. Used room service for BK one a.m. Ordered a Egg Sandwich. Was expecting a McDonald's version but it was actually a gourmet egg dish with sausage, served piping hot. Wish we would have had time to eat at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary stay! Smoke-free and relaxing yet just off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: NormaJoMo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. Staff was very friendly. Room was huge with nice balcony, spacious full kitchen and giant bathroom. Smoke-free is a huge plus after spending the day and night at various casinos on the strip. Big room lets you get back, relax and spread out in your own space after the packed strip hustle and bustle. Short walk or very easy cab ride to heart of the strip. Free valet. Front desk staff were pleasant and helpful--smooth check-in, very responsive to our needs and questions. Maid came daily during our stay. No complaints! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: dontSeattle
Reviews.Content: We had a very large suite with kitchen and laundry facilities for much less than the big hotels on the strip. We had to walk perhaps a quarter of a mile to get to the strip but it wasn't much for the value received. You read on Trip Advisor about the small rooms in the grand hotels on the strip and the cost of these rooms. The rooms at the Platinum are huge, with balconies, and cost half as much. The service is very attentive if somewhat off base. We had a water leak issue resulting in a visit by the repair staff and were given a free breakfast to compensate for the inconvenience. However the room cleaning service comes late in the day - 3:00 pm - and is inconvenient if you've been out walking and want a rest before dinner. Also they don't come back if you have your "do no disturb" sign out so you miss out on replacement linens, coffee and soaps. Fnally we were advised that you get the best price by calling the hotel directly and not booking through a service.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a family or extended stay”
Reviews.Author: TXRocker
Reviews.Content: Pros: staff was generally friendly; suites are spacious with full kitchen. Cons: sparse decor; long walk to strip; no self-parking (free valet...not including tips); ancient CRT TV in bedroom. Took 3 tries to get he room we actually reserved. Later we realized the AC didn't work, which we reported to the front desk, but it was never addressed. Maid comes every "other" day, which we were not told at check-in. Bottom line is the service seems more condo-like and less hotel-like. If you need a kitchen, and want to be fairly close to the strip, this hotel works...but doesn't have a resort/spa hotel feel.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh! Poor service and dirty room!”
Reviews.Author: Chantelcc
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Came here for the weekend wanting to relax but unable to do so. Problems at check-in - lost the reservation and then wanted to blame ME. I showed them the reservation I made over the internet and then, after some shrugs, got a room. Got to my room and it was dirty, shower door was broken, a total of 2 hangers (wow!), and tv did not work in living room. (At least the old CRT in the bedroom worked.) Service at front deal was awful, and when I check out, they messed up the charges. I am still trying to get this fixed a week later! Never again! For a god Vegas vacation, I'd recommend the W, Palms Place, the Encore and even the Tuscany next door over this place. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Problems from the beginning”
Reviews.Author: Pokervegas
Reviews.Content: Problems with the reservation on check-in. I called the day before to make sure the reservations were in place and was told all was fine. Got there, no reservation. Finally got it taken care of and when I checked out, they had messed up the folio and overcharged me. In addition, I had to call down for everything. Room needed cleaning. One pillow on the bed (really?), had to call. TV not working - had to call. No hangers, went out and bought some.

Reviews.Title: “We love Eugene!”
Reviews.Author: justddz
Reviews.Content: Went back for the Trade Show, this time we booked a stay with a Non- Casino Hotel ( based on the repeated yuck of the Rio ) and what a TREAT! I love love this Hotel. No casino but everything fun is within walking distance! ( And let me tell you work a booth for 14 hours a day and a nice walk is HEAVEN!) We arrived via Shuttle, battle worn & punchy...greeted by a super friendly & helpful staff. I believe his name was Eugene..he was AWESOME! Friendly, helpful, funny...everything we like! Our room was amazing! Roomy, clean, comfortable with just the right touch of class that reminds you your in a nice Hotel! Room service, cleaning service- every time we dealt with Hotel Staff they were wonderful- professional, personable. The one thing that I would want improvement on is the room service menu- not so good. Mostly dry & just well..not so good. If we didnt fly in we would bring food next time and save some $$. But..ALL else was excellent. The lounge outstairs was FABULOUS, tapa, great drinks, waitress was our new BFF ..."DON"T BREAK THE SEAL!" ...( private joke ..we loved you!) We love this place! Stay, bring your own food if you can- it's a nice stay with a staff that makes you happy you ARE staying! : )

Reviews.Title: “The perfect solution”
Reviews.Author: readingaway
Reviews.Content: we are not gamblers so not drawn to that as a feature of a Vegas hotel. In fact, it takes away from it all for us .. we tire or the noise and people and smoke. The Platinum has no noise (party-free policy). We never once saw someone else on our floor but saw they had room service so they were there! This is a 5 min walk from the strip and we took in shows every night and still walked back to the hotel feeling completely safe. No idea what kind of mattresses they have but it is the first time in a long time I did not wake at a hotel with a sore back ... the perfect bed. The bathrooms are amazing ... 2 person tub and lovely tiled shower as well as double sinks. Ample closets. Concerns: We booked a few months early and travelled wiih another couple and wanted to be by them. We were put 6 floors apart. Added logistics for sharing meals so was a bit annoying. I understand they were fully but surely hotel software has a way of linking 2 rooms make in the same reservation to be close together.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Kay W
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and were glad we did. We had 3 different rooms and were placed on the same floor. The staff were very accommodating and friendly. The rooms were huge, full fridge with ice/water dispenser, and lots of closet space. Short walk to the strip and a relief to escape back from the smoking, noise and lights that makes and breaks Las Vegas! Had to call twice for linens for the fold out sofa but when the kitchen overhead lights would not turn off, maintenance was there within 10 minutes. The Happy hour was a great value though our waitress seemed to be the only one serving and was very, very busy on Friday night. Did not get to make use of the pool or gym but the patio/pool area looked clean and attractive from the balcony! Overall a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: KChr
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the Platinum hotel! The minute you walk in its like royalty there. They treat you like you are a guest of honor and always make it worth the stay. I was there this past Presidents day weekend and the employees and management team were especially accomodating. Specifically, the Director of Revenue (Melissa) was very helpful and patient when answering any questions we had. You cannot beat the price for the rooms there. Even the smallest suite they offer is fully equipped with a kitchen and spacious dining room serparated off by a large bedroom with a beautiful bathroom. The view of the strip is an additional plus. It doesn't get much better than that! I will always stay at the Platinum hotel when I travel to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the madness of the strip”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFun033
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great in the sense that it did not have a casino, and therefore did not have the insanity in some of the others. The pools were nice and warm, and the staff was nice enough. Some of the room did not look like it had been wiped clean and there were stains on the carpet, but nothing disgusting. I would recommend this hotel/ The restaurant was not fantastic- the server was nice, but there are better places to eat in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay to get to the West Rim Grand Canyon & closest City Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Britty007
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a NON SMOKING Hotel, and you are looking for a room that will GUARANTEE 2 Beds, and you want to be close to the action, yet NOT Lost in the madness of it all, you are looking for service, romance, stay with friends or family..You would love a balcony, spacious accommodations, a full kitchen, stocked with utensils,feel like you checked into your second home, good food at great prices..THEN STAY HERE..Do yourself that great favor and stay here..If I ever go back to Vegas, this for sure will always be my hotel of choice..THANK YOU STAFF OF THE PLATINUM for helping me and my family create memories that will last a lifetime in the comfort and safety of your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for locals,too!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia I
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I have used conference facilities, hosted groups of up to 50 in their fabulous rooms, and regularly schedule breakfast meetings there.. and Iam a local! It's the perfect "offstrip" hotel because it is barely off strip... A short walk up to the middle of the strip..walk through Bally's -Paris retail areas...and voila, at Paris and across from Bellagio Fountains. I have even scheduled staycation in their suite. Highly recommended by and for locals as well as visitors..

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: This hotel the staff is so friendly and helpful. Huge rooms with amazing views. the gym and hot tub are a must. must wake up early to see sunrise. staying out till 2 and 3am waking up for sunrise was hard but worth it.Management is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Off Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cap49424
Reviews.Content: Everything about the room was great! Large bedroom, nice sitting room with fireplace, nice large balcony, nice kitchen with full size appliances even had a mini dishwasher. It also had a stackable washer/dryer. Housekeeping missed one our days, and I had to call for towels. Didn't really like the walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great off the Strip Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DesignerScout
Reviews.Content: Very large suite with nice kitchen and bath. Typical hotel furnishings, I wasn't impressed. Lots of room and very nice staff. Housekeeping only made it one day out of four. Two days they showed up as we were getting ready for dinner and I just took some replenishments from the cart. Great for families. Great value. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are spot on! Way to GO”
Reviews.Author: bajhome
Reviews.Content: I have nothing to say bad about this property. They did everything to make sure our stay was beyond comfortable. The rooms definitely live up the pictures and the two person jacuzzi tub is AWESOME. I did think the service in the restaraunt was kind of slow but the servers themselves were warm and kind. One day we found that the jets on the pool jacuzzi were not working. I alerted someone in the restaraunt who immediately got on the phone with maintenance to have the problem resolved. The young lady at the front desk (Trinity C) did an excellent job setting up a reservation and getting us transportation to the indoor go cart racing. There was a little confusion at check in with how much $$ they will hold if you are paying with a debit card. I am not used to hotels discriminating between debit cards and credit cards use when booking hotels (car rentals do of course) In most situations this is might have soured my desire to use this property again but after a few short discussions we were able to work out something to please all parties. I just suggest that the reservation center is clear with the deposit policy since I did make my reservation on the phone. On a positive note, If you don't mind being off the strip (very close to Ballys, Westin and Flamingo) This is the place to stay!!! Mature, clean, nice staff. Also I did not like paying to use the business center but hey in Vegas they charge you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff, Best Balcony, Best off-strip view!”
Reviews.Author: LindaLovesTravel131
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 2nd visit to The Platinum and this stay was just as great as the last. The valet and check in process was awesome. Every staff person we encountered was super friendly and very accomodating. Because this is not a "mega hotel" you are welcomed and treated with familiarity by the delightful folks who work here. We were upgraded from a "north" strip view to a "full" strip view by Joseph at the front desk since it was our daughter's 1st trip to Vegas since turning 21. It was an amazing view and you could even see some of the Fountain Show at Bellagio from our balcony...YES I said balcony, which was large enough to have a table and 4 chairs! The FULL Kitchen allowed us to host a cocktail party for friends from England staying at another hotel so we could fix a variety of munchies and enjoy ourselves privately as if we were at home. (Housekeeping will bring you additional flatware, pans, plates or anything else you might need.) I also made coffee, toast & omelets each morning and some late night snacks when returning from the strip, which again saved us even more $$. The bathrobes, comfy beds & 2 person jacuzzi tub were just icing on the cake of an amazingly quality room. The pool area with firepit, the restaurant and lobby lounge "Stir" were also really enjoyable and fair priced. (Especially the daily "everything half off" happy hour from 4-8 pm). We also enjoyed the walk to the strip which is shorter if you cut through Bally's. There were just a few "interesting types" along the way so I recommend ladies walking with a companion, but other than that, it's across the street and maybe 70 yards into Bally's back parking lot & SportsBook where you can catch the monorail or access the Strip. This is also a great place for people who don't want to go thru a smokey casino with their children everytime they enter the front door. I will continue to recommend this hotel to friends and family as the delightful staff and amazing amenities bring the quality ABOVE and BEYOND what you get at a typical MegaVegas Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - hidden secrets - long walks!”
Reviews.Author: nmnkno
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Platinum which a friend recommended. Very nice and super relaxing hotel. The employees are extremely friendly and have a lot of good advise when it comes to suggesting where to and where not to go! Talk to Brian and Nathan!!! The Valet guys can get you almost anywhere...talk to them, not to the front desk people. It is a walk to the strip but great exercise and worth the quiet of the rooms. We really didn't mind the walk. The food is incredible!! Happy Hour in the bar is awesome and the food for breakfast is very very reasonable and the view is great! My only complaint is that house keeping could do better! We were skipped one day but not a biggie and they sent up fresh towels when we asked for them.The next day I noticed things they missed. Watch your prices through because we traveled with friends who got a bigger room and a little better price when she mentioned a price change that I had found online in an email from the hotel it's self and had taken care of prior to our visit, but they ended up getting their's cheaper when they checked in. Oh well. The TV's are old but hey I wasn't there to watch, the view from the balcony was worth watching. Indoor outdoor heated pool and hot tub was a plus. Would I stay again? Maybe... only due to location...if not for location definitely!! This will sound funny but the elevators were awesome, there is nothing worse than waiting and waiting for an elevator and we never had too!! :) Front desk also very nicely let us check in early and offered a late check out!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: artdeb
Reviews.Content: I am giving this hotel an excellent based on the quality of room you get for the money and great staff. First off, you are only a 10 minute walk from the strip and you end up at Ballys when you get there. The staff was always helpful and we really liked that we received a call about 15 minutes after we were in our room. This gave us enough time to unpack and realize we had some questions and viola a call from the staff wanting to know if there was anything we needed. The room was large and had a comfortable bed. We enjoyed cooking our breakfast. We also went to the Stir Lounge for happy hour. We found the appetizers to be yummy and the happy hour price was just right (1/2 off). I cannot say enough about the staff. They always seemed to want to make sure we were happy. The guys who get your car for you whenever you want are quick and also genuinely wanted to know if they could help us with directions or anything that we needed. Actually we felt like they knew us and cared about us when we were only there for 2 days. Forgot to add that the rooms were very quite and we were very near the elevator. Didn't miss being on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: racerxgrl
Reviews.Content: We purposefully wanted to stay in a reasonably priced non-casino, non-smoking hotel that was near the strip, and selected the Platinum based on price and Trip Advisor reviews. What a great find for our recent 3-night stay in Vegas! The service was impeccable, from check in, to the phone call after we arrived to make sure the room was alright, to the friendly greeting every time we walked in the door.... each and every employee was enthusiastic, friendly and caring. The room itself was excellent -- clean and spacious enough for 3 adults. The room was shockingly quiet for Vegas. Although our friend said the pull out mattress was not very comfortable, the king bed in the bedroom was wonderful! We absolutely loved the balcony, enjoying our coffee out there in the morning and a cocktail before heading back out in the evening. The full kitchen was lovely, and we cooked in our breakfast every day just to save some money (a gas station and small market just steps away have the basics). The bathroom is huge, and the storage sufficient. We didn't use the spa, but we enjoyed 1/2 off appetizers and cocktails during happy hour one afternoon at the bar downstairs which was a deal. The pool area is very nice also, with excellent views of the city. The walk to the strip was longer than it looks, but isn't everything like that in Vegas? In less than 10 minutes we were in the heart of it all, and even sooner if you enter into the Bally's Sports Book and walk through the underground shops to get to the Strip. I was worried about the safeness of the area and the "unsavory characters" some reviewers mentioned, but we spent alot of time walking around the area at night and never had a problem. Overall, our stay at the Platinum was fantastic, and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The quiet oasis near the madness of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: captyoung
Reviews.Content: I was booked for 3 nights at The Platinum for a business conference. I drove up to the hotel and found it was Valet parking only. When I drive to Vegas I throw extra stuff in the car and when you have to valet the car it makes it unloading a hassle. Check in was a snap and they put me on the top floor with a view of the strip! What a shock I got when open the door and my room is a 1 bedroom condo! Nice kitchen and bathroom with an attached bedroom. The family room is small and not super comfortable. Plentyof storage with 2 closets for possible his and hers options. The fridge is full size with plenty of room for all your goods. The downside is there is no place to smoke including while you are sitting on the balcony outside of your room. I enjoy a cigar once in awhile and I have a gorgeous view of the city from my balcony but can't have a cigar. There is a sign on the sliding glass door that says you will be charged just for evidence of smoking. The lobby design has a swanky style with the bar just to the left. Happy hour is every night but food service is slow. The food quality in the business conference rooms was very good. There are many conference rooms and it is tricky trying to find your conference room. There were 3 or 4 conferences at the same time as ours and we did have some noise bleeding over from the other conference next door. When we decided to go out at night it was easy to get a cab even though we were not on the strip. This hotel is great for business and if you want a hotel without a casino and is non smoking then this is a great choice and is very close to all the big hotels on the strip. This will be one of my top choices when I come back on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service and location”
Reviews.Author: Roz A
Reviews.Content: My husband an I spent 3 nights at the Platinum celebrating our anniversary. We were surprised with chocolate covered strawberries and champagne. How nice was that? We highly recommend the Platinum. The staff is exceptional. This was our second stay and will not be the last!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Hhigs
Reviews.Content: The Platinum is a great value in Vegas if you are looking for a comparable size room. Last time we stayed at the new Wynn. The room was huge, as are the rooms at the Platinum. We were unaware that The Platinum was a condo style hotel. You get a ful kitchen in your room. Unlike other condo style hotels we have stayed at, you get full house keeping daily and no extra anemity fees included at checkout. The pool was great. The staff was extremely helpful and kind. The 4-8 happy hour at the bar is not to be missed and the bartender Nathan is just great. The spa is also not to be missed and you should definitely ask for Ellen if you book a massage. She is knowledgeable and passionate about her work. On the negative, I think more time could be spent on maintenance and cleaning of the hallways, elevators general public seen areas. We think it is a plus to be away from all the casinos ,and just a short walk if you want to get to them.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great service”
Reviews.Author: Mattred74
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Platinum in Jan 2012. We had a strip view Princess suite, that had 2 queen beds in a separate room from the lounge room/ kitchen area. The room also had a balcony, washer/dryer, plasmas and a hot tub in the bath room. The hotel was extremely clean and this was maintained throughout or stay. ALL staff that we came across during our stay were friendly, helpful, pleasant and nothing was too much trouble. This was evident not only at check in/out, but in the restaurant and bar, the concierge and the porters. The staff definitely did make our stay enjoyable and worry free. The hotel is about a 5 to 10 min walk to the strip. It is an easy walk, and you can go through Ballys to visit the shops on the way and use their moving footways to get to the strip. It is easy to get to the monorail stations at either Ballys or the Flamingo and there are numerous bus stops to get you most places in LV a 1 minute walk from the front of the hotel. The NO SMOKING policy of this hotel is fantastic and one which we very much appreciated. The pool area was clean and towels were abundantly available at all times. The restaurant served great food at a reasonable price, and happy hour in the bar was definitely a great place to visit. The wifi in the hotel was perfect and always available. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to family and friends, and we hope to stay again in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “High rating for this hotel is not deserved”
Reviews.Author: lycheewaves
Reviews.Content: Why is this hotel so high in the list of Las Vegas hotels?! Because of it I booked and I regret the amount of money we spent on this. The room is definitely large and the kitchen is definitely useful if you intend to cook or have a small family (but this is Vegas, are you really going to spend time indoors cooking?!) and it is non-smoking. However I thought the fixtures looked a bit aged, the TV’s are certainly from the dark ages! I didn’t try the hot tub. Our windows faced out onto the road, not particularly nice. The room is really too big for a couple, it doesn’t feel cosy because of its size and the decor is so bland and not designed to make you feel at home. Staff were ok at check-in and the valet were ok too. The walk from the Strip is a bit dodgy at night, I didn’t feel safe even with my boyfriend. I didn’t really like the location, even though it is close. Either stay off strip with a shuttle or stay on the Strip. However the worst thing was I left a charger in the room and came back after a trip to the Grand Canyon to see if anyone had handed it in. I rang and got put through to lost property but no one picked up the phone. Left a voicemail to be asked to be rung back but they didn’t. So we went personally. Got told by unhelpful front-desk that if they didn’t ring me back it meant that it wasn’t there. So I said well in that case someone from Housekeeping has taken it. I asked if there was a possibility that the hadn’t seen it because it was under the side table. He said it wasn’t possible, it was hotel policy to check thoroughly everything, several times over. So I said well either that wasn’t the case or someone had stolen it. Front desk guy didn’t even want to check if someone had taken the room in between our stay. I insisted. He looked exasperated and reluctantly called the security guys. They were a little more helpful and took me back up to the room. Contrary to what the check-in guy said the room had only been basically stripped and not cleaned or cleared. I got back my charger which is great but only based on my insistence and not through any help from the staff. I didn’t try the rest of the facilities but this hotel totally does not deserve such a high ranking nor the price I paid for it. We stayed our final night in Las Vegas for a fifth of the price and it was more worth it. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome! The best place to be in this hotel is in the odd numbered rooms facing north on floors 3, 4, and 5. These rooms have a spectacular view of The Las Vegas Strip! It is more like an apartment than a suite. There's a washer and dryer, as well as a dishwasher in the room. Pay no attention to malcontent boob from who posted a one star review of Stay bridge Suites Las Vegas on TripAdvisor on Jan 27, 2010. He doesn't know what he's talking about and he probably works for a competing hotel. It's quiet here and you can't hear any planes. This is the nicest basic hotel you can ask for in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Really good - here are some practical tips”
Reviews.Author: Hackfix21
Reviews.Content: As per other reviews - this is a great hotel, nice big suites, good service. Good kitchen, big bathroom with double size jacuzzi bathtub. Would definitely come back. We've been to Las Vegas before and previously liked being on the Strip, but now that we've seen it, it was very nice to be away from it in this quiet hotel. Couple of minor niggles: - mattress ok but a bit soft for my taste - the hotel could do better on providing information. The website doesn't have much practical information, and in the room there's no ring binder type hotel manual. I guess they expect you to call reception whenever you have a question. Some practical tips: - The location is a 10-15 minute walk east of the Strip. You reach the Strip where the Bellagio/ Caesars Palace are. But the hotel is also on the inside of a bend in the Strip, so you can also walk directly north and in 20 minutes end up at the Wynn and the Fashion Mall. So the location is not bad. - Also: highly recommended: keep walking east away from the Strip from the hotel and after about 15 minutes you get to Roys restaurant which is the nr1 Las Vegas restaurant on Tripadvisor. Great cocktails at $5 between 4.30 and 6.30, and really good prix fixe dinner menu. - From the airport to the hotel you should take a taxi. I researched the buses but it's just not practical, and the monorail still doesn't run to the airport. Taxi was $16 from the airport and $11 to the airport (plus tip). - The hotel pool is on a roof terrace on the 5th floor and is nice and warm and free. - As other reviews say, there is a 7/11 next to the hotel, but that really doesn't do more than drinks and snacks. Not good for trying to stock the kitchen in your suite. But then again, don't bother: in-room breakfast service is pretty cheap and big portions (one breakfast serves two). If you do want to cook, a quick phone call to reception is needed to get pots and pans. - Wifi: conflicting notes in the various reviews as to whether it's free. Technically it's not ($10 per day), but when we arrived at the room, we got a call from reception whether everything was ok; we asked about internet and were immediately offered free wifi for the duration of our stay (you get a password). - We were on the 9th floor which was fine to get a good view and not hear too much traffic noise. But on the whole I'm not sure I would bother again paying the unmark for the strip side view. - End of January is a great time to travel to Las Vegas. We got a good deal on the room (about £80 per night), and Las Vegas was pretty empty - no queues anywhere. And not too hot.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't get how this is so highly ranked”
Reviews.Author: Victoria5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family in August. While the room is large, the decor in the room is circa Holiday Inn. The hotel is located very far from the strip. When you walk to the strip, you pass a large parking lot, where several unsavory people congregate. I felt very unsafe walking to/from this hotel. I agree with what others have said about the friendliness/helpfulness of the staff but it doesn't make up for its out of the way location. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Large, Quiet, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kari P
Reviews.Content: Came to the hotel for a conference and to spend a fun weekend with a friend. We are super happy we stayed here. The kitchen came in handy, it was great to have a balcony, the bathroom was HUGE with a double vanity, and nice to have a separate bedroom with closed doors. We never heard anyone else and were surprised when we went to the gym and there were 8 others in there. The gym was great. We also enjoyed the hot tub and fire pit up on the roof when it got cool. Great location just behind the strip. Nice that there is no smoking and no casino to walk through. The only things I didn't like was the location of the elevator. We had to walk all the way around the building to get to our room. We also had to valet our car everytime we wanted it. We never had to wait long but tipping gets old. Loved the hotel. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & spacious off-Strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: KenJeffs
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my 50th birthday in LV and, following previous Strip hotel stays, decided to stop in a non-gaming hotel for a change. This was definitely a smart move, as our Princess Suite was spacious and clean, and the hotel facilities enabled us to recharge each morning before venturing out once more! The service was faultless and attentive (on my actual birthday, the hotel supplied complimentary champagne which was a nice touch); the reception and valet staff were friendly. The pool area was also a great place to unwind. Overall, welcoming and relaxing, we would highly recommend this as an excellent choice for an off-strip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, just behind the strip, and walking distance to the Sands Expo!”
Reviews.Author: cherylvu
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Platinum Hotel for work. This was my second time staying here because I was so impressed the first time. It is just off the strip, behind Bally's, and a half mile walk to the Sands Expo Center, where I was working for the week. The Platinum is a non casino, which means you walk right in and there are the elevators! No winding through a busy casino to get to your room. I was in a princess suite which had a full kitchen, large livingroom, separate bedroom and very large bathroom with a double-person, jetted tub. It was the perfect room to relax in after being on my feet for 10 hours at a trade show! You cannot get these amenities at a traditional casino on the strip. The staff is top-notch, the decor is very swanky, the Happy Hour specials are nice and we loved the heated pool. I will return here for future visits to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for money I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: G_The_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Platinum hotel for four days with my wife and it's been the best hotel we've ever seen for its value, even better than hotels costing twice as much. Location, staff, service and rooms are excellent. Unlike most hotels on the Strip, its outside look is pretty average and when you get there the first time it's hard to imagine how your stay will be once you get into the hotel. The suite was the largest I've ever seen at that price or at much higher prices, and it was perfectly clean, especially its large bathroom with jacuzzi. One TV set had a HDMI input, handy if you're traveling with a tablet supporting HDMI output. The room has no glitter, unlike some hotels on the Strip, but it's exactly this "normal" look, coupled with its sheer size, kitchen area and large refrigerator that makes you feel like if you were in a flat or apartment, basically in a "home away from home". The staff is efficient and friendly. The breakfast menu is delicious, and while they don't have an internal restaurant for a full dinner (you can have some food at the bar though), the hotel is literally a five-minute walk away from the Strip so you have hundreds of places where to have a good dinner. The pool is half indoor and half outdoors and the water temperature is perfect. If you're there when it's sunny, you can also sunbathe in the pool lounges in December and anyway there are comfortable places where to relax in the indoor area. Valet parking is free, as well as wi-fi, and the cars are parked right by the hotel so you never have to wait when you need your car

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Hotel in a City Full of Hotels”
Reviews.Author: nate1952
Reviews.Content: I work in the hotel industry, so - when I walk into a hotel - I have plenty of basis for comparison, and this hotel is truly remarkable for its general concept and the size of its rooms. I was just there for one night - but I wish I could have stayed longer, and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Vegas. Here are some details: - The Princess Suite was very well appointed. Essentially a small apartment, with a complete kitchen. Full "walk out" balconies are a big liability problem for hoteliers, but every room in the Platinum has one - so you can actually prepare a meal in the room and eat at the table on your own terrace. - Staff service level is excellent. Your presence in the hotel is acknowledged by everybody. None of the staff ever walk by you and try to pretend that you aren't there. - The Strip is literally within sight (you can see the Bellagio fountains when they are running) but you don't have the cigarette smoke and intrusive security of a casino. If you want to sample the Strip Experience, it's an easy walk - or a short cab ride - away. - The place gets a "4", instead of a "5" because there were things - such as bathrobes - that were missing from the room that I thought should have been there. And the hotel restaurant is truly nothing to write home about: all the usual cliches about hotel food apply. But, in sum - for someone staying multiple days in the city, and travelers thinking of preparing some of their own food, either to save money, or because of special dietary requirements - this hotel is a great choice and I would heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by room cleanliness !”
Reviews.Author: JCranford
Reviews.Content: The overall cleanliness of the hotel suite was less than expected. The first day we noticed various types of hair (long and short) on the bathroom floors (we had a two bedroom suite), which we cleaned up. We again noticed long hairs in the bathrooms on later occasions during the stay, indicating to us that these were likely left behind by the housekeepers. We did leave generous tips to housekeeping, but noticed that certain things like vacuuming, and cleaning of counter tops, etc. were not done... or done very well. After reading many reviews on the Platinum before booking for a local trade show I was expecting a bit more. The cleanliness of our 2 bedroom suite was not good. This is one area that means A LOT to me when traveling. Although you know there were many people staying in your room before you, you don't like to see evidence of it. Overall the Platinum Hotel has a lot to offer, but this is was real weak point in our view. I do give high props to the room service quality and price. We enjoyed every meal (breakfast and dinner) that we had there. As well, the spaciousness of the suites is obviously a big selling point! The kitchen is great, but you could tell that half the glasses had been taken away or broken by prior guests, and never replenished. Walking to the AM/PM and 7-11 next door is something best done before dusk in my opinion. We encountered the homeless asking for change every time we walked over, and encountered one sitting in the bushes of the hotel. The doormen and valet are great!!!! However, I did not get the sense of any real security/security guards present at the hotel. Nor do you notice any cameras in the hallways , etc. I got the impression anyone could easily walk in off the street and go up to the room floors with no one stopping them along the way. Obviously, a lot of folks like the Platinum Hotel ... I personally would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's not all roses ...”
Reviews.Author: crzzzr
Reviews.Content: Had reasonably high expectations for our stay around New Years 2011/12 in a Princess Strip View Suite after reading so many 5 star reviews here. Do people only rate 5 stars or 1 star and nothing in between?? We received a reality check with our visit: 1. Non smoking hotel but our room smelt terribly of smoke?? Requested room change which was thankfully granted. 2. Hallway smelt of vomit for 3 days. 3. Room decor is looking a little tired and didn't look like the pics on the website - are only some rooms renovated?? I would say probably 8 years old?? 4. Bathroom is huge with dual entry doors from main bedroom and entry 5. Lots of storage but nothing to hang clothes on. 6. Strip view was quite good but immediate view between the hotel and the strip is car park. 7. Room service meals were quite good and reasonably priced we thought. 8. Walk to strip is 10 mins - drops you at Bally's or Across road from Caesars Palace. Seemed safe enough. 9. Free car valet parking is good, but does cost you a tip every time you want your car 10. Pool looks OK but didn't use it. 11. Maid service was slow, with rooms not being done until late in the day at times. 12. Complimentary internet was given to us - maybe because we booked direct with them?? 13. Rooms were reasonably clean, but could've been better in our view. 14. No casino is a positive 15. We had more than 6 rooms booked at this hotel and our opinion was common amongst our group 16. Laundry in the Princess Suite was handy and we booked this room largely for this convenience. 17. 7/11 Convenience store very close by for groceries - Better supermarkets down the street but you will require a car. I would rate this property a 3.5 stars in comparison to other hotels we have stayed at in Las Vegas (5 visits). It certainly doesn't deserve 5 stars - not many hotels do! Not sure I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Platinum!”
Reviews.Author: Marlee S
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Platinum was excellent! The place was beautiful and very modern. It had an awesome outdoor pool on the 5th floor with multiple beds and chairs to relax. I stayed in a larger room with friends and the king size bed and pull out couch was plenty room for us to sleep. The kitchen was huge and had utensils for cooking and a large fridge, oven stove, and microwave as well as sink. It was so useful! The bathroom was my favorite!!! Huge shower and bath, and an awesome vanity. Perfect for a larger group to get ready in. The view was beautiful! The hotel is just off the strip, about 2 or 3 blocks, so easy walking distance for a night out. There are also 2 gas stations right next to the hotel, one with a nice market which was perfect for getting sandwiches and other food/drink. The hotel's restaurants was delicious and had excellent service. Our check-in went very smoothly and quickly! My overall experience was wonderful, starting from the moment we were picked up at the airport! Very convenient! I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway after a day on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: mila918
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Princess Suite. The room was beautiful, over looking the mountains on the 8th floor. The hotel is very peaceful and quiet, we stayed for 7 nights and only on one night I thought I heard some people above us partying. My husband did not hear it, but someone must have called because the noise did stop. About a 10 minute walk to the strip and we'd take a taxi from Bally's (which is the hotel in front of The Platinum) back at night, which I think was about $4-6. The staff was wonderful, everything was very clean, and you can't beat the price for what you get either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay off of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Sam D
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Platinum Hotel in Vegas was just about perfect. I halfway across the country to Vegas for NYE and could not have been more pleased by the service and accommodations offered by this hotel. It is far enough away from the strip (about 2 blocks) that you can get away from the craziness if need be, while close enough that you can get just about anywhere via a short walk or taxi ride. The staff could not have been more helpful, from the Waiters/Waitresses to the front desk staff, to the director of rooms (who made sure everything with the check-in went well and was even out at the valet station making sure everyone was getting what they needed). Would definitely recommend this hotel for stays in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great!”
Reviews.Author: ashandjb1
Reviews.Content: Having read the very positive reviews on TA, we had very high expectations of this hotel. We stayed for 5 nights over the New Year period and left a little underwhelmed. On the positive side, the rooms were spacious, clean and kitchens well equiped (however the beds in our room were far being on par with the Hilton). Being a busy period it was nice to be able to get a taxi relatively quickly, enter and leave the hotel without passing through a smokey casino, and generally escape the vast crowds of people along the strip and in the major casino hotels. The kids also enjoyed the pool in the evening, while the view of the strip hotels for the fireworks at midnight on NYE was definitely a positive. However the general location is also a major negative in our opinion. Platinum isn't in the most attractive location. From the strip, the walk isn't too long (about 5-10min), but it is surrounded by vacant lots / car parks and two main roads. Although we were on the 15th floor the noise from the road was constant. Our room also overlooked the electricity sub station which wasn't overly appealling. (Tip: ask for a room directly facing the strip). Being New Year, there was a lot of activity in the hotel. While noise late into the night was expected, the fire alarm at 4.45am on new years day was not. (It also clearly came as a surprise to the night staff when people started to exit the fire stairs!). Platinum is a good 3 1/2 star hotel, but it isnt anything more than that. Given our limited time, for a "Las Vegas experience" perhaps we should have selected one of the hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fully family friendly - children & pets alike!”
Reviews.Author: HappyEndingSD
Reviews.Content: We were in the cheapest rated room, but you could not tell by the accommodations! From the full sized refrigerator (w. ice maker) to the washer/dryer, fake fireplace & huge jacuzzi tub, this hotel leaves nothing out for any guest! Room service food was also very yummy. :) The staff are happy, friendly & eager to please! We were there with our dog & toddler...it was PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: Zymotic
Reviews.Content: We stayed between Christmas & New Year, when the build up of people for the celebrations was very evident all around. All valet parking & checked in within 5 minutes of arrival - very impressive when you witnessed the chaos & massive queues at check-in at the big hotels on the strip - yuk! Room was huge; full kitchen, living area, double jacuzzi bath & 2 large doubles. The opportunity to wash & dry our clothes was much appreciated as we were mid-way through our 1500 mile road trip. Decor is possibly getting a little dated but no major criticism & perfectly adequate for our needs, just not in the 'luxurious' bracket. We were horrified that smoking was allowed in the gaming halls of most hotels - so retro. Even our teenage daughters commented how disgusting the atmosphere was & we were all so very glad that we could escape to the Platinum which is non-smoking through-out! Situated one block back from Ballys the location was spot-on. Takes about 4 minutes to walk to the middle of the strip, straight up one road which seemed perfectly safe. Guests in the larger hotels can take 10 times this amount of time to reach the strip! Roof-top pool area was very pleasant & well-maintained. Whilst, Vegas was not our favourite destination on our road trip, the Platinum did deliver a peaceful & spacious space from which we could dip in & out of the madness. It's a bucket list city, glad we ticked the box but won't be too keen to return.

Reviews.Title: “Super location smoke free”
Reviews.Author: doctorfat
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it did not have a casino. Also, a short (and safe even late at night) walk from the strip. Hotel is located behind Ballys, in the middle of the strip. Handy gas station and 7/11 store next to hotel. Hotel suites are huge and well furnished. Bed was almost on par with "Hilton bed". Absolutely no noise from neighbours even on New Years Eve. Price was exceptional for Vegas and Valet Parking is Free.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Las Vegas experience at the Platinum”
Reviews.Author: Amber M
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in the hotel, and enjoyed the spacious rooms, beautiful lobby, and gorgeous pool area. The walk to the strip was not all that long. The rooms had a full kitchen with a side-by-side refrigerator, dish washer, dishes, stove, and sink, great sitting area, a large bathroom with a whirlpool tub, huge shower and vanity, and a separate sleeping area. Well-kept hotel, very clean, and decorated nicely. I enjoyed my stay, and will be returning to the Platinum when I make another trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carlie L
Reviews.Content: Stayed over New Years Weekend, perfect location just a 5 minute walk to the strip. Best location I can imagine since you are so close to the fun, yet can leave and return to a peaceful hotel at anytime. This was my first time in Vegas and all of the staff was extremely helpful. The rooms are AMAZING. Staying in just a standard room you get a massive bathroom, jacuzzi, full kitchen, living room and bedroom. Pool area is great, super clean and relaxing atmosphere. I will never stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TheSteggs
Reviews.Content: Great place off the strip - REALLY helpfull staff, could kick a footy in the bathroom. Had friends who atyed in another place on the strip, while their location and view were perhaps superior, their staff and the general 'feel' of the place did not get close to The Platinum. Being a non casino hotel was a HUGE bonus!! No hesitation in recommending - only good memories!

Reviews.Title: “A Platinum Experience - Worth Being "off the Strip"”
Reviews.Author: Aliesa G
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a meeting in Vegas. This was our first experience being in a non-casino hotel, and off the Strip. Have to say we would definitely stay here again! Hotel was quiet, rooms are huge, lots of closet space, and as an all-suite hotel an added perk was a full kitchen - sink, stove, full-sized fridge, microwave, coffee pot! Staff will bring you pots & pans by request. Every meal we ate in the restaurant here was quick, fresh, and tasty. Massage in the spa was one of the better ones I've had at a hotel. Fitness center is open late (tend to close early at all the casino hotels...) and fitness room was huge and well equipped. Indoor-outdoor pool and hot tub - great deck to hang out on, and the whole property was wonderfully quiet. It was a quick cab ride to get to the action, and a couple of times the hotel had a car available and dropped us where we needed to be. Our meeting room was great - my only comment is that it was challenging to control meeting room temp. But overall a wonderful experience. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but a hot walk to the strip in july”
Reviews.Author: karennorthampton
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days here before our road trip. Stayed in a suite which was huge and had great air con (vital) - bedroom with 2 large double beds, bathroom with jacuzzi bath and lovely shower, living area with sofa bed and a fully equipped kitchen. Lots of nice touches in the room. The swimming pool was great and had pool toys for the kids. Didn't eat in restaurant so can't comment but menu looked good. Garage and 24/7 close by. It's probably about 400m from the strip and there is very little shade when you walk there which means HOT HOT HOt - but then Vegas in July is like being in an oven. We went to two cirque du soleil shows - LOVE and Mystere both were absolutely fantastic and would recommend unreservedly. Eating wise in Vegas - avoid the Rainforest Cafe as very over-priced. Visit Carnegies deli in the Mirage for their cheese cake.

Reviews.Title: “Find a home away from home a few steps away from the Vegas Magic”
Reviews.Author: Terry P
Reviews.Content: The Platinum hotel is a real find in the midst of the Vegas action. You are provided with an apartment that meets all your needs just a short walk from the Vegas action. The room is clean, well appointed, roomy, very QUIET, and comfortable. The bathroom is spacious and the room the same. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. It's a peaceful oasis close enough to the hustle and bustle of Vegas to enjoy it when you want it. The people are great and the value is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great non-smoking hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheilia P
Reviews.Content: We recently had a meeting at this hotel in LasVegas. I loved that it was non-smoking because even when you request a non-smoking room in a smoking hotel, it still smells like smoke. This place did not and it was very clean and inviting. The standard room is actually a mini apartment with a full size refrigerator, mini dishwasher, four burner stove, microwave, dishes and utensils. There was even a new unopened sponge and a bottle of dish soap. There was a nice living space, the granite counter had four seats and separated the kitchen from the living "room." The bathroom was huge. You could access it from the main room and another door from the bedroom. The bedroom was spacious and had another tv. There was also a balcony with a table and chairs. Very inviting, comfortable and easy to work or relax in this large space. The service was fantastic in every part of the hotel. We also enjoyed the breakfast and lunch menu several days and again, we were impressed with the food and the reasonable pricing. Will definitely stay here again and recommend to others. One more thing. It was an easy walk to the casinos or an inexpensive cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Option for Families and Non-Smokers”
Reviews.Author: beaker_321
Reviews.Content: The Platinum was better than expected, and I had some pretty high expectations. If you want to bring your family to Vegas and are less interested in the more adult aspects of Vegas, I can't imagine any other hotel in Vegas that could be better. They have no casino, no slots, and no smoking anywhere in the building. The service, accommodations, and amenities are all of good to high quality. On top of that, I think the pricing is a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Never a bad word..”
Reviews.Author: pepsi_enya
Reviews.Content: Visited the Platinum Hotel again this year, whilst celebrating my 30th Birthday. Once again an amazing trip and stay. On arrival an error was made, stating I had ordered two rooms and paid for two rooms instead of one. This was quickly resolved and a slight upgrade with immediately given. The Champagne and chocolates arrived the next day as a birthday treat. I would always recommend this hotel to anyone going to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, very clean, awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: mwestbrook3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect home base for New Years weekend activities in Vegas. The strip view room was perfect for watching the strip fireworks. The spa is very relaxing, the pool is clean and has access to the bar/restaurant. They seemed a bit overwhelmed with the amount of people that were checking in for the holiday since housekeeping was a little behind. But the staff was more than accomodating for all of our requests. We loved it here and will definitely stay here if we are in Vegas for New Years again.

Reviews.Title: “Peace Amidst the Madness”
Reviews.Author: CaramutJane
Reviews.Content: The Platinum offers beautiful new suites that are extremely spacious and comfortable. We travel with three children so the full kitchen was brilliant. There is even a dishwasher. (The only trouble is finding healthy food to put in it. Head into the suburbs to a supermarket.) The beds were fantastic - the best I have found in a hotel for a long time. There was a big pull-out sofa in the lounge which was useful to us with 5 guests. One of the best features was the two person spa in the bathroom. Lovely. There is a heated indoor-outdoor pool in a nicely decorated roof-top area which is a relief from the busy city. The downstairs bar looked wonderful though we didnt get a chance to try it. We paid $165 (plus tax) a night for a large suite with 2 queens and a view of the Strip. It is a ten minute walk to the Strip and 15 minutes to the Bellaggio fountains and Ceasars. A message to people with small children - the strip is not very pram friendly. It is busy and there is not much space on the sidewalks. Eat at Marilyn's Cafe, is a five minute walk from The Platinum, inside the Tuscany Casino. I would stay at the Platinum again, in a flash, if only for the fake fireplace showing a warmly crackling fire.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent suites”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just before Christmas - the Platinum worked for us. Arriving: we got a taxi from the airport - got driven round the freeway whilst being told how quiet everything was and takings down. $30 - so no tip. Hotel says it should be $10-$15 to the Platinum and you need to say go via Paradise Road straight to Flamingo - not the freeway. Marquis suite: was excellent. Two bedrooms/bathrooms separated by large sitting/kitchen area. Fully equipped kitchen and a washer with separate dryer in a large cupboard. And 3 views of the strip with a balcony that would be more inviting in warmer weather. Housekeeping: seemed to be having an off week when we were there. Others have noted that here. Hope that is a temporary blip or it will blight what is an excellent hotel. Fellow guests: the touring Michael Jackson Cirque du Soleil cast and crew were staying at the Platinum while it was playing at the Mandalay - it would be a good place - quieter but still close to the Strip. Dining: We arrived late so had room service first night. It was surprisingly good in terms of quality and price. Above average for room service. Breakfast - again more of the same and the staff were really great. You can get a Platinum breakfast, which will be far more than you can eat, for $11. Less gigantic dishes also available... Walking: we walked back and forth a bit - there is a reduced price tickets place just on the right where E Flamingo meets the Strip - as you have to be there early (9:30) to get the best choice of the day's tickets, it's good to know it's less than 15 minutes away. We wouldn't really recommend walking around on your own anywhere much but there were 3 of us and we never felt uncomfortable. There were some homeless people around but they seemed to be pretty absorbed in their own difficulties. Anyway, once you've walked past the Westin on the other side of the road you can turn into the side road of Ballys and then into Ballys and out onto the Strip if you want to. We only did to get out of the evening cold. You can also walk down Koval and up East Harmon to get to the Aria/MGM end of town though probably only in daylight. It does avoid the piped music, which does get a bit spooky after a while. The Strip: Fantastic lights, Bellagio Fountains, MGM Lions, The Venetian and Caesars Palace all worth seeing. Definitely take in a show and if you can stand the smell of stale cigarettes overlaid with carpet shampoo then a stroll through the casino area of any of the main hotels is great. The Fashion Show mall is huge - just down from TI - with a Macys, Nordstrom, Neiman Marcus etc. Our absolute favourite thing was the Antiquarian Book store - Bauman Rare Books The Shoppes at the Palazzo - probably because it was so unexpected and they had some extraordinary books.
