One thing you probably already know but in case not... the sex trade is very present, in the form of magazines, advertising material and people trying to push flyers at you every 2 minutes or so. They are not around the bigger hotels but move away and you're fair target.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal on many levels”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsSJ
Reviews.Content: We booked via Expedia and got a great deal of 1 night free for a 5 night booking. Location ideal for us as we wanted off the Strip but centrally placed. It is a 5 minute walk to corner of Bally, Bellagio and Caesars Palace hotels. No casino in house which makes it quiet. We had a suite with everything you could want including jacuzzi bath. It also faced the Strip so great night view. There is also a small 711 store just outside handy for essentials. The staff were very nice and Concierge a great help with booking trips to Hoover Dam and car hire at best prices. Cannot recommend hotel highly enough. Only drawback for some may be that it is on a corner by itself surrouned by bare lots and car parks.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: RuthSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice (before and after) on our trip to and from the Colorado Plateau. It suited our purpose perfectly: the price was right, no casino (no noise), nonsmoking, adequate bar, good breakfast, and of course the suite. My husband likes to get up before me and fix coffee and read for a while. The separate living room and separate access to the bathroom worked perfectly. We didn't stay long enough to make use of the full kitchen. It's close enough to the strip to walk, which we did, but that wasn't our primary purpose for being there.

Reviews.Title: “Good suites and fitness centre and free wifi!”
Reviews.Author: Baggers82
Reviews.Content: Great space and the full kitchen was brill, had a nice view of the strip and there was an en suite jacuzzi that fit two! There's a fitness centre which was great and free wifi in the public areas. The very long happy hour (4pm- 8pm!) is great value and the bar staff were really chatty and helpful. This hotel does not have a casino so is non smoking and it was great to have a non smoky place to drink and go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Week Before Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Wareagledec2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days just prior to Christmas. The rooms are large with a full kitchen. Jacuzzi tub was nice. The bedroom is seperate from the living room/kitchen which is quite convenient. Hotel will supply limited, but adequate pots & pans. Nonsmoking, nongambling hotel. It does not smell of stale cigarette smoke like most everywhere else in Vegas. Valet parking was well run. We had a car, so the distance to the Strip or restaurants is not a problem. If you want to have a bunch of restaurants/shopping in a close walking distance - then stay in a mega casino or stay on the strip. Small area of the pool is heated and usable in the winter. But you must walk outside for a short distance to get to the pool area. Did not use the gym. Restaurant was fine for breakfast. Negative - cleaning staff did not pay attention to details. This seems to be a recent problem with the property. When something was left off (shampoo, coffee, etc.....) the front desk fixed the problem promptly. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: jaj1519
Reviews.Content: Great value for the space! Large one bedroom suite with kitchen and jacuzzi tub. Nice pool and restaurant. Off strip, but close-by. Made an easy walk when we wanted to get into the mix -- and quiet and handy for the times that we didn't want to be part of the insanity of the Strip. Will definitely stay again the next time I'm in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay at but wouldn't return if i was staying there by myself”
Reviews.Author: Hourray
Reviews.Content: If u have to stay in vegas or more than a coupke of days, the Platinum hotel is the place to stay at. Large suite with full kitchen (including small diswasher) .. Some of hem even have washer/dryer (princess suites). LOVED - en suite jacuzzi - 3 little cakes they hung on the doorknob for xmas - quality of the customer services they provided - didn't have a casino - non smoking hotel - complimentary valet parking -tons of great restaurant options around (not necessarily n the strip; morton's, fogo the chao, buca de preppo) and a grocery store (Albertson, +\- 10min by car) WASNT THRILLED ABOUT - walking from the strip to the hotel at night. 3 locks but lots of beggars; didn t feel too safe when i was walking by myself - cleaning job wasn't always thorough (found a used condom in trash when we came in, toilet bowl not cleaned thoroughly, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Good suites, limited resturant availablity”
Reviews.Author: travelabit
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very large, and have a fully kitchen available. Downside is that there is no location within walking distance to pick up groceries to use in it. It is just a short walk to the strip, but the walk is mostly along a fenced in abandoned lot. The resturant is not open for supper. The lounge on the main floor is open, but it serves mostly "small bites" and not meals. TV in main room didn't receive the same channels as the bedroom unit. Jets in tub did not work. It is very nice that this is a non smoking hotel with no gambling in it. Staff was pleasant and the internet (wired and wireless) works well.

Reviews.Title: “Decent walk to the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: stev79
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay in Las Vegas was spent at the Platinum Hotel and Spa in early September 2012. The hotel is well appointed with spacious, comfortable rooms and very helpful, friendly staff. The airport is just a short taxi ride away and the hotel pool is a welcome aspect on sweltering Las Vegas days. The only downside of the hotel is that it is a four block walk past vacant parking lots to the famous strip. Although this doesn't seem a great distance it does require a certain level of fitness when temperatures soar above 100 degrees. An attraction for my wife and I was that there is no casino attached to this hotel. In hindsight however, although the Platinum Hotel is of a high quality, we would have stayed on the strip at one of the larger hotels simply for convenience. While in Las Vegas we did take advantage of the opportunity to take a helicopter tour to the Grand Canyon and I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: martinandlindaEssex
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been amazing, the location is brilliant it is a 10 min walk from the strip, or you could catch the bus outside the hotel, just $7 for 24 hours and it will take you anywhere, we stayed on it for a while just to see different areas, excellent value, I would not bother with the monorail, that is $12 for 24 hours and you just see the backs of hotels and parking bays, very disappointing. I love the fact it has no casino attached and that it is completely no smoking. The rooms are out of this world everything you possibly need including and enormous whirlpool bath, (would have like a TV in there, but then again, I would never get out of the bath. :)) The hotel was spotlessly clean, the maids really do an excellent job. The stir bar is nice and quiet after a busy day on the strip, and taps food was good value especially during happy hour when tapas and drinks are half price. The staff are friends and helpful we especially loved Brian in the bar, who tried to teach my husband the basics of craps, we will find out how successful he was when we go and play later. I have nothing but praise for this hotel, and if we were back in Vegas then we would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great place, medium length walk”
Reviews.Author: C4S1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights in the heat of summer. Our room was extremely spacious, with a full kitchen, small balcony and huge whirlpool bath as well as a seperate bedroom. The restaurant on site is good, especially for breakfast and prices are reasonable. The inddor/outdoor pool is pretty good, but shade is an issue in the afternoon. There is a 7-11 about 3 mins walk if you dont mind the homeless hanging around, we never had a problem. The hotel is about a 12 min walk to the back of Ballys where you can hit the airconditioning again. It is a great place to stay if you dont mind walking. They have a town car that can drop you around the strip when it is available, which worked for tips.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel and service!!”
Reviews.Author: Roni67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located off the strip and is very quiet. The complimentary valet service was great! The moment you drive up or step outside the hotel, someone is right there to take or retrieve your vehicle. The hotel itself is very clean. The staff is personable, and very knowledgeable about the surrounding area. I needed help getting everywhere! My suite was beautiful! It had stainless steel appliances, very comfortable bed, spa tub, separate shower, a large screen television, internet access, a balcony, and another great thing....it's smoke free! I had all the conveniences of home! This is where I will stay EVERY TIME I visit Las Vegas. I don't have the words to say how great this hotel really is.

Reviews.Title: “Free upgrade to suite”
Reviews.Author: mj316
Reviews.Content: We booked a regular king room and on checking in found out to our delight that we had been upgraded to a suite. The room was huge - it made it hard to actually leave! The location is not on the strip, which is nice in some ways. It is nice to not walk through a casino to get outside. However, the walk to the strip is deceivingly long. In all, the positives of the location outweigh the negatives. Service is friendly and efficient. The attached bar is a nice place to relax with a drink over happy hour. In all, I would highly recommend the platinum. Ask about an upgrade at check in and you might be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel as the reviews mentioned”
Reviews.Author: Osiane
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious and affordable hotel 2 street away from the Strip. With its kichen in our room, we saved on food. The staff was really helpful. Being not directly on the strip helps for the noise, however, don't forget that you are in Las Vegas, the city that never sleeps. However, being a non-gaming and non-smoking hotel is a great retreat from the life on the strip. One tip, if you are looking for a grocery store, rent a cab as it is quite a long walk to get there.I would go back to that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service + Upscale + Clean + Big Suites + Barely a Block Off Center-Strip + VALUE = The Platinum Hotel and Spa!”
Reviews.Author: HappyKampersToo
Reviews.Content: The Platinum was a breath of fresh air, literally, when compared to the cigarette smoke and air-freshener infused casino hotels. We visited just after-Thanksgiving, and changed our planned one-night visit into three nights. A sanctuary of relative peace in the middle of the Vegas bustle. For contrast, I'll tell you about a night at a different hotel on our recent visit. First night: Stayed at a famous old casino, recently renovated, with a discounted room through their reservation service. It was mediocre service, bored employees, crowded elevators, long walks to parking, no view, broken vending and ice machines on multiple floors, hair other than ours in the bathroom, and redish-brown paint stains on the room carpet and furniture. Not a terrible facility, just barely mediocre. 'Express Check-out' box caused a $50 'late checkout surcharge' because the box was emptied after the11am checkout time. Overall experience: underwhelming mediocrity and poor value. Days 2-5: The Platinum Hotel and Spa(ahhh!) Parking: The valet opened my companions door, was cordial, professional, (and handled our luggage personally all the way up to our room.) He familiarized us with the valet service, basic hotel policies, and operations. After taking luggage to our room, he made sure we had everything that we needed, offered us extra towels, and had the cookware delivered. There was no valet charge mentioned, so I gladly tipped $10 for his positive attitude, good service, and attention to our needs. Check-in: 10pm was very smooth with only one other customer ahead of us. We were seated by the valet attendant in a small plush lounge, with comfortable sofa and chairs for the short 2-5 minute wait. A polite and efficient young gentleman handled our check-in. While working on our check-in he asked about the purpose for our stay, and then made some great recommendations on everything from food, shopping, and even general questions about Vegas. He answered some questions with an honest, 'I don't know, but will find out,' and then actually followed-up the next day! When he found out that we might stay for three nights instead of one, he asked my permission to change our room so that we wouldn't need to change later. He then apparently upgraded us to a better (princess?) suite with view at no charge! There were no sob stories needed, no $20 tip-sandwiches, nor a request was needed for that level of attention. Tipping for this level service is a pleasure. The Room: A Full Princess suite, clean, quiet, Kitchen with polished appliances, stove, full-size fridge with in-door ice and water, full smooth-top range, microwave, dishwasher, shiny clean stone counter tops. Laundry room with clean washer, dryer, iron and ironing board, laundry soap, etc. Living Room with balcony, big (sleeper?) sofa, chairs, electric fireplace, massive flat screen TV, balcony with table and chairs, and even a decent view. Bedroom:Two plush queen beds, soft clean sheets, big-screen tv in bedroom, closet with in-room laptop safe. Lots of room, plenty of lighting, and a window with a decent view. Bathroom was very clean, big deep multi-person spa tub with jets, large shower, double sinks, stone vanity, extra mirrors, hair dryer, large closet, nice tile floors and windows. Very nice, very clean. Late check-out and later housekeeping service was offered to us due to our late arrivals. This allowed us to sleep late in the mornings, with no pounding on the door by housekeeping...nice touch. A cooler of chilled water with real fruit and large cups were available in the lobby. It really helped us adjust to the dry climate and was welcome after walking the strip. There was a nicely appointed cocktail lounge off of the lobby, with music at a level that allowed relaxed conversation. We didn't try the food service, but the wings (I think) smelled great. Each trip we made out and back via car was painless due to the quick valet service. The staff even spoke to us by name after the second day, which was a nice touch. Internet service was quick, television reception was clear, and there was a good selection of free programming. The desk/operator answered the phones within three rings the few times we called. All in all, this was a very comfortable, quiet, quality stay within a block of center-strip hustle and bustle. Check out Google maps for just how close it is to places like the Bellagio and Bill's. The Platinum is an excellent value based on our experience. During our stay the suites were discounted to under $150/night, which I consider a steal given the level of service and location. There are a number of places to eat reasonably nearby, reasonable Italian, and even a new excellent Fogo de Chao all-you-can-eat Brazillian Steak house just down the block. Check it out for a great lunch that will stay with you until the next day! But with a full kitchen available, it's really convenient to eat cheap when you want in your suite. The Platinum has earned our repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: drumspider
Reviews.Content: we had two rooms here at the beginning of November, one of them as a special treat for our daughter who had got married in Vegas two days before. The fact that we had full facilities and it was non-gaming made this an excellent choice. the suites are a great size, the place was well kept and looked after by very attentive staff. the valet parking was a bit of a bind - I can park a car - but the guys were cool and did their job brilliantly, and we had a good laugh with a couple. we'd certainly look at staying here again; handy for the strip, and as another reviewer said, head away and you can get to good eateries like Bahama Breeze only 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for Vegas Trip”
Reviews.Author: MarciMo
Reviews.Content: The Platinum Hotel and Spa is the perfect place to stay for trip to the Vegas Strip. The hotel offers a close retreat from the craziness - two blocks from the Strip. The staff are super friendly and personable; they remember your name and greet you with a smile! The rooms are very upscale mini apartments with lots of space. The pool area is very cool with large lounge chairs and fire pits. The hotel is smoke free and casino free with a nice spa so you can regroup before going back to the Strip. What else could you possibly want!

Reviews.Title: “Extra large rooms”
Reviews.Author: JuliefromPerth
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to return to our hotel every night to these extra large rooms. The benefit of being able to have breakfast or snacks in the room plus washer and drier made these seem like home. The staff were superb always helping with transport or even scanning documents for us. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Kate V
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to arrive at the beautiful one bedroom suite after a long trip from Australia. The rooms were spacious with a well appointed kitchen and plenty of room for our family of 6. Staff were also very helpful in driving us to a few places as our family needed two taxis to go anywhere. It is a bit of a walk to the strip but probably worth it particularly with kids. The pool was everything we needed for a cool off in the extreme heat.

Reviews.Title: “How Do They Do It?”
Reviews.Author: Mick122
Reviews.Content: When so many other hotels in and around the strip look to get you booked in but do the minimum to get their $, the Platinum is an oasis for people who would like more than just a hotel room. I was given a room on the top floor, but facing away from the trip and loved it. It was quite, the staff could not have been more supportive and the amenities have to be seen to be believed. My room was a one bedroom self-contained apartment. The kitchenette had everything I could ask for (including a coffee machine, with coffee pack). The spa in the bathroom was more decadent than a single guy catching up with friends in Vegas deserved. This Platinum is only a 5 minute walk from Bally's, Paris, Caesar's and Bellagio but is in another universe when it comes to facilities and service.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jem”
Reviews.Author: Mike70000
Reviews.Content: While I agree with the positive reviews on TripAdvisor, I would like to emphasize some of the things I think are special about this hotel. I was impressed by the room size (950 Sq. Ft. on our first stay and 1,150 Sq. Ft. on our second stay). Besides the normal amenities, the rooms are remarkably well appointed -- plates, flatware, glasses, cooking utensils, paper towels, dish washing and laundry soap. They had large closets and a double whirlpool tub. Our room was spotlessly cleaned everyday. The staff at the hotel was great. Valet service was prompt (thanks Donn). The Spa was very welcoming (thanks Tina). While the Spa has a $5 charge it you don't have a spa service, it is well worth this modest charge. Though the hotel was a short distance from the strip, we had a car and would park in the hotel garages on the strip (free). This was quick and convenient. I'm going to conclude with a few final thoughts. Both of our rooms had a great view of the strip. There was no resort fee and valet parking was free (but tip your Valet). This hotel made our two stays in Vegas special and will be were we stay when we return.

Reviews.Title: “A secret worth sharing”
Reviews.Author: Jane R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Platinum for 19 nights - using the hotel as a base for a golfing holiday. What can I say - the hotel and all of the staff were incredibly helpful and kind. Special mention should be made of Derek the rooms manager who was extremely helpful when we had a problem with the showers in our room and Roger who leads his team,of valet and bell boys by example. I have been to Las Vegas several times and stayed in a different hotel each tiime. We chose the Platinum as it was a non smoking and non casino hotel which makes a huge difference. The walk to the strip is 10 minutes maximum and as two females travelling together we never encountered any problems as stated in previous reviews. If you are visiting Las Vegas I would thoroughly recommend the Platinum for its value for money, friendly and efficient service, in suite amenities and most definitely the comfiest beds you will find.

Reviews.Title: “just back from las vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ian B
Reviews.Content: this is a fantastic hotel , as an ex smoker ( about 2 weeks ) it was great to stay here as unlike many places in the USA allows smoking as much as in vegas ( you can smoke in most casinos) the room we had was overlooking the strip we where a party of 6 guys and i had the sofa bed in the lounge with a separate door to the bathroom i did not have to disturb the guys in the bedroom , the staff could not do enough for you form breakfast staff topping your coffee mug every time you needed it to housekeeping getting little things for you , will stay here again it is a short walk to the strip but try going the other way we found some nice restaurants just behind the hotel its the size of the rooms and the staff that make this a great place to stay , you do not need a casino plenty to visit else where but its heated pool is nice in november when the weather is a bit colder

Reviews.Title: “This non-smoking,no casino Hotel is an Oasis !”
Reviews.Author: Malena
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this Hotel ! King size pillow top bed which we could even see the strip from. A balcony with a table and 4 chairs, enjoyed our evenings sitting outside looking at the lights of the strip and then having our morning coffee,which was supplied by the Hotel. The 4th floor pool was clean and we had sun until 6:30 p.m. It has a good amount of loungers and covered sun beds. Hot tub was on the smaller side but it was actually Hot! The only fault was a late check-in (4:00pm) but they more than made up for it by giving us a 16th floor-strip view room.The lounge's 2 for 1 happy hour includes all their drinks,beer and wine and all the appy's on the menu. On Monday's (when we were there) they had a free wine and cheese night (3 white,3 red to choose from) and a very good selection of cheese/crackers. Also a yummy baked cheese-filled pastry .The singer performing was very good and even took requests! It's a short 4-5 min.walk to the strip right behind Bally's. We can't wait to return next year & highly recommend this Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Sam D
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel just off the main strip. No casino but a great atmosphere. Well appointed large rooms and a nice pool area. The walk is not bad to the strip, maybe 4 or 5 minutes. They have a nice lounge area with free drinks during happy hour and really good local entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with no casino.... Bliss”
Reviews.Author: cmdpc
Reviews.Content: We went to LV to get married. A beautiful cosy modern hotel off the strip, but still close to the strip. 7 Eleven mart and diner close by. No casino or no smoking. Big kitchen, sofa flat screen TV, wash and dryer. Big 2 sinks bathroom with Jacuzzi. Massive bed. Balcony with view of strip. Good choice of breakfasts. Swimming pool + Jacuzzi. Wi-Fi (have to pay for the code but then use it for free). We had a lovely massage at the spa too. Overall a great stay with our wedding party.

Reviews.Title: “Three generations from Nova Scotia love this hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: DebRW
Reviews.Content: Recently my Mother, myself and my daughter stayed at the Platinum for a week. We enjoyed every moment that we spent at this hotel. When we checked in we were originally on the 7th floor and I requested a higher floor because being from the country we wanted to experience the "city" life as best we could while on vacation. The lovely young lady at the front desk gave us a room on the 15th floor with a strip view. It was fantastic.... We had a rental car and the valet parking staff were always right there to open the car doors when we arrived back at the hotel and they were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and very large. The stainless steel appliances and granite countertop are evidence that the hotel is a class act!! We intended to purchase groceries and eat breakfast in our room but after going to the hotel restaurant for breakfast on the first morning we felt as if we were among friends and ate there almost every morning there after. The restaurant staff were awesome!!!! And the food was first rate... One evening after a long trip to the Grand Canyon Skywalk we ordered room service and it was very prompt and reasonably priced. The young lady who delivered our meal took time out to chat and recommend things to see and do. We mentioned to her that we were going to see Garth Brooks at the Wynn and a few days later we met her on the elevator and she asked us aid we enjoyed Garth....we were very impressed that she remembered us. All the staff at this hotel are exceptional as are the accommodations. I will definately recommend The Platinum to anyone who is thinking of a trip to Las Vegas and I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The Platinum staff are part of the reason out trip to Las Vegas will be a cherished memory for all three generations!!!! Many thanks....hope to return someday!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum for 3 nights out of a 10 day swing through Nevada and didn't want to leave. No smoke! No gaming noise! No crowds of people in the lobby! The employees greeted us with "Welcome home!" every time we came back to the hotel. We went to a show every night and absolutely hated the casinos where the shows were located. We couldn't wait to get back to our friendly oasis at the Platinum. The full kitchen saved us from having to eat every meal out, and the washer/dryer at this middle-of-our-trip stopover enabled us to fly with carry-ons only - we didn't need to pack 10 day's worth of clothing. I've booked a 4-night stay for a return trip in March. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Platinum Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mn-ta
Reviews.Content: The Platinum is a smoke-free, casino free hotel and I loved it. It is a great relief from all the the hustle, bustle, noise and smoke of the Las Vegas strip and its' environs. The rooms were very clean and large, actually apartment like. The employee's are friendly and service-oriented. The Platinum was very quiet and I never had to wait, check-in/check-out literally took about 3 minutes each. If you are looking for a break from the Las Vegas strip, this may be what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Girls' Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Victoriagurl
Reviews.Content: 4 of us girls stayed in room 1418 for 4 nights in November with NO REGRETS! We got a Princess Suite with a strip view - two Queen beds plus a pull-out Queen sofa bed. LOVED IT! There are no long lines in the lobby for check-in. We were in Bellagio one night and the lines were at least 20 deep with exhausted travellers draped all over their luggage looking frustrated. Platinum means 3 valets to open the door...friendly staff, no lines, large rooms & all the amenities. IMMEDIATE service for anything you might need. In fact, staff called to ask if we needed more towels after seeing 4 women check in - the towels and extra robes arrived in minutes. The suite is huge...the bathroom is huge...there is a jetted tub, two sinks and a great stand-up shower. Balcony, fitness room, pool and hottub - never wait for a lounge chair or an elevator! I stayed at the Cosmopolitan in May and as swanky as it is --- I prefer the quiet & cleanliness of the Platinum. Yes, the walk to the strip is long if it is chilly or super hot but after the first couple days we just took cabs back from whichever hotel we decided to stop walking at - $7 at most. We ate at the breakfast restaurant and although the food was good - service was sloooooowwwwww and confused. Lots of staff milling here and there but no one really seemed sure of what their role was. Gita, the concierge was fantastic and helped us with bookings and suggestions. Is this flashy & VEGAS-Y ?.. no...is it smokey? , no...can you gamble? no.... if you want to be immersed in the over-stimulation of Vegas 24-7 then don't stay here....if you like to keep the chaos on the strip and have a decent sleep with no stress STAY HERE! Thank you Platinum for doing it right and keeping your service standards high.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulreeves201042
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas. We stayed for 8 days arriving on the 4.11.11. The rooms at the Platinum are like apartments and come with fully fitted kitchens/ lounge areas, large bedrooms, good size separate bedrooms and large separate luxury bathrooms. Although there is no casino within the hotel we found this to be a bonus, as after a long day you can escape from the slot machine 'madness' and crowds of the strip. The staff and service are first rate and the food was excellent particularly the breakfasts and not overly priced. The hotel is idealy located being a less than 10 minute walk from Ballys Casino and the strip. Also nearby, is the Monorail which although does not cover the entire length of the strip will save tired feet and provide quick access to many of the major attractions. For onward or home journeys the airport is also just a 10 minute taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Honoring an old request for a room”
Reviews.Author: Marjorie M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice before at the Platinum. The second time had some problems so I filled out a comment card. Upon arriving home, I received an email offering me a discounted rate on my next stay because I complained. This was 4 years ago. I followed up with the Platinum about that old email; they said of course! We received champagne and chocolate covered strawberries upon our arrival, yum.

Reviews.Title: “An English point of view”
Reviews.Author: Martin L
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its rating on Trip Advisor (#2 in LV when I first looked around the web) and its price. A 1st class choice with a deserved reputation Excellent hotel which is a 5 minute (perhaps less) walk from the Strip. My 'room' was a suite with several small shops (eg/ a 7-11) nearby (and larger ones on the strip itself) for stocking the fridge. Why pay for the Strip hotels when this is better and cheaper and also quieter ! Downtown LV is a bus ride away (the Freemont Street experience was simply terrific and must NOT be missed - free of charge too). Airport is a $25 - $30 taxi ride each way (don't wait for transfer buses - they take forever and can still cost). One of the monorail trains is very close by (Bally Casino Stop - costs $5 per journey). There are NO gaming machines/casino tables inside this hotel (another reason to go there !) but is you want to gamble, Ballys Casino and many other is 4 minutes away on foot (Caesars Palace is 6 minutes by foot). Free Wi Fi is included I would most certainly stay here again and most probably not bother looking at other hotels now I have found this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Off Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StacysMom_52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while on our way to California and were very pleased. I agree with a previous review that says these rooms resemble condos. We had a full kitchen with stainless steel appliances and granite counters, a living area, and awesome balcony, huge bathroom with a jetted double size tub, and huge walk in shower. The bedroom is huge plus three closets. The room and hotel were clean and modern. The staff attentive and helpful. It has a great pool area on floor 5 with awesome views of the strip. It does not have a casino yet that was not a negative for me. The only negatives I found were that there is no luggage stand and the carpet was a bit dirty around the living room side of the breakfast bar. Other than that, it was very comfortable. I'm sure we would stay here again since it is non smoking building, a good value, and less than half a mile to the strip, easily within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBHgirl
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Platinum. It is perfectly located right off the Strip. It is easy to get to the major hotels, restaurants, and casinos. The hotel is not huge. There is no casino on site, and it is entirely nonsmoking. I think it used to be condos, because the rooms are like apartments. Our room was huge, with a kitchen, sitting room, a large bedroom, and a large bath. We had a nice view of the Strip from our room. The rooms are quiet, the beds are comfy, and the bar downstairs was quite nice. The price is more than reasonable, and every member of the staff we interacted with was so nice and helpful. We have already booked for next year.

Reviews.Title: “would absolutely come back!”
Reviews.Author: byoung1970
Reviews.Content: My husband and I actually arrived in vegas on 11-09-11. As soon as we arrived we met Paulo who checked us in . The lobby is very nice and clean. Sine its no smoking, it didnt smell and no casino so its quiet. The rooms are wonderful size and ours had a mountain view...looking out over Tuscany hotel and hard rock hotel. beautiful view of the mountains and you can sit and watch the planes come in. There is a full kitchen and since we were getting married on that friday 11-11-11, it was perfect to bring our friends back to after ceremony.It held 14 of us quite comfortably. You have to call and ask for pans if you wish to cook, but big deal, its a phone call.A jetted tub in the bathroom came in ver useful since your gonna be doing alot of walking. And yes, it is a walk to the strip, but others have said it was a bad part of town and there were"undesirables" in the area, i never once felt unsafe at any time in the area, and believe me we were out at all hours.Room service was quick and for the amount and quality of the food, not badly priced at all. Anything i needed all we had to do was call and someone was right up. Our first night there we went for a walk and came back to chocolate covered strawbrries and champagne....platinum you did a great job!! Also, check in with them on foursquare and you get a free shot at the bar in the lobby!! All in all, the hotel and its staff were wonderful!! I would definately stay there again! And Paulo deserves big props....he was alway working and just as friendly as could be!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: AusToUT
Reviews.Content: Loved not having to walk through a smoky casino to get to our room. Full kitchen and balcony (but DO NOT smoke on it), jetted tub and short walk to all the action. Perfect for a getaway to be in Las Vegas but not IN Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms/suites, plus a balcony”
Reviews.Author: Katathome
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! No casino, no smoke smell. 2 blk walk to the corner of Ballys, Flamingo, Ceasars palace. Come on the walk is good for you considering what a person can eat in Vegas!!!! The suites are great with a full kitchen--- although not a pot or pan, just everything else including a dishwasher. Ours even had a washer and dryer. Bathroom had 2 sinks --- love that-- jacuzzi tub and a sep. Shower. Pool was so nice with a hot tub. The pool was outdoors and then you swim thru a channel indoors --- very cool!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: arjem
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in this hotel. Great spacious suite probably biggest I have ever stayed in with full kitchen, lounge, bathroom with jacussi bath and balcony over looking the strip. Service from all staff is excellent. Every request is met with a smile and fast response. The pool is very good, warm water and good loungers. The bar serves good food and very reasonable prices at Happy Hour 4pm to 8pm. There are a couple of 24 hour shops nearby to buy wine and food if you want. The Wifi service is very good too. The hotel maybe off the strip but it is only 10 min wall to Ballagio or Caesars Palace. If I come to LV again I would make this hotely first choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Suite at a Sweet Price”
Reviews.Author: Love vacation time
Reviews.Content: We occupied room 1507 and stayed 3 nights from November 13 thru 15. The suite is extremely comfortable with good bedding (2 queens). I love having a living room and kitchen where my wife and I can each utilize our own t.v. and stock the refrig with fruit, drinks, etc. The staff in general were very nice and the extra touches showed management cared.....apples in the lobby, water, free N.Y. Times and Los Angeles Times available. Wi-fi is available at no charge in the lobby and dining room or pool (forget which)....There is a charge for wi-fi in the room. The bedroom was approximatey 21 x 12. It had a t.v. (not flat panel), lounge chair, 1 drawer and shelf nightstand, one lamp between the beds (not great lighting), 4 pillows per bed, lamp by the lounge chair, sofa, 3 drawer dresser, closet with safe. The bathroom amenities included shampoo, conditioner and body lotion as well as a magnifying mirror (unlit). There are two sinks in a nice pullman. You will enjoy a separate shower with an excellent shower head as well as a jacuzzi tub for two. Water pressure was good. The bathroom is large (18 x 9 approx) with a full length mirror. Towels are stiff and not luxurious.....but plenty provided....4 bath and 4 hand. We did not receive night service. A substitute product for Kleenix was anything but satisfactory. The bathroom was clean and had marble throughout. The living room was 20 x 13 with a 13 x 9 kitchen. In the living room there was a couch, coffee table, lounge chair, end table with lamp, desk and desk lamp with chair. There is a flat screen t.v. with a wide range of available chanels. The kitchen had a s.s. refrigerator that includes a freezer (side by side). There are 4 bar stools, lots of counter space, toaster, microwave, oven and a varied assortment of utensils and and dishware. Certainly enough to get by. Of course there is a wine opener and and ice bucket. Maid service was good. So this is not a luxury hotel.....no gambling.....no shops.....but a nice coffee shop and cocktail lounge. We went here for value and the comfort of a suite and were not sorry. It was a good experience and we would return. If you want a luxury feel, head to the Wynn, Mandarin or Four Seasons.....If you want comfort and want to save a few bucks I think you will enjoy the Platinum. It compares with The Hotel in comfort although The Hotel might have a slight upsmanship in class.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel offers a fantastic value for money and is only minutes walk away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: andytseng
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I was in Vegas for 3 nights as part of our California trip. We chose this hotel based on the many positive reviews here at TripAdvisor as well as its attractive price (we took the advantage of "Stay 3 nights and Save 10% off your rate" deal). And we were not disappointed at all, it's one of the best place we stayed during this trip!! We arrived just before the normal 3pm check-in but the very friendly Brittney at the front desk informed us that our room was ready for us and she also provided us with the complimentary free wi-fi as well. We stayed in the "Solitaire Suite with a Strip View" and it was located on the top-most floor (17th). The room is massive, clean and tidy, and the view from our balcony (especially at night) was just beautiful. The Jacuzzi in our bathroom (again, a huge bathroom) is superb and we used it every night when we were there - a nice way to wash away a day of tiredness. We didn't spend too much time by the pool (but it looks really nice) as we had a busy schedule but we did have breakfast in the Kil@wat Restaurant 3 times and it was a always wonderful experience every time we were there. The duty manager and staffs there (in particular a lady originated from Florida, can't recall her name) were extremely friendly and helpful, and offered some great conversations - you cannot beat that to start the day!! ;-) The hotel is only a 10mins walk away to the Bellagio Hotel (where we saw the 'O' - cirque du soleil, a must see if you are ever in LV, we saw 'KA' one as well but 'O' is clearly the BEST!!) which is in the middle of the Strip, perfect for exploring/walking to either side of the Strip. We had no problem in walking home at nights as we felt very safe there. The cab is a short ride away and will cost you something like $7 (inc. tip) from Bellagio Hotel if you don't want to walk. The Platinum Hotel and Spa may not have the glamour exterior design (though I like it) than some of the more established hotels in LV but it is certainly one of the best hotel you can find there in Vegas. I will definitely be staying there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Bigger Than My Old Apartment!”
Reviews.Author: m p
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st trip to Las Vegas...work. I liked the fact I did not have to wade through cigarette smoke to get to the front desk. We arrived well before the 4pm check in time but the staff was more than happy to see if they had a room available...they did and i was a little shocked. I could have brought my entire family with the space that I had in this room. Washer/Dryer(there was also detergent and softener provided), stove, microwave, fridge this room had everything one could need other than the groceries. The kitchen also included glassware, plates, bowls, silverware, and some cooking utensils. Dishwashing detergent for hand washing and the dishwasher was also provided as well as a scrubby pad for cleaning dishes. The pull out bed from the sofa is a little thin and you will need to contact the front desk for bedding for it but it was still much more comfortable than expected. Pillows fluffy..bedding clean and an extra roll of toilet paper in the bathroom closet. The jacuzzi tub also functioned correctly...great after walking all day. Took the stairs down from the 14th floor...the staircase is well lit all the way down. I did not hear a bit of noise that wasn't being made by the TV the entire visit. I was amazed!! Stir happy hour includes the tapas menu so everything is 1/2 price from 4-8pm which is awesome if you want a quick snack before heading out to the vegas strip. I can vouch for the spicy bloody mary..mmmmm. The fitness center has new equipment and opens at 5am. It was very clean and they provided towels and a water cooler. They had both weights/strength training and cardio equipment. Would have like to have seen a spin bike versus your standard recumbant but I can't have everything. The pool is gorgeous and the view is even better! Front desk included 2 mounted I-pads so that you can print you boarding passes for the airport right there!! Wireless internet worked well in my suite even for a webinar I had to attend the 2nd night I was there. There is climate control in the room and to activate it for your own personal settings you must insert your room key directly by the light switch in the kitchen. The thermostat was next to the fireplace. I run a little cold so it was nice to be able to increase the temperature in the room to my liking. There are 3 convenience stores within a block including a 7 eleven and a am/pm. At night, vegas is gorgeous from any side of the hotel due to all the lights in the city. It is a short walk to the strip ~3-6 normal blocks so make sure you have comfortable shoes unless you utilize a cab the entire time you are here. Bought a 3 day pass for the bus which runs 24/7 up and down the strip for $20. Well worth it as it seems like that casino is just a few blocks away..remember everything is bigger in vegas and that block actually is a mile.

Reviews.Title: “really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pabloh36
Reviews.Content: after a little attitude problem w/the front desk girl everything was great. huge rooms more like apartments. can't think of any negatives. had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favourite Hotel - fantastic rooms and location for families”
Reviews.Author: Liztdunedin
Reviews.Content: This is more like an apartment than a hotel room. We had a full kitchen which was very spacious and had everything we needed to have breakfast, lunch and dinner on our room. There is a gas fire in the living area which gives a lovely ambience to the room. Our balcony looked over the strip, which was a couple of blocks away, so you couldn't hear any of the noise.We had 2 adults and 2 children in the bedroom, which had a wardrobe and TV. We used the pull out sofa in the living area for 1 child, they also had their own TV. The bathroom was very spacious and had great storage. We used the pool area every day, it had an outside and inside pool area, so great to get out of the sun if you needed to. It was always very easy to get a sunbed or chair, and we never had the bustle and noise that we saw at the busy hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: beavertrail
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las Vegas a number of times and have stayed in various hotels on the strip. For this trip we got an excellent deal through Snique Away at the Platinum Hotel and decided to give it a try. On arrival - a short cab ride from the airport - we were told that our room was not ready but would be in 15 minutes. I was a little surprised because it was 3 PM when we arrived but we went and sat in an area just off the lobby and waited. After 10 minutes the front desk clerk told us the room was ready, apologized for the wait and offered free internet connectivity from our room for the duration of our stay. I thought this was a great way to start off our stay at Platinum. The room was large - kitchen, living room, bedroom, bathroom with jacuzzi tub and separate shower stall. Very nice and clean and very quiet despite being on the 2nd floor overlooking Flamingo Road which is quite busy. The kitchen was well equipped and we took advantage of having the kitchen for breakfast in the morning. There are a couple of convenience stores close by or you could walk 2 kms along Flamingo to Albertson Supermarket or Target. There is no "WOW" factor to the rooms like at many of the strip hotels but for the price it was a good room. The hotel offers a pool, fitness centre and spa - we did not use any of these facilities. They also have a happy hour from 5 PM to 8 PM daily in the Stir Lounge. Minuses - though I didn't think two blocks from the strip was a big deal, it is at night when you are walking back to your hotel after a long Vegas day. Housekeeping did not put bathrobes in the room and never replenished the coffee/creamer supplies. We had to ask for bathrobes and coffee supplies at the front desk. These were quickly delivered but I don't think we should have to ask every day for coffee. The front desk and door staff are very friendly and helpful. They always responded in a courteous, professional and friendly manner. The staff made a point of greeting us each time we entered or left the hotel and definitely made us feel welcome and important. I'd consider staying at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good service, 6/7 minute walk to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Davethepom
Reviews.Content: Let’s start - if you are looking for the flash settings of Bellagio or Caesars this is NOT for you. If you want a great standard of hotel, good size rooms, good service and value - this is it. It IS a 6/7 minute walk to the strip but you walk straight to the junction of Bills / Caesars / Bellagio / Bally's - so you are right in the middle of the main strip. Our friends were staying at Bellagio and agreed their room was more "opulent" but when they visited they were amazed at the space and facilities we had (A princess suite - over 1,000 sq ft). If you need taxi's to get around, that can be a bit of a drag and the guys work hard to get them to the hotel - it can be a bit hit and miss at peak times though. Would definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dogface1739
Reviews.Content: It's early November and I just returned from a 6 day getaway with my wife. We selected this hotel after reading several reviews from past guests. When we arrived we were greeted by the parking attendant who offered their assistance with true interest and not the -- I want a tip attitude. FYI, self parking is not an option at the Platinum and quite frankly for a couple of bucks here and there, well worth it. Checking in was a breeze with the same "how can we help your stay more enjoyable" attitude from the staff behind the counter. This theme by hotel staff carried on throughout our stay. Our reservations placed us on the 9th floor looking towards the strip. The view from our room was OK at best because you are looking out over an old large vacant parking lot and towards the back of the casinos on the strip. At night the view was much better due to the lights. Opening our room door, you enter into the kitchen which is a full kitchen to include, fridge, stove, dishwasher, plates, glasses, etc... What was not in the room but we soon requested were pots and pans. We choose to make breakfast in the AM when we got up. A bit different having a full kitchen with no cook ware, but no biggie we just called down and they gleefully sent up anything we needed. It also includes things like dish washing soap, sponge, etc... The kitchen counter was granite and it separated the kitchen from the living room. The living room was also quite large which included a large flat screen TV with a sleeper sofa couch, coffee table, etc... There is a sliding door leading to the balcony that looks towards the strip that has a table and a few chairs for sitting. Located in a separate closet off of the kitchen/living room are the clothes washer and dryer . It too includes the all the necessities needed for washing your clothes. The little things like no need to get soap, sponges, detergent, fabric softener, etc... speaks volumes in being a customer service oriented facility. I say facility versus hotel because from what I gather, some units are owned by permanent residents and others are rented like you would experience in a typical hotel encounter. Enough of that, back to the details. Off of the living room is a door leading to the bedroom. The bedroom is very spacious and the bed was very comfortable. Not some cheesy worn out mattress but a seemingly new firm mattress. There are the typical night stands, lights, clock radio, and chairs adjacent to the bed. The bedroom has a clothes closet with a safety deposit box. We didn't use it but it's there for your convenience. There's a large window that also overlooks towards the strip. Off of the bedroom is the bathroom that comes with a large tiled shower, a large Jacuzzi tub for two, a double bowl sink, and another clothes closet that has its own hangers. There are two doors into the bathroom, one from the bedroom and another off of the kitchen. The hotel has a inviting restaurant/bar on the first floor that was warm and comfortable. We ordered drinks and had a few appetizers only once during our stay. The drinks were fine but we did complain about the shrimp ceviche they offer. I'm a bit picky on ceviche so if you are you too, you'll be disappointed. To their credit they were apologetic and immediately took it off our bar tab. Located on the fifth floor is an indoor/outdoor pool with a medium sized outdoor hot tub adjacent to the outside portion of the pool. The temperature in November was in the upper 50's/60's. The pool has its own towels so there is no need to bring one from your room. There is no life guard on duty so be cautious with little children. There is plenty of comfortable seating available. The temperature of the water was very relaxing and I'm not a cold water lover so you gauge. All in all I would highly recommend this place and return again. Keep in mind this is a NON-gambling hotel so if that is what you want you'll need to walk/drive to the strip for that or find another place to stay. The hotel is located on Flamingo Rd. and the walk to Las Vegas Blvd. takes about 5 min. From there your right smack dab in the middle of things. Now for the bad. The view from our room was OK. There weren't enough towels in the room. There were three sets. I never asked for more but I'm sure based on past experiences they would gladly provide more. That's it..... p.s. The cost of the room including tax was about: $230 on Friday and Saturday nights $170 on Monday, Tuesday, wednesday

Reviews.Title: “Condo-style hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraAnn_11
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Platinum Hotel in Las Vegas for four days and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.What we loved about this hotel was the quiet atmosphere, size of the rooms, and convenience to all that Vegas has to offer, without being in the midst of people, noise and crowds. Did I mention the great value for the money? We had a huge living area with a full kitchen, fireplace, great bedroom, lovely bathroom with a huge bathtub! The service is also outstanding. Nice restaurant. We had one issue with our shower temperature, which they tried to correct, but then we were lacking water pressure. Thank goodness for the big tub! They didn't hesitate to compensate us with a $50 credit for our inconvenience. The doorman, Jimmy, was very friendly and helpful, arranging taxis, and helping with luggage. The decor is a little tired perhaps, but clean and bright. Walk to Batistas for a fabulous Italian meal at a Vegas icon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good service, housekeeping needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: AmaWW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to come here for our Vegas trip due to other reviews on Trip advisor. Like most reviews the condo units are quite large for a one bedroom. There is 100% no smoking. ($500 fee is evidence of smoking is even found in room and on your balcony) There is a large Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. The full kitchen with an ice maker on the fridge was really nice. We were traveling with 2 other couples so the living room and kitchen space was a great gathering place afterwards. At check in we had a small issue but the front desk was quick to resolve that issue. Once we checked into our room we had encountered a couple housekeeping issues. I called down to the front desk and the housekeeping supervisors (2 of them) came up to the room to check to see what was wrong. Once I showed them the issues they informed us they would send someone up to fix it. When we returned from dinner my husband and I found a bottle of sparkling wine for our anniversary which was nice and noticed that housekeeping had come by and fixed the issues. The next day I had a quick last minute booking at the spa and found them to be quite good. The restaurant for breakfast was excellent. I really enjoyed the omelettes. The bell boys were excellent. We tried to get a cab, but unfortunately there was a long wait for them. One of the bellmen offered to drive us to our location using the company vehicle. I’m sorry that I don’t remember his name but it was on Nov 4th. He has been with the company since opening. He drove us to the North Premium Outlets. He was excellent in answering questions we had. I’m not sure if it was a misunderstanding with housekeeping on our last day but they had come by earlier and asked if we needed service. I had told her that my husband was in the shower and if she could come back after an hour it would be appreciated. However she never did. When we came back to our room nothing was done. I called the front desk and unfortunately at 9pm there is no housekeeping service but we did get new towels. Apparently the exact same thing happened to our friends staying next door. Not a big deal but a little disappointed in housekeeping at this location. Although I had encountered issues at check in and with housekeeping, I would probably come back depending on price. The location is off the strip but the no smoking, no casino and full condo units are nice. Housekeeping standards needs to be looked at. If I did not encounter the housekeeping or issue at check in I would rank this hotel 5 out of 5

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Huggles_83
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We booked a strip view and it was great. We had a full kitchen and balcony. The bathroom had a double spa in it (which was heaven after walking all day) and it was nice to have a sepearate bedroom and lounge. The staff were terrific! The only thing was staying off the strip, although it wasn't that far to walk (about 10-15mins) by the end of the day walking around the last thing you want to do is walk all the way back to your hotel so if you are staying for a while and intend on going out all day and night I would recommend staying somewhere like treasure island or the mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but really nice. Very family friendly.”
Reviews.Author: piedmontcamom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Platinum Hotel in November 2011 with my 8 year old daughter. The Platinum is one block from The Strip, about a 10-15 minute walk from Bally's and The Bellagio. (The blocks are very long in Vegas). The small lobby has a chic, night club feel to it. This is a non-gaming hotel, so there is no noisy, smokey casino floor to walk through. Whew! We had a pleasant check in. We had room 302, probably not the best room in the hotel due to the low floor, and it was right across from the elevators. However, I did not hear one single peep from inside the hotel during the entire stay - not the elevators, not a door slamming, no one walking through the halls. There was some minimal traffic noise at night, which was easily taken care of by earplugs since I am sensitive to noise while sleeping. The room was a solitaire suite with two double beds, strip view. The beds were pretty good but had a bit of a trough down the middles. Four pillows of nice fluffiness per bed. The room was huge and very comfortable, with a full kitchen and palatial bathroom. There is a separate living room and two TVs. The bathroom included a large jet tub, and I spent a wonderful hour sipping wine in there on Saturday night. There was also a separate shower. No bathrobes but apparently you can request them at no charge. Nice shampoo and soap. We ordered room service twice and it was prompt and mostly tasty, but the chicken soup and the sea bass were way over-salted. Some drawbacks that prevented me rating this hotel 5 stars: -horrible coffee, in the room and in the restaurant. Cappuccino was okay, but the regular coffee tasted like soil. -poor wine selection. Kind of like cheapy stuff that they jacked up the price on. Particularly the chardonnay. The pinot noir (not on the menu) was better. -continental breakfast was pretty lackluster -way too much chlorine in the hot tub. Our eyes were stinging within minutes. I rushed my daughter back to the room for a shower so we didn't get a rash from it. -surly check out lady (Ginger, I think). Overall, though, it was a very nice hotel. They staff was professional and courteous with that one exception. Comfy and quiet. No problem getting taxis and if you are a good walker, it is very doable to walk to the strip. A very good choice for us since I wanted to be out of the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: jsieloff
Reviews.Content: Loved our experience at this place. Clean, friendly helpful staff, nice atmosphere, great service. Short walk to the monorail or Bally's. Great strip view from private balcony. Relaxing and very pleasant pool area. All around really nice and worth the $.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and brilliant venue for wedding reception”
Reviews.Author: af_robb
Reviews.Content: we stayed here last month for a week along with a lot of our family. We also had our wedding reception in the Misora rooftop Terrace venue. The suites were fabulous, we were on the top floor with great views out across the mountains and up towards the Stratosphere. The room was clean and very spacious which helped on our wedding day as most of the bridal party got ready there. It was wonderful to be just 10 minutes from the strip but to be away from the madness of the casino hotels. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Marie Quinby who organised our weding reception was amazing. The Misora was fabulous, we couldn't have hoped for a better venue, the rooftop setting was fantastic, you certainly wouldn't have had that spectacular a view on the strip. The food was lovely and the service was great. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone I know who is going to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, mediocre housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Jacana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum for several reasons.....first was the high recommendation on Trip Advisor, second was that there was no casino and it was off the strip, and the price was right. We were told that this hotel was originally supposed to be a condo but with the poor economy, they turned it into a hotel. We were upgraded to a Princess Suite which was amazing----it was huge like an upscale condo. The kitchen was fully equipped although we didn't use it. The bathroom had a separte shower and jacuzzi tub for two. The reception staff was very nice and they had ice water, apples and candy in the reception area for guests. The location is a block off of the strip near Harrah's which is convenient to the monorail if needed. It should be noted that this is a very long block. They were happy to call a taxi for us whenever we needed one. The only cnmplaint we had about the hotel was the housekeeping. The first day the carpet didn't appear to have been vacuumed and one of the bathroom mirrors was very dirty. We left a note about the mirror and expected the carpet to be vacuumed on the second day. The mirror was cleaned but the carpet wasn't. We also noticed that there was a very thick layer of dust on the bedroom furniture. Again, we left a note and the furniture was dusted. The carpet was never vacuumed that we could see as the same pieces of lint and stuff was on the carpet throughout the stay. We menitioned this upon checkout just to let them know and we were told that they were working on their housekeeping standards. I would stay there again because the housekeeping wasn't a deal breaker.....the price, location, room size and quality and no casino were more important for us.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for a wedding.”
Reviews.Author: Sam H
Reviews.Content: My daughter has chosen this hotel to host her Wedding. The staff here, especially the wedding co-ordinators were outstanding. They were willing to help before, during and after the wedding to clearify or rectify all needs. Rooms were very nice. We had a larger room that included a washer and dryer. All rooms had a full size refrigerator and stove. Since this was a big family event, the ability to keep beverages and snacks cold really helped. It also saved us a bit by eating in instead of going to a restaurant every meal. The wedding on the pool deck was wonderful. We had the lights of 'The Strip' in the background and the fire pits made the evening very cosey. The wedding staff were amazing. The hotel is a couple blocks from the strip, so if you are handicapped you may have some problems. For those healthy enough to walk, this was a great location. Just far enough from the strip to miss the hassles but close enought to enjoy yourself. I would highly recommend this for a group/family get together. You don't have the distractions of a casino in the hotel, but they are available fairly close. So it is quieter and more relaxing than the casino hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Zebra71
Reviews.Content: My husband, grown son and I stayed in a Princess Suite. It was just as nice as the Princess suite my grown son and I stayed in last spring. We like the location--just behind Bally's. The suite was quite spacious, clean and comfortable. The view of Vegas from our windows was beautiful. The bathrom was HUGE--jacuzzi tub, shower and a long vanity with two sinks. We never heard a single sound outside our suite--VERY quiet. The staff members were all friendly, pleasant and helpful. Restaurant on 5th floor has a view of the pool; the food was delicious with generous portions. I'm glad the hotel is nonsmoking and it doesn't bother me that it has no casino. it's a short walk to LOTS of casinos. The Platinum Hotel is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Spacious Suites”
Reviews.Author: Henryjen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and were very impressed with the spacious and modern suite. We had a large kitchen with oven, dishwasher and fridge with icemaker. The bedroom was a separate room and the bathroom was very spacious with double vanity unit, large spa bath and generous sized shower space. We appreciated being in a smoke-free hotel with no casino, away from the strip. The strip was an easy walk from the hotel, when we did choose to go there. We hired a car for 3 days and were happy to get free parking at the hotel (valet only) The staff were always polite and helpful. We would definitely stay here again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and view”
Reviews.Author: jegbj
Reviews.Content: Brilliant for a family to stay. We were doing a 15 day road trip and this was wonderful luxury after 11 days. Valet car parking and doormen to open the doors. We stayed in a room with a strip view but with three children from 10 to 17 it was lovely to be close to the action but not the full hustle and bustle of the strip which was only a five minute walk or even closer if we used the next door hotel's moving walkway! The whirlpool bath gave great entertainment and the pool received all thumbs up for being warm indoor and out. We were able to cook in the small kitchette and the balcony view was brilliant especially when the strip lights came on. Even though roadworks were started at midnight on the road outside below our window nine floors up we did not hear it. Best to reserve a strip view if you want it as then you get the sun too.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of room, reasonable location near the Strip, but not particularly clean or well appointed.”
Reviews.Author: candsnz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the room had a large living area with a pull-out sofa bed, and the bathroom could be accessed from either the living area or the bedroom - so the third adult in our party didn't need to walk through the bedroom. While the space was very functional, and the kitchen reasonably well set-up, the room in general was rather tired, not particularly clean and the bedding was pretty poor (holes in sheets and awful, small, lumpy pillows). The air conditioning was extremely noisy, and the water pressure in the shower was dismal. Self-parking isn't offered and waiting for the valet often took quite some time. So did waiting for the elevators. On a good note, however, every staff member we dealt with was pleasant and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - great staff - quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: lakelizrd
Reviews.Content: The good: Nice hotel. The rooms are nice and spacious. The hotel reminds me more of an extended stay because it includes a full kitchen area. We did not utilize the kitchen area - but if you are looking for that feature you are covered here. The staff is exceptional. Very helpful. I especially liked David in the 5th floor restaurant. Speaking of the restaurant. The food found here is superior and for Vegas - very reasoanble. An example: The platinum breakfast = two eggs, country potatos, bacon, juice and pancakes for $11.95. Excellent food. The lounge is what you would expect from this style of hotel. Small but personable. Happy hour from 4 - 9 1/2 price drinks and food. The only down side to the hotel is "IF" you want to spend quite a bit of time on the strip it is a 10 to 15 minute walk. It is a 10 minute walk to the Bally monorail station. But if you do not mind the walk - you will not find a nicer (non-casino) hotel close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “One of best stays ever in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: KnowingThisKnow
Reviews.Content: Since I am in Vegas several times a year I am always keen to try something different. What I look for when is a hotel that is non smoking, clean, is somewhat close to everything, and has good restaurants if I am too lazy to go out. I booked a standard suite for 4 nights and was pleasantly suprised when we checked in that they had upgraded us to a princess suite on the 11th floor strip view. Since it was a special occasion the hotel even sent up complimentary champagne and strawberries to help us celebrate (very much appreciated). The room is huge, about the size of a studio apartment, with a full kitchen, washer/dryer with soap (also nice touch), huge bathroom with jacuzzi tub, huge king bed, and a balcony with sitting area to people watch from. The hotel does allow dogs which was apparent from the teeth marks in a few of the chairs in our room and the pillow which had the top chewed off. If you are allergic you may want to request a no dog room. Our room was extremely quiet, everything worked properly, and except for the room service being slow at times everything was great. One nice perk is valet parking is free and there were no resort fees either which is a huge savings (we stayed at the Palms last time which has $30.00 parking and another $20.00 a day resort fees). I read some of the other reviews that talked about poor or inconsistent service but I have to say we only had great service. The next time we are in Vegas we will DEFINTELY stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great room but service doesn't match”
Reviews.Author: jetboy319
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in similar properties such as the Trump and Signature and thought we'd give Platinum a try due to it's high place in the ratings. While the rooms are definitely on a par with the opposition the service isn't. Our air conditioning was broken on arrival which admittedly was fixed quickly after reporting it but the housekeeping was poor. The toilet flush broke which ended up fixing myself too. If you want a room serviced you need to be away before 11 am or they don't bother. On one of the days we asked for new towels as they hadnt bothered touching our room while we were out. They agreed to send up some fresh towels but again they failed to materialise. To be fair the rooms are generally impressive and the front desk staff are good but the attention to detail leaves a lot to be desired if Platinum wants to be a credible off-strip alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, but could have better service”
Reviews.Author: Kim A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3nights in a 1bdrm over a very busy weekend in Vegas. The place was HUGE, but not surprising since thats what everyone had said before. Couldn't believe the full kitchen and double door fridge. Loved the comfortable double bed and had a spa everynight in my bathroom. The washer/dryer was useful. The only thing was the poor advice from the girl at the front desk about going to the supermarket (all I can say is take the bus to Albertsons) and it taking nearly 30min to get a can opener when we were in a hurry to get to our show that night. Otherwise, it was a comfy place to stay away from the busy strip. It is a 10min walk to the strip from there in the heat. Overall we enjoyed our stay there and slept very well!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay on 17th floor!”
Reviews.Author: dakazibear
Reviews.Content: We stayed a princess suite with a strip view in Platinum Hotel for 3 nights in Oct 11 and Yes, the rooms are HUGE with a very nice with full kitchen, massive lounge, big bedroom with kingsize bed, HUGE bathroom and great washer and dryer. Great views! BUT we stayed on 17th floor(top Floor) room 1715 and the room just hummed and vibberated due to being right under the A/C- cooling building unit. I asked girl on front desk about it and she looked at me like i was crazy and said she would get someone to look at it and that was the last i heard about it, this girl also checked us out and didn't even ask how our stay was! And, Yes, I should have asked to be moved,but We couldn't be bothered! So, in short, if you are going to stay here, DO NOT STAY ON 17th floor, 16th or under is you best bet. Must say though, The Valet guys were Awesome. I don't think i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Staff, Kind of Dirty (:”
Reviews.Author: m1a2a3
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Platinum for 3 nights over Halloween. Got there at 4:45p.m. with our friends and one of our rooms was not ready yet. This was somewhat surprising and annoying but they fixed it by upgrading us to two other rooms, which was the right thing to do. Rooms were HUGE with a full kitchen, washer and dryer, fireplace, jacuzzi tub, and large patio. The only problem was that the carpets are in big time need of being replaced and the general cleanliness of the rooms was not up to even average standards. Dust bunnies between the night stands and beds, carpets were stained, and the detail that should have been common place in this level of property was just not shown by the low level of housekeeping. On the positive side, the staff were all exceptionally friendly and accomodating at all times. The hotel is on Las Vegas block (large blocks) off the strip and located very well if you are not going to stay on the strip and want a completely smokeless hotel (which we did). Pretty much a $10 cab ride to any major hotel on the south strip and a $20 cab ride to Downtown Vegas and Fremont Street. Fitness area was very large with pretty new and well maintained equipment. The pool area is on the 5th floor and has both an inside and outside area with a pass thru. All in all a very nice and comfortable hotel, but they REALLY need to do something about the cleanliness and the carpets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: MT5700
Reviews.Content: The Platinum hotel is not a hotel room it is a condo that you could easily live in, seriously. The room was enormous; the bath was large with a 2 person Jacuzzi tub, full working kitchen and a living room with couch, chair and flat screen TV. Balcony was large enough to seat 4 people. All were spotless and decorated nicely with a homey clean feel. As an added bonus the hotel and rooms are non-smoking. There is no casino on the premises so the hotel is quiet and a welcome reprieve after visiting the strip. We had a room facing the strip (great view) and were not disturbed by the street noise. There is construction at the corner. The hotel staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. From the minute we drove in we were greeted with politeness. The staff must love their job because they smile all the time and treat you like you are the only guest which is rare! They go out of their way to assist you in any manner they can. The walk to the strip is about 10-15 minutes and not a big deal. Don’t go by number of blocks, Las Vegas blocks are large. We walk at an average pace and it did not take long to get to the strip. I think we waited for cross walk lights longer then it actually took to walk. The staff will be happy to get you a cab if needed. We made a few long distance call unaware we would be charged almost $2.00 a minute. When we checked out my husband questioned the bill. The manager wanted our stay to be perfect and split the bill with us which was totally acceptable and was very appreciated! I cannot say enough good things about the Platinum Hotel. If you like to get away from the noise of the strip and experience customer service at its finest then this hotel is for you. If you are looking for an old time Italian restaurant visit Battistas. The food and atmosphere are great.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Value”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights . We are retired and are frequent travellers and have a good knowledge of Hotels worldwide. The Platinum was first class in every respect, the staff could not have been friendlier, front desk, doorman,barman all could not be faulted. The beds were as good as we have ever slept on in a hotel, with excellent bedding, everywhere was spotless, we had a huge room, two flat screen T/V,s, big bathroom, fully fitted kitchen, really there was nothing not to like. It would be OK for some being a block away from the main street (about 10 minutes) or it may be a bind, but for us it just meant a bit of relative peace and quiet - a quite haven. A minor criticism would be the frequency of the house keeping dept, the odd day we did not have our room cleaned, however the hotel did remove a portion of our bar bill to compensate !. We have never felt inclined to write a review before for any establishment but we were genuinely impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TacomaJoe
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Platinum for a conference in September. I was given a normal King suite that was cavernous! The square footage of the place must be roughly the square footage of a standard one-bedroom apartment. The room was very clean overall. The appointments appeared new and not dated. The kitchen was functional, and I particularly enjoyed having this as an option to avoid having to eat at restaurants for every meal. The location is perfect if you want to be close enough to the strip (2 blocks to Bally's), but don't want to be directly situated on that vortex of human frenzy. The pool area was somewhat odd in structure, with a strange indoor enclosure that I can't see much of a reason for in the desert warmth of Las Vegas. It also closed early (by Vegas standards). And the service was hit or miss. At times, we encountered the friendliest front-desk staff or valets. Other times, those we encountered regarded us as though were were interrupting their day - a strange attitude to have when your job is centered around customer service. But overall, I have to say for the price, I was very much impressed with this relatively small fish in a big, big pond of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “My wedding over the Halloween weekend”
Reviews.Author: Russell1013
Reviews.Content: I got married at the Platinum on October 28th and it was amazing. Every employee of the hotel went out of their way for us and our guests. Marie was our wedding coordinator and she did everything she could to make a night perfect. The valets were very friendly and helpful.
