When my new wife's hair clip broke she called the concierge, Michael, and he was up in the room with a hot glue gun in minutes. She asked for olive oil, he got it, whatever she wanted he got. I can not give Michael enough love on here, the whole bridal party was amazed by him. Everyone who stayed at the hotel loved their rooms and the pool. They could not believe what they were getting for their money. We had family and friends in the regular rooms, the princess suites, and the Marquee suites and everyone loved it. They loved the full kitchens and balconies. All the locals at the wedding had never noticed the Platinum before and kept asking me how I found out about this place because they loved it so much. I am a Las Vegas local so I know about most of the hotels in the city and I would recommend any future visitors to stay at the Platinum. Its only a block from the strip so you can get to and away from all the madness within minutes. There is no value like it on the strip. It is hip, the bar and lounge on the first floor are really cool, and the service is unbeatable. Thank you to everyone at the Platinum for an amazing weekend!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the madness of Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: L1ttlest_h0b0
Reviews.Content: We had a suite with a strip view. To be honest we could have lived there, an absolutely beautiful apartment essentially. Great bathroom with double jacuzzi tub, full kitchen, quiet and comfortable bedroom. About 10 mins walk to the strip it felt like an escape when it all got a bit crazy on the strip. The pool area was great to spend some time at, although quite small it was very relaxing. I really liked being at a non gaming, non smoking hotel, would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel in a City With Choices”
Reviews.Author: Ziprodot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Platinum during a recent vacation and were not disappointed. Our room was fantastic and went beyond our expectations! The staff members were also equally wonderful. When we had settled into our room, we found that the thermostat was not operating. One quick call to the front desk and they very quickly sent a maintenance person to take care of the problem. Wonderful customer service! The hotel is just off of the Las Vegas Strip and is a wonderful place to make your base of operations for a visit to Las Vegas. It is one of the hotels that does not have a casino in it, which was a major selling point for us. Our only complaint was that the overnight front desk staff was not as attentive as the staff that was present during the day. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again during our next trip through.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Las Vegas Desert”
Reviews.Author: SnowyywonS
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by many others the Platinum Hotel is on East Flamingo Road, just down the road from Ballys, and is just a 10 minute walk from the Strip, or 5 minutes from the Ballys Monorail station. The rooms are large and our Princess Suite had a very comfortable Queen Bed, Spa bath, fully fitted kitchen, two TV's, Bose FM Radio and Washer/Dryer. When you've had a busy day doing whatever floats your boat in Las Vegas, this is the perfect place to get away from the hustle and bustle and just relax as there's no Casino, just peace and tranquility! The happy hour in the Bar is between 4pm and 8pm each night with everything at half price. The Pool area is rarely busy and has comfortable beds and a very warm spa bath with waiter service for whatever you need. Everyone who works here was very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The only minor quibble was over pricing for breakfast with the bill having to be queried a couple of times but it was soon sorted out without any problems and profuse apologies for the (honest) mistake. All in all, it can only be highly recomended and we'd stay here any time.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Besty2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in late September 2011. We booked this based on the reviews on trip advisor and were also traveling with our 2 children so we found it refreshing to find a place off the strip that was non gambling and non smoking. The best things about Platinum Hotel & Spa - - the hotel is BEAUTIFUL - the decor, room, pool everything - including the people that work there! - we booked a strip view room and ended up with a partial strip view, but we weren't annoyed, we still had a view, but as soon we mentioned to the staff that we weren't 100% happy with the view - bang they had us moved so we had a full strip view and upgraded us to a bigger suite - WOW - what customer service. - the rooms are big - big bathroom, full kitchen, beds comfortable, double glazing on the windows so you hear nothing of traffic noise. The view is beautiful over the strip at night. - people complain about the valet parking - who cares - tip the valet a couple of bucks a day, big deal that's all we did and they couldn't be nicer (we come from a country were tipping is not part of our culture - so if we can do so can you!) - the hotel is not as some people say too far away from the strip - it is walking distance probably 5 minutes until the corner of Bally's and it is completely safe - those complaining its too far are just too lazy. - nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the strip - the pool is to die for, half indoor, half outdoor, spa, deck chairs, lounges, beds - what better way than to spend your afternoon lazing in the pool area. - the valet parking guys - you rock, your manners where impeccable and we always had our car within 5 minutes, even bringing the masses of luggage and packing it in our car for us - what amazing service. All that is left to say is that if you are considering staying here don't hesitate. This hotel is great for families or anyone wishing to experience the ultimate Vegas but still being able to get some rest and relaxation away from the hustle and bustle. We will definately be recommending this hotel to our friends back home. The staff should be commended on all the work they put in to making everyones experience who walks through the doors the best possible one they can. Way to go Platinum!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: PickyGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT on the Las Vegas strip, and thank God for that. I really dislike the crushing crowds, the persistent stench of tobacco smoke and the annoying clangs of those dreadful slot machines. The Platinum is a 10 minute walk east from the Bellagio or Ceasers. The rooms are huge! The bathrooms are huge! My room had a full kitchen, desk, couch, king size bed, jacuzzi tub, and more. The view of the power substation wasn't that great, but I didn't care. The restaurant was OK. The internet was great. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Larry E
Reviews.Content: The suites are nice in size, very quiet, nice view of the vegas strip from balcony. The spa staff and services at the spa are rated a 5 star. Best messages that my wife or I have ever had. Even if you stay at another hotel in Vegas I would recommend going to the spa for some R&R.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Smoke-free, Friendly Oasis - convenient to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JJD2
Reviews.Content: This is not the newest or most dazzling hotel in Vegas, but it is a very solid choice for quality service, price, and location. The Platinum is a couple of blocks from the Paris, Bellagio, and Caesar's Palace, but is a bargain compared to other hotels on the Strip. And without a casino on site, it's a whole lot quieter. I find the cigarette smoke at all the casinos a huge turn-off, so I appreciated our nightly return to a smoke-free environment. Check-in was a breeze, even though we did have a big problem with the first room we first were given. There was a huge, ugly vent blocking our balcony view, but after we returned to the front desk, we quickly were assigned to a much nicer room several floors higher. The staff handled our concerns very well, I must say. The Platinum was the cheapest hotel spa we stayed in during our trip (Scottsdale - Sedona - Grand Canyon - Vegas), yet was by far the most spacious (over 1100 sq ft)! Walk-on balcony, washer & dryer in the room, full kitchen, electric fireplace, nice view (ignore the parking lots below and focus on the Strip in the distance). The parking valets were great - very fast and professional. What more do you need?! The pool was a nice feature, even though it could use a little updating. Breakfast was very convenient, if not particularly outstanding. Stir Lounge, the bar located next to the lobby, was great though, and the happy hour was a relative bargain, and provided a great venue to begin our nightly festivities. We will definitely return to the Platinum next time we are in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ambaliscious
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed at The Platinum Oct 20-24th. The staff was SO friendly!!! Matt took SUCH good care of us at the pool every day. Daniel at Stir Lounge was great!! Happy hour prices on food and drinks everyday! Valet guys were awesome...took us in house car to the airport. We will DEFINITELY be back and will stay here AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Roland726
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Platinum. The location of the hotel was very convenient. The room(s) were amazing. Extremely spacious and the decor was great. Very quite. The view was tremendous. We were there in the second half of October so the sun rise was late, the view from the balcony was spectacular. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place but some parking issues”
Reviews.Author: david c
Reviews.Content: I loved this place and I've been to at least two dozen different vegas hotels. My suite was huge and I got the smallest one they offered. It has a usable balcony, full kitchen with dishwasher. A fireplace. Washer and dryer IN the suite!! Jacuzzi tub with separate shower. The staff was pretty nice. Room was clean. No real restaurant to speak of, however, so you'll have to go elsewhere to eat which was fine. My only real complaint was the valet parking. I drove there so I had my car with me. They MAKE you valet the car which is ridiculous considering the AMPLE parking all over Las Vegas. I like to tip, but that got annoying when I had to run some errands and tip 6 or 7 times a day after waiting 15 minutes to get my car. They need to make this valet-optional. In the middle of the afternoon there was only one poor valet guy parking cars and retrieving cars so, needless to say, I was pretty pissed off when I couldn't get to my car quickly. The hotel next door has also figured this out when I tried to park there instead and the little rent-a-cop guy booted my out of their HUGE parking lot because I wasn't staying there. If you don't have a car, this is a GREAT hotel in Vegas. 5 minute walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel central to strip”
Reviews.Author: queenrachee
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised when we opened the door to our room. It was HUGE! So luxurious and comfortable. A hotel like this I would expect to pay three times as much as we paid per night. Super comfy king size bed, beautiful large marble bathroom, large kitchen and living room AND a balcony! It felt like staying in your own apartment. Happy hour at the hotel bar was great too...great selection of wine and appies for 50% off! Great place to get your night started. The pool was so-so, but I wasn't really for the pool scene anyways, so I didn't care. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want a nice stay outside of a smelly overpriced casino hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum service”
Reviews.Author: CL M
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful, nice bigs rooms, living room, kitchen bedroom and bath. Set up like an upscale condo rental, with a great staff. The pool area was wonderful as well. All the staff could not have beenmore attentive and sincere. I loved this place and although I am not a Las Vegas fan, this place allows you to "Stay in Vegas" w/o stying right on the strip, just a little over one block away.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in busy busy busy Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: MissDiscodolly
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at The Platinum. From the moment I checked in (I was early but they had a room for me - many thanks!) to the moment I checked out the staff were polite, friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms are amazing, my suite was bigger than my flat! I had a view of the Strip, albeit a little way in the distance, and looked down onto the pool. Having a washer/dryer in the room was fantastic; I can't tell you how much I appeciated not having dirty laundrey to contend with when I got home! Yes, the hotel is a way back from the strip. But, it's a 10 minute walk and when I really couldn't be bothered getting a cab wasn't a problem at all. I notice that in some reviews people have commented on some undesirables on the street especially late at night. I live in SE London and in comparrison to some areas I walk through at home this was a dream! I often walked back to the hotel on my own at night and never felt anything but safe. I loved the fact that it was set back from the Strip, it was like a little oasis in the madness that is Vegas. My only complaint about my stay was the cleanliness of the room. Superfically it looked clean but everything was covered in dust, even on the day I checked in. The whirlpool bath was lovely until I turned the whirlpool part on and a load of green gunge spluttered out. Yuk. In fairness, I reported it and it was cleaned immediately but it did rather put me off having another bath. However, I would stay at The Platinum again in a heartbeat - fantastic value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TPa64
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Platinum end of September/early October for 4 nights. The platinum is located a half mile or so from the strip behind the Bally's Casino. We stayed in the Princess suite with a strip view. The room was great and the primary reason we chose the Platinum was because it was a non-smoking and non-gambling hotel. The walk to the strip can feel "long" especially on hot days. Eventually, we were able to reduce our heat discomfort by walking half the distance through Ballys and then walk the remaining 200 yards on the sidewalk. The strip view rooms can become very hot due to the sun shining through during the evening hours. Also, we may have had an air condition that did not cool as efficiently. The room service food was good and very reasonably priced. Overall, very good value and great option in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Vailprincess
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The staff was amazing and friendly! Our check in was super smooth and quick. This hotel is very quiet and I don't think we ever even saw anyone on our floor. The suite was huge! We were celebreating our honeymoon and let them know when I made the reservation. They congratulated us upon check in and in the morning surprised us with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries! Thanks Eugene!! This hotel is pet friendly and there is a $75 non refundable deposit. I'm sure not many people bring their pets to Vegas, but this is our favorite vacation spot and we were driving and my dog is little and old, so a doggy day care was not an option. The only thing I would suggest here is a better place for potty for dogs. There is a gated area by the valeted cars but it only has astro turf (which ended up making my dog's feet green and covered in turf) and she would just jump up onto the rocks to pee. Not sure if a sodded area would be a solution?? Like I said, I know there aren't many people who bring their dogs and there isn't much grass period in Vegas, but something natural might be nice. The distance from the strip wasn't a problem for us. Bally's is right there and they have a monorail stop for $5 a ride or $12 for a 24 hour period, so if you work it right, you can make it work. (One suggestion to those who bring a vehicle...Aria has a great free self parking option. Park there and you can get to most casinos on that end of the strip. Try to park on the 2nd level.) As a whole, this hotel is great! No resort fees, friendly staff, quiet rooms, pet friendly, free wifi in the lounge...what more could you ask for? Get a high strip view and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Carol B
Reviews.Content: Went for a 2 day trip for my anniversary. Very clean, and comfortable. All the same ammenities of being at home. Will definately return. Great stay

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff but encountered some problems........”
Reviews.Author: lINERBABE
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed here for 9 nights and cannot fault the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Just everyone was so nice. However I did encounter some problems so first the negatives... I had booked for a high floor quiet room and strip view (a more pricier option) and I got a middle floor with a roof and an air conditioning unit right outside my balcony. I did try to change but the staff over two days could not find me a suitable room. In the end I gave up and lived with it. Also once again although the housekeeping staff were so sweet and friendly the room on the surface looked clean but it was not...on arrival even the dishwasher had not been cleaned or emptied and still had the last persons china in it!! I ran and then emptied it. The cutlery drawer was also pretty yukky! I had to request my bath be cleaned after the first few days (the bath is huge by the way with fabulous jacuzzi bubbles if you so require) and it did not get cleaned again the rest of my vacation. Nor did the room get hoovered for the last four either...I know because I was up late the last four days and so was there when housekeeping attended. I gave up requesting things be cleaned by then! I had also previously requested also the kitchen tops be cleaned as they weren't touched either. There was thick dust around the furniture at the bases, on the lamp and telephone leads and even on the table tops. They turned my room around in a max of 5-8 minutes a day when I was there and the suites are huge so it was just a case of replenishing stuff and not much cleaning as you can imagine. On the "in room service" I did order a couple of times and the food was good but on one occasion the food was barely warm. Be aware of the extra delivery and service charge they add as that can really hike it up.Also it would be nice to have service by the pool for at least drinks but I never saw anyone. Failing those faults the hotel staff do a lot to make up for it. I have never met such pleasant staff....If you request an item they always follow up with a phone call to check you have received the items. They took exceedingly good care of my car which I was nervous about leaving anywhere having just had it scraped at another hotel in LA. The hotel room does have everything you need and if you do get a strip view room you get a washer/dryer which was a godsend....going back home all washing done a real plus after a month away. I did not find the distance to the Strip a problem because I used my car but I think you would definitely need a taxi to and fro otherwise as there's not just the walk to and from the hotel but the strip also and that can be very tiring having walked all the casinos or other attractions. Whether I stay here again I don't know as I was expecting just a bit more for the price I paid...there are other non casino hotels offering as much for cheaper but I went for this one as at the time it was #1 on trip advisor and I see it is now #3. Once again though the staff are great so it's worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money but...off the strip?”
Reviews.Author: billtheb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Platinum for 2 nights with friends during September as part of a tour and were blown away by the standard of accommodation here especially for the money we paid. Just astonished but...it wasn't on The Strip and we missed that vibe. The week earlier we had had a one night stay at the Golden Nugget on Freemont Street which was ok for a Vegas hotel but it did have that amazing light show just outside. If you haven't seen that you need to. It has all of the excess that Las Vegas has to offer without the continual hassle associated with moving up and down The Strip. Anyway, I digress. The Platinum is just 2 blocks from The Srip at Ceasar's Palace and so it is well situated for geting to the main action, but as I say, misses out on the "the vibe" which was disappointing for the 2 days that we were in Vegas but probably a God send if your visit is for longer than that. Hey, we've all got to sleep sometime. Facilities and service I really cannot fault. Polite, efficient, friendly, what more could you ask? The room came with a huge bathroom and I mean huge, a fully fitted kitchen with breakfast counter in granite, a good sized lounge and a balcony from which we could see most of The Strip. There is a good sized swimming pool sheltered from any wind and a good supply of sunbeds and towels. Also, just to make the break from The Strip complete, there is no cassino. Yippie! On the next block heading for The Strip there is a very nice and handy shopping walkway that gives a number of options onto the main street including through the Paris Hotel. It's pleasant and even if you don't like shopping it's good to walk through. That means it is not very far away from the Bellagio and they have, without any doubt, the best "all you can eat" buffets in the city. Whatever time you go there will be a queu. Be patient. They'll get you in and it will be worth it. All in all, I would without hesitation reccommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Vegas for a while just on price but for 2 days? Pay the extra get the real vibe of Las Vegas while you can.

Reviews.Title: “Who'd have thought it....a relaxing hotel in Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: the barman
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a week's stay at the Platinum Hotel, having booked the hotel based on TA reviews and the price, and we weren't disappointed. This is a smallish (by Vegas standards) hotel a short walk from the strip, which is both non-gaming and non-smoking. This was our 4th time in Vegas, but first in an off-strip hotel....and we loved it! Although we are both gamblers, it was a treat to be able to walk out of the casino, walk back to the hotel and have peace and quiet. We didnt find the walk to the hotel at all hard work and we never felt threatened, even walking back in the small hours....we encountered the odd homeless person, but they were nothing but polite and we encountered more on the bridges over the strip. We stayed in a princess suite, which was huge. It was clean and comfortable (especially the bed) and whenever we requested anything from housekeeping it was with us within 10 minutes (now you dont get that on the strip!!) We ate breakfast at the hotel a couple of times and it was good and convenient, but we also went to Tuscany Suites more or less next door and ate at Marilyn's cafe which was also very good (and slightly cheaper). The pool area is lovely and reasonably quiet even on a weekend, with everything you need on hand. We also used the spa, which was great and the prices were so much cheaper that anything you would find on the strip. All in all, this is an excellent hotel with fantastic staff who are attentive but not intrusive. In my opinion the short distance of strip is a pro not a con....in my experience you can walk further thru a casino and along a hotel corridor to get to your room than we did to get to the action.... Have actually returned from our trip to Vegas feeling relaxed - a first!. Would I come again....you bet I would!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic end to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: KezzinDorset
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to end our Route 66 honeymoon and this decision was based on two factors, price and reviews. The TA reviews were superb and the price was very good. We pulled up in our Dodge Charger which had been our travel companion for 3 weeks and it was taken away by the valet. We proceeded to check in which was very smooth and directed to our room. We were welcomed by a full kitchen area, full lounge area, massive bathroom and super king size bed and balcony with a wonderful view of the strip. Bliss for weary travellers!! We thoroughly enjoyed the double size spa bath and huge shower, large comfortable bed and the views of the entire strip. We even had a view (albeit small) of the Bellagio fountains in the evenings from our balcony. Everything was comfortable, clean and well maintained. The pool area was great too with indoor and outdoor areas and lots of room for sunbathers on large padded sunbeds. There are towels for guests to use down by the pool so no need to bring them from your room. This hotel is non-smoking and non-gambling but after being in a few of the casinos this is a welcome haven to come back to. We had lunch twice in one of the restaurants and breakfast room service on the last day of our trip and the food was excellent and cheaper (even with the room service charge) than you would pay in any of the strip casinos. Food in Vegas is expensive!! The walk from the strip to the hotel is around half a mile so not worth doing by anyone with walking difficulties. The valets will flag down a taxi for you from the front of the hotel if this is required. If you do take the walk then you will come out right in the middle of the strip between the Flamingo hotel and Bally’s which is directly opposite the Bellagio and Caesars Palace and right in the middle of everything. I would recommend going to see the Pirate show at Treasure Island, the Volcano at The Mirage Hotel and most of all the famous fountains of the Bellagio as they are wonderful and ‘go off’ every 15 minutes after 10pm or so. I would highly recommend this hotel and would be the only place for any future stay of mine in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel that makes a heaven in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nmkUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on one trip and used three rooms in total. Each room was excellent (if you can, book the two bedrooms in one option - excellent value for money and you get LOADs more space). The service was excellent, the food was very good, the pool area is nice, the hotel is very quiet.. the list goes on. This was one of my favourite hotels of all times - and I have travelled a lot. For the price, this hotel is high quality at bargain prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great but no Restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: oscar0734
Reviews.Content: The room /suite was amazing.Beautifully fitted out with top quality furniture and appliances.All rooms were hugeand spotlessly clean -bedroom,bathroom Kitchen and living room.The swimming pool (outside)and spa was luxurious beyond belief with a choice of doublebeds ,wicker love seats and comfortable loungers.Most Staff were fine but some definitely needed retraining.However this Hotel has no Restaurant and you have the choice of going out to wander the Strip, or the Burger and Pizza Room service or staying in and perching uncomfortably in the Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here Oct 2011”
Reviews.Author: 1love2travel2
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place. This was our fourth trip to Las Vegas, previousely stayed at Luxor, MGM and Caesars Palace. The platinum without all the raz-ma-taz is up there with the best. Just 1 block away but over looking the strip was ideal we counted about 24 major hotels from our balcony. From our room to inside Ballys back door took me 8.1/2 minutes, another 4 minutes you are on the strip. We had a fully fitted kitchen so you can do yourselves a little bit of breakfast to start you off for the day, or warm up your doggie bag from the day before. The staff where all friendly and polite and helpful, the valet service was great and they always offer to help with directions or parking to where we visited. This is the place I shall be recommending from now on and staying at on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mismad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very pleasant place to stay especially when you are with kids: no cazino and no smoke. it felt like home, included all the amenities travelers need: washing and drying machine, a big fridge and dishwasher. very close to the strip and have a great view to it, huge rooms, quiet pool and wonderful service from all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: naysayers
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at Platinum within the last couple of years. We love it! We feel like we are staying in an apartment when we stay here. Full kitchen, living room, bedroom and large bathroom. One block walk to the back of Bally's. We enjoyed spending time in 'Stir' watching baseball with their great bartender "Daniel". Thanks Daniel! Go Brewers! We were celebrating our 25th Anniversary and the staff of the Platinum was great! We had Champagne and Strawberries waiting for us in our room. Every staff member we encountered (Front Desk, Housekeeping, Doormen and Stir staff) were all friendly and helpful. Had appetizers in Stir and they were great. Half Price Happy Hour 4-8 daily is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you come to Vegas for...”
Reviews.Author: ktulu
Reviews.Content: Going to Vegas is a bit like taking a trip to the greatest sin city on earth. Lots of fun and attractions, and you want the feel to continue as long as possible. Now, staying at the Platinum will keep you off that feeling. The fact there is no casino, not even a slot machine in the place is great for those who want calm and balance, but if you want a bit of a thrill and fun, not the right place. Perfect for families, there will be no problem for you and your kids to stay with comfort. The place was apparently a time-share project that went wrong during the GEC and they increased the hotel part as the time share weren't selling. So, the room are fully equipped, litterally like a private appartment and you can feel at home without any of the dodgy experiences of the appartment hotels which are often located in the out skirts or the city. There will be the odd vomit on the carpet and teenagers that will party once close to your room until 5 AM, but hey, you're in Vegas. If you looking for peace, go elsewhere. The con of that place is the location. You are not that far off the strip, but far enough that it can become dodgy at night to walk all the way out there (especially if the ladies are planing on putting those stilettos they haven't dared wearing since they bought them some years ago). So you have to use taxis, and without a cab rank, it takes forever, even if ordered by the receptionists. If you are on your way to a show, make sure you are organised. The same for security. No need to have a hotel room card to access the floors, you can just walk in. I never felt threatened, but you never know, especially as a women or with young kids. The views are terrible, giving you a direct access to the car park, boulevard and other empty land sections that surround the place. One pro, is the 7/11 and petrol station around the corner, if you forgot the bread or if the room service stopped serving (at 11PM). A con, the business centre is really bad and forget about printing the last minute presentation. The board room is nice and well organised but pricey. Business in there, only if you have to. The personnal is nice and polite. The prices are ok, but for the same budget, you can be on the strip, with the casino, the fun, the noise and the craziness associated with the parties and the excesses. Anyway, your call at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Your own condo while in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Pattis_Zone
Reviews.Content: Last week my daughters and I traveled from California to meet with my sister and a friend from Florida and got a couple of rooms at this hotel. We were greeted with great service and even by phone before we got there. The accomodations were more like a condo. It is laid out with a fully equipped kitchen and granite counter, living room and balcony with a large bedroom and bathroom with separate jetted tub and shower on the other side. The pool area has ample chaise lounges and sunning beds with an indoor/outdoor pool and hot jacuzzi. The restaurant was more than adequate and the service there was spot on. You can order drinks and bar food while at the pool. The walk to the strip took about 5 minutes and you can cut through Balley's and there is a catwalk from there over to Bellagio. The other option is to cross the street and go to the corner of Flamingo and the Strip and take catwalk over to Casesar's. There is also a monorail stop in Balley's. Balley's is connected to Paris inside with great dining options.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel In a Secondary Location”
Reviews.Author: StuartCD
Reviews.Content: Our 6 night stay here recently was fantastic. Having stayed previously at the Signature and Bellagio, I cannot fault the quality of the hotel, the service (especially the pool bar attendants who were exceptional), the size of the rooms / suites and the amenities included (fridge-freezer with ice maker, washing machine, dishwasher and all the expected items for a Vegas hotel). However, it loses a star as we sometimes felt a little unsafe when walking back from the Strip later at night (although you can reduce the 'outside part' by using the Ballys sportbook entrance). I understand that the price of the rooms reflect that the hotel is off-strip and that price was excellent, with no 'daily resort fee' that more and more Vegas hotels seem to be adding. I also understand that we could have got cabs, which is a valid point. For someone willing to use cabs more than we wanted to, or more relaxed about the off-strip location, this is a perfect hotel for a Vegas stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel just off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Dani638
Reviews.Content: Recommended through Trip Advisor. We loved the Las Vegas Strip but it was nice to stay just off the strip. This hotel is in such as good location with a 7 minute walk to the strip opposite the Bellagio. If it is too hot go through Bailys which is just on the opposite side of the road. It has no casino which can be a blessing. Very comfortable large suites with great views and cannot fault it. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “No, it's not akin to the Wynn, or Ceasar's, or Bellagio, however ....”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa60schick
Reviews.Content: Over the years, we've stayed at the hotels mentioned in the "title". This time, our last time to Las Vegas, we wanted a "brand" hotel, clean, quiet, non-smoking with no casino. (We were also celebrating our anniversary.) I won't repeat the very well described, well deserved, extremely accurate descriptions below, because I agree with all of them. The Platinum is exactly what we were looking for, and it is exactly what we got -- with several very pleasant and unexpected surprises. I'm also going to include an invaluable "tip" for those of you reading this review and others who've mentioned the distance to the strip. Yes, it is a bit of a walk. We're seniors, we walked it only once to get to the closest self-serve ticket-wicket (around Planet Hollywood). The City runs an exceptional public transit system. A 3-day, unlimited use pass costs a mere $20 per person. With this pass you can ride the DEUCE up and down the entire strip PLUS it gives you access to the ENTIRE bus system throughout the city. What can be better, cheaper, faster? Bus No. 202, which runs along Flamingo Drive runs every 15 minutes on the quarter hour (like clock work!!). The stop to use to get to the Strip is in front of the Westin Hotel; the stop coming back to the hotel is not 50 yards from the hotel's driveway. And from the Strip, the bus stop faces Bill's Gambling Casino (just steps past the elevator structure from the pedestrian walk-way off the strip). Unlike other reviewers, we saw neither "vagrants" nor "ladies of the night" around or close to the Platinum. We ate at the Kil@Wat restaurant following our check-in. Although the service was very slow (probably because it was 2:30) the food was delicious. We also took advantage of the Happy Hour at the Stir Lounge. Like everything foodie in Las Vegas, the tapas portions were HUGE. My husband and I each ordered 2 items from the extensive menu. We couldn't finish it all. Hubby had a shrimp cocktail (huge, fresh shrimp), some 6 shrimp and chicken wings. He thought being tapas, he'd get 5 or 6 wings -- nope, a dozen. I ordered bruschetta and veggie spring rolls -- got 3 beautiful and very tasty bruschetta and 7 spring rolls. I managed to eat the bruschetta but only 2 spring rolls. Tapas? In Canada you'd get 1 piece of French bread cut into 4, and 2 or 3 spring rolls. The drinks were also half price. All in all, take advantage of the Happy Hour .... after a long day's walking, we didn't much feel like going to the Strip again to eat. I do want to mention the outstanding front desk staff, especially Nathan Rex, the housekeeping staff, the engineers (who fixed the washer connection and the spout in the jacuzzi tub) and of course the valet/doormen. No sooner did my husband call down to report the problem, within 5 minutes (honestly) a knock on the door, an introduction, an apology for having disturbed us, the engineer went about his task; explaining what he found broken, what he would do, and the time frame in which he would complete the task. A phone call some 10 minutes after the task was completed, asking if the job had been done to our satisfaction. Our last night we called down for clean wash cloths because we opted not to have the room "done" (I'm anal about making the beds and tidying up myself), housekeeping was knocking on our door within 3 - 5 minutes. Ten minutes later the phone rang asking whether the wash cloths had been received. Another call about 5 minutes after, again, asking whether the wash cloths had been received. Service ...... no competition Wynn, Ceasar's, Bellagio; take a lesson from the Platinum. Oh and about 4 hours after having checked in, a knock on the door; the management and staff had sent up a bottle of champagne and a platter of chocolate covered strawberries along with a congratulatory anniversary card!! Now that says CUSTOMER SERVICE in spades.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, But”
Reviews.Author: TJ B
Reviews.Content: Very nice large room with allot of extra's. But some of the service was not up to 4 star standards. Twice I came back at 4 pm and my room was not cleaned. When I called, the girl said they can clean up until 6pm. I'm glad I didn't return after 6pm and/or have clients with me. And no, they were not that busy.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel room with a dishwasher”
Reviews.Author: milwaukee_concierge
Reviews.Content: Non-smoking, non-gaming hotel that is about a 10 minute walk from the strip. If you are wearing your crazy shoes or it is too hot, the cab ride is around $5 each way. Cab to and from the airport is <$20 each way. Huge immaculate suites and awesome service from all staff. Each suite has everything you could possibly need, including a full kitchen. I think the bathroom was bigger than an entire apartment I had during undergrad. Great value for the price. Spa also had good prices, but I was not able to get a massage as they were totally booked. Room service and catered conference food was decent, nothing special. Appetizers in the lobby bar were good. Again, amazing staff, from the valets to the managers. Pool area could be spiffed up a little bit.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice, spacious rooms, but location is a bit "iffy"”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: VERY low key compared to the other hotels. The lobby was pretty dark and small, but functional. They had one small bar next to the lobby, but I never saw anyone in it. I assume everyone was like us and walked to the strip for actual "stuff". But the first floor really was the _worst_ part of the hotel (and, really, not so bad (just dark - lots of dark wood - what's up with THAT?)). The room hallways were nice, simple but nice. The rooms were nice - _almost_ classy. Tile/stone floors and walls in the bathroom, giant separate tubs, REALLY lots of room in the "lower end" suite we stayed in. The only negative I can think of for the room was there was only a single, small dresser. But they you have two decent size closets too, so really not the end of the world (VERY minor negative). The pool area is even nicer than the pictures on their site let on. Not sure what the drink prices were on the pool deck, as that would kind of spoil things if they rake you over on that. A small restaurant right next to the pool. Also, the pool area was on the 5th floor, so you're very removed from the street. Nice little "oasis" if you're looking for a place to quiet down from the strip. It wasn't as glamorous as the Palazzo or anything, but certainly nice you you just want someplace to hang. The gym was HUGE compared to most hotels with some VERY good equipment. You could easily get a decent workout here (most hotels you're really having to compromise the workout as the size/equipment is so limited - just simply not an issue here). The room was super clean. The kitchen was almost bigger than the one I have at home! They aren't kidding that it's a FULL kitchen. however, absolutely no food (not even ketchup) so it's pretty limited as to what you're going to actually cook. Unless you're driving and bringing a bunch of condiments/spices and everything else, the kitchen is not going to be much good. Honestly, they could have just left the kitchen out entirely and the room would still be great. We paid under $200 and that was a steal. This hotel on the strip would be worth a lot more... As for going to the strip, WALK you will. While it's really only one block off strip, it's a B_I_G L_O_N_G B_L_O_C_K with nothing but the backside of Bally's (and front of Westin...?) and a grimy parking lot. It would have been pretty sketchy but there were very few people along the way (only one couple begging for money! ( the pedestrian walkways were worse ;) ) It's well lit, but you might consider taking a taxi just because it is one BORING walk... Especially compared to the total sensory overload of the strip. So... Nice rooms, great pool area and gym, not really all that "glamorous", but more than adequate unless you're trying to show off. All non-smoking and no casino (yeah!). Good low key choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in LV”
Reviews.Author: Chris Duc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 10 days after researching on the internet. A very good choice. A large apartment with a full kitchen, living room, and bedroom. We saved a lot of money by cooking our own breakfast every day. Only a 1 1/2 blocks from Bally's where there is a monorail stop (go into the Sports Betting doors). Also there is Ellis Island right around the corner for great food and good prices. If you need basic groceries you can pick them up at the 7/11 which is also right around the corner. The staff were great and the pool is nice and warm. Not crazy about the food but that is just me. Very comfortable bed and a double jetted bathtub. The balcony furniture was not very comfortable but we didn't use it much anyway. Very good hotel for the price with a nice pool and a lounge.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time this year”
Reviews.Author: derbysh
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in September for 10 days and also 2 weeks in June, we stayed in a princess room with strip view . We loved everything about it, the valet parking is great not like the hotels on the strip you can be walking to the car park for at least 10 mins . The pool is only small but not over crowded . The rooms very large and loved the washer and dryer . The staff cannot do enough for you , just needed to ring and they sorted it stralght away .The distance to the strip is only 10 mins away along a busy road and felt very safe .We go to vegas every year but for next June for 2 weeks the price as nearly doubled .Unless the prices come down we will be looking at somewere else to stay .( if im being picky the doors in the kitchen are not wiped and have greasy marks on them )

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, massive room, no smoke!”
Reviews.Author: travel_mad09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights as part of a Vegas trip and we couldn't have been happier. The room is huge with a fully equipped kitchen. The staff were helpful and friendly. The pool and poolside restaurant is such a great place to have breakfast and sit in the sun. There is a lovely peaceful walk to breakfast with no smoke and no "ding ding ding" of the casino! The rooms were extremely quiet - never heard any noise at all. It's a short walk to the strip. As mentioned in other reviews, I wouldn't walk there by myself at night, but during the day it was fine and very easy to get around and no problems getting a taxi when we wanted to go out at night. The only downside for us is that our strip-view room wasn't actually a direct strip view. We were looking at the north end of the strip and our room was north facing which meant no sun on the balcony. The view is also over the electrical substation. I would highly recommend this if you want to be close to the strip but a million miles away from the chaos!

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: brent a
Reviews.Content: Hotel exceeded my expectations, large comfortable rooms just off the strip and no gaming. Bathroom cleanliness (hair on floor) was the only disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Paula P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Las Vegas for three nights at the Platinum Hotel in a strip view room.The room was lovely.The staff were very polite and helpful when we needed them to open our balcony door when it was stuck.We used the hotel car on one occasion on their suggestion and the driver was great and the car was huge easily accomodating more than our 4 passengers and no more expensive than a taxi.If you are a family looking to steer away from the casinos,smoking and masses of people the Platinum is the place to stay. Every time we came back to our hotel it was a totally different and less chaotic world than the strip.The pool area was fantastic and the big chairs very relaxing and easy to fall asleep in.Our friends at the same time stayed in the Monte Carlo and were very disappointed.We would definitely recommend the Platinum to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: planner05
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Vegas with Family of 4 , this hotel was perfect,, great views of the strip from the upper floors, fully furnished kitchen allows you to ease into your morning, we did order room service the first morning the food was great and at a fair price, rooms were very clean,large spacious bathroom.The staff were very helpful and valet parking was fast and efficeint.We found this to be a great oasis away from the hustle of the Strip ( no resort fees). I would strongly recommend the Platinum as a prime hotel and location for families, first timers and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awesome....”
Reviews.Author: Tracy M
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel following reading TripAdvisor reveiws prior to our arrival. The room standard was excellent, great bathrooms, kitchen, good size room. The balcony was great with an excellent view down the strip. All the staff were courteous and helpful at all times. We renewed our wedding vows while in Vegas and hotel management surprised us with a bottle of champagne and chocolate coated strawberries - very yum . On our departure day we had difficulty getting a taxi big enough to take two couples and all our luggage (from great shoppingat the outlets) so the wonderful conceirge (can't remember his name) dropped us to the airport. While it was a few minutes walk to the main strip the added exercise was great. We particulary enjoyed coming back to the clean fresh air of the hotel after the smokey clogged air of many of the other hotels and clubs on the strip. Great choice of place to stay in Vegas and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dinnerand
Reviews.Content: Got a fantastic deal with Sniqueaway......planned to stay here anyway. Lovely place with fantastic staff. Everyone was so nice and helpful. Had a terrific breakfast in room the first day....not too pricey. Also, NO resort fees at this hotel. (I can't stand the nickel and dimeing that some of these places do.) My only complaint...they had pillowtop mattresses and I'm NOT a fan. Great location as well.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise package!”
Reviews.Author: Iluvtheoutdawz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vegas for a couple of nights at different properties. The Platinum was great! If you are looking for something genuinely different from the mainstream Vegas Casino resort then look no further. The Platinum suites boast plenty of space, seperate bedrooms, large living area and an expansive bathroom. The location, just off the Strip and the fact the Platinum does not have a casino was a real highlight and something we found particulalry attractive as we were travelling with children. Outstanding value for money, we recommend without any hesitation. Service from the staff was excellent, helpful and friendly without being intrusive . Our only disappointment (for our kids) was the fact the pool was closed to guests for a wedding on one of the days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely large apartments 2 minutes away from the madness of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: iwaswayoff
Reviews.Content: Beautiful one bedroom apartments, gourmet kitchens, large fridges that make ice, wonderfully nice staff, relaxed atmosphere, GREAT VALUE. Even room service is cheap. ($8 for chicken and chips!). I have been on the strip many times and my trip always ends with me dying to get out of there. It is a constant onslaught of noise, crowds, drinking and smoking. Now if you haven’t been to Vegas before this is exactly what you want, so stay on the strip for that kind of break. In this hotel you can make coffee, buy food from the seven 11 next door and generally relax. It is a $6 taxi ride to the strip, right in the middle, so you can walk anywhere from there. You can actually walk to the strip in 10 minutes, but I will say it doesn’t feel nice doing the walk. A few seedy characters that hang around the service station next door make you feel a bit uncomfortable, but I am sure it is safe. I had a conference at the Sands and walked there every morning in about 20 mintues door to door. Only small complaint was that it advertises a BOSE stereo, which did not exist in our room. However on enquiry the staff did offer to move us to a room that had one. I highly recommended this hotel if you are over the strip. A tip, the Tuscany restaurant next door is VERY nice and not too badly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but a couple of things to bear in mind.”
Reviews.Author: regulator_11
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the Platinum were very good. We arrived around 11 pm and check-in was handled extremely efficiently - 5 minutes total from walking into reception. Our room was on the 16th floor and we'd chosen a strip-view Solitaire Suite; again, first impressions were positive with plenty of space, immaculately appointed kitchen area, adequate storage and a large, very comfortable bed. Larger rooms are available but if you're travelling as a couple, the Solitaire should be plenty big enough - the only advantage I can see for the upgraded Princess Suite is that it comes equipped with a washer/dryer. The bathroom, whilst large and nicely appointed, was starting to show its age and a couple of the door frames had started to rot at the bottom, but otherwise no issues with the room at all. The only slightly disappointing aspect was the 'strip view'. You can certainly see the strip from the 16th floor but you are effectively looking at the back of the Paris, Planet Hollywood and Bally's. Is the additional premium for a strip view worth it? Maybe from a higher floor, but if a strip view is important and you're prepared to pay for it, know that it will be a distant strip view and ask for a room on as high a floor is available (elevators are quick and there was never a queue for the 4 nights of our visit). We only ate in the hotel once, which was breakfast, and whilst it was probably slightly pricey by Vegas standards, the quality could not be faulted. Special mention also to the table staff (sorry, can't remember their names) who were excellent. The Platinum was a compromise choice as my wife and I travelled with her parents who are non-smokers and do not gamble. The hotel is only one block from the strip but one block in Vegas is quite a trek and if the casinos are your primary reason for visiting, consider carefully. Also, being off the strip, The Platinum will not have a steady stream of taxis waiting outside reception. That said, the guys at the front door do a great job at hailing cabs from the street and I don't think we waited more than 5 minutes on any occasion - in fact, twice they arranged for the hotal car to take us to the strip which was greatly appreciated, thanks guys. My wife had 2 spa treatments and had nothing but good things to say about the whole experience. She also made full use of the pool area each day which she said was immaculatley maintained, plenty spacious and quiet by Vegas standards. All in all, the Platinum was a very relaxing stay following a week of sightseeing round Yellowstone and if relaxation is what you, or your significant other, are after then you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “We see why hotel has dropped from number 2 to number 3”
Reviews.Author: Welshnewfie
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Platinum and we can understand why the hotel has fallen from number 2 to number 3 on tripadvisor and unless the staff are given a shaking the hotel will fall further. Our first stay 2 years ago was faultless, not so this stay. The cleanliness of the room left much to be desired and took 4 days to rectify. Not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Better Places to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dmac87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Platinum for 4 nights in Sept 2011. Overall, it is a nice hotel with spacious, clean rooms. It was also very quiet -- we rarely heard anyone. However, I do take issue with "Most Comfortable Bed Ever." The pillows were small, thin and polyester filled, not conducive for me to a good night's sleep. The mattress was one of those that shook when your partner gets up or moves. I did not sleep well our entire trip. Another disappointment for me was the hotel's location. It was about a 1/2 mile to the Strip and the area was sketchy at best. I would advise women not to walk alone. There are bus stops along the way where we encountered some very shady looking people who would call out to us as we walked by. I am from Chicago and have lived and worked in the city for years, so I have some street smarts and don't think I am overstating this. We would definitely NOT walk back to the hotel at night. Across the street from the hotel was a full city block of power stations. Strip view from the room? Yes, you could see the strip hotels in the distance along with a charming view of the Super 8, Ellis Island Casino and & 7/11 as well. The pool was small and looked like an afterthought. We didn't think the lack of a casino would bother us as we are not big gamblers, and have been to Vegas many times. If you want a "real" Vegas experience, I recommend staying at one of the hotels on the Strip where you have the benefit of the restaurants and shops that go along with the casino. The biggest benefit to this hotel for us was all the walking we did! We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: KimD2009
Reviews.Content: My husband two teenage boys and I recently stayed at the Platinum for 2 nights during a month long trip to the US. The rooms are huge (I booked a high floor room with a Strip View) and was very pleased with the size of the room, cleanliness, washer/dryer and full kitchen (even though we ate out every meal!) It was about a 5-10 min walk each morning to the Strip. There was also a Seven 11 next door if you wanted/needed to pick up drinks/snacks etc. It had a great pool and secure parking. We enjoyed our stay but there were a couple of things that could have been a bit better. I paid extra for a Strip View room on a high floor which was worth it. When we checked in we were given a low floor and it wasn't till I queried it that we were "elevated" to a much higher floor. While the view was good, the hotel does look across a big vacant lot, so consider this when you book if its not what you want. Parking is valet only. Given parking in all the casinos is pretty much self park and free, I couldn't see why that couldn't be the case here as well. While we didn't try the bar, it seemed popular with the 25-35 age group.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TerryM27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to Vegas for a company convention. We decided to go out 3 days early and explore on our own. After reading the positive reviews of the Platinum, I made our reservation there. The casino/night life is not of big importance to us, so this property fit our needs. All of the reviews that I had read are pretty much spot on. The rooms are huge, more like an apartment than a hotel room. Having the full size refrigerator was so handy to keep our bottled water, drinks, and extra cheesecakes from The Cheesecake Factory. The only downside for some might be the walk to the strip, it is a 10-15 minute walk at least. For us, we enjoyed the exercise and helped to walk off some of our dinner. There are two convenience stores nearby, one next door, the other across the street for any last minute item you might need to pick up. The staff were always friendly, hotel exceptionally clean, and whole area very quiet. I really hated to leave. This is a rare gem in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaDurnford
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Solitaire suite with ‘Strip’ view at the Platinum Hotel and Spa for 4-nights in September 2011. I booked directly via the hotel website which was very efficient and quick and because I had booked directly, we were given high-speed complimentary internet access for the duration of our stay which was very efficient. We were allocated suite number 1415 on the 14th floor. The suite was a good size with a full kitchen including a fridge and ice making machine and a strip view which was very impressive. The bathroom was very spacious and had a door from the bedroom and also the main living area and had a double jacuzzi bath and separate walk-in shower along with 2-sinks, a large selection of towels and toiletries. The suite was very clean and the towels were changed daily. In the evening - we could see the Bellagio fountain display through a gap between buildings! The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, as were the pillows which is often not the case in hotels. There were a number of extras like a full size ironing board with new iron and a hairdryer with long cable which was not permanently fixed in the bathroom (a big plus). There was also a kettle for use on the hob. At night the room was very quiet and had black-out curtains to ensure a good nights sleep - the only noise was a very slight rattling on occasion from the air con unit. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from the main strip and a handy cut-through the Bally and Paris hotels makes this even quicker. On our return from a day’s walking ‘The Strip’, the complimentary fruit flavoured water and cookies located just off the lobby were a real bonus. There is a small swimming pool on the 4th floor which we did not use but it looked inviting although the view is not very impressive from that floor. We bought a few supplies from the 7-11 and garage which are a few minutes walk from the hotel so we did not eat in the restaurant during our stay. This is a non gaming and non smoking hotel which is a definite plus after visiting all the other hotels on the strip! All in all, this is one of the most comfortable rooms we have stayed in and we have traveled quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Space is in abundance at this hotel.......Huge rooms indeed”
Reviews.Author: lexibrat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a part of the family road trip around the USA in a pirincess room ( 2 beds ) stduo with separate bedroom When considering accommodation in Vegas we had in the forefront of our minds that we were traveling with two early teen girls who we felt the casino scene would not be appropriate for. We booked the platinum after reading reviews on trip advisor. The hotel was amazing .........and facilities scarcely provided for such a low cost in such a tourist attraction. The entrance hall was larger then some if the hotels we stayed in on this trip....well nearly. So the pros........ Huge rooms Kitchen with huge fridge with ice maker....none of the if you move it you buy it as in so many of the weighted bar fridges in the USA. Laundry facilities to help refresh the clothes on the road trip. Two huge comfortable beds. Views over the city neons lights for an additional $ 10 per night! Only one block and a little from the bellagio fountains . Convenience stores at the base of the hotel ...including liquor outlets. Free valet parking included Cons No pots to use in the kitchen actually in the room. One night when we were back late and missed room service which closed at 11 pm we called down for a pan to cook up some eggs. Firstly they sent up a pen ( ok forgiven we are Aussie and they may have had trouble with the accents), But then the next morning at 7.30 am a full set of pots , pans and utensils were sent up by room service in addition to the pan from the night before. ....even though the do not disturb sign was on the door. Only other con was the location. We were only a block away from the strip but there was an abandoned car park across the road that had me somewhat creaped out. A few looser type guys were there one afternoon as we walked past with the kids holding hands......they said - I would like ton hold your hand little girl as we walked past. Yuck and weirder them the guys handing out the dial a chick for your room cards as you walked down the strip. I know that kids and Vegas aren't great mixes but we really wanted to do a helicopter flight ov the grand canyon so added this in. Would we stay there again".........absolutely yes. The great space and facilities in this hotel certainly outweigh the creepy guys we experienced on our first night but would stay there as young females with out a husband ( or other protective guy in tow...? No I am afraid I wouldn't"safety is of the essence.

Reviews.Title: “Huge comfortable room at half the price of nearby famous hotels”
Reviews.Author: SteveM114
Reviews.Content: If you can live with a 10-15 min walk to the main strip and a quieter gambling free hotel then this a very good upmarket hotel with great rooms. We paid less than half the rate of the Bellagio which is 10 mins away and got a room 2-3 times bigger, with kitchen, fridge, washing machine etc and more space than we could use. A great choice for us,lovely staff, very nice bar and a more personal hotel with none of the madness of the show hotels which can be visited bery easily.

Reviews.Title: “There is No Better Place to Hold a Business Meeting or Event!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewS69
Reviews.Content: My company holds several professional events both around the US and internationally every year and I can honestly say that The Platinum tops the list of places I have visited. First of all we do an event in Vegas every year or so and it is always a challenge. Land in the heart of the strip and attentions wander, too far from the strip and you have rooms full of pouting professionals. The location cannot be beat, right next to Bally's and a quick walk anywhere you need to be. As far as the event itself, the attention that the staff gave the members of our group was nothing short of amazing. Marie Quinby runs a fantastic events team. No request seemed to be too big or too small. However, they were so detail oriented that we did not have much left to request, and I will readily admit we can be pretty high maintenance. Lauren Simms and Alejandra Ramirez ran our day to day coverage for meals, snacks, etc. and never missed a beat. More importantly they made it a point to quickly learn the needs and likes of each participant and quickly had things ready and waiting for everyone before they could ask. Truly a great team! Now as for the hotel itself... Prepare for the biggest bang for your business buck ever. When we do these conventions I expect a Marriott style room (and there is nothing wrong with that), but was greeted with something out of the Hangover for the same price. For the same price as an average room in any other city I had a full kitchen with granite countertops, a washer and drier, a fireplace, a balcony, a bathroom the size of a small apartment, and a king size bed that rivaled any of the high dollar chains for comfort. Additionally, they have a great lounge downstairs with very reasonable prices and a happy hour from 4-8 that was a great way to unwind at the end of the day. As you can tell, I became a huge fan, and WILL go back for business and even vacations any time I go to Vegas. This place is can't miss, but the main reason was the people. A big thanks to Marie and her staff again!

Reviews.Title: “YOU GET MORE THAN YOU PAY FOR”
Reviews.Author: george2455
Reviews.Content: partner and I have just returned from a visit to the west coast of america. booked the platinum hotel based on the previous trip advisor comments. we were not disappointed. the room or should i say apartment was huge. the facilities included full kitchen with cooker, fridge, dishwasher and even a washing machine and dryer. as we were travelling around we made use of the washing machine, they even supplied the washing powder. the staff are professional and friendly and i believe that they made an effort to make our stay a pleasureable one. had a great view from our balcony. at night the city just sparkles and you could not get a better view. loved using the pool area in the morning. it was quiet and we were able to a little sunbathing before the sun got to hot. we will be back in vegas and we know where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel just off strip”
Reviews.Author: SonnyDoc
Reviews.Content: The Platinum is an excellent alternative to strip hotels. Spacious rooms with full kitchens and large baths and sitting areas. The strip view rooms have roomy balconies. Friendly staff and a wonderful four hour happy hour every day. Very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Sophistication in the midst of glitz”
Reviews.Author: jerseylady59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum recently and will return. Hotel was quiet compared to the hoopla at other "name" hotels and that is what we wanted. We had a complimentary upgrade of room...beautiful suite. Beautiful decor and very clean. Service, whether at front desk, door or room, was consistently excellent. Every request was answered, "My pleasure." The lounge was great for relaxing and the food was very good. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KarenCoco
Reviews.Content: We have spent the past five nights at the Platinum and have found everything to exceed our expectations. We had two Princess Suites next to each other, both with Strip views - one for us & one for our two teens. The rooms are absolutely huge with full kitchen facilities & washer/dryer. Ok, I'm not doing any cooking BUT it's great to be able to make coffee & have a bowl of cereal before heading out. The pool is well maintained & not too overpopulated. The service has been exceptional - I've only had occasion to call housekeeping once, and they were here within 5 minutes. The Valet team are friendly and efficient. If you're a gym junkie, the fitness facilities are great - good quality cardio equipment + a room full of Freemotion cable machines. The kids would have rather stayed on the strip as the walk back & forth can be tedious at times, but I'm more than happy to leave the bustle behind and come back to a smoke free, quiet environment. I've spoken to a few Aussies around the place who have all had major tales of woe with respect to the larger on-strip hotels and their complete lack of customer service. Here, we've experienced none of that. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near the strip, yet just far enough away to get a good night's rest!”
Reviews.Author: shoegal50
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Platinum was our first, and a very pleasant one at that. you really can't go wrong here for the price either. all the rooms are full size suites - FULL kitchen, living area, nice size bedroom and a huge bathroom! and some rooms even have a washer/dryer combo, although ours didn't. the bed was super comfy and we slept like champs. nice billowy, yet firm pillows! this is a very nice, quiet little hotel(little by Las Vegas standards!). there is no casino on the property, which for us was nice since we don't gamble much, plus, it's completely no smoking! so it didn't have that lingering stale smokey smell, that seems to be ever present in Vegas (even in the big posh hotels!), in fact, it smelled really good when you walked in, like a lavender/aromatherapy scent...very nice! we liked the pool area a lot because it wasn't packed with people like some of the other "big name" hotels tend to be. there were plenty of towels, comfy lounge chairs and even lounge beds available. we didn't get a chance to try the restaurant although it looked very nice and well appointed. the complimentary valet parking was nice too, especially after a long day of walking around and you don't feel like parking a car and walking more! the valets were quite friendly and were always quick to get the doors for you too. all the staff at the hotel were friendly and willing to help with whatever you needed. this hotel isn't for everybody, especially if you want the loud, gambling, drunken-fest and non-stop party scene that is otherwise Las Vegas. or if you like the mainstream, big name, enormous, almost unreasonably big "mini city under one roof" hotels. this hotel is a nice quiet retreat off the strip, just far enough, but not too far. it has just what you need, without all the excess. this would be a nice hotel for families too since it has the big accomodating suites and not all the tawdry riff-raff that the casinos and countless nightclubs within a hotel often bring. all in all, we really enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to come back and stay again! we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Again”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly W
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed there again on vacation from Sept. 27 to Oct. 1. Just like the last stay in Oct. 2010, it was pleasing. We were promptly greeted as we got out of the cab and our bags taken care of. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning around 10am, and was immediately checked into our room.We were even given complimentry free in room internet service. We stayed in the princess suite that overlooked the backside of the hotel. We had a amazing view of the mountains and in the distance the airport. It was nice to see at night the lights. I treated my sister to the WellSpa, which they were having a special on a massage/facial/body scrub for $110. She enjoyed it and stated it was one of the better ones she has had. The staff at the spa was very nice and attentive. The front desk staff was extra friendly and more then willing to meet your needs. The rooms and hotel are exceptionally clean and neat. We have stayed at the Bellegio in the past, but never again. After going over to the Bellegio for gelato, we quickly stated why we do not stay there anymore. The smoke in the casino, too much congestion and noise. The rooms just don't compare for the price. If you are planning a trip and still deciding where to stay and are considering The Platinum you will be making a good decision. I was apprehensive my first stay, but after arriving I was sold. All the reviews on here are true to what the hotel is. We are looking forward to coming back in the spring and staying again. The Platinum is our vegas home.

Reviews.Title: “So glad i picked this place...Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Idriveor
Reviews.Content: We loved this place so much we wish we has stayed here for our entire 2 week trip to the west coast. We spent 9 days here. On check i had requested a pool view if available, but there were none, so the girl (i think her name was Brittnee) offered us an upgrade to the princess suite free of charge! We were well pleased! I asked about internet, and she gave us complimentary internet access also! We were given a room on the 12th floor, and it did not disappoint one bit. It was huge! Everything was good condition, and very clean. We had a mountain view, and also a partial strip view. Everything you could possibly need is in the room. The bed was extremely comfortable, and good variety of pillow sizes which is good. Bathroom with 2 sinks and a jacuuzi bath and seperate shower..great. Also, good lighting and a full length mirror in the bathroom, which is important for getting ready/makeup etc. Big fridge/freezer with ice maker, dishwasher, oven, microwave, washer/dryer. We used the gym a few days, it was excellent also. Good machines and lots of weights. 4 t.v's to watch while you work out. Pool was great, never crowded, actually nice and relaxing. You have the option of swimming inside to the indoor pool which was nice. We ordered a burger and fries, and a chicken quesadilla at the pool which was lovely. Valet was always very friendly, helpful and quick. Nice bar area in the lobby which was done up all white for labor day weekend. They also have a nice wee area off the lobby with free cookies and apples, and 2 containers with water with orange/strawberry or lemon/lime inside..great. The strip is approx 5 min walk from the hotel, and it was great coming back here every night after all the madness of the strip. The only thing i didn't like was that on our last full day at the hotel, they had the pool closed for a private function, i don't really think that's fair for any hotel to do that, i really wanted to spend a few hours at the pool on our last day before we left the following morning. But that's the only small negative i have. We loved the Platinum, and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value great room”
Reviews.Author: DrDivaG
Reviews.Content: This will be our Vegas hotel from now on! Huge rooms with full kitchen! Awesome bathroom. Bed was incredibly comfortable. Food was outstanding. Bar was relaxed and fun. All for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Isabel W
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Las Vegas and stayed at the Platinum Suites. I first saw this on trip advisor and asked travel agent to see if they could book it. Best thing I ever did. I made contact with Carla and the team and was given a beautiful self contained rooms for myself , daughter and fiance - ( hubby had to stay at home to look after the dogs!! ). It really is the best place to stay. It is quiet with no casino. The facilites are great. The room furnishings are super - whirpool baths, shower, separate living room, two queen beds plus sofa bed in living room.The pool is inviting as you get a strip view where you can relax at night before going out or just chill during the day. The restaurants are great and staff are very helpful. Would I go back back or recommend this place - you bet.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: JPDLEIGH
Reviews.Content: couldn't fault the hotel, helpful service, cheerful staff. good location, though little back from the strip. nothing negative to say.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Respite at End of Long Day Trips Outside of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mollyked
Reviews.Content: The Platunum Hotel is a fine place to chill-ax at the end of long days. We spent most of our time visiting sites outside of Vegas (Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon, Zion Natl Park, West Rim) and this was a wonderful place to return to at night. It was very, very quiet...no nasty smoke odors from casinos and nice views of sunrise on the east facing mountains. The balcony was ok. Pool and hot tub were nice but we didnt use them much. We walked a few times to and/or from the strip...these are two long blocks...while it is not a scenic walk and dirty in places, my husband and i felt safe making the walk late at night. We also took cabs if too tired to walk. The valet guys were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jinxy1986
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, room was amazing, we went for a strip view apartment and we got it :) the location was perfect to just being off the strip, we went for this as it didn't have a casino so it wouldn't be a noisy hotel. The only negative if I could think of one was the air con was not cool it was more like a fan but it was liveable. Breakfast was also very very tasty :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lotsawine
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Food, service, rooms, location and pool were excellent. Loved the quiet atmosphere to return to after a day on the strip. The location was perfect for us since we enjoy walking and if necessary we hopped on the monorail which is right at Bally's. The room we had was huge on the 17th floor with a north view that included the strip and mountains. We enjoyed coffee and wine on our balcony every day. We will only stay here when we return to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LKB132
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great stay at the Platinum. Did loads of research on here before booking and booked based on these recommendations and was not disappointed. We stayed in a Princess suite with strip view. The room was great, spotlessly clean with everything we could want and more! The pool area was good and the restaurant was very reasonable with good food and the staff here were great. Would definately recommend this is an alternative to the huge, smokey strip hotels. Yes it is about a 10 minute walk to the strip but you can cut through Bally's and when you do this you enter near the monorail station which is very convenient. The walk from the hotel to the Strip seemed safe and was busy with other people. There is also a gas station and a 7 eleven next to the hotel - perfect for stocking the fridge!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value,out of the crowds”
Reviews.Author: LizT55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April - mid term and weekend - so Vegas was very crowded. As said by others it was good to not have to wade through people and smoke to get to your room - which is actually an apartment - and very good value, large and clean. Asked for view of the Strip and the lights are great but you're looking over a very large area of concrete/carparking/vacant land and it gives it a bit of a desolate feel.
