Its a very large block to the strip - again past all this empty land. Enough people walking along not to feel alone. Happy hour was good value at the main bar and with a drink and a few substantial tapas plates served as dinner on 2 nights. Food in the upstairs restaurant was ok for breakfast. Staff were very helpful and it was no problem leaving our luggage when we went for an overnight trip to the Grand Canyon. We were just getting used to Vegas when it was time to leave - it's sort of overwhelming to the senses - and it would be good to return outside such a peak time. Interesting demographics though - from prams to wheelchairs and everything in between. No bad behaviour despite the loads of groups of young people with grog in hand.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent end to our holiday..”
Reviews.Author: Kim P
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful and friendly hotel.. Non-smoking and no casino was perfect for us as we had our daughter(6) and mother-in -law with us.. Princess room was huge, complete with full kitchen and washer and dryer and balcony. The bathroom was enormous with a spa bath.. one block back from the strip which was only a 10 minute walk. All of the genlemen at the door were polite and freindly and eager to help..The indoor/outdoor pool was beautiful and warm and made for a good start to the day.. Highly recommend this hotel especially for families.. Could not fault it whatsoever..

Reviews.Title: “It's Got It All”
Reviews.Author: james59929
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for value, exemplary service, elegance, and a quiet, yet convenient, location this is the Las Vegas hotel for you. My wife and I spent four nights at the Platinum and when our stay was over we didn't want to leave. Our good experience began with the reservation desk where Stephen Owens,a delightfully cordial, efficient, and welcoming young man arranged for a high, quiet room as promised, throwing in a generous Princess Suite upgrade for good measure. Once inside our spacious, remarkably handsome lodging we were treated to champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries in honor of our wedding anniversary. What a way to start a vacation! And it just got better from that point on. The hotel restaurant is chic, the food delicious and handsomely presented, and the servers efficient and genial, and in-room dining, of which we did plenty, proved to be of extraordinary high quality. An added bonus is being able to enjoy a stunning view of the Strip (just ask for a room with a Strip view) without suffering the noise and hurly burly of a hotel right on that busy thoroughfare. The Platinum is an easy walk--it took us about twelve minutes and we don't speedwalk--from the Strip itself and the monorail is just as close. We do a great deal of traveling, both in and out of country, and thus have tasted the fare of many, many hotels: the Platinum ranks right at the top. I know this sounds like a paid commercial, but, in truth, it's simply the reaction of a patron getting luxury and service at rock-bottom prices. Both my spouse and I highly recommend this Las Vegas gem; like us, you'll want to stay longer than you can.

Reviews.Title: “Three words, Wonderful! Wonderful! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Roy_and_Val
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place to stay, all the staff were attentive and friendly, we booked a Princess suite which was wonderful, comfortable and big! We enjoyed it was a "no smoking" and no casino hotel. There are many many casinos within walking distance i.e. Paris, Bellagio, Caesars Palace, The Mirage and right next door to the Platinum, The Tuscany to name but a few.What was surprising is the Valet parking is free and the people working the area are quick, polite and helpful.This was our first time in Las Vegas but certainly not our last. We will book our next visit and stay at The Platinum in a heartbeat. Thank you everyone at The Platinum for making my stay at your hotel such a special occasion. The occasion was to celebrate my retirement from work after fifty years. Thank you to everyone at The Platinum. The Concierge staff were helpful in booking shows or simply giving sound advice. Roy and Val Mayoh

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, lovely rooms, location is far from the action. Overall, a very pleasant place to stay and good value.”
Reviews.Author: LovesDogsinSF
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised that this hotel is called a resort. It has a pool but isn't a resort. We stayed 2 nights and there were 4 events (weddings, etc) that took over the pool area. This wasn't a problem for us as we weren't using the pool. This place has Very comfortable rooms and is and smoke-free! No casino and no fluorescent lights glaring! If you want to be fairly near the strip but have a respite from the chaos, this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “No Smoking, No Gambling and Great Balcony”
Reviews.Author: richvabrew
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for business and loved that this property wasn't a casino. Yet if that is what you are looking for several casinos are within walking distance. Ellis Island is practically right next door with BBQ specials and $1.00 beers. The steak special $7.99 was going on and the sirloin steak was excellent. I was given a room on the 17th floor and not sure I would recommend being that high because it was the top floor of the hotel. I could hear a thumping noise throughout the night above me and figured it was the A/C unit. Otherwise the hotel is extremely quiet and very roomy. I would definitely stay here again. It was great to drink coffee in the morning while sitting on the balcony and looking over the strip. You actually have a coffee pot with free coffee unlike the huge casinos on the strip. The reviews for this hotel is correct and if you don't want to stay on the strip yet very close to it, definitely book a room at the Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “Service is lacking.”
Reviews.Author: lpucker
Reviews.Content: My massage by Ellen was excellent, but the receptionist was cold and did not explain anything. I would probably not return because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Happy hour!”
Reviews.Author: vld51
Reviews.Content: Much has been said about this good hotel, but when we were there happy hour between 4 & 7, was a great success. Drinks and tapas at half price and the food was really good. It was nice to be away from the crowds on the strip and to enjoy the quiet pool. Temps were 100 degrees during our 4 night stay so the pool was very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent end to our trip”
Reviews.Author: More-Smiths
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night in Vegas after a trip into the parks of Southwest Utah, and we could not have picked a better place for what we wanted. We received an upgrade to a fantastic princess suite, which had -- halleluia -- a washer-dryer -- perfect for washing a few things before heading home. We also enjoyed the fantastic huge bath with shower and jacuzzi tub and the great balcony overlooking the pool, which we hope to use on future visits. This is also a great location to a portion of the Strip for gambling and shopping, which we usually like to do a little of on our Vegas trips. The spa was beautiful as well, and every single employee we encountered was polite and helpful. We will absolutely want to stay here on future trips to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: johnhamilton_10
Reviews.Content: the platinum hotel & spa is ideally placed two blocks off strip behind bally s casino.nice and quite compared to strip there are a couple off small casinos either side which are far cheaper than strip casinos.the suite we had was a princess suite which is slightly larger,it had a balcony,hand even washer?druge bedroom, full kitchen,living room with pullout bed,lock off bathroom and even washer& drier.it has a lovely pool area with indoor out door swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: TrueNorthFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum Hotel for two nights of our vacation. I read the reviews on TA and thought this hotel would be great. There are a few things that spoiled our stay. Check-in was smooth and by all accounts pleasant. They upgraded us to the bigger Princess suite which was a nice bonus. The suite itself is nicely furnished and is large enough for a family of 4 to spread out. It was a nice suite except for a couple issues.The suite smelled of mould! After looking around, I figured the smell was coming from the bathroom. The tiles didn't seem like they were cleaned properly-the shower was the worst. I don't think it drained properly. I was equally turned off when I saw the huge jetted tub missing jet nozzles and other pieces to it. It's such a shame other guests would abuse the furnishings. It would have been nice to try it out. I appreciated having two queen beds but the mattresses were in poor shape. They were not comfortable at all and were very cheap. To top off my gripes with the bed, the linens were extremely poor quality and smelled dirty. I'm not convinced they were changed from the last guests. What does poor quality mean? I wore black pyjamas which by morning were covered in lint. They were certainly not high thread count bedding you'd see in such a beautiful and first-class hotel. On another note, this hotel has a valet service only. We are not used to this service and my biggest fear would be something would happen to the car rental. Well, on day 2 when our car was brought up, there were two dents with paint removed off the rear passenger door that were not there the day before. My husband being the non-controversial type didn't mention it to the driver. I realize car rentals might be seen as not a big deal but to me I would treat this car like my own. It made me angry. Here's where it gets more interesting. The pool area has potential to be a great spot to relax and swim. It's on the 5th floor and overlooks the strip. The indoor section of the pool is nice especially when it's extremely hot outside. Unfortunately, I found a cigarette butt on the pool deck. This hotel is suppose to be non-smoking so how could that be? I think the worst part of the pool is the fact it looked extremely dirty. We planned to swim and there were others in the pool but the water was cloudy. Other guests were commenting about the cloudiness too. I don't think this is normal, nor did it seem normal that there was little chlorine smell. Anyway, my little one developed itchy eyes after the first swim. After her second swim the day after, her eyes were extremely red, very painful which made for a miserable evening. She developed an ear infection as well! The in-room washer and dryer were nice and I did a couple loads of laundry. Not sure whether it was the detergent "surf" they give you but my husband developed a terrible rash all around where his shorts/swim trunks would be which occurred after I washed some of his clothes. He was the only one to come down with it but it took nearly 3 weeks to go away. I hate to leave such negative comments on a review but this was honestly our experience. I won't return to the Platinum hotel because there are others which are better. Perhaps there are two classes of rooms and we never had the deluxe version but I'm thinking mould-free, decent bed, higher quality clean linens, a clean pool and careful valet drivers are a must when paying for a higher priced hotel in Vegas. I can't say our experience here was all bad. Room service was excellent. Our service provider was wonderful, friendly and polite on both evenings. The food was very good and hot on delivery. The restaurant breakfast was very good too and the service equally as pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “"First Class Experience."”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas so many times and I can say this place absolutely is 1st rate. The Hotel is all Suites and it's well worth the money (but it's cheaper than the strip!). Stainless steel appliances, full size fridge with ice maker, stove, microwave, dishwasher and a large kitchen. Stayed in Suites at the Casino's and this would easily be a $400 to $500 min. or more a night on the strip. Ellis Island Casino next door in walking distance, easy access to the strip with buses and cabs everywhere. Jimmy the Bellman/Valet, Brianna at the Front Desk and Matt the Bartender at the Pool are all Top Rate Professionals! I was on business, but I will definitely stay here again when I come to play. Pro's: Pretty much everything, Felt like I belonged, Con's: add another 10 to 15 minutes coming and going to the center (Caesar's/Bellagio) of the strip (doesn't really matter though). Your room will make you feel like a "High Roller".

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, off the strip”
Reviews.Author: SomersetSpud
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms in a decent hotel. Limited facilities but only a short walk to the centre of the strip (in the Bally's/Bellagio area). Spent a very comfortable night here prior to flying back and it was relatively close to the airport (US$15). Staff a little brusque and took ages to get taxis, but otherwise I would recommend it, especially when the hotels on the strip were charging an awful lot more per night at the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value close enough to strip!!”
Reviews.Author: Manchesternicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Platinum for 4 nights in September!!There was 5 girls in one room and it was fine!! Well what can i say the suite was fantastic full equipped kitchen , large living area with pull out double bed, large bedroom with 2 queen beds and a large bathroom with twin sinks , walk in shower and hugh jaccuzzi bath !! the room was very clean but was never cleaned when while we were there , but that didnt bother us as we are very tidy girls anyway! The pool area was fantastic really relaxing with a bar guy running around filling your drinks up when required!!! the resturant was lovely food was fab!! Bar area was very nice to if a little quite but perfect for a quite drink before you hit the strip!! The strip was about a 10 min stroll from hotel which was a nice walk but would not advise to walk back at night as there was a lot of drunks along that road later on, but it was only a couple of dollars in a taxi!! All in all the Platinum was a fantastic hotel and location and vry cheap prices to i have stayed at the MGM before so i know it a lot realistic in price terms!! would i stay in this hotel again? in a heart beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice while you are in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: MsFeed
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky traveler! I most often travel in my own motorhome because I don't like the thought of the masses of people that go through a hotel room. This wasn't an option for my trip to Vegas because of the distance so I chose this hotel because of the no-smoking, no-gaming policy. It is a lovely hotel with very spacious rooms that are well kept and clean. We had a beautiful view of the sun rising over the hills and the weather was perfect for sitting out on the balcony to watch. One long block up the street puts you at Bally's where you can pick up the monorail or the doorman will have a taxi for you in no time if you need to get further then the monorail travels. We enjoyed visiting the casinos, but loved coming back to the nice quiet and clean Platinum. It is also a green hotel that uses smart energy practices. All of the staff was helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Thank's to TripAdv!!”
Reviews.Author: Lorelay b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum Hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was pretty clean and very spacious. All was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite”
Reviews.Author: Empress30
Reviews.Content: This is a suite hotel. There was a full kitchen with an island and stools that seated at least four people with aluminum appliances (dishwasher, microwave, full-size refrigerator, washer/dryer, dishes and stove. The adjoining living room had a queen-size let out sofa bed, gas fireplace, executive desk and flat screen tv. The "huge" bedroom had two queen beds with a spacious full-size closet, tv/credenza and lounge chair. Last, there was a marble master bath with a jetted tub that could fit two people, a double vanity and also a separate walk-in shower. An unbelievable double-door closet twice the size of the bedroom closet was in the bathroom. Nice outside pool, hottub and restaurant. Great lounge, too. $109 per night including the $10 extra for the strip view from balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for those "more than a weekend" stays!”
Reviews.Author: LindyfromCanada
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else who has stayed at the Platinum, we loved the absolute "no smoking" and no "run the smokey gauntlet" of a casino to get to the elevator to the rooms. The full kitchen was perfect for us as we were there on a conference for a week and we are committed to eating healthy. We had a car and the valet parking was a treat. It was 103 degrees, so by the time the car came to the hotel door the a/c was going full blast. We didn't find a problem walking to the strip in the evening when it was cooler and even did it a couple times during the heat of the day. Taking a short cut through Bally's and into the Paris (if you can stand the smoke) is a good way to go. The service was very friendly and good as long as you don't request a luggage rack in the room (we tried 3x to get one and were promised it was on the way 3x, then we gave up. The room was very quiet and the bed comfortable. The pool was really wonderful and hardly used by other guests. A truly wonderful place to stay to experience the strip without having to stay on it.

Reviews.Title: “Good one but not as good as we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: Pi5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good one but not much more. Far enough from the strip but not too much. The room (one bedroom 2 queen beds+kitchen) was nice and quiet. As usual the sofabed is a ... sofa first and optionally a bed. The kitchen is convenient especially when you are a family that can't eat fast food and pizza all the time but don't expect anything unforgettable. The swimming pool is great. In-room internet is chargeable. The room service needed to be called twice to get thing done.

Reviews.Title: “Very posh and quiet but close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Dccruver
Reviews.Content: Just off the craziness on the strip but close enough to walk. Nice pool and luxury rooms. Nice lounge for visiting but no in-house casino which I liked. I will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at the Platinum hotel & Spa.”
Reviews.Author: VicnHil
Reviews.Content: We had suite on the 2nd floor looking out towards the strip. The suite has everything you need including a full kitchen and a washing machine and dryer so necessary when you're travelling. There's lots of room and we immediately unpacked for the first time on our trip. All the staff from the reception team to the valets have been cheerful and helpful. We got the tip on getting a day bus pass for $7 from one of the reception staff and used one each day we were here. There's a happy hour in the bar Stir every evening with half price drinks and food, a wonderful place for a relax after a busy day. One advantage of a stay at the Platinum is that there's no casino so you don't have to walk through gambling floors and smoke. There's free wi-fi but found connection quite difficult at times. We enjoyed our stay and would certainly come back to the Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: grmcfrey
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to stay. The staff cannot do enough for you, and the suites are huge and scrupulously clean. The free valet parking is really convenient, and the breakfast is excellent. There is a great happy hour in the bar, and at the same time all food is half price. The pool is large and nicely kept. It's amazing to get a deal like this in Las Vegas. The only slight disadvantage is it's a good 20 minute walk to the 'strip' and in 100 degree + temperatures this can be a bit of an ordeal.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Shari J
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the family friendly atmosphere, non-smoking resort, and a non-gambling resort and I was not disappointed! The rooms were AWESOME and the customer service was OUTSTANDING. I have stayed at many hotels across the country and this one was among the top picks. I am already making plans to visit Las Vegas again and will most definitely stay at this location. Some reviews state that it is off the "Strip" and was in an "industrialized" location; however, I did not have any issues at all with the location and it was within easy commute by foot to the Strip, even with a 3 1/2 year old! The rooms were immaculate and clean with no odors. We had the one bedroom suite with the sofa that pulled out into a bed and it works well for us. There was a T.V. in the living room and another T.V. in the master bedroom as well. The bathroom was HUGE and had two entries (one from the kitchen and the other from the MB). The kitchen itself was the best I have ever seen in a hotel. The bellman saw that we had groceries and took it upon himself to request the pots and pans needed. The valet service was awesome and each time we arrived back at the hotel they would greet us with "welcome home!" How awesome is that!?!? They even held the doors open for us and everything! Again, outstanding customer service. We needed the sofa bed sheets and so we called down to request them. Within minutes a lady arrived with the sheets in hand and made the sofa bed up for us! WOW! We also utilized the indoor/outdoor pool - which was a must for me traveling wiht a 3 1/2 year old. I was so impressed that I even got in for about two hours (not much for water!) but this pool was amazing! Again, if you are looking for a clean, non-gambling, non-smoking, customer service oriented resort - look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Lovelybilly
Reviews.Content: We had a double queen suite and slept 4 comfortably using the very large sofa bed. Had an oven and equipped kitchen. Bathroom was large and spacious. We ordered from room service for diner one night (was reasonably priced for Vegas) - pizza was lovely, also had a pasta dish, grilled chicken sandwich, chicken strips. Breakfast from room service was overpriced and portions small. Location to the strip and main casinos was very good, easy walking distance, but without the noise of staying on the strip. Would happily stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to take a family”
Reviews.Author: SKI_Road_Warrior
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while enroute to see Bryce/Zion with my mother. The rooms are large and comfortable, we booked a suite that had a kitchen unit and fireplace - and it worked out well for all of us. I'd say for being "off the strip" -- it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor reviews are correct!”
Reviews.Author: SAKM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum Hotel in September 2011. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was pretty clean and very spacious. The only downside of this hotel is the location. It's a good 4 blocks to The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: melwood7
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectations for the Platinum after reading many reviews on many sites. We travel to Vegas every August for a trade show and prefer to stay at condo/extended stay hotels due to the length of our stay. We got an amazing deal on a travel website and decided to try it out. The hotel itself is beautiful. It's still fairly new and they did an excellent job with the decor and ambiance. The rooms are absolutely huge! We reserved a solitaire room which is the smallest room at 950 sq. ft. and a Princess Suite which is even bigger at 1150 sq. ft. Really, the only difference between the two suites is size and the Princess suite has a washer/dryer. They were laid out the same and the bathrooms were almost identical. They have huge fully functioning kitchens. The bathrooms were probably the biggest I have seen in a hotel. The only thing I thought was odd about the bathroom was the small shower. It seems unproportional. They each had a jetted tub and a large closet. Very comfy beds with lots of pillows and a nice balcony. These are the quietest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in! The door was very heavy and hard to open but this made for very soundproof rooms. I loved it! Location to the strip is okay. I wish it could be closer but it's not bad. It would have been better for us had it not been in the 110 degree range when we were there. It made walking back and forth miserable. We did like most other people do and cut through Bally's Sportsbook area and then onto the strip. TIP: You can walk through Bally's to Paris and out onto the strip to catch the Deuce or the Express bus for way cheaper than catching a cab! We did this several times and saved a lot of money. The staff was very friendly with the exception of a couple people. The girl at reception was very helpful and got us into rooms on the same floor away from the elevator (as requested). The guys in the front of the hotel (valet, doormen) could have cared less when we arrived. The three of us packed our 5 suitcases into the hotel without even one of them holding the door. I thought this was odd as I have stayed at lesser priced hotels and at least had them hold the door for us. However, each day after that, the door was held open and they valet guys were very, very nice. We did have some issues/confusion with housekeeping. We do cook some of our meals at the hotel due to the length of our stay and almost every dish/utensil we pulled out of the cabinet was dirty. And not just a little bit dirty, some of the silverware actually had peanut butter on them. Caked on. The coffee maker had old stale coffee and grounds in it as well. We used the coffee maker each day and were never restocked on sugar/creamer. We had to go down to the lobby and ask twice. These are very little issues to me though. All in all, it was a very good experience and I would definitely stay here again. You can tell that they take pride in their hotel and are there to serve their customers. Thanks, Platinum!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, super service”
Reviews.Author: dave1920
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The room was absolutely massive with kitchen area and whirlpool bath. It is located about 5-10mins from the strip which we found was perfect. I read in previous reviews that some people were uncomfortable walking this distance as it was a bad location but we had no issues at all. Some of the pool areas in the other hotels looked totally overcrowded while we could go down at any time and get a seat by the pool. We had breakfast in the hotel each morning and on the first day and last day I had the platinum breakfast and barely got half way through it. It was lovely but very big. The hotel itself was nice and quiet but Vegas itself was loud and we found ourselves being woken by the sirens from the emergency vehicles. We would go back to the Platinum again any time we go back to Las Vegas. The taxi journey from the airport took us on the interstate/motorway and it cost around $35, however the journey back to the airport went a shorter way and cost $10. It pays to ask the driver to avoid the interstate.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to relax in comfort”
Reviews.Author: dadndoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a Princess Suite with a ‘strip view’ from the 12th floor. Everything was fantastic. The hotel was 10 minutes walk from the strip giving us a peaceful hotel environment that suited us perfectly. Our suite was enormous with a fully equipped kitchen, large lounge area with balcony, a bedroom with two double beds and the bathroom with a double spa. We were greeted on arrival with a complimentary bottle of champagne from hotel management for our 40th wedding anniversary. Check-in was fast, staff were friendly and access to our room was easy with fast lift service and a short walk. We’d definitely stay at Platinum again on another visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: Relaxing. upscale property close to all strip casinos. Staff was extremely friendly

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jerwick
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights end of August, first part of Sept. We had our car and we were familiar with Las Vegas so getting around was no problem. Great one bedroom condo setup. Fully equipped kitchen. We had strip view. Valet parking only: they were extremely helpful. Be sure to tip a couple dollars each time they get your car. The bar called Stir had happy hour with 1/2 price drinks and tapas 4pm to 8 pm. Call name brands. Strict no smoking policy, $500 fine id caught.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: NurseJen157
Reviews.Content: First trip to Las Vegas for my husbands birthday. We don't gamble or smoke so this hotel was perfect for us. Upon arrival, we were early and our room wasn't ready. With no questions asked they upgraded us to a larger suite with a washer/dryer and fireplace. The front desk staff was so nice. They also sent chocolate covered stawberries and champagne to our room for the birthday celebration. The hotel is quiet, clean, comfortable, and very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LDes4444
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious, spotless, large. Water and ice provided in fridge was a nice treat. Jacuzzi tub, pool, large bathroom, internet, etc all were great. Front desk staff were very helpful. Non-smoking and price value were why we picked this hotel and we were pleased we did. The 10 minute walk down Flamingo to Bally's / The Flamingo is worth it. Staff brought up anything we requested - extra towels/blankets, pots for making breakfast. The free fruit and cookies in the lobby were also a treat. I can't say anything bad about this hotel and we will surely be back.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic .”
Reviews.Author: 1bigmomma
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 night stay for our 25th wedding anniversary. It was everything we could have wished for and more, I would not hesitate to recommend it and would love to go back again. The staff are lovely and management left us a lovely bottle of champagne and a card 4 when we arrived very thoughtful and much appreciated after a long journey . bar is great and so is happy hr wit tappas and drinks half price from 4 till 8 in evening/ food in ,stir restaurant was lovely also . only short walk to strip and ballys hotel where u can pick up monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: AIVY25
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great, but the plumbing is HORRIBLE!!! Service is VERY SLOW!!! The employees are a bunch of shady liars. Be very careful, they will charge you extra fees on almost anything ... Even if it's not your fault. They charged us a deep cleaning fee on a mess we did not do in our room. They sent us the pictures. It was staged and obviously housekeeping trashed the room. There were items in the picture that we did not even purchase during our stay there. Customer service was not helpful while we tried to solve this issue. Kept transferring us to a lot of people and would not return your calls. Apparently, they do not have a manager that runs the hotel because we had to keep dealing with Security. Seems like the staff has everything planned out on what they will do and treat their guests. You might be next ... So, be very careful. They'll just blow you off.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas locals staycation review - So relaxing and amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: montezr
Reviews.Content: - Better service than you will find on The Strip - Let us check out late by an hour and a half - Lack of a casino keeps out the obnoxious part of Vegas - Walking distance from the heart of Sin City if you want all the casinos and crazy nightlife - Clean, relaxing and rooms felt homey. Never slept better Being from Vegas, my fiance and I were looking for a nice and relaxing Staycation over the weekend. We've stayed at over half of the hotels on The Strip and The Platinum surpasses our expectations. First, there's no gambling and no smoking, and we realized how much of a difference this made. Everything felt clean and less cluttered without all those slot machines. Plus, its just walking distance from The Strip so gambling was withing reach. All the rooms are suites and having a kitchen in our room is great! No trip to the ice machines, no drinking from the bathroom facet and a place to heat up so leftovers make our stay that much better. Service is the fastest I've seen in Vegas and I think that's because the hotel isn't over-sized like all the other Vegas casinos. Of course I forgot toothpaste, but they PROVIDE THAT! We asked for toiletries and received it within minutes. STIR Lounge was great because of the 50% Happy Hour from 4pm to 8pm, same with their tapas plus no long wait this was exactly what we were looking for. And the restaurant Kilowat by the pool, we went for breakfast sat wherever we wanted and had breakfast and a good price when compared to what's on The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: kai-jun
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 adults and 2 children) stayed here for 2 nights in early August 2011. As we were not into gambling (main purpose was the Grand Canyon trip) thus we decided to choose this hotel. The room is huge (was given a complimentary upgrade from solitaire suite strip view to Princess Suite strip view)...one bedroom with 2 queen-sized beds, huge whirlpool bathtub, separate shower room, one closet and one luggage storage cupboard. Kitchen is well equipped with fridge, microwave, microwave, stove and utensils and not forgetting the washing machine and dryer. Complimentary washing powder and softener. From the balcony, one can have a great view of the line-up of casino hotels in the Strip! Location-wise - though it's not too far away from the Strip area, it can be quite tiring for the younger children especially if the weather is HOT!!! Pool-size is not very big; fitness centre is well equipped with latest workout machines. Overall, i will recommend it especially families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value, Service, & Class”
Reviews.Author: jmcelhattan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Platinum August 25-27 for our anniversary. We chose the hotel because of its excellent rating on Tripadvisor and because we were able to book a suite for $119 per night on a weekend. We had told the hotel before our arrival that we were celebrating our anniversary, and after a very quick and easy check-in, we were taken to our room on the 10th floor facing the strip where champagne and chocolate-dipped strawberries awaited us. That same evening when we returned to our room after dinner, there was a beautiful fruit tray from Dennis Gradillas, the General Manager, wishing us an enjoyable stay. Everyone at the Platinum was extremely friendly and hospital, and never seemed too busy to help you. Our room was only slightly smaller than some of the other suites in the hotel, yet we had more than enough room for just the two of us. Where else in Vegas, especially this close to the Strip are you going to find a room with this many amenities? We also really enjoyed sitting on our patio at night enjoying the beautiful view of the Strip at night. We would definitely return to the Platinum for our next Vegas trip. I have already told several friends that if they're heading to Vegas, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Platinum is a GEM in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: AirMowb
Reviews.Content: Just have to say staying "near" the strip...staying in a NONE SMOKING hotel...lovely appointed...fantastic staff...great price...all around best way to be in Vegas but not have to be ruled by Vegas Casinos, smokers and extremes. The best and only way we'll visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Skeptica
Reviews.Content: Arrived on on Wednesday and stayed two nights. That was good because they could give us a free room upgrade -- which we weren't expecting and on Wednesday's at 5pm they offered free wine and hourdourves. It was also very nice that they had water with lemon slices or another drink and good snacks and complimentary newspapers available to the guests in the lobby. The rooms were like condominiums, bigger than our apartment. The gym had first rate equipment in new clean condition and was cool enough for a good workout. We loved that we could escape the intense sun by swimming into the inside half of the pool. None of the facilities were crowded while we were there unlike what we noticed at the Aria. Speaking of the Aria, which was what I wanted to book originally, they required an extra $80 to include a third person for a two night stay. The Aria would have been about $500 for the two nights for our party of three. The Platinum was a good $100 cheaper. The service at The Platinum was first rate and the employees were great. We never tried the spa so we can't comment about that. It is a great place to rest and spend more time there but we had plans to visit other cites.

Reviews.Title: “From A Las Vegas Veteran Visitor - Simply The Best!”
Reviews.Author: BlueSunbeam2
Reviews.Content: It may help if I give my background before writing this review. I have been coming to Las Vegas since 1990 for both holidays and conventions. It is, without doubt, my favourite city in the world for holidays in particular. Anyone who tells you that you can ‘do’ Las Vegas in 3 days has not opened their eyes to all the city and the immediate surrounding area have to offer (beyond gambling in which I have no interest). Over the years I have stayed at many hotels including t Sahara, Stratosphere, MGM Grand, Luxor, Venetian, Rio to name a few so this review is based on a wide range of experience. Add to this in my day job I spend 100+ nights away from home in hotels and have been lucky enough to have stayed at some of the very best. I have also grown to rely heavily on Trip Advisor to guide me in places where I have no knowledge and to look for a change when visiting a city I know well as was the case when visiting Las Vegas for the past 10 nights. One reason I will write a review is to counter negative reviews where I feel that they are ill informed or unreasonable. Having had an extended stay, I feel well qualified to write what follows. The fact that The Platinum has been at or near the top of the Las Vegas Trip Advisor reviews for at least 12 months in the city with probably the most diverse choice of hotels on the planet is an amazing feat of achievement. This is even more the case when you consider what it offers is a hotel with normal (well except for the room size!) facilities, it is not as is the case with many of its rivals in the city a centre of entertainment. The hotel sits 1.5 blocks from the Strip. Getting to the rear entrance of Ballys takes exactly 7 minutes at a normal walking pace. When you get to Ballys rear entrance you are almost at the Monorail Station so are then within easy reach of all parts of the strip. Also by the back entrance to Ballys is a really good small café/pizza place together with a few small gift shops. If you ignore the Monorail and walk through Ballys to The Strip (it’s cooler than walking outside) another 7 minutes will bring you to The Strip itself, roughly at its mid-point in terms of where all the action is. Hiring a car can be a good idea as if you are staying for any more than a few days what you will pay in Taxis fares will easily pay for a hire car. In our case I rented a convertible for $220 from Enterprise. UK visitors DO NOT be bullied into buying extra insurance. Instead have a look at http://www.insurance4carhire.com/ . One of the few moans about the Platinum is its compulsory Valet Parking. I read one negative review which claimed to have spent $100 on tips for their Valet Parking, all I can say is that the reviewer does not understand the commonly accepted tipping levels ($1-$2) a ‘park’ paying when you get your car back, not when you drop it off (some folks do it both ways which is too generous in my view!). Another comment and one which would concern me was from the reviewer who said their room had been broken in to while they were in it? I don’t quite get this, all rooms a fitted with the security bar that prevents someone, even with a key, getting access to the room. If your in the room this should be set! I must also say that on a number of occasions I saw security patrolling the floors. Lets be real, this is a big city and as with any big city there is always a small risk of crime and both hotels and guests should work together to prevent it. So far as the quality of the place, its all been said by previous reviewers! The hotel is clean and well maintained, the food good and service excellent. All in all this is a GREAT place to stay in Las Vegas, regardless of the purpose of your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum lives up to its name - and its TripAdvisor ranking”
Reviews.Author: carpediemoz
Reviews.Content: Although the Toastmasters International annual convention we were attending was being held at Bally’s, we chose to stay at The Platinum, a couple of blocks off the strip largely because its guest reviews rank it so high on tripadvisor.com - at the time exceeded only by The Four Seasons (at double to 25 times the price). We spent a few more dollars to stay in a Princess Suite which at 1,083 square feet is almost 20 per cent larger than the Solitaire Suite, and also gave us a washer and dryer. All units have a large bathroom, with whirlpool bath, and full kitchen. We felt as if we were living in a spacious apartment – and all for just $115 a night. Shop around online but also check the hotel’s website for extras like the fourth night free or complimentary internet. The hotel, which has an indoor-outdoor pool, spa, restaurant, nightclub, etc. but no casino (and therefore no crowds of guests), offers complimentary amenities like toothpaste, razor, deodorant and other travel items. We asked Gita, the hotel's concierge, to book our shows and restaurants; her knowledge of what to see and do – and which seats (not necessarily the most expensive) were the best – proved invaluable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Mike T
Reviews.Content: The Platinum Hotel and Spa was a great place to stay. The rooms were huge and with lots of features to include a hot tube. The staff was so helpful and nice, valet parking was great to boot. Used the spa and that was a super experience and way to relax after a day of walking Las Vegas. When I go back to Las Vegas, the Platinum Hotel and Spa is my home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Large Room”
Reviews.Author: trucker64
Reviews.Content: Loved the size and the fully equiped kitchen. The bathroom was wonderful with an oversize tub. Front desk staff were extremely friendly. The only drawback for some might be the off strip location. It's not really that far but in the August heat it may be uncomfortable. Great hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-deployment trip with the Wife”
Reviews.Author: Thekeithman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights. The only issue I had was the narrow sidewalk from the hotel to the strip 1.5 blocks away. Otherwise, the service at the hotel was top notch. Free valet parking, BIG jacuzzi tub, large balcony, full kitchen and double sinks in the bath. In this hotel, you're giving up the glitter of the big fancy hotels on the strip but are getting larger rooms, better service and a good setting for a romantic getaway without breaking the bank. I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel - Tasteful, spacious, and reasonably priced!”
Reviews.Author: gforh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a combo business/pleasure trip. It is off-strip but less than a 5-minute walk to Bally's. The rooms are beautiful, with a full kitchen (think full-size fridge, dishwasher, stove, oven, sink, etc.), living room, and balcony. Loved the bathroom amenities, too :) Free wi-fi if you book online (at least when I booked). Convenience stores nearby. Also, if you like low-key, less classy gambling, there are plenty of holes in the wall around! This may be our new hotel of choice in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel: quiet, spacious, and nice service”
Reviews.Author: all2u
Reviews.Content: The great thing about Platinum Hotel is that it provides space, luxury, and great service for a very affordable price. What I liked very much, was its location: close enough to the strip to stroll, but far enough to stay away from the masses and the noice. No slot machines! If you don't wanna walk, take a cab. The few blocks from hotel to the strip are not awkward, as some reviws mentioned. Breakfast was nice, the room was clean and very quiet. I had a suite with strip-view at one of the upper levels. The suites are very large and include a huge living room with kitchenette, a spacious bed room, and a large bathroom with separate shower and jacuzzi. The views were great. The price was really good. I have been before in Vegas, in a small room high rise at the strip, with my kids. For families, Platinum is top! If I am back in Vegas, this will definitely be my hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Off Strip.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie Hurley
Reviews.Content: During June and July of this year my wife and I toured the American West and stayed in thirteen different hotels over a 30 day period. We’ve rated all the hotels (including this one) relative to each other. We hope this will help others planning a similar journey. On a previous visit to Vegas, we stayed at the MGM Signature which boasted one of the best suites of any hotel that we had ever stayed in. The only drawback was that it was situated off the Strip. This time we initially considered the new Cosmopolitan but were deterred by the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor. We eventually settled on the Platinum on the strength of its reviews and price. The suite that we were allocated was huge and contained every amenity that anyone would ever have need of. It was clean and well-maintained although it didn’t, in any way, match up to the luxury feel of the Signature. There was a pleasant atmosphere in the public areas of the Platinum - the pool terrace, in particular. The staff went out of their way to be helpful without ever being “over-attentive” – an unwelcome trait of the tip-orientated service in the rest of Vegas. The Platinum is excellent value for money. However, like the Signature, the hotel is situated off the Strip. This might not be a problem for some but, as each day of our stay passed; we found it to be a growing inconvenience. 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “High-class room for a lowly budget”
Reviews.Author: darick04
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the weekend of the 20th in a princess suite and it was AMAZING! The room was huge, with a full kitchen and washer and dryer in it (opened a closet to find this). Raves: Large room and it was comparable to standard rooms in other hotels. A small room by the concierge where you can refill your water bottles with lemon or orange-flavored water. Stylish furniture in the rooms. Large 2-person bathtub. Rants: Spa services looked expensive, so we didn't try those. Overall, a good value for a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Number one hotel for a reason in vegas”
Reviews.Author: chidorisai
Reviews.Content: We had the princess room with king size bed. The hotel is nice and location good. Far away from noise and good place to rest after party\late evening. I did not eat in the hotel however it was looking nice and the price fair enough. Really good size for the room/living room/ bathroom If you had any issue you can get the help from the hotel. If you missing anything to cook or bathroom ...you can request The swimming pool can be access at any time no safeguard so be careful with the children below 14. you don't have any self-parting, I did not feel any problem with that. regarding the SPA,, the wife went to do a nail and this was not done properly.. so you may want to think about using there service regarding nail. So my opinion I advice 100% this place. I really appreciate the place the

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time, thanks to the concierge!”
Reviews.Author: pamlvs2trvl
Reviews.Content: I went on a trip with two girlfriends who had never been to Vegas before. We booked here instead of directly on the strip because we were able to get a really great pre-paid internet deal and it is a non-smoking (non-gambling) property. We enjoyed every minute of our stay! Our room was large and clean, it was fairly easy to get cabs, and you get nice views of the strip from the hotel. The hotel is directly behind Bally's, but the hotels in Vegas are almost a block wide each, so it is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Strip. We felt it was worth it to have a nice quiet, clean hotel to come back and "recover" in. The icing on the cake for us, though, was the concierge, Gita S. She made our impression of the hotel that much better. She got us guest-listed (with the cover waived) into various night clubs (Marquee, XS, Tao, etc.). That alone saved us over $300 and more than made up for proximity to the strip. We had a fabulous time and would stay again, if nothing else, just to have Gita's fabulous service again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: reefsurf05
Reviews.Content: First off, I booked the solitare suite and right off the bat I got upgraded to the marquis suite! I highly advise making reservations in advance. Customer Service was exceptional. This was my second time here and it definitely won't be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Super fabulous hotel! Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: annieosu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing and I can see why it's gotten such high reviews on Trip Advisor. The staff is so pleasant. The rooms are HUGE... and I mean absolutely immense! We stayed in a Strip View Solitaire Suite (me and my two small children). The hotel is perfect for families because it's completely non-smoking and there's no casino. You can get to the pool in a matter of seconds (and not have to walk three miles from your room like some of the large strip hotels). There's a 7-11 right around the corner from the hotel, so we stocked up on breakfast food since there's a full kitchen (stainless steel appliances even!). It's quiet. And it's a quick (usually around $10) cab ride to any of the large strip hotels. One note... many of the cab drivers we had were not exactly sure where the hotel was, so make sure you carry the address with you. And I hate to say anything negative, but my two gripes are: 1. The pillows are terrible. It's like sleeping on a stale marshmallow. They are small and really, really poofy so you're not sinking into the pillow as much as you are on top of it. I woke up the first morning with a headache and stiff neck. 2. The hot water in the shower won't stay one temperature so you have to keep adjusting it. But again, the place is amazing and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag.......”
Reviews.Author: dmishesq
Reviews.Content: Let me start about the good news about this hotel. It's fairly new; has reasonable rates and huge suites. Although the property is newer, it's already showing it's age and it looks to be used hard due to low rates. The bad, they charged me a $10 fee for signing for a package. For a full service "hotel" this is a first for me. I have over 50 nights this year in hotels around the country and have never even heard of a fee for accepting a package on behalf of a guest. When I inquired about the charge and requested it to be reversed, my request was denied. Quite an interesting way to alienate business customers. When I requested a late checkout, I was told no such requests were being granted. Again, not a huge deal but not quite what I was expecting. Will I return to the Platinum on my travels to Las Vegas? No, I'm going to skip it. I would rather pay $50 a night more for a hotel that isn't going to nickel and dime me. Does that make sense? Not necessarily, but I don't believe that that is the way to do business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: RobAngMichigan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 14 people on a business trip, followed by a few days with my wife. Everyone loved this hotel. Rooms are fantastic, location was perfect for us - near enough to the strip, and also to some great off strip restuarants. Staff were great in all areas. And we all loved the 4 to 8 happy hour in the bar! I will recommend this hotel to other groups at my company when the visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay in Vegas ...”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl32
Reviews.Content: Initially learned about the Plantinum and booked a 5 day stay based on the reviews read on Trip Advisor, and boy, are we glad we did! Stayed the first 2 days of our vacation at the Rio (because teen son wanted to experience their sand pool, which ended up being closed anyway for a Chippendale photo shoot!) So on the 3rd day, quickly headed over to the Platinum. They even accommodated us with an early check-in. Rio advertises suites, which is nothing more than a large room with a small refridgerator. In fact, found this to be true with many of the other strip hotels .. they advertise "suites" and you only get oversized hotel rooms. At the Platinum, you have a separate living area, full size kitchen (complete with fridge/dishwasher) spacious bathroom with jacuzzi spa tub and separate glass door shower. You have all the amenities of home, and then some. What really sold us on the Platinum was the main bedroom separated from the living area, by a door. Great for privacy from the teenager, who slept on the sofa bed in the living room. It was enjoyable sitting and eating breakfast on your private balcony, viewing the mountains and some of the strip. Pool area was clean and the indoor/outdoor pool was refreshing. But in my opinion, what makes the Platinum outstanding, in addition to what has already been written in previous posts, is the personal service. Everyone is friendly and willing to accommodate. Valets and porters rushing to open the door for you, always with a greeting and a smile. We never waited more than a few minutes to get our car -- can't say that about our Rio stay. When we called guest services to request bathrobes and pots/pans, a follow-up call made to see if the items were received and if everything was to our satisfaction. About the only "problem" encountered during our stay was that on the last day, our room failed to get cleaned. A call to the lobby quickly rectified that situation and fresh towels, extra shampoo and body lotion were brought up.. Since it was late, told them it wasn't necessary to send housekeeping up to make/change the beds. Another call soon followed to confirm our request. Now that's what you call great customer service! Husband and son said they wouldn't stay anywhere else when they are in Vegas. I agree.

Reviews.Title: “Princess suite-Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Mary47
Reviews.Content: Just one day and night here but it was all good. Our morning arrival was well before normal check in time, but they were able to accommodate us by early afternoon. We passed some pleasant time in the shade by the pool and really liked our lunch in the adjacent restaurant. The Princess suite was enormous and comfortable. The staff were courteous and helpful. Two things, one correctable and one not: 1. The hotel restaurant did not open at 6 am for breakfast as we were told, so we had to make do at the airport. 2. The location makes it tempting to walk to the strip and back. But it is not a nice walk due to traffic and dirty streets, so next time we would taxi there and (maybe) walk back. We got an excellent deal through SniqueAway, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very large rooms with full kitchen”
Reviews.Author: SaMoTraveler
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect for a families or for those who prefer to self-cater. The bedrooms in the Princess Suites are enormous, with more space that you could actually use. The bathroom had the largest jacuzzi tub I have ever seen. Two people can stretch out completely in the bath. The full kitchen includes everything you need to cook. The hotel is a distance from the strip, so if you plan to spend most of your time on the strip, you might want to stay closer. The fitness room is well-equipped and the indoor/outdoor pool is a nice touch, though there were many kids in the pool, which might not be the best for couples. You should be able to get a good deal on rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A calm oasis”
Reviews.Author: 911SC
Reviews.Content: Had a very good stay here at the start of a US road trip. A roomy one bed suite was ideal for my 4 person family (incl 2 teenage girls) with a large foldaway bed in the lounge called into use. Nice staff, pool and located close enough to the strip but far enough away to feel some calm/respite from the casino orientated strip hotels. I celebrated a major birthday whilst at the Platinum and unprompted the hotel sent up a bottle of fizz. Nice touch from a hotel deserving of its high tripadvisor rating. We really loved Vegas - unexpectedly so and would also recommend Cirque de Soleil's Mystere and Sundance Helicoptors. Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Our haven from the LV craziness, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: hfla
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the value, and because it is non-smoking (with no casino, so really non-smoking). The in-room Jacuzzi and kitchen were a plus too. We are SO glad we stayed here. The Platinum delivered on what it promised. It was clean, spacious, and you could choose a "regular" apartment suite, or a more luxurious one with a fireplace, etc. Even in the basic room, the balcony had a nice table and chairs. A surprising plus was how quiet the room was. I was worried because we were near the fitness center - but no problem at all. We didn't hear anything in the hall or the neighbors, and barely heard any outside noise. Our room had a beautiful view of the mountains. The staff were very nice, and especially Julian with the valet staff was so helpful in getting cabs. The Well Spa at the hotel was also amazing. The deep tissue massage was great - and a great value too compared to other spas. The only negatives, which are relatively minor, was the somewhat small menu at the restaurant. Also, it had good food, but not spectacular. However, compared to some of the horrendous reviews I saw of similarly priced strip restaurants, it is a good value. The bed was fine, not spectacular, but hotel beds usually aren't. Although there is no convenience store in the hotel, there are three next to the hotel, and a Starbucks half a block away. Whole Foods is about 10 minutes away in a cab. If we ever have to come to Vegas again, this will be our only choice! Note: The reviews about the other hotels are correct - ANYTHING with a casino STINKS of smoke. As a non-smoker, the stench hits us when we walk through the door, and most dining options are adjacent to or in the casinos so that makes even trying to eat in the large hotels unpleasant. We didn't have to deal with any of that at the Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAM1London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of August. Our apartment was very big - massive kingsize bedroom with lovely large bathroom. Spacious sitting room with sofa bed for our daughter (although sofa bed a bit uncomfortable), plus a kitchen. The apartment was spotless. Its about a 10 minute walk to the strip but in 40 degs celcius it is very very hot. We would take a short cut through something called the "Sportsbook" and then through Bally's hotel so we could take advantage of the AC on our way to the strip. Free cookies and cold water available in the loby. We ate tapas in the bar during happy hour - that was good value, but full price I thought was too expensive. We ate breakfast once that was good. When we arrived in LV, we took a cab from the airport but I think we were ripped off as the driver went on the freeway and charged us $30. On the way back to the airport the driver took the street route and it only cost $15. If we ever go to Vegas again we would stay at the Platinum. It is so convenient for all the over the top hotels in Vegas but its nice to go back to a quiet place with no smoking!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: robhbev1
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms on Expedia for $89 night, stayed 3 nights. The rooms were nice and big, full kitchen, staff was great, especially Daniel the bartender. Only a ten minute walk to the strip. We also used public transportation, the bus dropped us off in front of the hotel. I liked the extra amenities, free newspapers - USA Today, LA Times, and NY Tiimes, free cookies and lemonade. They also have a very good happy hour 4-8 pm everyday. The front desk was excellent, we arrived at the hotel at 8 AM, went to have breakfast on the strip and the rooms were ready when we returned. The bellmen were great, especially a African-American gentleman who wears glasses, sorry I forgot his name, went out of his way to make sure we made it on time to a show, by giving us a ride in the Platinum SUV, since we couldn't get a taxi for five people. For the price, service, food and drinks, this hotel definitely gets a five star from me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay Off Strip”
Reviews.Author: 2BizzyTravlin
Reviews.Content: The rooms are suprisingly large suites w/ full kitchen, and a nice living room area with a flatscreen tv. We found the bedroom to be very roomy with a comfortable bed and plenty of closet and drawer space. The bedroom opened into a very large bathroom with a large jacuzzi tub, seperate shower, and a double sink. Conveniently, there is an AM PM Market next to the hotel and a 24 hour grocery across the street. The strip was an easy block and a half away, far enough to cut down on traffic noise. In fact, we found the hotel to be very quiet, and loved the non smoking policy. We stayed Sun & Mon night and paid $134 ( AAA rate) for a single king w/ strip view. There were cheaper rooms available, but we enjoyed the patio w/ view for a few dollars more. Great for enjoying a cup of coffee in the a.m. and watching the hustle and bustle of the city from your own little patio.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip, good value.”
Reviews.Author: otocad
Reviews.Content: If you want the crowds, the noise, the hype, the Vegas Experience, go to a hotel on the Strip. If you want to stand back from it, & sample it only when you can tolerate it, come here. It's a block back from the Strip, behind Bally's, so a 10-minute walk to the action. No smoking, no gaming & no shops in the hotel, but there is a bar, restaurant & pool if you want these. 7-11-type stores next door and across the street. If you come by car, valet parking is mandatory, but free and efficient. Only 5 years old (in 2011) so still looks new, inside and out. Pleasant, helpful & friendly staff, & they don't try to rip you off with extra fees, offers, etc. Large rooms, good value for money. I'd come here again.

Reviews.Title: “So glad I choose this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Thorlindur T
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in Vegas and I am so glad I chose this Hotel. I would definalty reccomend this hotel for the following reasons. The hotel staff is extremely nice and helpful going out of there to serve you. The pool on this hotel is amazing. Its on the 5th floor with magnicant view of the nearby casinos. Its within walking distance of the mall at Ceasers Palace but comes without noise and hustle and bustle of staying there. This is a non-casino hotel, which I realized later is extremely nice because it gives you a nice refuge from noise and comotion of the strip. When I go to Las Vegas again I will definatly be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, relaxing oasis to stay in hectic Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DirtyLabTech
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a king bed suite for 1 week. The rooms were clean, quiet, nice and well equiped for a multiple night stay. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The pool and exercise room were in great condition. I was able to have coffee in my room each morning to a beautiful sunrise over the mountain. The ability to buy groceries and cook small meals is nice when traveling alone so that you do not have to search for a restaurant or coffee shop when you are tired. The ice maker on the refrigerator was an extra bonus. The restuarant and bar in the hotel are there and reasonable when you just felt like having something nice. Good for business travel or family wanting to stay off strip. The strip is just a few blocks away and the monorail is one block away at Ballys.

Reviews.Title: “A sanctuary from the excesses of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: alMossah
Reviews.Content: We wanted a quiet hotel with plenty of space. We got all of that and a lot more. The rooms are spacious; comfortable bed, big bedroom, lots of storage space, great well-equipped kitchen, huge fridge, and a great view of the strip from the strip-side - see photo. Saturday night brings in a few party-goers, but for the most part the hotel is filled with families enjoying the relative peace and quiet. The roms are really quiet - even on Saturday night there was no sound of returning revellers. It being a smallish hotel, one gets to know the staff, who are all excellent. The pool and gym area are good; time it well and you can do some serious swimming; the rest of the time it's pleasantly full. Poolside service is available. Breakfast starts at 6.30; great for jet-lagged Europeans on a first morning. It's good value; the best value anything you'll get in this ripoff city. It's a 1km walk up to the strip, half of which can be through Bally's if you can't stand the heat. The Spa is good; friendly, and probably good value for Vegas. We had a great 4-day stay here, and if we ever were dragged kicking and screaming back to Vegas, we'd stay here again; an oasis of sanity in a crazy city. Thanks, Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family”
Reviews.Author: Bad_Seed4
Reviews.Content: We deliberately didn't want to stay at a casino hotel because we wanted to avoid the smoke as we had kids and this was a great choice. Rooms are very spacious, we had a reasonable partial view of the strip and the kids enjoyed the pool while the adults enjoyed the happy hour half price drinks in the bar. It is a reasonable walk to the main strip and when we stayed, it seemed longer because of the heatwave but once we worked out we could walk a lot of the way through the Bally property in the air conditioning, it was easier. Staff are very freidnly. Recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME...we will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: K M A
Reviews.Content: Great suites, pool area, bar, and staff! We stayed here to celebrate my 40th birthday with some family and close friends. The staff went out of there way to accommodate and the hotel suite was perfect for our get together. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Will only stay here from now on!”
Reviews.Author: AdonisP
Reviews.Content: Do you want a class A hotel with reasonable rates? Stay at the Platinum!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, superb quality and wonderful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: elliottsa
Reviews.Content: I can not recommend this hotel enough; as others have before me. Great service, especially David at breakfast who was exceptionally polite and attentive; but not annoying! The rooms were perfect and incredibly spacious - I would recommend the strip view solitaire suite, very resonable and a massive run around in bathroom! It took us 5 -10 mins to walk to the strip and felt safe coming back late. Great value at about $149 per night and possibly even cheaper on Hotels.com. A warning to British travellers - hotel pre authourisation eats away at your credit or pre pay card; anything from $150 - $500! Try to have a pre pay dollar card like Caxton FX to pay the balance and an empty credit card to secure the pre authourisation.

Reviews.Title: “Wow... great value accommodation and close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: arad85
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Vegas at the start of a 3 week roadtrip around South Western USA. We wanted something off the Strip and a reasonable price so chose the Platinum based on the recommendations of TripAdvisor. We booked one of the Princess suites with strip view and it was perfect - and totally huge. Breakfast very nice and so was the burger in the bar and not too badly priced. Happy hour from 4pm - 8pm is the best time to hit the bar as drinks are half price (drinks are a little expensive here). The pool was lovely and has both an outdoor and indoor section as well as a whirlpool. Staff all attentive and very polite. Nearby shops available for snacks/drinks (7-11 is just next door) and the Strip is a 10 minute walk away at most. Not the best area (some vagrants begging/drinking, but not at the hotel) but this is Vegas! Didn't feel at all threatened even when walking back from the Strip at 10pm. The bonus for us was the washing machine/dryer (although we didn't need the dryer - an hour on the balcony got everything dry). We shall be calling in again as we come back through Vegas in a weeks time as we enjoyed it so much there and we can get the washing done for the final week in California.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LinSim
Reviews.Content: Booked the Platinum back in Feb for our stay in August ( used Trip advisor going by reviews) we were not disapointed ALL the staff were very nice and helpful. Like the other reviewers its clean and value for $. I booked it because its a non smoking non gambling hotel, back in Feb i was a smoker this place was my insentive to stop, i have been smoke free since 25 June, so my reward paid off,by Australian standards we would pay $250 a night in Perth. Going into gambling casinos is fun but they are noisy and NOT smoke free, so do yourself a favor and stay at the Platinum. Its just so peacful u would never think just 5 mins up the street is hussle and bussle of Vegas. Thanks Platinum for helping me quit the smokes,sorry we have 2 leave tomorrow (8/10/11)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, quiet clean yet close to strip, free valet parking, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: beenthereMn
Reviews.Content: Brittney at front desk was the best. Traveled with mom and 12 and 13 yr old boys. I strongly recommend a rental car for getting around due to heat and how big the strip is. Love the free valet parking, clean spacious rooms. We got upgraded to princess suite due to my sons birthday and mom's retirement. Strip view with balcony is worth it. Overlooks the pool too. So glad we switched from MGM SIgnature to the Platinum. MGM is just too big, At the Platinum the pool is never overcrowded and getting in and out is easy....not so much at the large casino hotels. No resort fees and no extra $30 per person per night for the boys like at MGM. Room service Pizza was the best! I will post pictures when we get home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value with all you could want”
Reviews.Author: QueenieRoadie
Reviews.Content: So much better than spending over the odds on the strip. Huge apartment with lovely balcony and all amenities (including washer, dryer and washing powder provided). Lovely pool on 5th floor and very helpful staff. Only caution is that the 5 min walk back to the apartment is slightly isolated and if you have kids I'd consider getting a taxi if it is really late. Could have done without bumpin into 2 'working girls' leaving the hotel at 8am on our first morning but hey it's Vegas and I guess that could happen anywhere! Wonderfully clean I would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was so helpful, we felt like we were really special”
Reviews.Author: lindagepfer
Reviews.Content: The staff was so helpful, we felt like we were really special. . Quiet hotel even though it was close to the strip. Restaurant had good food, very reasonable

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we stayed in while travelling in USA”
Reviews.Author: Anna S
Reviews.Content: For a very reasonable price we stayed two nights in a nice two-room apartment with fully equipped kitchen (washng machine included) and the balcony. The rooms were big but at the same time very cosy. We liked swimming pool where we could sunbathe and relax after the long visit in the city. The hotel is located abt. 0,5 km distance from the Strip. For some people it might be little bit unpleasant to walk for 15 minutes along the street without any trees around, especially in a very hot weather. The service and staff was friendly and fully professional. I

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Platinum”
Reviews.Author: rn4kids45
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Platinum several times and have never been disappointed. The rooms are condo style with a full size kitchen, living area with plasma tv, fireplace and private balcony. The bedroom is in a separate area with another tv and the bathroom is large with a whirlpool tub, separate shower and granite counter tops. Although there is not a casino in the hotel, casinos are within walking distance. This is a non-smoking hotel which my husband and I love. There is a restaurant and spa on site. The pool is always great with an outside and inside location connected. Meal and beverage service is available at the pool. The staff are always friendly and willing to accomodate requests. I do not have a bad thing to say about The Platinum. We hope to return again next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on a large suite with balcony”
Reviews.Author: djmjr
Reviews.Content: Chances are, you won't find a better deal on a large hotel suite in Vegas unless you lose a lot of money and get comped one at a casino hotel. The rooms (with balcony) have a large living room area with a pull out couch adjacent to a small kitchen, and a separate bedroom. The bathroom is large and well appointed, with a whirlpool tub and separate shower. The strip is a short five minute walk away -- close enough to reach easily, and far enough to be away from the craziness (especially on the weekend). Valet parking is complementary, but of course tips are expected. Wifi was complimentary when we booked on the hotel's website (we had to ask for a passcode at the front desk). The fitness center is fairly large and well stocked with cardio and strength machines. The fifth-floor pool deck has connected indoor and outdoor heated pools, and the pool deck has plenty of seating. The staff was friendly and helpful overall. I would stay here again if we returned to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Event Execution & Beautiful Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: blueskyguy5
Reviews.Content: The Platinum hosted our daughter's wedding in July and the event could not have gone any better. We were a group of 80+ (staying 4 nights) and the hotel staff managed to send everyone home happy - no small accomplishment. The wedding facilitator was highly organized and helped removed a lot of the stress of event planning. No details were left unattended and the staff were gracious and responsive throughout. The large suites and the comfortable pool area were perfect for relaxing when you needed a break from the Vegas excitement. We would definitely recommend the Platinum for both vacation visits and special events.

Reviews.Title: “So spacious and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Kayjay64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one block from the main tourist area, which to us was great, a bit of a reprieve from the hustle and bustle of the strip which we found busy all day and night long. The check in was fast, and our one bedroom apartment was wonderful. Large kitchen living area plus balcony, king sized bed in our bedroom with a large ensuite in marble, televisions in both rooms not that we had time to watch them. We didn't have a car so we were able to purchase a few groceries at a convenience store diagonally across the street. The concierge was so helpful she made our stay most enjoyable arranging our tour to the Grand Canyon, suggesting lots of ways to see Las Vegas in the short time that we had , we achieved all that we had intended to see and more.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet retreat in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: MBK_Victoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum for 5 nights. It is situated one block back of Bally's,so we liked the ability to do a short walk and be in the central part of the Las Vegas Strip. We also liked the fact it had a huge suite with kitchen facilities,sometimes we like to make our own breakfast or light lunch before heading off to the glitz and glamour. The pool on the 5th floor was also a wonderful feature, barely crowded even on those afternoons when the temperatures hit 109F.They provided opium beds, pool toys and even a swim in channel if you preferred the indoor part of the pool.Very relaxing and sure less busy than the Strip Hotel pools which were packed with people. At night the hotel was very quiet,hard to believe in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel with excellent service, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: sryan1018
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers high end condo units. We took a room on the top 17th floor which gives you great views of the strip and the mountains in the background. Hotel is maintained to a very high standard, better than some of our time share units we have stayed at in the past. The staff are at your fingertips 24/7 and are very courteous and helpful. Roger Yen requires a special mention as he was exceptionally helpful time after time. I would certainly stay at this hotel the next time we visit Vegas. Rick & Sandra Ryan Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN LAS VEGAS THATS JUST OFF THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: monkeypants73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honey moon. The rooms are great and big, the staff is great and very friendly. The pool is very nice not to big not to small. This place is great for people who like Las Vegas, but do not like staying on the strip. There is nothing bad to say about this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mtnprotracy
Reviews.Content: Large rooms with kitchens were reasons why my family was drawn to this resort. We'll come back because of the impeccable service, clean rooms, and perfect location. We really enjoyed the manager's reception with live entertainment on Wednesday. We were traveling with kids and loved the fact that there were noodles and other pool toys available. The area around the pool was just perfect. I've never seen such an array of options for lounging! There are, for lack of a better description, beds....beds with sufficient shade....even in July. The fire pits would have been a real treat in the fall/winter season. Prices at the restaurant were affordable, and the food was good. The elevators were some of the fastest I have ever seen!! Check-in was a breeze...and the free, valet parking much appreciated. We also traveled with a special needs child (autistic 12 year old). Everything he needed to meet his needs was accessible and the staff was so courteous and insanely speedy! I'm not sure we'll visit Vegas again, but if we do, we'll most certainly stay at the Platinum. Honestly, I don't know if I have ever stayed at a nicer hotel anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: labrt2004
