Reviews.Content: Two words: sleek comfort. I got the Princess Suite. The room was huge! The bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, and living room were beautifully appointed. It was also blissfully quiet, with its off strip location. I had to get a lot of work done on the trip and was able to do so while kicking back on the balcony. The staff were efficient and helpful. I was amused by my fake fireplace--I thought that was their one nod to Vegas kitsch. Spent a lot of time soaking in my huge tub and marveling at the size of the bathroom, which could have fit my entire apartment. Downside was that there really wasn't many non-fancy food options available if you were hungry late into the night, since they're off strip. But since I was able to order off their room service menu and kept it reasonable. Would definitely come back again and would choose it over the smoky, noisy strip joints any day.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusieT50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a quiet stay, which we wanted. We're not in to gambling or shows and were using this as the start point for an 18 day fly drive and stayed 3 days at the start and 2 days at the end. Large rooms, excellent decor, furniture and equipment etc. No smoking thoughout (what a joy!), no casino. We had Princess Suite for 3 nights and Solitaire Suite for 2. Solitaire is smaller but you'd never notice for just 2 people. The Princess did have a fire and washing machine, neither of which were needed! Staff great - special mention to Eugene and Nathan who checked us in with no hassle, Brianna who organised a late check out at the last minute and sorted out our flight on line check in, and Jeff and David in the breakfast restaurant for being so pleasant and helpful. Breakfast on average $30 for two, but huge portions and well cooked. I've seen complaints about compulsory valet parking - we had no issues - guys were helpful, prompt and didn't hang round expecting a tip. Didn't use the pool, but must be OK as people were always in it, even though it is a bit small. Location does leave a bit to be desired - 10 minutes walk to the Strip (just behind Ballys) and no fun in 105 deg temp! We got cab back a couple of times as heat too much to walk in (not cheap as meter runs when stuck at traffic lights and there are a lot of them). Tip - go in Ballys side entrance on East Flamingo and you can then walk through there to Paris and Planet Hollywood without needing to go outside. Also, area is a bit run down - looks like renovation started but hit a problem. Yes, tramps do doss around there and do hassle you if you're walking, especially if going to the 7-11 around the corner (their favourite haunt) but working in a major city I'm used to it and just ignored them. On the last night we wanted to go to Fremont - everyone said use the bus as cabs expensive but we're not bus people so bit the bullet and got a cab. $22.50 each way (£13.50, we'd pay that going in to our local town) and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here next time”
Reviews.Author: EenJinUSA
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 nights through a Travelzoo deal in the Platinum hotel. We have stayed both on/off strip before and in both gambling/non gambling hotels. I had a few doubts before if I would like a off strip / non gambling hotel and I must say we were pleasantly surprised. The Platinum hotel is a small scale luxury hotel. They have eye for detail and for personal attention. We stayed in a strip facing suite. We were pleasantly surprised by the full kitchen, the large living room and the balcony where you could comfortably sit with 4. The bathroom is very big. Great shower. Bathtub is like a swimming pool. Bedroom had a great bed, we slept like babies. On the fifth floor there was a swimmingpool with comfortable beds that were available at no charge. The pool was relatively small but as the hotel is also smaller than most Las Vegas hotels, there was plenty of room in the pool. Staff at the pool was very nice and helpful. Restaurant served great food. We did not visit the bar. Bellagio/Paris/Flamingo/Ballys all within walking distance. A week later we spent another night in Las Vegas and I had booked the Luxor just because we wanted to stay in the Pyramid once. Let me just put it this way - next time we are in Vegas, we will stay at the Platinum hotel....

Reviews.Title: “it was close enough to the strip, but far enough away”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetoquilt
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and very easy to get to the strip - The walk was not that far maybe 5 minutes. My only complaint was the people next store who was very loud and made a lot of noise before going out and then when they came in at about 2 or 3AM - thank goodness they left abotu 2 days after we checked in!

Reviews.Title: “Great location just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: gr1069
Reviews.Content: Location one block off the strip. No casino but that was a plus. Just walk into the lobby and the elevator was right there. When purchasing I didn't pay much attention to the amenities but it was a condo with a full sized kitchen, washer dryer and a large jacuzzi bathtub. We didn't visit the pool but it look like a great place to relax. Will definitely be back. Walk a block away to Ellis Island for the best breakfast in town. The only downside is the empty lots across the street and a small abandoned building right by. 10 minute walk to Bellagio, Ballys, Caesar's etc without the insanity of the huge casino crowds

Reviews.Title: “Used to be our go-to hotel in Vegas, not anymore”
Reviews.Author: MamaDep
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 4 times. First two times, loved it. Good off-strip location, newer, non-gaming property, decent pool (not crowded, heated), and overall great value for 1bdrom suite with kitchen. Last two times, had problems. On one stay, the 2brm suite across the hallway had a party going on, with smokers. The second-hand smoke seeped into our room, and we had kids. Called to complain, but was told that they cannot do anything because they (the other party) were owners. Partying music didn't end until 2am, but even after that, there were constantly door slamming noises from the people who were leaving and going. On the other stay, the pool was closed from 3pm onwards as they prepared for an event. Again, another party until 1pm. Note, we booked the 2brm suite...one of the bedroom has an entrance right next to the elevators. Very noisy. Wish this boutique hotel continued to be stay a secret, but unfortunately the high traffic and popularity has taken a toll on major wear and tear. The cleaning and maintenance crew need to do a better job in between renters. The valet crew are still great...but other services are going downhill. Still a strong contender, but the last 10 times to Vegas, have found more competitively priced and luxurious accommodations elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent non-casino hotel near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jhawkx2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at The Platinum hotel in July 2011. We specifically chose a non-casino hotel, because as much as we enjoy the buzz / excitement of Las Vegas, at the end of the day, our hotel is a refuge from the clanging and smoke of casinos...yet still close enough to the action. Note: The Platinum is strictly a non-smoking hotel. The room was truly a suite - one bedroom with separate living room and full kitchen. There was a small balcony, large jacuzzi tub, shower and two sinks. The decor was very modern and tasteful. We were only a short walk to where our friends were staying at Harrah's. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The lounge had happy hour every evening with half-price drinks. The restaurant was only open for breakfast and lunch and you could either sit inside or poolside on the 5th floor. The breakfast was excellent and reasonably priced. We both had a delicious breakfast, mimosa, bellini and a spicy bloody mary for just over $50 including gratuity. Our friends joined us for breakfast on Sunday and raved about how good the food was compared to what they were experiencing on the Strip. Many (if not all) of the units are privately owned so you can book with the hotel front desk for a standard rate OR may be able to find a better deal booking directly with the owner. We found a much better price via VRBO - saving almost $50 a night. Valet parking is included (except tipping the drivers). I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This was SO worth the money - GREAT value for a large and lovely suite”
Reviews.Author: Sandy_baby2
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay. Excellent and friendly service, (Sloooow pool side food service, but they do warn you about it) and nice ambiance overall. I like the fact this hotel is off the strip. The pool is a rooftop pool with fire pits, and bit lounge chairs..and its not your standard crowded Vegas pool scene..if that's what you want this is NOT the place. If you want to lounge in the sun, have the pool virtually to yourself, and the spa too...well you should check this place out. The suite was large, well appointed, with a balcony and a fully equipped kitchen. The bedroom was huge as was the bathroom, and it had a spa bath too. We had a great time, slept like babies and enjoyed coming back from the strip to our huge apartment-like quarters..you could honestly have fit another couple of people in the suite...and hosted a fair sized party there too! We will be going back for sure. Definitely deserves the high rating on Trip Advisor. Thanks fellow reviewers, we would never have found this place without Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaneneck
Reviews.Content: We usually don't stay at hotels but we really enjoyed the stay. The rooms were large and the staff was friendly and helpful. The location was convenient and we had a lot fun in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Reba5
Reviews.Content: The Platinum is off strip by a 5 mins. walk, so it's a haven, not a gambling hotel. Our room was good value and massive! Princess suite. View of the strip with a balcony. Swimming pool was never too busy and often quiet. Pool side staff were excellent. Staff were excellent, really helpful especially at getting taxis, which can be difficult. The bar at the reception had happy hours everyday - half price, on drinks and food, excellent value and good quality food - only regret that we didn't use it more. As a treat we ordered breakfast in our room, this is something we wouldn't normally do, and it wasn't that great. In reception there was free fresh fruit water, cakes or biscuits. Service one day was slow in the restaurant next to the pool, but that was compensated by offering it to us free. If you want to experience Vegas, but not be in the thick of it this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “5* apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bee072
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for almost two weeks and stayed at the Platinum. Excellent service from the moment we arrived. Complimentary valet service (always keep some bucks in your pocket for tips, though). Free cookies and newspapers in the lobby. Clean pool and huge gym. Exceptionally comfortable apartment with full kitchen including dishwasher. We saved a ton of money cooking our own meals. Look for Albertson's grocery store a few blocks away. Highly recommend this hotel - it was our second visit and we will be back. (Used the spa last time and it was great - can't review it for this trip)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for those who don't like to stay in casinos”
Reviews.Author: finn59
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on other Tripadvisor reviews, and were not disappointed. Several reviews had complained of the long walk to the strip, but we did not find it bad at all. It's about a 5-10 minute walk to Bally's, and from there you can also proceed to the Paris and the rest of the strip. Check-in was an absolute breeze - it took maybe 3 minutes tops, and we were early. As we walked through the casinos, and saw the huge lineups there to check in, we were positive we had made the right choice. Even more so when we chatted with a couple who said they had been refused check-in because they were an hour early. Yikes - what a way to start your vacation! We had a strip view, and although it is a limited view, we felt it was worth the small upgrade. The suite was great - clean, with a full-size fridge and all the amenities. The bathroom was large, and everything was spotless. We ate breakfast each morning at the hotel restaurant, and had no complaints there either. The prices were very reasonable, and service was terrific. We would gladly recommend the Platinum to family and friends, and would stay there again. We did have some confusion with our bill - (we didn't get a statement at check-out, and had some difficulty getting one) - but in the end, that was sorted out satisfactorily. Thanks Nathan for your patience and attention to this. If you have never been to Las Vegas before, and are taking a cab from the airport, make sure they take the route south of the strip, which should cost you about $10. We got hijacked for a race around the strip, etc., when we arrived, and the joker ran our bill up to $27. If we had known, we would have taken down his name and cab number, and filed a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: ReidRock
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end our 3 week USA driving tour and it was by far the best hotel (and best value) of the 12 we stayed in on our trip. It started with Nathan on reception very kindly allowing us to check in early (and book out late for a late flight). We then went to our suite (Princess Suite 10th floor) which was huge, nicely fitted out and very comfortable with great views of the strip from our balcony. All the staff - reception, concierge, cleaners, maintenance, pool area etc etc - always had a smile and always spoke to us. The hotel is in a great location, ten minutes walk max from the centre of the strip so it is convenient for all the hotels, is in a safe area and has a fully stocked 7-11 just around the corner. We loved this hotel and will certainly return - and we are recommending it to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Venusmm
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for our college reunion, we also had our dinner in one of their function room called Misora at their 17 th floor. We all enjoyed our stay as well as the dinner, food was delicious. The staff were helpful and courteous. Their room is so spacious, clean and updated. This will be our hotel to stay every time we visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good location some excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Minchminch
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a driving trip taking in the Big Sur, Sequoia National Forest and Death Valley which was amazing! We found the hotel and knew about the valet service. As we had a lot of luggage from our travels we wanted to pull over out of the main thoroughfare to allow other cars to pull in... We hadn't even stopped the car when we were waved down by one of the valets who then proceeded to shout at us. We explained that we had a lot of luggage to gather together and felt uncomfortable as he tried to take the keys when we had hardly a chance to unload a thing. We are reasonable folk with little demands but we honestly did feel that unfortunatelt he was more of a hindrance than a help.  I went into to get a baggage trolley and found chap inside was very helpful as was the lady at reception. From then on we had an excellent time. The queen suite was beautiful, it had it's own kitchen, sitting area, balcony and large jacuzzi in the lovely bathroom. Wifi in the rooms was not free but available at a reasonable price. We enjoyed staying just a short walk from the strip and would definitely consider staying here if visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice if u don't want to be on top of a casino”
Reviews.Author: Travellingozz
Reviews.Content: Great rooms so spacious. Staff helpful. Gym excellent. Thank you platinum for making my daughter and I welcome and providing a lovely hotel to rest our weary Vegas bodies.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Xcellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: mpvasq
Reviews.Content: We decided on this New Years Eve Trip at the last minute and got a great rate. Our room at the The Platinum was gorgeous, huge and had a great view of the strip. Room Service was Excellent and the New Years Eve fireworks view at the top flloor was fabulous. Las Vegas was very cold when we arrived but getting around by taxi was at a reasonable price. We saw 3 fabulous shows that we booked 1 day before or the same day calling the 1-800 number in the "Las Vegas" magazines in the room. A+++ overall experience, except we couldn't visit as many hotels/casinos as we would have liked due to the frigid weather but we'll be back when it's warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Zo9
Reviews.Content: My party had an amazing time! The price was affordable, the location was good and everyone was extremely impressed with the rooms. I would recommend the Platinum hotel to everyone and I plan on staying there many more times to come!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adrianhamill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 12 nights at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. The room was huge -one of the best we have ever stayed in. Large bedroom and good wardrobe space. Separate lounge and full kitchen if you wanted to cook a meal. Large bathroom with twin sinks. Balcony equiped with table and chairs. Very quiet -the only noise we heard were the ambulances going past. We had a room facing away from the strip which had lovely views. Every night from 4 to 8 there was a half price happy hour in the Stir lounge (recommend the angus sliders and the Absolutely as a pre-dinner/show starter). Wednesday afternoons there were complementary drinks and nibbles for all new guests and Saturday afternoons they had a dj by the pool. The only down side to this hotel was the distance from the strip. It's an easy walk -approx 15 minutes, but in the height of summer, after a few days it became a chore in the heat and we began taking taxis into town and walking home. I'm sure in cooler months we wouldn't have had the same problem, but that's the trade off you get for choosing a quieter hotel off the strip. Overall, highly recommend this hotel for those who don't want to stay on the strip, those who don't want to stay in a gaming hotel and those who want a quiet hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Class”
Reviews.Author: Crossmichael
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attended a family wedding here and the hotel and staff were both first rate. The rooms are clean and fully equiped for a short or extended stay. They are unusually large compared with what many upper end chains offer, and at a very reasonable price. The staff who arranged the wedding did a superb job, I heard not one complaint from any of the more than eighty guests that attended. I highly recommend this hotel for any family event you may be planning. Best of the best? The men at the door. Got a problem, any problem? They fix it. They made a great stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenkwfl
Reviews.Content: My first time to Vegas..stayed three nights at the Venetian. The location was great, but there was no personal service, the rooms were not what I expected and the smoke throughout the hotel was bothersome. My friend and I decided to move to a non-gaming, non-smoking resort, but we wanted a suite with space for our remaining nights. We were able to check in to the Platimum before the normal time and were greeted warmly. The suites were amazing with full kitchens, balconies overlooking the Strip. The bellman/valet were fabulous and every employee that we can into contact with was pleasant and helpful. I will definately stay at this hotel the next time I can escape to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: snappydoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights during our first trip to LV. From the minute we stepped through the doors, we were treated like royalty. The staff members were always available to bring whatever we needed. They were all so courteous that we almost felt guilty. Dennis, you and your staff have set the standard that other businesses should follow. It was clear that everyone employed at the Platinum shared a common vision....simply, to provide the best customer service possible in a beautiful facility. We can't wait to go back.....we are already planning our return.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: sallylass
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Platinum Hotel and Spa and were extremely impressed. The suites were absolutely amazing - very spacious, stylish and modern design with all the facilities you could want. The pool was also very nice, not huge but fairly quiet with a friendly laid back atmosphere and lovely comfy daybeds (just the thing if you want to crash out for an hour or two before getting ready for a night out). Although the hotel is not directly on the strip, a five minute walk brings you out directly into its heart. The staff were also all very helpful and accommodating, going out their way for you. All in all we can heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms and great price but a little too far from the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: Debbie S
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking for a good price at a nice hotel. You know, the biggest bang for your buck. I found this little jewel and got a suite room with a "view" of a strip. We only paid $119.00 per night so I think it was a fantastic room for what we paid for it. As far as the room was concerned, you couldn't have asked for a better one. The only thing I would have liked better about it would have been if the Solotaire Strip View Suite had a better view of the strip. The room was on the end of the building. If it had been on the front of the building the view would have been much better. I would imagine the Princess Strip View Suite would have been on the front and had a better view but they were more expensive. The walk to the strip was a little farther than I had imagined when I viewed the hotel on a map of Las Vegas. It appeared to be one block off the strip behind the Bally which is right on the Strip. The map didn't show was how large the Bally is along with the monorail station that runs behind it and a very large empty lot between the Bally and the street the Platinum was on. It is hot in Vegas so walking that far in the heat was not enjoyable. If you don't mind the walk this is the place for you as long as you don't mind having to walk somewhere else to gamble. This is a non-gaming hotel. There was a full gourmet kitchen with granite counter tops, a full-size living room with a flat panel TV and a desk for work space if you need it. There was a small but adequate balcony, a beautiful, bedroom but too little drawer space, a more than luxurious, marble bath with a jacuzzi tub, a separate shower and a double vanity.

Reviews.Title: “great for families, full kitchen and nice pool”
Reviews.Author: johnfromwollongong
Reviews.Content: about 15 min casual walk to the bellagio. not as flashy as the vdara but very functional. the princess suite was large. the pool was open till late (unlike many other vegas hotels). It is bit of a walk but one can walk to the bellagio in 10 min if you walk briskly. Would recommend for self catering families or those who want more space.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SriSumy
Reviews.Content: Platinum is an awesome place to stay for families. We liked the large rooms, the space for the kids and the full kitchen. Having the strip in our view and accessible was good. We would love to stay again at this facility. I would like the restaurant menus to be a little more comprehensive

Reviews.Title: “Right on target for a long (9 night) stay”
Reviews.Author: SamandTaylor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 nights - in strip view w/washer & dryer. We had a vehicle, therefore the 1.5 block walk to the strip was not a issue (we walked a few times, but were not limited by this feature). Valet, the only option, was always quick and super friendly (Julian, you rock). All other employees we came into contact with were also friendly, professional, and accommodated every request. We had one glitch with housekeeping, but that was resolved appropriately. Having a bedroom separated from the rest of the 'living' area was invaluable, as it allowed one person to sleep, while another could be watching tv or playing Angry Birds in the other room. I calculated we saved approx $350 on food costs by having breakfast and lunch in our room (there is an Albertson's a mile away). We used the restaurant once, and the prices were reasonable (especially for Vegas) and the food was good. The pool was a tad murky, but for a quiet couple like us, so very nice not to have a 'zoo' in the pool area. The kids that were there were attended and well behaved. We never had to fight for chairs or umbrellas. Tried to get appointment w/spa on short notice (24 hours), they were booked up - so we went elsewhere for that luxury. All was as advertised - we had a good view, full kitchen (ask for pots/pans), everything was in working order - the inclusion of clothes & dish detergent is so very convenient.. No complaints and we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Second time”
Reviews.Author: marlowe78
Reviews.Content: This is a well located hotel just off the strip. It is our second visit to this hotel and we think it cannot be beaten , Although the hotel is not too big the rooms are a very good size, very very clean, and the staff ,well we cannot praise them enough they are helpful ,always with a smile and nothing is too much trouble they were excellent . The only issue we had was that round the pool area there was'nt enough shade and that is a must in those sort of temperatures (come on Platinum thats all it needs) but if we do go to Vegas again we would certainly stay with you again

Reviews.Title: “Great *non-smoking* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elaineboorstein
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled to find a non smoking hotel in Vegas. We were stopping for just one night on our way to Southern California. Truthfully, though not into gambling, I could have easily enjoyed a second night here. Service was wonderful and the rooms (one bedroom apartments) were nicely appointed. We were able to check in early, and my daughter and I enjoyed the pool area while my husband rested up from a long day of driving. We ordered room service (pizza) for a late lunch. For dinner, we visited their lounge and enjoyed Happy Hour priced tapas. The following morning we had breakfast at the restaurant next to the rooftop pool. Excellent food! Beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom (with jetted tub) was huge and lovely. My husband is debating on attending a conference in Vegas this August. As much as I cringe at the thought of Vegas in the summer, I could happily camp out at this very lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with young children!”
Reviews.Author: Nicebreaks
Reviews.Content: What a great stay at Platinum! I would recommend this hotel for young kids and families. My daughter (7 yrs old) and I went to Vegas to celebrate my birthday at Platinum. This was our first time and we were thrilled with excellent services and wonderful smiles from the front desk staffs. We arrived at 12:00 PM and they let us check in. No line at all. The hotel is non-casino and non-smoking room in all areas so it is great for young kids and adults alike. Room was great with big fridge and freezer, marble counter top, and working area. They did not have pots and pan stored, but you can call the front desk and they will bring them right up. There will also be a follow-up phone call to check if you receive them. This hotel has a good procedure to ensure that your stay is wonderful and pleasant. I can tell that they have a good management team here. Bath room is huge with a jet bathtub and a stall for a shower bath. Dining area is also nice. Bed is comfy wiht two TVs in the room (one for me and one for my daughter after a long day). Internet is free if you book your room directly with the hotel. Pool is on the 5th floor. They have both indoor and outdoor pool connected with one another. Children bath toys and noodles in the box are located next to the pool. You can also enjoy a poolside breakfast there as well. It was very pleasant in the morning because the building itself blocked the son and it's not up and shined on your head until noon. The hotel also surprised me with a birthday card and two Norwagian water bottles on the following day. When I opened up the fridge, there were chocolate dipped strawberries inside. My daughter loved it and said what a wonderful hotel! At the reception area, there are chocolate chip cookies, sugar cookies, lime water, straweberry/orange water, and apples for refreshment. The hotel is located one block away from Bally's and strip. We purchased three days unlimited pass to monorail to go everywhere in Vegas. It was $28 per person. I believe kids under 5 ride free. Since I have youngs kids, we tried to walk from hotel to hotel to avoid the heat. We came back to the hotel very late at night after seeing the Lion King show at Mandalay Bay and had to walk from Bally to Platinum. Duringn our walk, we didn't find anything that made us feel uneasy. The lights are all over the places and there were many tourists walking with us. There were so much to do in Vegas. We had a great stay and Platinum has made it possible. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you... thank you very much”
Reviews.Author: medmike07
Reviews.Content: Yeah, we also saw Viva Elvis, fun show! As for the Platinum: Great for family with toddler; service-oriented staff; accomodating! My wife, toddler daughter, and I went to Vegas with a group of other couples for my 40th birthday celebration. Stayed the last week in June. Stayed on the 16th floor, payed a little extra for the "strip view", which was worth it. Cleanliness: Unfortunately, not fully cleaned when we got there (dirty kitchen floor, some pins and cardboard on the floor), but the hotel was quick to rectify and clean the place. When something broke, such as the safe, they were quick to fix. No problem. We asked for a high chair for the week. We got it. Spa: Relaxing, until you see the cost. They add 20% tip on the bill. Yikes! There are cheaper massages/facials, etc, but none as convenient. Gym on the 4th floor - Outstanding. You have the place to yourself in the morning. Let's face it, not too many people work out in Vegas in the morning. Restaurant: Ate there once. Solid chow, nothing fancy. Room service: Rocks! Just go for it, you already blew a few hundred dollars at the spa above, right? Walk to the strip: not bad. only 15 minutes with stroller. Nobody bothered us day or night. I would stay here with my family again. Hey, management, how about a military discount?!? ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: chavezfamilyctee
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the best service and hospitality we have ever had at a hotel. The workers were extremely nice. One night, we asked for extra blankets. A few minutes after they arrived, the front desk called to make sure they got to us. The same thing happened the next morning, when we asked for frying pans. On our way out, three workers ran to the doors to open them for us. The room service speed was also incredible. We ordered breakfast and within 10 minutes it was delivered to our room. The rooms were extremely comfortable. They were much bigger than usual hotel rooms such as at the Luxor, or MGM Grand. The room also included a stove, washer and dryer machines, and refrigerator. We were also impressed with the no-smoking policy. It was nice to be able to escape from the business and smell of the strip, and come back to a cool, clean, hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Without doubt the best hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BigSteve31
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the best hotel experience I have had in Las Vegas, having stayed in Las Vegas 6 times previous with all the big names like MGM, Ballagio, Venetion, Monte Carlo and others I have to say this is the best. I am a demanding sort of character who expects a high level of service from start of my stay to the finish and I found it hard to fault The Platinum Hotel & Spa. This place is situated just of the strip, a block away but realistically a 5-6 minutes walk from the strip were all the action is. There is no smoking in the rooms or inany of the bar/restaurant areas and there is no casino at the hotel BUT DON'T let this put you off, this means they can concentrate of giving you the personal service you don't get at the larger hotels with thousands of rooms where sometimes you just feel like a number. This place is about you, your enjoyment and your comfort. It is great that you don't have to fight your way past gamblers and gamers, slots and restaurants just to get to your room. That said, if playing the slots or tables is your thing, then there are several major hotels/casino's just a few steps away (5 minutes walk maximum) where you can gamble through to the early hours. I found the front desk staff, pleasant, polite and nothing was too much trouble. The bar staff, were excellent, funny & helpful, witty and again nothing was too much trouble and the same goes for the guys whatever time of day you arrived or wanted to leave the valet parkingteam were were there waiting and enthusiastic. Valet parking is FREE would you believe.. But, more importantly, the room was immaculately clean, very spacious with a fully equipped kitchen/dining area complete with washer dryer, a separate sitting area with HD TV and a fantastic bathroom with walk-in shower, a jacuzzi bath and twin sinks. The bedroom was very spacious, lots of wardrobe space, HDTV and a very large bed. The room service team were great, the room was kept clean and fresh with fresh towels and clean sheets as required. Don't take my word for it, try it for yourself and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Room & Location”
Reviews.Author: Scooter106
Reviews.Content: The Room is FANTASTIC!!! Everyone time we travel to Vegas this is the only place to stay for us. We love that is is off of the strip, but still close and walking distance to everything!! Great staff and wonderful spa!! Have a facial while you are there!!!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with the Platinum.”
Reviews.Author: birdy83
Reviews.Content: The Platinum was a terrific place to stay in Las Vegas. Being one block off the strip, you're able to have a little solitude from the casino action. Everything is within walking distance. The service was outstanding. Whenever we needed something, we called and it was brought to the room within minutes. Every person was accomodating and friendly. The rooms are wonderful. A couple of days we just sat out by the pool (also wonderful) and hung around the room. I can't say enough about this place. Having no casino and also no smoking were two of the pluses in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel...Fantastic Room...Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer134
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my new absolute favourite in Las Vegas. From the massive fridge/freezer and granite worktops you encounter on entering the room to the almost immediate check in with smart, professional and friendly staff made this a great experience. We did visit the "Bellagio" during our trip and witnessed long "Disney" style lines of people all wearily waiting to check in and it made us all the more sure we had made a good choice of hotel this time around. The hotel is only a few minutes walk to the strip and it became a haven away from days spent around slot machines, casinos, crowds of people and 110 degrees baking heat. The bar area offered a great place to relax with a cold beer, and a great snack menu featuring tasty bites at good prices. Drinks are especially good value if you arrive during happy hour which as a Scotsman I am glad to announce lasts for 3 hours (4pm-7pm). The rooms are massive and ours included big comfortable beds, a luxurious jet spa bath, seperate shower with a rain head, Washer/ Dryer, HD flat screen TV with a great selection of channels and views toward the strip, although it was really a "view" of the back of the hotels situated on the strip but it was still good. The only complaint I have is the lack of free internet in the rooms and although it is free in the reception and bar area I'm sure paying guests would appreciate complimentary access at such a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDvm
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful Fourth of July mini vacation at the Platinum. Dennis must be commended for such a great staff. Nathan Rex made sure our accommodations were everything we had expected. We can’t say enough about the staff; they go above and beyond to make sure you have a perfect stay. Britinee checked us in with efficiency and a smile. The valets are the best; parked our car and had our luggage up in no time. The dining & bar staff made sure that our experiences were always perfect. We have stayed here 6 times in the past two years and have never had a bad experience. We almost hate telling others about it because we want to keep it our best kept secret, but were not that selfish. We have stayed in many major strip hotels, but have not experienced the value and comfort that we have at the Platinum. . Pool DJ, holiday barbeque, and lobby treats are a nice addition since our last visit. Give it a try, you will not be disappointed. D & J from SoCal

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive service”
Reviews.Author: bcmegan
Reviews.Content: I know competition in accommodation is probably higher in Las Vegas than most other cities in the world, but we were very impressed with our choice. The price was very competitive and we were blown away when we stepped into our huge apartment. We entered into a very nicely decorated sitting room and kitchen - there was plenty of equipment if we had wanted to cook our meals. Our room had a large balcony and we had a great view of the strip - specially the lights at night. Our bedroom was huge with a lovely bed and lots of storage. The bathroom had two basins and even a magnifying mirror! Whilst we were there our vehicle was involved in a minor accident in the valet parking garage. Management dealt with it so well, that it turned a negative into a positive for us. There was so much help in getting the matter dealt with, and even a nice credit to enjoy a meal and drinks on the hotel! The barman was particularly friendly and drinks were reasonably priced - the bar was also a much quieter place to drink than the strip (no poker machines here). Fresh fruit and cookies were available at reception every day. The location is good, with about a 10-15 minute walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Allisonbelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid June and enjoyed our stay for the most part. We booked a princess suite with strip view and the first room we were given had a balcony that adjoined the air conditioning plant with a small wall between. This was not a huge problem except the door wouldn't lock to our room so we called down and asked for another room which was organized very efficiently and without question. Traveling with an 11 year old girl so security was paramount for us. We had no car so walked most places and found staff directions to be sketchy at best and spent a lot of time (and skin) going the wrong way. Blisters aside we loved the location and wouldn't ever stay on the strip. Loved the strip though and wish we had stayed in Vegas longer. Will come back to the platinum next time and stay for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Such a huge room, great price”
Reviews.Author: Chardle
Reviews.Content: Thanks to trip advisor we selected this hotel. Yes, the hotel is 1 block away from the strip but it is a short walk to the Bally's hotel which has a monorail station (and air conditioning, phew the walk is hot!) plus E Flaminog Rd takes you to the heart of the action on the Strip. We paid for a Strip view room, so worth it, but the room was still great value and HUGE. We had a large fully equiped kitchen a living space with sofa, TV and Bose music dock. Large King bedroom and a double bathroom with walk in shower spa bath and double sinks. The room, pool, and hotel areas were very clean and the staff very friendly. Valet parking was very efficient. My only comment, and it isn't a gripe, is that the pool area is very uninspiring and bland, with not much shade. Compared to Caesars Palace and the Belagio this pool is pretty dull. If you have a family or are staying for a longer time this may be a consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning place - can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: BillDTravel
Reviews.Content: We'd read the reviews and booked the Platinum and we were not disappointed. Everything about the place just works. Luxury at a very reasonable rate. Restaurants and facilities were faultless as were the staff - we even got free internet on our visit. An easy walk to the strip. Couldn't recommend it higher.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmurphy1321
Reviews.Content: Great customer service really makes or breaks a hotel, and this one was outstanding! Plush hotel, everything you could want, great room, clean, spacious, pool, fitness center, free internet, wonderful staff. The staff went above and beyond for simple requests. Enjoyed every minute of it. Walkable distance to Strip, 2 blocks from cesars/bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, close to the strip, nice people!”
Reviews.Author: spryspry
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Platinum at the end of June. The facilities were very nice. The employees were exceptionally nice and helpful. It was also great to stay at a place with no casino to get away from that for a little bit, but it's right between two large casinos so gambling is just a five minute walk away. We will definitely stay at the Platinum again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Megabunchan
Reviews.Content: All of us (including 15 & 13 years old) loved it. We stayed one night and off to Grand Canyon, and came back and stayed one more night. We wish we could stay longer. The room had a high ceiling, a nice full kitchen, a roomy bathroom with a shower and a jacuzzi. The hotel is located in walking distance to Bellagio, but my daughter and I quickly came back since it was scorching hot in (we got sunburn by just walking for 10 minutes). We should have driven there instead of walking. Very nice hotel and we would definitely to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mels031
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum last march and we just can't wait to go back! The room was perfect, very spacious, spotless. We loved everything about this amazing hotel. It's just a ten minute walk to the strip, location is great. I can't think of anything negative to say! We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous suites”
Reviews.Author: derbysh
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 weeks in a princess suite with strip view ( on 16 floor ) it was like home from home loved the washer dryer staff could not do enough for you the valet was wonderful rang down as we were leaving the room and the car was there not like the hotels on strip were its was a walk to the car parks also the same with pool on level 5 only took a minute to get there there was always emply beds in the afternoon the walk to the strip was no problem 10 mins to the back of ballys felt safe walking to it on busy road try ellis island for food excellent value also out back steak house ( steak and ribs ) a bit pricey but worth it dont miss big elvis in barbary coast check him out the only neg is you have to pay $10 a day for the internet

Reviews.Title: “3 Stays = 3 Disappointments”
Reviews.Author: somhawk
Reviews.Content: Don't believe all the hype. 2007: arrive to find out my reservation was changed from 7 nights to 1. Had I not had a printout with me, I was SOL as hotel said they were sold out. Sent to the Palms for 1 night with bags of groceries. Returned next day, given very last room at end of building furthest away from elevators. Not convenient. 2009: balcony door stuck and can't be opened without an Herculean effort. No attempt to move to a different room. Rental car dinged up every day by valet to the point I had to file a report with hotel security in case Herzt accused me. 2010: arrive and sent to room not ready or inspected. All chair and sofa pillows stacked on floor. All kitchen cabinet doors open. Easily fixed. In-room safe locked and refused to accept my chosen code. Security changed the batteries, changed the locking mechanism to no avail. Two times I returned after long day to find my 8th floor balcony door wide open after dark. Someone had helped themselves to refreshments from my refrigerator and left the empty bottles on the patio table. Despite polite complaints to management, not much done about it. Wrote letter to hotel ownership group in Midwest, no response.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: FromHawaii2SanJose
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews, we decided to book a room here. We got the strip view on the 8th floor facing the back of the Paris hotel and Bally's. Between the two, you can see part of the water show at the Bellagio. There is no casino at the hotel and there is only valet parking. The benefit of having just a hotel is that it is not crowded but it is close enough to walk to the strip. In Vegas, of course, you don't have to if you have your own car because valet parking in Vegas is free. The suite is the best part of the hotel. It has a refrigerator with ice maker, stove and oven, coffee maker, dishwasher and sink replete with cups, plates, knives etc. The bathroom is large with shower and whirlpool tub. Double sinks were nice too. The bedroom in in a separate room which means the suite is quite large by Vegas standards. The kitchen is okay but the pool is both indoor and outdoor. Nice outdoor beds for tanning are nice. We didn't try any of the other bars. Fireworks were from the top of the Ceaser hotel and visible from the room. The hotel is only about 7 years old so everything still is nice and newish. The air conditioning works well and the the furniture comfortable. Overall a very nice stay with pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Great hotel and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: trib0y
Reviews.Content: I read TA a lot but was compelled to join and write a review after our stay here. We stayed 8 nights at Platinum and were very pleased we did. Arrival: We arrived about 6pm on a Wed night and Varun had a very warm welcome for us and we were booked in with a minimum of fuss. I thought the whole feel of the hotel was a positive experience upon arrival. Room: We were allocated a room on the 6th floor, I was hoping for higher but didn't say anything upon checking in. The room was fine but 10 mins after entering Varun from the front desk called to see if everything wasok and I asked if there was a higher room and within minutes we were allocated a room on the 11th floor, which had a better view. I was not expecting this and is something that I consider to be excellent service. The room itself was very clean, and impressive in its size and I was also impressed with the range of toiletries. The double door ice making fridge was the best thing for us (coming from the UK where most kitchens are smaller than the fridge freezer in your rooms LOL). Staff: This is by far the best asset the Platinum has. Every single staff member was extremely helpful. Coming from the UK and Australia, we are not accustomed to tipping as it's not part of our culture. I did tip however whenever our bags were brought up/moved etc but I never got the impression that a tip was expected at all. Juan, Julian, Verun, Nathan, Rebecca and a host of others, genuinely made us feel like they were only there for us. This is a major credit to thehotel. I don't know what method of staff training and motivation program they have, but they need to keep on doing whatever it is they are doing because it's working. My job involves me evaluating suppliers every day, I've done it for 15yrs and whilst I've never done it in the hospitality industry, I do know how to tell a service provider that cares from one that doesn't. Bravo to them all on this. The hotel is just the right 'vibe' for us, fairly low key but something to do always. We made use of the pool area and never felt pressured into ordering from the pool/bar menu at any time. We did not eat in the resaurant but we did have a bar snack on our first night, which was half price due to the 4-8pm happy hour. The only downside to our stay was that on Saturday night there was a party above us and we could not sleep. There seemed to be a lot of people in the room. I did call security as I had someone knocking on my door looking for the party (above us). The issue was dealt with by hotel security in a professional manner. All the staff were very helpful about this and wanted to know how things were for us the next day etc. We had to be up early Sunday morning for a trip to Grand Canyon so I did not get to speak to anyone properly about it until Sunday afternoon. I spoke to Nathan who arranged for us to move to the 16th floor on our return from our GC trip on Sunday afternoon. It was a very quiet room and had a different view from our other room which was nice as well (still a Strip view). I don't think there would have been any issue with staying in our old room after saturday night but it was great to have a different view for our remaining 4 nights anyway. Summary: A fantastic place to stay. The walk to the strip is not far, even in the heat and the staff and overall experience cannot be beaten for the money. I've stayed in much more expensive hotels and have sometimes gotten a lot less in terms of service from them compared to what I received at Platinum. I'd recommend anyone to stay at this hotel if you're looking for a bit of a 'geatway' from the hustle and bustle of the Strip. Our incident with the party on Saturday night was far far outweighed by the overwhelming positive experience of our other 7 nights. Tip: If you ask for Pricess suite with a Strip view get a room on the upper levels to avoid the Seven Eleven sign being in view.

Reviews.Title: “Always the best, we will stay here for every Vegas trip!!”
Reviews.Author: miguelalatorre
Reviews.Content: Platinum provides easy access to any hotel that's on the strip because it is located on Koval which runs along the strip and there's never any traffic. Every employee makes you feel very welcome and comfortable from the moment you arrive. There's also easy access to everything inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, although a bit out of the way..”
Reviews.Author: mcmoore828
Reviews.Content: There are endless pros associated with the Platinum hotel including gorgeous and enormous rooms, the gracious service, the delicious restaurant and the pool/hot tub. The only con is that the hotel is quite far from the Strip and since Vegas doesn't have much in the way of public transportation, it can be a little taxing walking all the way to everything and back as often as my husband and I had to (especially in heels, which I wore the whole time of course!). Don't bother to pay extra for a "Strip view" as the hotel is really too far way from the Strip to be able to properly view it. We paid for such a room and really only had a view of the pool. Also, the hotel is minuscule compared to most of the others in Vegas, with only 14 floors. However it is a great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil place to stay in the craziness of Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Kirstyberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the reviews on this site were so positive, ans were really happy we did. Suite was great value and luxurious for the price, staff were friendly and courtious, restaurant breakfast very good, pool area very relaxing, hotel 10 mins walk off the strip and super clean, quiet and non smoking. Only minor niggle was that the hotel bar closed early, 11.30pm on a Thursday night... apart from that we were 100% happy with everything and would recommend to anyone seeking a peaceful antidote to the brasher hotels on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Platinum did it again...GREAT stay!”
Reviews.Author: katinSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Platinum before for a family reunion trip, and was pleased with the good service and great rooms. Thought we'd try it again this time, and although there were many options (including on-strip hotels), I worked with Nathan in making room reservations and he made the booking process so convenient and smooth that we went ahead with staying at the Platinum again. There is something to be said about professional and excellent customer service- Nathan clearly cares about representing the hotel well. Nothing was overlooked in our room reservation process- everything went as smoothly as we had hoped when we checked-in (my pet peeve is when the hotel staff has communication problems and we don't get the room type we expect- thankfully, this was not a problem here!). Anyways, upon staying at the hotel again, we were not disappointed! Despite being pretty busy, the hotel front staff members were excellent and efficient (it's amazing how so many hotels don't get this correct- given how front desk service can really affect guests' hotel experience). The rooms were very LARGE and clean (everything still seemed new and in great condition, despite it being another year of wear-and-tear with Las Vegas guests). We were traveling with our son, and it is SOOO much better to have the separate bedroom/living room areas so that we could have our privacy. And with the fully functional kitchen- we were able to easily make breakfast in the morning. Also, the view of the strip from our room was fantastic! Lots of usual Las Vegas strip lights, and my son especially loved seeing the monorails go by. The hotel is obviously run by good management who ensure that the rooms are well-maintained, and the front desk is running smoothly. We had no difficulty with valet parking at all- again, despite it being busy. During check-out, we were able to call down to the valet and put in a request for the bellman and valet. I think this helped with the valet experience being fine for us (I remember staying at one of the on-strip 5-star hotels previously and they didn't allow us to call down beforehand to valet- irritating!). Also, when we first arrived, my sisters had to rush to check in so that they could make it to the Jersey Boys show-- the valet guys were great in making sure that the car was in the front and ready to go when my sisters were- no delay and they made it to show on time. We ate in the downstairs restaurant, and honestly- it was just OK. Next time, we'd probably stay in the room and order room service (which worked well last time- not too expensive and decent food). In summary, Platinum impressed us again- great rooms, excellent service, no resort fee, location near the strip...we'll be back! We just hope that the rates will remain competitive!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Laurenajustus
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about having my 1year old in Vegas because of all the smoke, noise, & limited space (for "play") that comes with a casino stay. The Platinum was perfect! The rooms are spacious, smoke free, & located a block from the strip. My son loved having space to run around, & I was glad to have a kitchen for preparing his meals. The hotel service in general was exceptional. The front desk provided me with a crib as soon as we arrived. Everyone wanted to make our stay "with baby" a comfortable one! The only con is that valet parking is mandatory, though the valet drivers are very polite, friendly, & helpful. It's close enough to walk to the strip with a stroller. I will definitely stay at the Platinum again when I return to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Very friendly service!!”
Reviews.Author: Kellyhokie
Reviews.Content: From the excellent service to the huge room this hotel was a total hit!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and want to share our experience with everyone.”
Reviews.Author: wendyk110
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 day trip to Las Vegas. We stayed at the Platinum Hotel,and loved it! The room was great witha full kitchen, great bathroom, including a jacuzzi tub and all the ammenities, and a seperate bedroom. Everything about it was great. The employees were very polite, courteous, and knowledgable. They had free cookies in the lobby every day and a free happy hour on Wednesday nights .It is not on the strip, but certainly within walking distance. The only thing I might suggest is a pool with more shady trees, but other than that, we would recommend highly it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing place a short walk from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: TravelBooker7
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, modern hotel, 2 block walk to the Las Vegas Strip. Very relaxed atmosphere, good place to come back to after a long night of gambling, clubbing, etc. Pool area was small but very nice and had a great view. Staff was nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but it's a long walk in the heat to the strip! Not central for walking.”
Reviews.Author: canyonmum
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing value - a suite with full kitchen and balcony. Excellent value for families or couples. The rooms are clean and very quiet. Room service rates are reasonable. The door staff is wonderful and they have free valet parking which keeps moving fast (would prefer self park but oh well). The pool area was okay, nothing to write home about. The shades which people sit under in the pool area were ripped which made it look a bit old. Our only complaint is (and this is not the hotels fault) that it's a long walk in the heat to the strip and there is nowhere close by where you can grab a bite to eat (except 7-11). We had a car and had to drive everywhere and it took forever to go even three blocks due to the traffic. I liked this hotel but I think in future we would stay on the strip so we could walk to more restaurants, bars, shops etc. I prefer to be in the heart of things.

Reviews.Title: “Definately will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: suzyk63
Reviews.Content: Spur of the moment trip to Las Vegas with a girlfriend. Was disappointed that the Platinum Hotel was not on the strip, but it turned out not being a problem as it was only one block away and we could cut through Bally's if it was too hot out. From the get go the service was impeccable, from the bellman to the front desk, to the bartenders. :-) The flavored water in the lobby was a very nice touch as it was over 100 degrees when we arrived. The room was amazing (with a free upgrade to a strip view). The suite was beautiful and the full kitchen came in very handy to store wine and make breakfast. The beds were extremely comfortable but bring ear plugs as the city is noisy. Wed night in the lobby bar was free wine and great appetizers. The only downside was the service at the restaurant by the pool....it was extremely slow and they didn't make the best bloody marys there (It took 3 people to try to make it). The bartenders downstairs in the lobby bar (Charly and Annie) were much, much better. I definately will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This spot is the BOMB”
Reviews.Author: figboo69
Reviews.Content: Great price, Great room, TV selections could've been better, but gorgeous, quiet, plush and very spacey!.... Loved it! Will be back for sure! The jerk wings were fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel we will be back”
Reviews.Author: sasha079
Reviews.Content: We drove from Bakersfield via Pimm (on the border from California, this has a terrific outlet mall which actually was better and less crowded than the outlet malls in Las Vegas) and found this great hotel. We had a 2 queen bed suite which was the same price as we would have paid for a rollaway and a normal queen bed room. Nice to have a separate bedroom from the rest of the room. On the 15th floor we overlooked the back of the Strip and could see Bally's and the Bellagio. You have a balcony with chairs and a table. Yes there is a power grid on the other side of the road, but it is the same multilane road which the other big hotels also face onto. We could not see this from our balcony. What was great about the Platinum was the helpful and friendly valet guys and the front desk people. The room had a kitchen and a full sized fridge (yeah), we rang downstairs and they brought up a set of cooking pots etc, then we headed down to the 7eleven next door bought eggs, bread and bacon and had home cooked breakfast each morning. This is a non smoking hotel (second yeah) and no gambling (third yeah..yes you can go to Vegas and not gamble in your own hotel). We were a block from the action which is fantastic as you dont have all the tourists and lights and noise on your doorstep. Headed out to the outlet malls during the day and then walked over to see the lights and M&M world in the evening. (visit M&M world, there is nothing you cannot buy). The wifi at the Platinum is good, actually a cable so I was able to answer lots of emails from work in the comfort of our room. The suite had a massive spa bath which was rather cool. We were very happy with this hotel and would highly recommend it. Downstairs in the lobby they have home cooked cookies later in the day and also have a cheap tapas and drinks menu (unfortunately the 11 year old had to miss out on that bit).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel off strip”
Reviews.Author: dah22002
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great. Rooms are new and modern in decor. It was great having a real balcony and the view of the mountains was great for us since we are from FL. Large suite made us feel very comfortable. I used the washer and dryer...they provide soap. Staff was outstanding...truly good service and I usually stay in JW Marriott resorts and the like. Bathrobes proveded upon request, complimentary wifi which I used in the room to check on flights. Champagne and choclate covered strawberries delivered to room because we were getting married....made us feel special. Only downside was our room did not get serviced the day of our wedding so when we arrived "home" that evening, we walked into the suite still with dirty towels on the floor and the bed not made up. We called for clean towels and even though it was about 11pm, they were delivered promptly. We used the huge double jetted tub every night and it was soothing after walking so much in the heat every day. There were no cabs avaialble when were checked out so they drove us to the airport in the hotel SUV...of course we still gave the driver $20, but it was much more pleasant than the usual cab! Room service was prompt and delicious and not outrageously priced. We knew it was off the strip and we don't mind walking but I might not stay there again because of it. The hotel was new and beautiful. Pool area was nice and the loungers comfortable and had flags to hold up if you wanted drink/food. The windows on the pool deck with awnings for shade made it feel like an upscale resort. It was a wonderful stay and the staff fantastic....especially for the price we got on sniqueaway.com.

Reviews.Title: “Nice layout but filthy dirty rugs and sofas”
Reviews.Author: hyknski
Reviews.Content: Hi This hotel has a great rooms but they are filthy dirty. The rugs and couch in our room were black from dirt. I don't think they have been cleaned since the hotel opened. The doors, door jams and walls were also dirty. I did not walk barefoot in the room. I would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “You can only valet park your car!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stacie444
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint is that you have to valet park the car. I have a small child and often leave some of his things in the car, which makes valet parking a really big problem. The room was lovely and huge, although our view on the 6th floor balcony was of a wall (room 615) Really enjoyed the pool which was part indoors part outdoors

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, slightly off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: BlackMangoPhoto
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Platinum at the beginning of June 2011. The hotel is not much to look at from the outside, in comparison to it's bigger brothers and sisters on the Strip, however, inside it is immaculate. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, we were on our honeymoon, although I didn't want to use this to gain freebies, it came up in conversation with one of the gentlemen on the reception desk. After a day out viewing the sites of LV we returned to our room to find a chilled bottle of champagne, some chocolate strawberries and a congratulations card. All very nice touches and much appreciated. The room was huge and extremely tidy. An enormous king size bed featured in the bedroom and we still had space for chairs and a view from the patio doors. Staying on the 17th floor gave us a great view of parts of the strip, but please keep in mind that this hotel is a block away and if you were on other side of the hotel, facing away from the strip, I guess the view would be less impressive. The room also had a full size kitchen and living area. The kitchen had all the domestic appliances you could wish for and you could self-cater if you so desired. The bathroom had a spa/hot tub, shower and two sinks, all clean and in excellent condition. The one and only caveat I would place on this hotel is its location. The walk from the crossroads on the Strip (which house other hotels like the Bellagio) to the hotel passes several liquor stores, an employment office for the larger hotels and a few dark car parks. As such, the many homeless people that are situated in Las Vegas, along with some people who clearly start drinking from an early time, make you a bit wary when walking back to the hotel. I will add, we had no trouble at all. Aside from the above I can heartily recommend this hotel if you do not want to stay directly on the Strip or you want to save a little money.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel. great service”
Reviews.Author: melodyt1
Reviews.Content: We loved the large room and all the little details they provided. The bath and products were absolutely wonderful and everyone we dealt with was friendly and as helpful as possible. We will definitely stay here next time we are in Las Vegas and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: onedivaHouston
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a good stay. We traveled to Vegas to see the sights and visit family. We were traveling with our 10 yr old so did not want to stay right on the strip amidst smoke & casinos every day. I read reviews so knew what to expect in regards to the hotel surroundings. The room was spacious but I don't know if it was worth it to pay for the strip view. We were on the 10th floor overlooking a part of the roof, the 7 eleven sign & part of the pool. Not a big deal to us but you might want to be specific about the location of your room especially if you pay extra for it. We did not get the room with the washer dryer but I wished we had as they do not have a washing facility on site for guest. We had not planned on cooking but the kitchen was nicely equipped so we did fix our own breakfast on a couple mornings. Room service was satisfactory. We ate at the restaurant for lunch a couple times and it was good. There is not a big selection on the menu but we did enjoy what we ordered. The walk to the strip was as everyone said, about 2 blocks and if you don't mind inhaling the smoke, you can cut through Ballys by the 2nd block. It really was a pleasant walk as the weather was decent when we visited. There is a big empty lot you have to pass and I would not have felt safe walking by myself at night but the area is very busy so we felt fine as a group. Cabs in vegas are very reasonable. We did not have a problem getting one to take us to a show one evening or to the other hotels for sight seeing. The valet was able to get us one right off of Flamingo. If you need a cab from the strip just go into one of the hotels and there are plenty of them. We were told it was illegal for the cabs to just stop on the street. This hotel is a great option if you are traveling as a family. I do have to note that while we were there my husband got sick in the middle of the night. I called down to the front desk for some items and thought it was 3 in the morning they brought them right up. I was very relieved about that! We also used the spa and was very happy with the massage & pedicure. The hotel definitely is an oasis away from the crowds & craziness of the strip. I just wished there was a closer grocery store to pick things up. The 7 eleven has some things to get you by but if you want to take advantage of the kitchen there is not a lot of choice. I would stay here again. it was very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Positives, a Few Minuses, Overall Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: iliketropical
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a weekend in June of mixed business and pleasure and I'm a bit torn over how to rate the Platinum. The hotel is clean; the staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and genuinely seem to care about the quality of your stay; the rooms are massive, with nice furnishings; the view of the strip is very good; it's a quick walk from the lobby to the rooms and pool (which is sunny until evening); it only takes a moment to get your car from the valet; and it’s only minutes to drive to any property of interest. There was also plenty of room to setup and get 4 or 5 hours of work done each morning. Unfortunately, the pool is modest in size and feels very tight if there are more than 15 guests using the facilities. The location is also near the strip, but not a particularly pleasant walk and it’s hard to catch a cab. Likewise, there are no entertainment options inside the hotel other than a small cafe that closes at 2:00 p.m. and a lounge bar. The rooms also look directly over the roof of a 7-11 and dry cleaner. Overall, I would recommend this property only to someone that has been to Vegas a number of times. Otherwise, you may feel that you're 'missing out' by not staying directly on the strip or by the absence of a casino. In the past year we have stayed at the Wynn and Vdara. The Platinum is not to be confused with those properties, nor is it priced the same. With these expectations in mind, we did have a great time and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the property to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: Rayzor72
Reviews.Content: We've been to Las Vegas 6 times now. We've stayed at the Wynn on the Strip and Loews out at Lake Las Vegas and would rather stay here anytime. Even though you're not on the strip, you're only 2 blocks away. The staff is really nice and the service is excellent; without being pretentious. The rooms were large, clean and quiet and felt more like home than being crammed into a motel 6 and tripping over your suitcases. If you want to gamble, smoke, and party 'til you puke in the same hotel and never leave it, stay somewhere else and leave this hotel for the rest of us who go to Vegas for all the other reasons. This will be the only place we plan to stay from now on.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: sm823
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum for a couple of nights mid-week on a recent trip to Vegas. We knew going in that this hotel was off the strip and we'd have to walk a bit or take a cab to get places - not a huge problem. We got a deal on the room for $75 a night through sniqueaway.com, so we were willing to deal with that. What I wasn't aware of was that the hotel looked over a gas station on one side, and a power plant across the street. So, don't expect much from the surroundings. Our room was nice and large, clean and well furnished. We were on a fairly high floor so we had a decent view and it was quiet. Nice to have a full kitchen though we didn't use it much. The bathroom is huge, with a large tub that was fabulous for a soak. The only issues we had with the room were 1) There was no body wash/bubble bath soap, so I used shampoo for the bath instead; 2) The phone in the living room didn't work. Not major problems. We also liked that the hotel is smoke-free and doesn't have a casino, and that they put an emphasis on being environmentally-friendly. It's a much more serene experience than the other hotels/casinos. The reason this hotel isn't a winner in my eyes is the service. There were a few hiccups that made the experience less enjoyable. The biggest issue we had was with room service, starting with the snotty/bored-sounding woman who answered the phone and took our order both mornings, and ending with the second morning when we waited almost an hour for brewed coffee (our initial request for house coffee, as it is called on the menu, got us a packet of coffee grounds instead of the brewed stuff we wanted.) Considering we were staying there on a Monday and Tuesday, I didn't think the hotel could be that busy and didn't understand why it took so long to get our orders. The food itself was ok, nothing to write home about. For a hotel that calls itself "green," I was hoping for things like organic eggs and jam without high fructose corn syrup in it. Then there was an instance in which we asked for a cab to be called for us, as we were going out for dinner and a show. We were told we'd have to come downstairs and then ask the valet for the cab. So here we are, all dressed up, standing in the heat waiting for the valet to show up at the front of the hotel and call a cab. We were told the cabs wouldn't wait... except we were coming right down and were there in minutes. I don't get that. When we checked out, a bellboy took our luggage downstairs and we asked for our car to be brought up front. After checking out at the front desk downstairs, we went outside up front and waited for our car and luggage. The two valets working were running around like chickens with their heads cut off trying to help everyone that was checking out at 11 a.m., and the whole operation seemed disorganized - nothing like the quick service at the bigger hotels. Finally it was our turn, and we are told our car was waiting on the SIDE of the hotel with our luggage this entire time. Great. Finally, they charge $10 a day for in-room wireless internet (while giving it away for free at the pool, restaurant and lounge) which I think is highway robbery and super annoying. I think if they work out all the kinks in service, this would be a decent place if you don't mind the distance from the strip. But on our next trip to Vegas, we'll probably pay a bit more and stay somewhere more central and hopefully without the service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Huge double bath, very nice”
Reviews.Author: sim_zlatko
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Rooms are big with separate living area and bedroom. It would be a good place to stay for several days as the kitchen is well equipped. Breakfast was the only meal we ate at the hotel - dishes were good and service friendly. Do note this hotel is a couple of blocks from "the strip' and I'm not sure I'd want to walk it late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & spacious”
Reviews.Author: xzaviorz
Reviews.Content: Everything from the kitchen to the balcony was clean and organized. Wasn't expecting cups, bowls, silverware, utensils and was pleasantly surprised to find a clean well equipt kitchen. A very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, well-located, and you don't have to walk through casinos”
Reviews.Author: KommissarKen
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious. We stayed in a princess suite which was one of the largest layouts we've ever stayed in anywhere. The staff is courteous. The Platinum is located a short walk from The Strip on Flamingo Road. It is not a casino, so if you're planning to gamble, this might not be your first choice. But if you don't gamble (I don't) it is a great place to stay and have easy access to the attractions on The Strip. If only they had self-parking -- then it would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Strip”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGo85028
Reviews.Content: The Platinum Hotel is convenient and offers a clean, modern environment that is within reasonable walking distance to some fun casinos on the strip. I would certainly be happy to stay here again. The only downside was a lack of self parking, so everytime you wanted to access or take the car you had to go through valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Da BEST hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: sirgeneral
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I ever stayed in las vegas! The rooms are huge and also the jaccuzi! Easy to find and no crowds! The place has clean air so you will be in good health! You won't lose any $$$ @ this hotel, I guarantee it!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleoSydney_aus
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the very spacious Platinum.You get all the conforts of home and the staff was very polite and good at their jobs. The maid service was just ok, on the only occasion we used the coffee it was not replaced. The only other inconvenience we had which wasn't the hotels fault was the distance we had to walk to get to the strip. We did see the reviews ,yes it is a 10/15 min walk but you have to factor in the tremendous heat which makes walking unpleasant . All in all we had a pleasant stay but decided next time we will stay somewhere closer to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home and then some!”
Reviews.Author: missymauve
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out every employee of this establishment was very helpful, knowledgeable, and professional. It's both non smoking and non gaming. A great place to get away from it all, yet it's conveniently located to the strip, restaurants and shopping. Loved having coffee on our sunny balcony in the morning. One further note: there is no self-parking here - only valet.

Reviews.Title: “Just exactly what TripAdvisor said about it. PERFECT in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Tphobe
Reviews.Content: After a lot of deliberating we finally decided to book the Platinum for our stay in Vegas. We weren't sure that we wanted to be off the strip, but with a Number 3 rating out of 289 on TripAdvisor, and after reading the reviews we decided to go with it. Well, it was unbelievable and if and when we return to Vegas we will definitely stay here again. Thanks again to TripAdvisor, they have never steered us wrong. We were with my 90 year old dad, and 85 year old mom and my dad stated to me: " I have done a lot of traveling in my life and have stayed in many, many places but none like this." He was thrilled. We stayed in a suite and the room was to die for; a fully equipped kitchen (glasses, dishes, silverware, etc.), a full sized refrigerator and freezer, stove, diswasher and microwave. The counter for eating at was just beautiful and with four stools.
