There was a full living room area, extremely comfortable with a flat screen HD tv, a lovely separate large bedroom, a bathroom with a double sink, a shower stall and a jacuzzi bathtub. In addition, we were on the 12th floor and we had a balcony outside that had a Vegas strip view, with the mountains in the background. Breakfast is not included, but there is no resort fee so they balance each other out. On the strip you pay for breakfast and have the resort fee. The breakfast menu is very varied and the food was great. The pool area was large as there is a connecting indoor, outdoor pool. It is adjacent to the restaurant so one can easily eat outside on the pool deck. Another interesting thing that I have not seen before is that on the pool deck there was a large chest and inside the chest were all kinds of water toys for children to use while in the pool (tubes, balls, noodles etc.). These provided free to the guests by the hotel. The lounge in the hotel offers half-price drinks and appetizers every night from 4-8. It is a slight walk to the strip. My husband and I could have done it quite easily I assume but we did not walk because we were with my parents. Although they are in very good physical health, we knew we would be doing quite a bit of walking in the casino/hotels and along the strip and did not want to add this extra amount, especially at night . We had a rental car. At the Platinum it is required that you use Valet parking for your car, but that turned out to be very easy. We never had to wait more than a few minutes to get our car, and it was an extremely short and easy drive to the strip. In addition the free (unless you choose to tip) valet parking at the hotels on the strip was very easy to use . Or if you choose to do self-parking at the hotels on the strip you can do that too. All in all, the Platinum is a phenomenal place to stay!!! In addition,it is an eco-friendly hotel, and even the water from the refrigerator is purified water. Finally, the staff is exceptional AND the price is definitely right!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased 3 Geneations and We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Elephantdoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family trip/business trip. I was able to get a great price at Sniqueaway.com. The room was clean, spacious and included a full kitchen. We were able to make breakfast and have a place to store snacks and drinks. We did not have pots and pans at first but with one call to the front desk, they were delivered quickly. The happy hour at The Stir was excellent: great atmosphere, service, food/drinks, value. The pool amenities and llounging area were first class. Our entire stay was quiet and calm. Although, parking is free, they have valet service so tipping at times became repetitive as a family of five comes and goes 5-6 times a day! Overall, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Fault It....Deserves No 1”
Reviews.Author: p00kies
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Platinum for 4 nights last week and had the most amazing stay. As we were looking for a part relaxing/part party holiday this hotel suited us down to the ground. Located just a 10 minute walk from the busy strip (which we walked every time and even at 3am didn't once feel unsafe) this gave us the best of both worlds and we looked forward every evening to coming back to a quiet, relaxing night's sleep. The rooms were amazing, bigger than our flat at home in fact! The bed was very comfortable, bathroom was equipped with his and hers sinks so we never had to fight over space (!) and we ate breakfast every morning on the balcony in the sun. The kitchen area contained everything we needed including a large fridge complete with chillled water/ice front feature. There was also an iron, ironing board and hairdryer provided along with washing machine and washing powder. The pool area was lovely and clean, with many loungers, tables and sofas and towels were provided down there. They have a pool side DJ who played a couple of times we were down there which livened up the atmosphere a little without being too full on. All staff were really friendly and happy to help with any queries we had. The queue to check in was minimal which was such a contrast to those we saw in the major strip hotels. All in all an amazing stay and I just can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “"We'll be back"”
Reviews.Author: JKRPerth
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel because of the reviews we had read here and yes now I am writing on here too. Great hotel, we had a room on the 16th floor with a view to the strip. Strip is only a five to ten minute walk away and we enjoyed that as it gave us our daily excercise. The staff were wonderful and when they found out that we had gotten married in the morning that evening there was a bottle of champagne and the biggest chocolate coated strawberries we have ever eaten, yummy. The happy hour everyday includes not only drinks at half price but the food too and the food was great. Our room was a fantastic size, with an awesome bathroom complete with spa... the kitchen fully equipted meant that we could have meals here if we wanted to with a 7Eleven close by, this kept our costs down which meant we had more to use on our sightseeing, there is also a washer/dryer so again no laundry to pay out for. This is a non smoking hotel, very clean and anything you require is promptly delivered or dealt with. Starbucks just across the road at The Westin so again you don't have to walk too far. We didn't eat at the restaurant here as there were plenty close by. Possibly the only drawback for us was the outdoor pool, we thought there was not enough cover although there is an indoor pool for kids, it was really too hot to sit outside so we didn't use the pool area at all. Monorail is about five mins away and a cheap and easy way to get around the strip. Big tip.. carry water with you and lots of one $1's as you can buy water around the strip for $1. Without a doubt we would reconmmend this hotel to all, thanks Platinum for making our stay here so pleasurable, we most certainly will be back. Happy guest JKRPerth

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 1DrRick
Reviews.Content: Awesome facility with incredible staff and NO SMOKING (which the rest of the city desperately needs!). We cannot say enough good things about this Hotel and highly recommend it, especially if you want a "real" suite and a full kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “"WOW" - WE CELEBRATED OUR 46TH WEDDING ANNIVERSARY AT THE PLATINUM AND IT WAS A VERY MEMORABLE TIME.”
Reviews.Author: samantha2000
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank The Platinum Hotel for extending to us a very warm, friendly, and hospitable atmosphere for our stay June 5 -10, 2011. We have usually stayed at TI on the strip, but after reading all the great reviews on Trip Advisor about this Hotel, a few weeks before we went we decided to change our reservation to THE PLATINUM ..... and we were not disappointed. From the moment we pulled up in a cab and were greeted by the valet persons outside, we could feel that this was going to be a great experience. Brianna....... on the front desk was very friendly and helpful and got us to our room quickly and efficiently ..... even though we had arrived about 3 hours before the stated check-in time. Room was clean and ready for us ........ and I thought it was more than what the pictures show. Spacious, well equipped in the kitchen for making coffee and tea, meals etc., nice fridge with and icemaker and full size range , huge bathroom with separate shower and jacuzzi, twin sinks, balcony ....... and lots more you have to see to believe. And to top it all off, the whole Hotel is NON-SMOKING. The Hotel smells wonderful . It was our Anniversary on the day we arrived and when we returned from supper, on the countertop was a lovely card from the Staff, bottle of bubbly, and strawberries dipped in chocolate. Wow, we felt like someone really cared about us!!!! Now that is class!!!! Now everyone talks about the walk to the Strip, but when you are in Vegas eating and enjoying the sights and the casinos .......... what a lovely way to unwind and get the smell of smoke out of you clothes on a short walk back to the Hotel. I am sorry that I did not remember all the names of everyone we met and who made our stay so pleasant ......... but you know who you are!!!!! You opened doors, were a few steps ahead pushing the button when we went to get the elevator, answered questions on the front desk, came and repaired a problem with the TV, cleaned our room and made sure all the necessities were there, gave us frozen melon balls at the pool, and finally on our last day hailed the cab for us that wisked us off to that busy airport. And all this came with a smile and a greeting!!!! Are we telling people we enjoyed our stay, most certainly ............. and we actually can not wait to return. Thank you Staff at the Platinum ........ you are running a top-notch Hotel and the atmosphere is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The Platinum Rocks It!”
Reviews.Author: Butterbeans
Reviews.Content: We are not into the smoky gambling scene too much so looked for an alternative place to stay for a week. This hotel was absolutely wonderful and at a good price too. I must commend the lounge staff since we spent a few evenings there (Matt, Veronica, and unnamed polite caucasian gentleman who listened to my war stories), They were true professionals. The room was spacious, pool was great and the doormen were also consummate hospitality pros. When we return we will certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “My Big Regret”
Reviews.Author: allowat
Reviews.Content: My big regret is that I only stayed here 2 nights. After many trips to Las Vegas I finally discovered the perfect place for business travellers. Good location, willing and helpful staff, fantastic decor, unbelievablly wonderful suites - I won't stay any where else on future trips whether they be business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Our private event was outstanding and highly recommend the Platinum”
Reviews.Author: PuraVidaLV
Reviews.Content: I held a private party at Kil@wat restaurant that flowed out to the pool. The sales and catering team worked with me to develop a menu that would work for the party. This included the chef's willingness to create a custom menu-item just because I requested it! The food tasted wonderful and the presentation was great. The pool area was perfect for the party because all the confortable lounge chairs and tables were set up along the fire pits. They even provided roasting skewers to toast marshmallows for smores, which everyone loved. Overall, we had a great event and were well-taken care of. I love that it is a non-smoking and very clean hotel. The rooms are all suites, and a great value. This is my second time holding at event at this hotel and I highly recommend it because the team does such a great job.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: beantiful
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were looking for a non-gaming facility..hellllooooooo Platinum! The Platinum Hotel's friendly staff, comfortable suite with spacious bathroom exceeded our expectations!! The location, pool area and ammenities were just what we were looking for. I will be scheduling a return visit soon. Shout out to Vuran and Walter at the front desk and the valet's Jimmy, Julian and Lido for their exceptional service during our stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Solitaire Suite - Whirlpool Deception”
Reviews.Author: Cashmere773
Reviews.Content: We wanted a quiet and romantic few days in Vegas without the gambling and especially the smoking. The Platinum Hotel & Spa was the ideal choice because of all the above plus full kitchen, proximity to the Strip, and a whirlpool. After a lengthy flight and an exhausting shuttle from McCarran, we checked in to the Solitaire Suite with two Queen beds + kitchen + whirlpool. To our shock and dismay, the whirlpool was very small almost apartment-sized! It would only fit a person with a small frame. Outside the room was a sign that stated something as a room for handicapped persons. We weren’t sure if the tiny whirlpool is designed for them. However, the large size of the Solitaire Suite would certainly allow for a two-person whirlpool. We immediately complained and asked for an upgrade. Fortunately, the staff member, Nathan, was kind enough to give us a complimentary upgrade to the Princess Suite. We had to wait for an hour since it was being cleaned. As soon as we came back to the Princess Suite, we were pleasantly surprised with the suite. It was huge! It included a full kitchen, 2 Queen beds, 2 TVs, Internet access, balcony with patio furniture, a washer/dryer, and a large bathroom with a whirlpool to fit two people. Overall, it was quiet except for the odd garbage truck noise overnight. Most importantly, we were very comfortable. We planned to rent a car and drive to suburbs of Vegas. We inquired about buying a map but it wasn’t available at the hotel. Next door was an am/pm gas station that had maps for sale. In a bizarre way, there was a sign to not open the maps or we had to buy them. We took the risk and bought them. What a major mistake!! You seriously need a microscope to see the names of the streets! Don’t waste your $10 on this garbage. If you need good maps, go to the ABC Store in the Miracle Mile Shops. Also, go there for cheap munchies, souvenirs, and alcohol. Valet parking is mandatory. Unlike other Vegas hotels, we didn’t have the option to park our car by ourselves. The walk from the Strip to the hotel was roughly 10 minutes. Finding a taxi in front of the hotel was difficult. Thus, we had to go across the street at the Westin Hotel to get one. Bonuses: complimentary access to two jugs of fresh water infused with strawberries or citrus fruits, free newspapers, cookies, and apples. We didn’t inquire about access to a computer printer to print out our boarding passes. Instead, we went over to the Bellagio where the staff was very helpful in not only directing us to their free use of the printer but to direct us to a great rental car place in their premises. Checking out was trouble-free. We were surprised to hear that we weren’t charged for the Internet service. Normally, it would go for $9.95 per night. Due to the rocky check-in, we probably won’t come back. It would be nice to alert the guest on the hotel website with regards to the whirlpool size instead of being hit with a rude awakening upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Always pleased with The Platinum”
Reviews.Author: dezaria33
Reviews.Content: Second time we stayed there. Great for a group of 5-6 people. All suites, taxi's average 6-16 dollars to most of the strip. Excellent rooms/views regardless of which you pick. Good to walk TO the strip (8 minute walk on average) but we usually took a taxi to return. Offered a house car one night to drive the group of us and asked only for a decent tip. Best pro's about this place are the location and the quality of the hotel. Some con's a few people might worry about are that it's non-gaming and non-smoking and that the bar closes early. Each time we've gone though the entire staff WANTS to make sure you enjoy your stay. They even helped us throw a FREE cake reception in their closed bar one night by providing plates, forks, etc and allowing us to use the bar seating. We love them!

Reviews.Title: “Totally non smoking, huge appartments, fantastic service- PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: kelasarj
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel from 28May until 7June 2011. We booked this hotel because it is a totally non smoking (including the pool area), non gaming hotel set slightly back off the strip. We stayed in a Princess Suite which was huge and including a fully fitted kitchen with microwave, range oven and hob, American style fridge, washing machine and dryer as well as a full compliment of crockery, pots and pans etc. Washing up liquid, paper towel and a dish cloth are provided as well as a dishwasher. The lounge area is seperated from the kitchen by a large breakfast bar area. The lounge includes a sofa/sofa bed, chair 50" plasma TV, living flame fire, workstation/desk, coffee table and opens directly on to a fully furnished balcony. The bedroom includes a king size bed with feather pillows, bedside tables and a walk in wardrobe, a further TV set upon a a set of drawers. A panoramic window overlooks the strip (or the mountains depending which room you are in). A large, double jacuzzi, seperate double shower, his and hers sinks with large vanity area and full size cupbaord for coats, dressing gowns (which come complementary) and which houses the ironing board, iron and hairdryer. The reception area leads to the Stir bar/restaurant which does a happy hour from 5-8pm each day with free canopes and wine each Weds between 5-6pm. Happy hour is great for bottled beers with Becks at $2.25 a bottle (normally $4.50) and a Mojito cocktail costing $5.00 rather than $10. Bar snacks include Angus Sliders (three mini burgers) Salmon mouse on toast, three types of humous with pitta bread and I enjoyed the fish in cheese sauce. All reasonable and great value for money in the happy hour. The pool bar opens from about 12-5pm and served the same drinks as the main bar but has a different menu. I would recommend the Cobb Salad, which was so delicious. The cheese and chicken quesadillos were also very yummy. The standard burger was fine and typical American size portions. Huge!. The pool side loungers are comfortable and come in a range of typical loungers, cabana sized beds with over head canopies for shade and a few large round love seat style chairs which were great for cuddling up with a book and large cocktail. The pool is only about 4ft at all parts of the pool with walkd down steps. The pool has a small canal style entrance joining the indoor pool with the outdoor pool, quite different and lovely to swim from the warm to the cold or vice versa. There is also a fantastic gym with modern and clean equipment. The hotel also has a spa/beauty salon, though we didn't use this. Room service menu is reasonable for a hotel and you are not served "ping food", there is a chef cooking at all times of the day, so you get high quality food. Room service is charged at an additional $3.00 trip charge olus 20% service charge added to. I could have easily tipped again having not read this, but the delightful delivery lady told me that all charges were included. Room service food served on silver ware and over the course of our 9 days we had 3 complementary bottles of champagne brought to our room to help us celebrate. The hotel is actually within walking distance (30mins) if you have light luggage but BE WARNED, we were charge double the regular taxi fare as we didn't know the quickest route. If you are taking a taxi then insist that the driver comes straight out of the airport and goes along Paradise, not the highway on to the strip. Our "rip off taxi" was $30 and our "correctly charged return taxi was only $12.50. We were told that had we got a receipt and the name of the driver and company we could have complained but we learned this too late. A few wise words. We walked from our hotel to the Strip each day (five mins), quite safe so long as you cross at the lights etc. The Strip is quite safe to walk along 24 hours a day from Mandalay Bay to Hilton Towers Grand Vacations. However beyond the Hilton (which is as you head towards the Stratopshere hotel, The Sahara hotel - now closed, and NASCAR) I would strongly advise you catch the bus. I would NOT walk past the Stratosphere and I certainly would not walk past the Hilton after dusk. Unfortunately this area is very run down with many homeless and less desirables. Downtown Vegas, i.e The Freemont Street area, the Golden Nugget area etc I would not recommend you stay in, nor walk about after dusk. I was really disappointed at the state of this area. On the Strip (Mandalay Bay to Hilton) you will be bothered by the street touts selling girls/sex/shows etc. It's a pain in the backside and if you ignore them as my partner and I did you often get shouted after and not the kindest of words. We saw one man square up to one of these touts which wasn't pleasant. Las Vegas, is an experience of grand proportions. Everything is huge. Hotels (with canals/gondolas, theme parks, theatres, casinos, shark reefs, lion reserve and shopping malls the size of your average high street INSIDE the hotels!) It's worth having a look inside the hotels as each one is themed. A 24 hour bus ticket costs $7 and we bought this at 4.30pm one day and it lasted until the same time the following day which is ideal. We took a trip to the Grand Canyon with Let's Go Tours and paid $139 each however we learned that we could have paid $80 each had we negotiated direct with the company. The driver drove safely, was knowledgeable and the tour included a very light breakfast and lunch ( we were still hungry, but its something). All in all we loved the Platinum hotel, Las Vegas was good, but once you've seen one casino, they are all the same and very smokey. The grand Canyon was breathtaking so if you are only going to Vegas once, then it's worth going to the Canyon and do the South Rim tour which has better view points. Happy to answer any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, comfortable hotel with no casino.”
Reviews.Author: brobat
Reviews.Content: Superb rooms, friendly staff, good heated indoor / outdoor pool. Good breakfast & lunch, but eat out in the evening as only room service or light snacks in bar when we were there. Would choose this hotel again if we were in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Giant rooms, nice people - but will not return.”
Reviews.Author: SeaLTK
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked our room here for a weekend away. The hotel in non-smoking and gamble-free - two oddities for Las Vegas. I must say, we loved that aspect. Returning to a nicely lit hotel with clean air was a treat, as I have stayed in many on-strip hotels that are filled with smoke and dinging slots. The people were very friendly during our stay, and the room was HUGE. Adorned with two giant TV's, a full kitchen, king bed and double sinks in the bathroom we were HUGELY impressed with the size of the room for the reasonable price. It is also within reasonable walking distance to the strip. Additionally, the pool gets great sun coverage all day - and is not packed like many Vegas pools. It was much more relaxing. Sadly, we will not return to the Platinum. We opted to use the jacuzzi in our room one night, as the hot tub was already closed. The next morning, my skin started breaking out in small white bumps - similar to pimples. It was much different than anything my skin had done before, and within hours I had developed these bumps on my neck, jaw, shins and arms. It was awful. Before I was able to get in with my dermatologist, I was google-ing all skin conditions associated with hotel stays, which was extremely stressful and very upsetting. Within 24-hour, my friend also developed the same symptoms. My dermatologist diagnosed it as hot tub folliculitis, an infection that comes from bacteria in hot tub or jacuzzi jets. When I called the hotel to let them know what had happened, no one bothered to call me back. My friend also called, and the man he spoke with said his wife had had hot tub folliculitis and her symptoms were not as my friend described so it could not be the same. Overall, we were very disappointed with the lack of response and courtesy given. We were not asking for a refund, rather we wanted to let them know what had happened. Instead, we were ignored.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic option close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: SusieBMck
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for 7 nights and had originally intended to stay on the Strip for the whole week, but having seen the great reviews for the Platinum on Tripadvisor we decided to split the week 4 nights at the Platinum and 3 nights at The Mirage. It was my sister's first visit to Vegas and she wanted to experience one of the themed hotels, but if we went back again we would definitely stay at the Platinum for the whole trip - it was much better value and more welcoming. The location is fantastic. The last time I stayed in Vegas was at Circus Circus and we felt quite far away from everything there. From the Platinum it is a 10 minute walk to Bally's, The Bellagio and Paris Las Vegas on the Strip, and we never had any concerns about walking back late at night/in the early hours. We did a couple of trips outside Vegas and they didn't offer pick-up service from the Platinum, but were happy to pick us up outside nearby Bally's. Our suite (Princess Suite) was massive for 2 people and we each had a very comfortable double bed. The suite had a well-equipped kitchen for preparing food and a balcony with views towards the Strip and the snow-capped mountains beyond. We didn't ever visit the restaurant but took full advantage of the 1/2 price tapas (which were delicious) and drinks during Happy Hour every night at the bar, and we were pleasantly surprised by the choice of free wine available at the Manager's reception on the Wednesday night. Without exception, the staff were friendly and helpful and the standard of service was high. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quiet, happy place”
Reviews.Author: petenjulia
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights for our anniversary and we LOVED staying here! We have been to Vegas many times, and could stay for free with our gambling, but we'd rather pay & stay at the Platinum! As others have said, the suites are just as represented, and the staff is AWESOME. Everyone we encountered was happy & helpful. It was soooo cool not to fight the strip crowds, but be so close to all the action. Actually, all the action we wanted we found next door at Tuscany (a great casino!). The best part is the balcony--we spent most of our time outside enjoying the view. The pool has great service and not so loud music, which we appreciated (all strip pools are so LOUD). Happy Hour at Stir Lounge was fantastic--half off EVERYTHING. The Platinum is a perfect fit for us, and we plan to stay there again as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Anyone could stay here and leave happy!”
Reviews.Author: ShannonMichelle
Reviews.Content: Brought family along on my husbands business trip and stayed in a princess suite! Amazing property, super nice staff (even to my children), great restaurant, very clean pool (awesome cocktail service!) and best of all was the location and NO CIGARETTE SMOKE! Loved all the added touches like free newspaper, fresh cookies (available always & were a hit with my little ones), ice as well as cold filtered water in the rooms and we just loved having a patio to enjoy the night lights! Overall great experience and will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “large ,modern accomodations, just dont leave anything behind”
Reviews.Author: birdsanctuary15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum over memorial day weekend for the first time and our check in went well with an upgrade given to us and very efficient bell service with luggage brought up promptly. The room was large and all was in good working order. The carpeting right where it starts off the tile was very badly stained which did not seem too inviting however. The pool was good and pool service, food, etc was also very good. The staff was friendly and efficent. Our main complaint came after we left and realized we had left our feather bed pillows from home. When I called back I was told they were not turned in and the room had been rented out already. Seems kind of strange that there would be two pillows with different pillowcases and a different size than the other pillows used on the bed left on it when the maids made it up. Makes me think that someone decided to keep the pillows or just didnt want to bother with sending them to us. We will not be staying at the Platinum hotel again because of this. There is alot of competition out there for hotels and I would hope some would try a little harder to return items that are left behind which Happens alot I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in a city of excess”
Reviews.Author: stoneman56
Reviews.Content: This has been our 8th stay at the Platinum. Each time we go there reminds me why we continue to frequent this lovely hotel. The staff are fabulous, from the valets, to the doormen, to the cleaners, right up to Claire the front of house manager. We have done that been there with all the "strip" hotels, but sometimes when all is said and done, you need somewhere to call home, and Platinum does that for us. With free wifi and use of the gym, you can not beat the value of this boutique hotel. The rooms are huge, all with balconies and massive bathrooms. If you need anything one call to the front desk has someone knocking at your door within a couple of minutes. We entered our room to a bottle of chilled champagne, chocolate dipped strawberries, and a hand written card welcoming us back again (try getting that at Wynn). Happy hour at the intimate bar (4pm till 8pm) has cracking cocktails for $5 and tapas for less than $4. Don't know what more I can ay about this place, just try it.!! Regards Andy and Tracy Young (England)

Reviews.Title: “A real find in Las Vegas hotels”
Reviews.Author: Tax-exile-NZ
Reviews.Content: A friend and I travelled from NZ to stay for 5 nights - and this place is impressive. Leaves any other hotel in Las Vegas behind due to it being an apartment hotel, with a proper kitchen, living area, bathroom and bedroom. There are few cheaper options either, and the short walk off strip (no casino, no smoking) makes a huge difference. Staff were excellent, as was the service, and the valet parking was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “All that I hoped it would be and more”
Reviews.Author: Lorna54
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Platinum and had a fantastic time. Rooms were huge, very clean and simply gorgeous. Loved the balcony and view of strip. The staff was the best I have ever experienced. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again. Here is my recommendation--If this is your first visit to Vegas then by all means stay somewhere on the strip to take in the whole Las Vegas experience. But if you are a seasoned traveler to Vegas then I highly recommend the Platinum. We have stayed on the strip numerous times and it’s not all that impressive to us anymore. Yes it’s fun but at the end of the day it’s nice to return to the Platinum where it’s quiet, smoke-free and away from the ding, ding, ding of the slot machines.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: AutumnAnn55135
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect!!! It was close to everything, but offered a great place where we could go and relax without all the craziness of the strip and casinos. I especially liked the clean, non-smoking atmosphere; it was awesome to wake up and not smell like day old cigarettes. The pool was really nice and had a great view. The staff at Stir bar was really friendly and a bartender, Nathan, always remembered us and was really knowledgable about stuff to do in Vegas. Were planning another trip in September and we'll defiantly be staying at the Platinum Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasurable experience”
Reviews.Author: fuzz56
Reviews.Content: This a great place to stay as it is a haven away from the full on pace of the strip..No casino and non smoking, however the smokers did smoke outside under the building Walking is about 10 mins to the strip and you are come out in front of the Bellagoe Casino, so it is in the centre of the action. The building is only 250 rooms compared to the casino hotels of 1000 to 2000 rooms.. therefore you are welcomed and treated like part of the family.. Happy hour is at the relaxed bar from 4pm to 8 pm all drinks and tap-pas half price, they even give you a roady ( any type of drink) in a plastic cup when you head off walking.. ROOMS: large clean and new , a lounge area, separate bedroom, comfy queen bed, fully self contained kitchen with stove and convection microwave and yeah a kettle so you can make a cuppa...Full sized fridge.. We cooked dinner twice however did have to ask for frying pan and a pot which was not a drama and we ate breakfast there every day.. spa bath in big bathroom.. and a balcony for fresh air. we had a room over looking the strip which was great called the Solitaire room.. The rooms really an apartment!! Free Wifi and no daily fee which I think other hotels charge $50 a day.. in the foyer free apples and cookies all day ... Bus travel is easy as each road has its own bus number for that road so no confusion.. $7.00 ticket for 24 hour. SHOPPING: 2 outlets one north and the other south.. clothes, shoes and makeup so cheap..and the rest.. Lots of restaurants to choose from.. the only down side with USA is the tipping, I would definitely recommended the Platinum because you are surrounded by so many casinos you don't need to stay in a hotel with a casino.. as in those places there is so many people therefore lots of pushing and shoving and lots of walking to get from one end of the hotel to the other .

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon to remember :)”
Reviews.Author: MrsTwiggers
Reviews.Content: We just wanted to say a big thank to the Platinum Hotel for helping to make our honeymoon so memorible. A special thank you to Varun on the front desk. On our arrival from an 11 hour flight he could have not done anymore to help with any question we had, made the check in as quick as possible so we could just relax in our room and WOW what a room, it was the biggest hotel room we have ever been in, everything you could wish for, king size bed, view of the strip. He gave us a map of the strip and info booklet and recommended the best way to get reduced tickets for food and shows and the times the kiosks opened. The room didnt have pots and pans or bath robes but a quick call down to front desk and two secs later a knock on the door there was everything, amazing service. We went for the hotel mainly for it location, yes it is 5/10 min walk off the strip but Bally's was only 5 mins away where there is a tram stop. This was so usefull as we then could go north or south and be at either end of the strip within a few mins. We were walking around all the gambling hotels on the strip and to see the people walking through the main casino just to check and these can be 5/10mins with a heavy case(if you are going with a lady who has to carry everything and the kitchen sink), then walking back through the casino to where the room was located another 5/10mins. I didnt fancy that. At the Platinum you are greeted at the front door, in to the main lobby and straight to your room no hassle, no walking through a mass of people and no smoke. I am not going to lie we did have a few little problems with the door lock, but a phone call from the phone located in all the lift areas a member of security came up, had to show I.D to prove we were staying in the room it was all sorted. Every hotel gets problems it is how the hotel sorts them out is key and we could not fault it. There is a 7Eleven and fuel stop next to the hotel, and also a 24hr mini mart across the road so you don't have to go far to pick up a few things. Also a U.S Bank 5 mins away so if you're taking travellers cheques (which we strongly recommend as all the ATM's charge varying amounts to withdraw money ontop of your bank charges) which is commision free. They also offer a grocery ordering/delivery service. The pool was not the biggest or most elaborate but it was great for us (when we could tear ourselves away from the strip!) comfy loungers and excellent service. So if you want amazing service, a great happy hour, wonderful rooms, no smoke, somewhere to relax at a great price. I really dont think you will go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Short Walk.”
Reviews.Author: Ferris2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only one night, left hugely impressed. Check in with Varnum (sorry if I spelt your name wrong) was a breeze compared to a previous experience @ TI. 6mths ago . Claire the manager was outstanding in her approach to customer service. My husband flatly refused valet parking & she promptly made alternative arrangements. The Princess Suite we checked into was spacious, well equipped, tastefully decorated & spotlessly clean. Thanks Platinum Hotel, your name describes very well our awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: homer123England
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel just off the strip,we stayed in a princess suite it was enormous,spotlessly clean,lovely staff,it was like being home from home.Just a short walk to the strip this hotel is in an ideal spot.We enjoyed it that much we are booking again for december.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: majcka
Reviews.Content: Huge room. Awesome staff. Block off the strip but witout a casino so it was quiet and relaxing. Lounge had great appitizers and drink specials. If you are looking for a relaxing trip but close to the strip, it is just behing Ballys and Paris, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “An extraordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessicahawt
Reviews.Content: The platinum hotel is the place you want to stay, when you are in Vagas. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They make you feel at home. The rooms are very clean and comfortable , also the spa is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pepperclare
Reviews.Content: The Platinum Hotel is a respite from what has become the cheesy, lowest common denominator scene that is the Strip. One of the only all suite, non smoking and non gaming hotels in Vegas, the Platinum offers space, luxury, service, accessibility and most importantly, a separation from the glitz, sleaze and solicitation of Las Vegas Blvd, but is in close proximity that one could walk easily. The staff, the food, the pool and convenience cannot be compared to any other Vegas property, and factor in the value for price paid, and you have just been introduced to the area's best kept secret amongst experienced travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mysteryjam
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Princess Suite with strip view room 718 - very impressed. Great free valet parking, reception staff very helpful. Rooms were huge - a full size living room/kitchen area, with washing machine, dryer, even dishwasher! Huge bathroom with large jacuzzi bath. Large separate bedroom with king bed. The whole room was clean and housekeeping was excellent. Enjoyed using the indoor/outdoor pool. We had a great night's sleep both nights. Lovely sunny balcony to have breakfast on in the morning. I don't really have anything bad to say about this hotel. It is a very short walk from the strip, and quiet at night. The only negative was no free internet. Apparently, you do get free internet when you book directly with the hotel rather than with a travel site. I was not aware that people who book on sites rather than the hotel get treated differently, but there you go!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: BSKMOM
Reviews.Content: We were at a conference close to Vegas and wanted to extend our stay on the Strip. We were travelling with 2 teenagers so I wanted a hotel that would provide the right atmosphere. The Platinum is non-smoking and does not have a casino. That might deter some but there are so many casinos very close and I believe it was the best choice to stay with family. It is centrally located so you walk a block to the strip and you can right or left and get to see the strip. There is an indoor/outdoor pool. The rooms are all suite which is also very handy. I just wish we had more time. Also we asked to check-in early as we were only there that one day and had an early flight out. Not only did they let us know that we could check in early, we were pleasantly surprised with a complimentary upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Darn near perfect”
Reviews.Author: Beerguy57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit Vegas at least once a year. We have had suites at the Mirage, Harrah's, Bally's, and "upgraded rooms" at MGM and Paris. This was our first off the strip experience and we were nervous about it. Our worries were completely unnecessary. The suites were beautiful and well equipped, the staff was friendly and extremely helpful. The food at Platinum was delicious, especially the salads, and the local restaurants were at par quality wise with any of the Strip's and not nearly as expensive. The Platinum will be our first choice from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Excellence is the strong suit”
Reviews.Author: carteresca
Reviews.Content: Hotel is the best in Las Vegas-it was our first time but it will not be the last. The staff was outstanding for service, friendliness and courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: HIohana
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 606 for 3 nights. Didn't realize that units are individually owned. Pros: Small Non-smoking hotel off the strip with fast check in Large jacuzzi tub Huge bathroom Large kitchenette lobby: strawberry/orange water, cucumber/lime water,cookies and free newspaper Pool fast, friendly valet balcony Cons: ~A/C vents in bedroom shot down on head with loud noise as it went on and off HOUSEKEEPING! ~In back of bathroom door, there was hair and bits of the loop pile from the rug that was never cleaned in the 4 days that we were there ~Didn't replace washcloths or tub mats daily ~Shower stall floor felt slimy and not clean ~Sheet for rollout bed had stains on it ~Dust in back of nightstand: saw when plugging in phone charger ~No shower caps ~Noisy from room above and traffic outside Overall, a nice hotel with poor housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “My next stay in Vegas will be at The Platinum”
Reviews.Author: marcialmcleod
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good about our stay at The Platinum Hotel. The rooms were extremely clean and spacious, the kitchen was an amazing bonus, the staff was courteous, friendly, personable, helpful and very quick to respond to all of our needs. (Compare that to other hotels). The "Happy Hour" in the bar was a great bang for your buck and the walk to the strip was as easy as walking from your room to the strip at any hotel located on the strip. My husband and I are in our 60's and walked it many times, day and night, during our 4 night stay at The Platinum. We also loved the pool and the service provided there.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay when you come to vegas”
Reviews.Author: danelazo
Reviews.Content: thank you for your great hotel i very much enjoy my stay here and thank you housekeeping for the clean and fresh room thank you rosalinda for the great service in my room

Reviews.Title: “I knew this would be awesome and it was!”
Reviews.Author: MjrMilnee
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through an amazing deal on SniqueAway and even though people said, "Platinum? Ugh, never heard of it", I'm so glad I ignored their skepticism. Location: It's not on the Strip. I repeat, NOT ON THE STRIP. Everything in Vegas is farther than it seems, so I'd say it was maybe a 15 minute walk. And if you like to walk like I do, do it. It's not sketchy, lots of people are out. Would I walk at 3am? Probably not, but still, it's fine. If you don't want to walk, get a bus pass. $20 will give you all-access for three days and it's an easy way to get around anyway. To get to the Strip, the stop is at the corner across the street and to come back it drops you off right in front. Since it's not a huge hotel, cabs probably won't be waiting around at all hours. Rooms: Gorgeous! Stayed in the Princess Suite with two queen beds which are the MOST comfy beds I've ever slept in. Nice and soft, I love it. The big window looked out across Flamingo Rd away from the strip. Not the most fantastic view, but I could see the mountains and the sun came in around 8 am. Love. The tub is the bomb. Big enough for two, but lovely for one, especially when you want a nice relaxing jet massage. :) Also liked the fake fireplace. Nice touch. And I wanted to steal the big makeup mirror, but I didn't. I swear. I'm not sure when the cleaning people came by, but it isn't at 9am like regular hotels, so that was much appreciated. You never feel like you're being rushed out the door in the morning. The staff washed all the glasses and dishes we left out too. Thank you! One more thing: internet is only free if you book through their website. Otherwise it's $10 per day or you can use the free hotspot in the lounge downstairs. Amenities: The pool is great. Half indoor/half outdoor. And did I mention it's heated? Cuz it is. My friend and I usually showed up around 10:30, 11ish so it was never crowded. And it's a smaller hotel, not some people rodeo, so it was always quiet. Food: Stir Lounge is awesome! Go for the happy hour everyday from 4 - 8 and the whole menu is 50% off. My only disappointment is that they were out of some lobster risotto balls or something. The happy hour menu is bigger than the one on the website, don't go by that. My friend and I got there early and waited a while for our food because of some kitchen mix up, so the bartender got us each a free drink. He made me a special cosmopolitan, so how could I be upset? Oh, free flavored water all day by the front desk. Fruit in the morning, cookies at night. :-9 Service: The whole staff is great. Speedy and easy check in and check out. I had a late flight so they held my bags for the afternoon. Room service was crazy quick. Everyone is really polite and happy too, always asking if they can help me with something. I read the bad reviews and I'm convinced those people are crazy. If you don't want housekeeping in your room during the day, put the privacy please sign up. I met almost the whole front desk staff and they never copped an attitude or refused to help me or fix something. Be polite and they'll be polite right back. If you think it's noisy, that's your neighbor's fault, not the hotel. I never heard a peep. If you don't like the view, move. There's a restaurant and bar on one of the upper floors. Sit at the pool. Who stays in their room and looks out the window anyway? Voodoo Lounge at the Rio, go there. Or the Eiffel Tower. It's SUGGESTED that you tip valets, not required. If you're going to complain, keep your money. And don't say someone forced you, that's BS. Lastly, if you think the area is full of "vagrants", don't go to big cities. Everyone minds their business as long as you mind yours. Thanks, Platinum Hotel!!! I look forward to staying with you again. :D

Reviews.Title: “Excellent off-Strip non-gaming hotel”
Reviews.Author: coolcaesar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Platinum over Christmas weekend 2010 for a badly needed vacation. I recommend the Platinum Hotel & Spa to anyone looking for a reasonably priced nice off-Strip hotel that is upscale, pleasant, and quiet, and is seeking to avoid the overcrowded, tourist-jammed, noisy, factory-line nature of the huge Vegas megaresorts. The Platinum's decor is contemporary and soothing. The room and bed were comfortable, well-maintained, and excellent. The fitness center and pool were superb. I especially liked the indoor/outdoor pool feature where one can comfortably enter/exit the pool in the indoor room (where the ambient temperature is kept toasty), and swim through the channel to the outdoor pool. The rates were reasonable compared to the megaresorts, too. The exterior balconies are a nice touch not available at megaresorts (or most other Vegas hotels either). The significant downside to the Platinum, as many other reviewers have noted, is that it's jammed onto a tiny lot in a sketchy neighborhood about two blocks east of the Strip. This resulted in several awkward design compromises at ground level, such as mandatory valet parking, a small lobby, and a cramped porte cochere where the valet parking people are constantly running around to keep the cars flowing. Other than that one issue, though, the Platinum is still an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel like a king and queen”
Reviews.Author: jamaicajohn
Reviews.Content: I am semi-retired and have traveled the world. For the money, this is by far the finest suite I have stayed in. The couples jacuzzi tub, separate shower, his/her sinks were great - the bathroom was larger than my hotel room in NY 2 weeks ago! It's a new building and everything feels fresh. The views were spectacular and I'll post some balcony shots later. All valet parking and all the amenities you'd want. We did the Swedish couples massage for a very reasonable price and after the massage they put us in a little lounge where we could sip tea, listen to soft music and stay as long as we liked. It felt like heaven and it was a shame that we had other places to go to. It is a non-smoking, non-gambling establishment that is dignified, pleasant, and tasteful. Steve, Shelly, Debbie, Nevon, Kevin and the bellhops were all so nice it felt as if they were happy to be there too. This place is not just a bed, it is a destination. Enjoy the indoor/outdoor heated pool and then take your wife to the spa for a real treat. We are definitely returning and staying longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel,but!!”
Reviews.Author: parsley1410
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Platinum for two nights (Fri+Sat) in May, the hotel was clean and the rooms spacious and comfortable and the staff friendly. BUT it does have short comings, when we arrived the pool was full of drunk 20 year olds shouting at each other and up to their mates on the upper floors, just what you want after a 3 hour drive, never mind this is Vegas we thought. After getting changed we went down to the bar only to find it was happy hour (half price drinks 4-8) guess what they had all now moved to the bar, so back up to our room and try the in room dining ( as restaurant is only open for breakfast and Lunch NOT dinner!!) which seemed very reasonably priced for a hotel. Food arrived promptly but on further inspection my wife’s sweet and sour had no rice, phoned up room service only to be told “ok we will send some up”, no sorry from them or the lady who brought the rice. The price of the meal was knocked off our bill but we only found this out when we checked out no one told us or left a note in the room apologizing. Later on we ventured down to the pool area only to find it littered with wet towels,cans,plastic glasses and bits of food, not impressed. Next morning we were charged for breakfast (even though we had breakfast included in our rate) this also happened the following morning. My wife rang up to complain and the woman at billing started to argue with her until my wife told her to look at our booking, she then changed her tone and said it would be knocked off the final bill, again no apology. In the afternoon we went to sit by the pool, the lady who took our drinks order lost our bill along with everybody elses round the pool so we had to sign twice then around four a manager came out with a cleaner and started rearranging the sun beds and power wash the deck even though people were still relaxing around the pool, again not impressed. Also as others have said the strip is a ten minute walk which is ok during daylight but seems to attract shall we say the more undesirable element at night. we only popped to the 7Eleven behind the hotel and were approached by street people asking for money. To sum up it is a very nice clean hotel but needs to make up its mind what type of clientele it wants to attract either couples/families or the party crowd it cannot have both also it really needs to brush up on customer service being nice is not the same as being helpfully. If you want this class of off strip hotel I would recommend the MGM Signature, rooms are just as nice (if a little smaller),its a lot cheaper and closer to the strip/ monorail station at MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vsp3327
Reviews.Content: The Platinum is off the strip about 2 blocks. So it is quiet. We had a wonderful view of the strip. The room was a suite with a small kitchen, huge bathroom, living room, bedroom and nice balcony. The room was clean, the staff extremely helpful. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “High Value. Hassle Free. High Quality. Great Experience.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBeautifully
Reviews.Content: Why I picked this hotel - After carefully researching all of the hotels Las Vegas, I kept reading amazing reviews on The Platinum Hotel. This is a relatively unknown, more obscure hotel, just off the strip that constantly got raves for space and efficiency. When the price dropped to ½ off on SniqueAway.com, I jumped on it and promptly booked a 1200 SF Princess Suite, strip view. Check in – After many trips to Vegas, I have spent my fair share of time waiting in line for my room at the check in, demoralizing my trip. (I am talking to you, Venetian.) Not here. I was greeted promptly by a bellman from my cab, then welcomed by a very friendly night attendant. They had me for a single bed, when I wanted a double. Without hesitation, they moved me up to the 15th floor for 2 queen beds. The lobby was decorated modernly and modestly, with good taste and chilled water for guests. In fact, there were 2 large containers of chilled iced water, with slices of oranges inside one container and with slices of limes in the other. How nice! There were also light cookies and apples to refresh yourself after your flight in the lobby. This property was clean, efficient, and calming inside – exactly what I was going for. Rooms – The room was an amazing, huge space overlooking the Las Vegas strip and I was instantly impressed. (The rooms here are all eco-friendly, so once you stick your room key in the activation slot, everything electronically in the room will operate.) This is also great because you always know where your room key is! The rooms have granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, full sized refrigerator, ice maker, water dispenser, full sized stove, oven, and cupboards are stocked with dishes /silverware. The living room has a very nice pull out couch, fireplace, and small work station for business needs. What I loved was that you actually have your own balcony, so you can go out there and have dinner overlooking the Las Vegas strip if you wanted to. What I also liked was that the room had a fireplace in it, which was activated with a flip of a switch, no hassle. This gave the room a romantic feel, so it could go either way as a romantic room for couples or a nice, spacious room for families. I loved the size of this room, because it gave me the option of having all of my Vegas friends over and not feel crammed into a tiny space. My friends were able to comfortably lounge on the couch, enjoy the view from the balcony, or help themselves to a drink in the spacious kitchen. The room was perfect! Another nice amenity was that it had a washer & dryer inside the room. It always sort of disgusted me to haul home dirty laundry in my luggage, comingled with my clean clothes I didn’t wear. Here, I was able to wash everything up quickly before I caught my flight. No dirty, gross, soiled clothes roaming around my suitcase! They provide you with detergent and dryer sheets; they really think of everything here for you. Bathroom - The bathroom is enormous with double sinks, granite counter space, and big shower. They all have a sunk in Jacuzzi tub, and it worked perfectly with a push of a button. It was really nice to get to soak in a big tub after a long day of walking the strip, so I appreciated the big tub. (They sell really amazing dissolving bath salts in the shape of an ice cream scoop for your tub, $9, single use, in the spa. Check that out!) There was a makeup mirror, which was nice, but would have worked a lot better if they had them mounted into the wall like most hotels. It was unlit, so I had to kneel on the floor to do my makeup, but it was fine. The provided toiletries were basic and unremarkable, so I would pack the things that you like / need from home. They do provide you with a blow dryer, so you can leave that behind. Bedroom - The rooms have double closets, but have about 5 hangers each, so you may want to call housekeeping for more hangers for your things. Also, I wish I would have called my first day for a bathrobe, because they are free to use while at the hotel, but you do have to call down to get one brought up to you. There is a large view of the strip from both the living room and the bedroom, which was really nice. There is an in-room safe, which worked perfectly when I used it for my laptop. The bed, I would say is comfortable, although not outstanding. They could have had higher quality mattress and linens, but it was fine. Perks – There are a lot of them! I read online, prior to coming that the free Internet is limited to the common areas and the pool. Not any more. I was given a free Internet card upon check in and had access to Internet throughout the hotel property and in my room, no restrictions. It worked great and I never had a problem with it at all. The other major perk of this place was the food. I could hardly believe that you could get an amazing meal delivered to your room at a super FAIR price, almost unheard of in hotels. The reviews on here said that the food was good and they were right! Because the prices were so fair, and the food was so good for the money, we just kept ordering room service out of sheer convenience. (This hotel is smart in the way that it recognizes that it is off the strip, and people are really at the mercy of the hotel to provide good food, fairly priced to them, which Platinum does repeatedly.) Room service arrived always faster than expected, hot, delicious, and by friendly staff. I have stayed at much higher star rated hotels that didn’t come close to delivering this quality of service. It was truly remarkable and appreciated. Everything we ordered for 4 days was outstanding. What I missed – This is a very small, modest request, but I actually missed a common Vegas TV station that plays nothing but new music coming out. They had this channel at Mandarin Oriental, South Point, the Palms, and Hard Rock. I always look forward to listening to music on that station while I get ready, and then downloading new music that I like to my laptop from my room. This is something that I look forward to. Also, I figured the room would have something to play my Ipod, but thought I would bring my travel player, just in case. Good thing I did, because there was no Ipod player in my room and that would have annoyed me while getting ready with no music. What I liked – This property is nothing but value. I loved that I could get a massage here for $85 in a hotel, so close to the strip. I also loved that I could invite my Vegas friends over to the manager’s cocktail party on Wednesday from 5 -6 PM and have food drinks, wine, cocktails for 3 people for $11. Come on. $11? The service was great and staff was super accommodating. This is the perfect hotel and night to invite your local friends over for a little catching up before you head out to the strip for dinner; I was so pleased! Also, I liked that it was a non-gaming property so I wasn’t inundated with noisy slot machines every time I went to my room. I loved that it was smoke free and was sort of a free standing, Vegas sanctuary of peacefulness. I could cab into the chaos, but cab away from it at night. It was perfect. Spa – Typically, I would not get a service done at a hotel, but because this hotel offered so many affordable services, and didn’t price gouge you, I opted for a Swedish massage with Shelly. When I walked into the actual spa, I was in awe. Everything was new, tranquil, dark, modern, and lovely. I really liked my service and the surroundings inside the spa were perfect. I did read on here previously that the sandals they give you are cheap and uncomfortable inside the spa. That person was right! I ended up 86-ing the sandals provided and putting my own back on for comfort. They need to order more comfy sandals, but other than that, it was perfect. I would definitely recommend this spa and use it again based on quality and value. Overall – The reviews and ranking of this hotel are correct; it is just plain excellent. Whoever is running this hotel is doing a great job with attention to detail. There is no undertone of pomp or circumstance here with employees; everyone here is warm, friendly and accommodating. At my checkout, the bellman noticed that 3 of us all needed rides to the airport and they used the hotel SUV to drop us all off. Such great service here. From the value of the room, amenities, food, service, and heavily discounted happy hours, you just can’t go wrong here. This hotel is perfect for – Families, solos, girls getaways, large groups, business professionals, value travel, wedding groups, bachelorette / bachelor parties, those with dietary needs / issues. This hotel is not perfect for – Someone that wants to be right on the strip, wants a casino onsite, wants a smoking hotel, wants high end-opulence for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great find! Nice hotel, loved having the balcony”
Reviews.Author: greyhoundmom24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Platinum Hotel after getting a great deal on sniqueaway.com. We were more than pleased with our accomodations. ROOM: We had a princess suite w/ strip view which was very large (living room, bedroom, large bathroom and a kitchenette) and had a nice balcony looking out towards the strip. The only negative I have is that the pillows were awful, but that was pretty minor. The rooms are energy efficient and require a room key to turn/keep the room's AC/lights on (nice to see a hotel doing that!). At night, we picked up a 6 pack from the gas station nearby and enjoyed a few beers on the balcony. It was such a nice way to unwind after the crazyness of the strip/casinos but still having a view of the strip. LOCATION: We walked from the hotel to the strip and back during the day and night. I didn't think the area was bad at all (no one bothered us while we walked) and I saw a lot of other people/tourists walking in the area. It would be worse in the heat of the summer though. TIP - it is hard to get a taxi from the hotel since they don't have their own taxi stand/area, so we would just walk to Bally's and get a taxi there. You can also take the monorail from Bally's to several other hotels - that turned out to be a good inexpensive way to travel. Staff was great and very accommodating. Pool/Restaurants - didn't use Overall, we enjoyed our stay and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Now if they could have only done something about my luck . . .”
Reviews.Author: HankmanTokyo
Reviews.Content: Chose the Platinum due to the feedback on Trip Advisor. Was not disappointed. Very speedy check-in. Hotel had prepared the exact room type I had requested. Rooms are very roomy with a separate living and sleeping area. Cool huge jet baths. It's two Las Vegas blocks from the strip but the views are nice, not spectacular, but nice for 2 blocks away Vegas strip views. Unfortunately did not use a lot of the hotel facilities as spent most of the time out and about. Only used the 1F lobby bar for drinks and one meal. Food was good and Ok selection of craft/micro beers. I can tell you the staff are very good. Gita the concierge was extremely helpful with suggestions - Thank you! My Bday happened to fall on a day during my stay and initially the front desk staff noticed upon check-in and I was later surprised with a complimentary bottle of bubbly and some sweets. That's hospitality folks. Thanks Platinum. Very restful sleep due to comfortable beds and quite nights. As in any hotel stay, as in life, not everything is perfect. And I must compliment the hotel management with being very professional in their resolution of one concern which came up during my stay at the Platinum. Platinum is indeed more precious than gold. NOTE, this is a 100% non smoking hotel. Not a problem as I'm not a smoker but I was not aware of that policy when I booked it. FYI.

Reviews.Title: “This is just a condominium”
Reviews.Author: Margarita_gem
Reviews.Content: This is just a condominium, not a hotel! You will be vary disappointed if decide to stay there! Platinum is very different from all the other beautiful hotels of Las Vegas, no casino, no people, no day to day celebration- the atmosphere and the interiors are not luxury at all. . The price difference is not so big, go better in Bellagio or Four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what an amazing trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: oliveluv
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Platinum after 5 days. This was our first time in Vegas and we were not sure what to expect. Back to the Platinum...We stayed at room 1117, princess suite. The suite was huge and included everything from a fully functioning stove/oven, dishwasher to a washing machine. The bathroom was huge with double sinks, a rain shower and a huge jacuzzi tub which was very relaxing. We also had a balcony with the view of the strip. Everything was amazing from check-in to check-out. Kudos to Juan at the front desk for the chocolate covered strawberries and champagne to help us celebrate our anniversary. Every single staff member we encountered from pool-side to room service to the bellman were genuinely nice and helpful. The spa on our second day was really nice and relaxing. We also splurged on room service with both breakfast and dinner and both times had delicious meals. Overall, Platinum exceeded our expectations. The location is a 10 minute walk to the main strip so you are within walking distance to all of the excitement but still far enough to be able to relax. Thank you Platinum for an amazing trip. We will definitely be back. Viva Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The Platinum Hotel is the best place if you want quiet and to just plain relax.”
Reviews.Author: blairhut951
Reviews.Content: The Platinum Hotel has the best food for the value. I found the rest of the resturants in Las Vegas were very expensive! I am planning on going back there and staying at the Platinum Hotel again. Very satisfied with the service and cleaness of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but not perfect as others say.”
Reviews.Author: Jarrad_D
Reviews.Content: To start, the hotel accomodations are excellent. We had a huge room or a great price. The restaurants seemed vacant for the most part, so we had a concern about turnover. The location, although just one block off of the strip, it is a a bit of a hike after a long day of walking the strip. There were also many vagrants around that location. They seemed to always be drunk and annoying passer by's, and at times they were on the verge of harrassing people. The valet guys also told us they would be uncomfortable walking the area at night. I am on the fence with this one, I did love the room, but perhaps I would prefer to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Space”
Reviews.Author: hateswork
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with 2 young children. Great space for the kids to play around. Used a cot for the baby at no extra charge. There is also a sofa bed in the main room. As previously mentioned the location is off the strip, approx 5-10 mins pushing a pram. There is a 7/11 nearby thought the service station diagonally across was better for baby supplies. Pool area was great, particularly the indoor area which was great for the kids. The only down sides were the shower which we found constantly changed temperature, and we did find housekeeping definately did a quick once over, though for the price for such a large room I am not complaining too much. Platinum is also non smoking which is great, we had friends staying at Bally's where you could definately smell the past smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas by far .....”
Reviews.Author: sueschmoo1
Reviews.Content: If you want service then stay at the Platinum Hotel , the staff here are the best i have ever had the pleasure of being served by . Nothing is too much for the Platinum team , i will be back .....

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: stevenrsweeney1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights and would highly recommend this place to anyone that wants to keep the noise and maddening crowd at a distance. Venturing into the chaos of the strip is a short skip away making for a just as quick retreat! The staff is top-notch - everyone from the valet to the maid service to the bartender are there for one thing - keeping you happy. Rooms are very well equipped and spacious. I could live there easy...

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: ppthepp
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, just 10 mins walk to the strip. All the staff are excellent and Jimmy really made my trip with " Good morning Mr Pini " every day! We stayed for 2 weeks at the platinum and was impressed every day. My only negative is my room never seemed to be 100% clean. The black marble kitchen counter top was always dusty. But this is a real minor think!

Reviews.Title: “Our New Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: BabsWI
Reviews.Content: This was our 10th trip to Vegas but our first stay at the Platinum. I can honestly say as long as they continue to provide excellent customer service and maintain the upkeep of the hotel we will never stay anywhere else again. We stayed in the Solitaire Strip View Suite on the 12th floor. The room was super clean and quiet. The balcony was a nice touch and our view of the north end of strip and mountains was beautiful. Every morning I sat on balcony to put on makeup. Because we booked our reservation online directly through Platinum's website we automatically received a late checkout of 2:00 p.m. Otherwise checkout is at 11:00 a.m. Service from the front desk, valet, housekeeping and security was incredible and by far the best we have ever encountered at a hotel. They always had a smile on their face and were eager to accommodate us. Didn't have time to try the restaurants, spa or pool. As others mentioned there is no self parking, only valet. But the staff is very quick and we never waited longer than five minutes for them to bring our car around. Yes there are homeless people who hang out at the gas station next door but the Platinum valet and security do an excellent job of keeping unwanted visitors out. Housekeeping cleaned room daily and provided fresh linens. At some hotels housekeeping begins knocking at your door at 9:00 a.m. We prefer to sleep in so it worked out well that housekeeping didn't arrive until after we left at 11:00 a.m. I needed to google Fedex locations back home and asked the front desk staff where their business center was located. To my surprise the staff member offered to google it for me and printed off his findings which saved me a trip to the business center. The only two cons I have for this hotel are there are no cabinets or drawers in the bathroom to store your cosmetics, toothbrush, etc. and there is no full length mirror anywhere in the room. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and already booked the Platinum for the Fall. Note to the General Manager of the Platinum Hotel--keep doing what you're doing because you have the best staff in town!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixandshoos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in march and absolutely loved this hotel! The valet staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel was immaculately maintained with modern, sleek yet comfortable decor and furnishings. Our room was as big as our house!!!! And the gigantic spa bath was so indulgent. The bed was extra comfortable and the kitchen was fully eqipped. The concierge (Guita) was extremely helpful in helping us choose suitable shows, restaurants and activities for our tastes and budget. The 15 min walk to the strip was not a problem - a small price to pay for such great accommodation. No resort fee, non smoking rooms and no slot machines and all of the above definitely make this my top pick. We have not stopped raving about this hotel to our friends and family and would definitely stay here again if we returned to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful staff, good price!”
Reviews.Author: Jim_M139
Reviews.Content: This hotel turned out to be better than I expected. From the photos on the internet I knew it would be a nice hotel, but it was the extras that made this hotel exceptional. The rooms are spacious and flow nicely as soon as you walk in. The kitfchn is fully equiped with an oven, microwave, fridge (with built in ice-maker), and even a full oven. When travelling in Vegas it is nice to have the option to be able to have an occasional meal in your own room. The bathroom had a separate jacuzzi tub as well as a separate shower stall. His and Her sinks were a nice touch. The bathroom had a spa feeling to it. The staff at the hotel make a huge difference. They are very courteous, friendly, and accomodating. They make guests at this hotel feel valued. From the managers to the maintenance staff a high level of professionalism was maintained throughout. The 5th floor restaurant overlooks the indoor-outdoor pool. We went for breakfast twice (before going out to find a grocery store), both times were pleasant experiences at a reasonable price. Valet parking is complementary and they are very quick to retrieve your vehicle. I do like the option of self-park, but could quickly get used to using valet more often. The internet connection is not free, but for Las Vegas this is not uncommon. But the signal strength is high. There may have been a free signal in public areas such as the lobby but I did not investigate this. There is a business center if you only need a short amount of time to keep in touch with family/friends. This hotel does not have a casino, but there is a casino in the hotel located directly beside the Platinum and another as you walk towards the strip. The walk to the strip is roughly 7 or 8 minutes, but you will find that you are at a central part of the strip, i.e. close to Bally's. There are a few homeless people who are on streets in the area, but there is always so much life at this part of town that security is not an issue. From my point of view this hotel provided a nice break from the busy Vegas strip. If you want a great room at a good price I think this would be good option.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: chefdaryl
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 5 women who came from Washington, Alaska and different parts of California to celebrate a very special birthday. The Platinum Hotel was the only place we seriously considered for our 4 day/3 night stay. The facility is well located off the strip, very quiet but easy access to the casinos. The staff was incredibly responsive and even sent a surprise bottle of champagne to the room for the birthday girl. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and the full kitchen makes it easy to have snacks and beverages handy for those in between times. I have told everybody I meet about the Platinum--as long as they keep up the facility and the staff stays as friendly and helpful as they were I won't stay any place else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Like the name, its the best in its class!! Highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: Aubelisa
Reviews.Content: Super, excellent, fabulous, wow factor hotel! An absolute stella of a hotel. Staff friendly, free valet parking, no breakfast. The room is like a mini apartment, with a huge living room, huge bathroom with a hot tub, and the kitchen is amazing, with everything you would have in an apartment! Fantastic place, with a superb warm water swimming pool. Book a room that faces the strip, its well worth it!! Its a block and half away from the strip, there is a business centre but you must pay for the internet only downside Like the name its top notch! Go for this place you will not be disappointed! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: rodenbach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Platinum last night. We arrived several hours early, but had no trouble checking in, and learned that our room had been upgraded to a Princess suite. The suite was amazing: full kitchen, a huge bathroom with Jacuzzi, shower and two sinks, a very large living room, and a balcony. There was even a washer/dryer! The room was immaculate, and everyone who worked at the hotel was very professional, gracious and helpful. The hotel is only about three years old, and is just beautiful. We enjoyed happy hour tapas and drinks in the bar yesterday, and had a delicious breakfast at the restaurant before left this morning. By far the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. I couldn't ask for more. I'm not a gambler, so I enjoyed that this is a hotel, and not a casino - though it's just a few blocks from the Strip.. (Completely non-smoking too!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: dorielsa
Reviews.Content: The Princess Strip View Suite was so spacious and comfortable, that we began to refer to it as home. The full equipped kitchen was a luxury I could not find in any other Las Vegas hotel for such an affordable price. With only a little fifteen minute stroll down Flamingo Road to the Belagio Hotel, we were enjoying their water fountain show and the fabulous oldies music that accompanies it. But, the main reason for choosing The Platinum Hotel was the strict non-smoking policy and no casino in sight. Conveniently located mid trip, the fifteen minute walk to the Belagio and other mayor hotels and surrounding restaurants was a welcome relief after the many hearty meals we enjoyed. BTW, the best dining deal is the very affordable Ellis Island next door to the hotel on Koval.

Reviews.Title: “Never again! Security, noise problems”
Reviews.Author: MDR2011
Reviews.Content: 1. My room was broken into while I was falling asleep the first night. When I called the front desk they told me that was impossible. Security told me the same thing until they saw the beaten in lock. No apology or management response. 2. The second night the pipes moaned and vibrated so loudly that they woke me up all night long. When I mentioned this upon checkout, the response was, "Oh, yeah, the pipes do that." Really? 3. I was offered an upgrade on my next stay, but told to email The Manager to verify, which I did to no response. If security and comfort aren't taken seriously, why would I ever stay there again?

Reviews.Title: “Very chilled out, great staff and amazing rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Mide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum for 4 nights as we were in Vegas for our wedding. After a lot of research, I chose this hotel because we wanted something a bit more intimate than being one of 5,000 rooms in one of the huge casino hotels. We also like our peace and quiet! The hotel really is great. It has a nice layout and a nice atmosphere. Everyone we met at the hotel seemed very chilled and it was nice to be able to get away from the chaos of the strip. The suites are huge and the whirlpool bath is really nice after a day walking round Vegas! and the beds are firm but large and comfortable. The hotel has a happy hour from 4pm until 8pm in their bar area. We only really drank in here once and ordered some of their 'tapas' food, although it's not really tapas (thai chicken skewers, battered prawns etc.), which was good.
