We ordered room service a few times and the food was good, but you do pay a price for it (like all other hotels we encountered). What made it for us was one of the valet's, Roger, who was excellent during our stay. On several occassions he got out the house car and drove us where we wanted, instead of having to take an expensive taxi (you just tip him). I'd highly recommend you ask if the house car is available as it is very confortable and costs a lot less than a taxi. Sometimes they ask you if you'd like to take it when it is quiet, but ask anyway...it's really worth it. Roger even arranged to have a bottle of bubbly sent up to our room when he found out we'd got married the day before! The hotel is pretty quiet compared to the strip, but it is a 10 minute walk down the road to the Bellagio on the strip. The area it's in is fine, with a few shops to buy basic supplies, although late at night it can seem a little bit dubious, mainly due to some beggars out on the streets. Having said that we walked back at night a few times and because it's along a main road, it was fine. Everyone we met there said they chose it to give them sanity away from the strip, and interestingly, many of those people were seasoned visitors to Vegas, where I think the novelty of staying in a ridiculously austentatious hotel with no chance of being given special treatment, had finally worn off. The Platinum only has 250 rooms, compared to thousands in the other hotels, so you obviously are treated in a much more personal way. If I had to be ultra picky, the only thing I could say about the hotel (apart from the walk to the strip) is that the Strip view isn't all that great and the living room/kitchen can be quite dark as not much natural light comes through the window. Still, the suites do have balconies, which is unusual for Vegas, and the suites are massive! Also, they have a kettle for all us Brits who like a cuppa, which we didn't find in other hotels on the west coast (just coffee machines). When you arrive they also ask you if you want pots and pans to cook with, which is good. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel and its staff and if you want a bit of sanity and peace and quiet away from the madness of the strip and don't mind a 10 min walk to get back, this is the place for you! Oh and one last thing......they have the nicest cookies in the lobby I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Librarian39
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum for 5 nights in May 2011 and could not find fault with any aspect of the hotel or service. The spacious suites are well equiped with a full kitchen, large bathroom and bedroom with king size bed. The staff were friendly and helpful. The bar has a happy "hour" from 4 - 8pm daily, all drinks and entrees are half price. The pool was warm with towels and floats provided, there was also a waiter service for drinks in the pool area. The Gym was well equipped, towels, water and headphones provided. The Strip is a short walk away (we found that it was quicker to cut through Bally's and the Paris to get to the centre of the Strip.) Next door there is a 7-11 and Ellis Island Casino and Steakhouse. The food in here was very good and really cheap, it is also a microbrewery. Opposite the rear entrance to Bally's is a little bar where you can get a bud or bud light for $1.50 and add a hotdog to that for another $1. Fantastic. The Platinum is a smoke free hotel. I would not hesitate to reccommend this hotel to friends and wishing to visit Vegas but wanting to be able to step back from the craziness at the end of the evening (about 12 minutes walk from the Strip). Taxi from the airport cost us $30 (Valet told us that we should have told the driver not to take the Freeway and it would have been about $15) When we checked out the valet drove us to the airport in the hotel car for a tip of our choosing which took only 5 or so minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but the clientele is starting to worry me.”
Reviews.Author: H20shear
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel because the tacky Vegas scene and hotels are not my thing. The rooms are huge and have full kitchens, which is great for extended stays. The only problem I have started to notice is the clientele. It seems as though thugs and gang members have discovered the hotel. I think they realized that they can put 10 people in the rooms, which are very reasonably priced. I thought I was at a gang party when I visited the pool and picked up my car at the valet. I will give it one more chance, but if it happens again, I'm out.

Reviews.Title: “Dungeon number 720, and some other strange things?”
Reviews.Author: crazyserb
Reviews.Content: I visited Las Vegas twice in last two weeks.First time I stayed in Trump(excellent expirience), but on my second visit, I decided to try, some other place, as Trump does not have suites with two separate beds.I booked this hotel throught Expedia, and as I find some poor rewiews about cheaper suites, I decided to take princess suite for me and my mate.On check in guy on reception desk seemed totally disinterested.Than he told me:"We have for you, nice sunny, suite with strip view"...When we get to our room, there was dark, outdated, with some strange smell, dungeon, for disabled persons(neither I, nor my friend are disabled in any way).Bathroom, was also dark, with old style poor lightning.Shower part of bathroom was without any water barrier(probably was maked for disabled persons) so during the shower, almost all water was flooding rest of the bathroom.Also that part was full of mould stains(look at the pictures again).There was lots of grab rails inside the shower part, but nothing to leave shampoo, and soap.Terrace was completely useless, as on 3 meters distance of it, was huge ventilation duct, who was making incredible noise.So, most of the time, terrace door must be closed, or you cant clearly talk inside of appartment.That was issue especially during the night , but we used, ear plugs.Please look on my pictures, to see, how "sunny, strip view princess suite" looks.Then I payed, $30 for three days of so called "internet".Internet was so slow, that I did not manage to use Skype, and browsing was so terrible, that I give up, after 15 minutes of it.Also, once I could not log in to my internet account, and I called front desk, but they told me that they dont have any informations, about it, as internet in hotel is provided by third party?Also, when I asked, where I can print out my airline ticket and rent a car confirmation, they send me into their bussines or something room, on fourth floor where I payed $7, for two printed pages, and 5 minutes of internet!!!!On the end, we went last night on couple of drinks in town, but when we came back, our keys did not want to open the door.I went to front desk, and they reprogramed my key card, and then when we enter the apartment I found third card(we got only two on check in?) pushed into the electric switch.As cleaning lady was at our room around 2p.m. that day, I dont have clue, who was in our appartment between 10.p.m. and 1.a.m. on the same day.Somehow, people on the front desk did not know either?That was really enough for us and we left hotel on next day.On the other hand, valet boys were all fast, and really helpful, room was huge, and it was provided with everything(laundry powder,cups, glases, kettle, huge two door fridge with ice maker, etc...)I sincerely reccomend this hotel, for families, but everyone else, especially if you are on bussines trip, and you need good internet connection, try to find something better.I reccomend Trump hotel, who is by my opinion, lightning year in front of this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great value, huge room”
Reviews.Author: Gracecarolina
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Excellent service. 2. Huge rooms and full kitchen. 3. Great value. 4. Washer and dryer in the princess suite. 5. Internet speed is good. Cons: 1. A bit far from strip, but still bearable.

Reviews.Title: “want a huge room in vegas -look no further”
Reviews.Author: PCGal
Reviews.Content: This is more like a condo-huge space for the money. Full kitchen, living room with fireplace, gigantic bathroom and huge bedroom. It's a non gaming/non smoking property about a 7 minute walk to the strip but a great alternative to a regular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SiaCanada
Reviews.Content: The room is huge! It has a big kitchen, a sitting area and a separate bedroom - this comes in handy if one wants to watch TV and one wants to sleep. The hotel is away from the Strip so it is nice and quiet. It takes about 20 minutes to walk to the Strip. There is only valet parking. I will definetly stay here again if I do come back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: joewillie
Reviews.Content: We purchased a stay with Platinum Hotel from a Groupon deal. It was the best Groupon deal we've experienced! From the day of our arrival, until we departed, the staff was accommodating on everything. Each staff member from the valet staff. to housekeeping services, to the front desk exceeded our expectations with their quick, efficient and friendly customer service. The one bedroom suites were incredibly huge with full bathrooms, full kitchens, washer and dryer. We did try to book spa appointments, but they were booked solid the entire four day weekend. If I had to comment on something constructive, I would have preferred the location to be on the strip, but you can't have everything and the bus system makes it an easy cheap ride to the middle of all the action. We will definitely return to the Platinum Hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Proposition for Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cmgnorthwest
Reviews.Content: After booking my room I wondered if the photos shown would actually be the realistic view of the hotel rooms. They were and this suite hotel far exceeded my expectations. This is a great value for Ls Vegas for those seeking a quiet, non-casino hotel experience not too far from the Strip. The breakfast was good at the Cafe and the staff was very welcoming, friendly, and helpful. I would stay there again as it reminded me of the vacation club resort suites, clean, expansive, and comfortable. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place with great amenities and well priced”
Reviews.Author: tesmithjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed the amenities, the location and the staff with the valet staff really standing out. Great pool area and the workout room was well stocked with all of the equipment you would need. It works well for families because you dont have the chaos of a casino hotel. Good pace for the family. Can't beat the price for getting a 1bedroom and a full kitchen with bar eating area. Would definitely recommend and stay again if traveling to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Really is an oasis away from the craziness of the Vegas Strip..!!!”
Reviews.Author: vegasguy1409
Reviews.Content: The Platinum Hotel and Spa is just a large city block from the strip, (right behind Ballys), but it is a non-smoking and non-gambling hotel that was one of the quietest - cleanest hotels we have ever stayed in.!! The large rooms with full kitchens and whirlpool bath was really upscale for the price of a regular room on the strip. We would DEFINATELY stay there again, and HIGHLY recommend it to anyone we know. Its also very handy to the airport avoiding the busy strip traffic when arriving late and all you want to do is get settled.

Reviews.Title: “Never ceases to disappoint even on my 5th stay”
Reviews.Author: dragondt
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem just right off the strip. This is my 5th time staying here while it was Preferred Hotels and now Marcus Hotels. Even with the change, the hotel is still my favorite. The staff is very friendly and courteous and will always do their best to accommodate you and your needs when you ask. I have stayed at Wynn, Venetian and Palazzo and you will not get this kind of service at the high class mega resorts on the strip without being referred here and there and walking everywhere to get what you need. PROS - The guest suites speak for themselves and is better than my own apartment. Spotless and clean with a spacious bathroom, spa tub, kitchen, own laundry/dryer, and a private balcony. You don't get this on the strip for the comparable prices even on a weekend! - Even better is that it is non smoking because I hate smelling like someone else's exhaled breath. - An invisible housekeeping staff keeps your pad in tip top shape, they don't even have the service hangers on the door to let housekeeping know that you have left and needed turnover! They put dishes in the dishwasher, remade the beds and they even neatly laid out my already ironed clothes that I left on my luggage on the remade bed. Absolutely amazing. (don't forget to tip them) - Very relaxed pool area without the scene and loud music - Amazing happy hour - NO RESORT FEE. I rather put that money to tip the incredible staff they have. - I am very glad that they have decided to include free wireless internet so that I can now keep up with my business! CONS - The only downside is that parking is valet only and is a bit inconvenient when you want to drop off/pick up things for a few minutes without the hassle of valet. That shouldn't be a reason not to stay here, this is my 5th time here and most likely a sixth stay in the future. - The location could be a turn off for some. Walking isn't that bad to the strip since it is no more than 15 minutes but during the summer that would be quite prohibitive or if any in your party are in heels. - More available taxi's but this can be remedied by calling ahead for one if you don't want to wait around for one. - I do wish the hotel could make a minor adjustment in being more environmentally friendly. I left my once used towel back on the ledge by the toilet to dry to reuse and it was already taken away by housekeeping and wasn't replaced with new towels. Just a minor thing but I do like that they now have the room key for the lights instead of going around turning everything off when you leave. Davis

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing oasis, close to the action in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Supercal
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our week long stay at Platinum Hotel. We had a 2-bed Marquis suite which had lots of space and ideal for us (2 couples) to share with privacy in our master bedroom and excellent shared living area. Balcony could have been better as we were right above the air conditioning unit but wasn't a problem. Hotel bar was nice and happy hour was a bargain, staff were all friendly and I enjoyed the spa. Didn't use the pool or restaurant. The hotel is located very conveniently for The Strip (probably as close as some people staying in hotels on the strip who have to walk through miles of casinos and corridors to get to their room!). I felt safe walking around the surrounding areas in all directions. 7/11 and am/pm garage handily located for basic provisions. Taxis were frequent enough - and the hotel car was available too - really felt like we got excellent personal service. The non-smoking/non-gaming aspects were great - nice to come back to and get some relaxation from the craziness of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous surprise. would highly recommend. top notch spa/bath.”
Reviews.Author: BostonYellow
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute through hotels.com while driving to Las Vegas. I asked for a 4 star hotel within walking distance to the strip in the $125.00 range. And boy did they deliver! Could walk to Planet Hollywood for an evening show. Full kitchen, balcony, and a spa/bath to die for. Beds were very comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lots of space, off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Muchachachacha
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet (non gambling) room off the strip. About a 10 minute walk to the action. Our room was large, approx 910 sq feet with a full kitchen. definitely liked it and would recommend it, but I will visit Vegas during pool season next time and consider staying somewhere with more of a vibe. Wasn't much going on at the Hotel. FYI we took a tour to Red Rock Canyon (not affiliated with the hotel) and our guide/driver named "Mountain Buck" actually RAN OUT OF GAS and ran two red lights in the meantime! We also never received the complimentary water that was advertised. Had a good laugh anyway, glad we survived.

Reviews.Title: “The Platinum deserves its high trip advisor ratings.”
Reviews.Author: Captain767
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Platinum for 6 nights. We checked in and Nathan upgraded us to a suite facing the strip. The suite was beautiful, similar to a 1 bedroom apartment with a good size balcony. The hotel is nonsmoking . It's about a 10 minute walk to the strip, but avoiding the smoky casinos, the crowds, and the small expensive hotel rooms along the strip was a great trade off. We saw several Vegas shows and did some shopping. It was a great mother and daughter vacation. I highly recommend the Platinum Hotel and would definitely stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: WidnesBubbles
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay, the accomodation was great , spacious ,clean etc Easy walk to the strip but prefered to taxi home as felt uncomfortable at night Would stay there again, staff great

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: shortstack44
Reviews.Content: What an experience!!! From the time we pulled up to valet - until we pulled out yesterday we had the most incredible stay. I had read all the reviews and it was difficult to find anything negative and believe me - we couldn't find anything either. Our room was so spacious and clean. The kitchen was incredible with a stainless steel refrig + microwave and even a washer/dryer. The bed was so comfortable and with closing the two entry doors we slept undisturbed. We had coffee/wine at sunrise/sunset on the balcony looking out over the skyline of Las Vegas. I did see one comment re: negative area - we did not see that. The Flamingo/Bally's/ Bill's/Tuscany are all in walking distance + we rode the monorail (also w/i walking) to MGM/Harrah's/Imperial Palace/Mirage. I want to mention that I had a medical emergency with my Dad on Tuesday. We approached the front desk to cancel the remainder of our stay - very accomodating and sympathic. We had planned to leave at 6 a.m. the next morning, but at 7 p.m. we found it only require day surgery and he had already returned home so we went back to the front desk to re-instate the remainder of our stay. They were as excited as we were and each day there after they inquired about my family. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and we will stay again. I just hope it is REALLY soon.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great room”
Reviews.Author: Pitbulllady
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and the staff could not be more helpful. They always greeted us by name. The room is spacious and quiet. It was so nice to return to our quiet big room after a day/night of activity on the Strip. The location is great and I will stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't need a sentence, just one word: Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Old_TV_Guy
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, dynamite suite, great location, peace and quite (no gaming). Whenever I picked up the phone, whatever I requested was delivered quickly. With the exception of the poor audio quality of the radio alarm clock, everything was perfect. Don't worry, the Bose Wave radio in the living room sounded great, especially when I played music from my MP3 player. This is not a small suite like the ones you get at suite hotels. My suites have all been over 850 sq ft every time. The fitness center, pool, spa, restaurant, and lounge are all first rate. I've stop considering other hotels in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: tom69g
Reviews.Content: Awesome Hotel. Super clean staff was super friendly. Pool was awesome. Lounge and food were excellent. I will definately being staying at Platinum for all my future vegas triips.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis just minutes from the strip”
Reviews.Author: clarindaIreland
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Vegas. I travelled with my husband (his first visit) having travelled with girlfriends on my last trip. As we were staying 7 nights we wanted to combine a relaxing break with the frenzy that is Las Vegas. We were tentative about booking a hotel off strip. However the Platinum is actually closer to the centre of the strip than many of the hotels on the strip. It is a short walk (less than 10 mins) to the corner of Ballys, The Flamingo, The Bellagio and Ceasars Palace. The suites are great, more like an apartment with room service! We booked a strip view which really looks fab at night. Great for enjoying a nightcap. The bedroom is situated away from the hallway and is very quiet. The weather was in the high 80s the week we were there. Relaxing by the pool and the hot tub on the 5th floor was a great start to the day. There is also a steam room and relaxation area on the 4th floor. Food and cocktails are served at the pool so we never managed to leave the hotel until mid-afternoon! On Wednesday evening the hotel hosts a reception for guests with free drinks and nibbles. There is a happy hour in the bar every evening. Customer service is high on the agenda in this hotel. Every request is followed up to make sure you're satisified with the service. Our visit to the Platinum exceeded our expectations - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “It's an oasis in a sea of Gaudy hotels.”
Reviews.Author: singlemommy1
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say, that I was treating my sister to a trip to Las Vegas for her birthday, and I thought staying in a hotel that was off the strip might be nice. (I've been to Vegas many times, and always found the strip hotels pretty loud.) Read the reviews here on Trip Advisor, and thought the Platinum sounded good. Since my sister and I were arriving from two different parts of the country, we connected at the airport...and arrived at the Platinum around 11:30am. As the taxi approached, at first I thought, "Maybe this wasn't such a good idea," because it seemed as if we were pretty far from the strip. We arrived to check in...but were told the room wasn't ready, but would be in about an hour. So, we went to the Ellis Island casino, after the bellman suggested it..(it was right around the corner)...and had lunch.(Pretty good by the way...) Came back about two hours later...and was told the room still wasn't ready. Well, by this time, we were getting tired of just killing time...but the man behind the desk basically said, "Well, you did arrive early...so what can you expect?" This ticked my sister off...and she suggested we go to another hotel....however, I had already paid for our stay, so I asked if I could see the manager.. I believe his name was Nathan...(if not, please forgive the oversight.) He was very cordial, and told me that our room was ready. After we made our way to our room, we were both pleasantly surprised. The suites were spacious...the kitchen area very functional...and the beds extremely comfortable. Our view overlooked apartments across the street...but we weren't there for the view. We found that our walk to the strip wasn't as long as it looked...and actually, gave us a chance to exercise. The strip is only about 4 blocks away. When I made our reservations, I mentioned that not only was it my sister's birthday, it was also her first trip to Las Vegas. So, on our first night there...there was a knock at the door, and a server presented us with a tray of chocolate and candy covered strawberries, and a bottle of sparkling wine with a card that read, "Happy Birthday!" My sister was so impressed, that she has decided we should come back very soon, and of course stay in Room 606. She even joked, that she could live there... So overall, after an initial gaffe, the entire stay at the Platinum was wonderful, and I do plan to return. I've stay at many of the major hotels on the strip, so I can honestly say, that they can't hold a candle to the Platinum!

Reviews.Title: “Best Girls Trip Ever to Vegas! The Platinum is the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: Lea-Lea76
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from a 4 day trip to Las Vegas with six girlfriends to celebrate my birthday and my best friends birthday. We chose the Platinum because of the suites they offered and the location, just a short walk from the strip behind Bally's. Prior to our arrival I arranged late check out& our room locations with Nelson & Claire who were both very helpful. The hotel car was arranged to pick us up from their airport which was great. On our arrival Brittney & Lena were great checking us in. Originally our rooms were side by side but we were able to move right across the hall to rooms 1212 (overlooking the mountains) and room 1217 (overlooking the strip). The next morning we were pleasantly surprised with a knock on the door and delivery of both birthday cards, welcome cards, chocolate covereds stramberries, a fruit basket and a bottle of champagne! Overall a WONDERFUL stay at the Platinum Hotel. The staff is incredible! The food is great! The rooms are fantastic! The rooftop pool was amazing! I would absolutely reccommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Vegas. If anyone has any questions, please feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of any better place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jpete02
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas several times and this was the nicest hotel room I have stayed in for under $200 in Vegas or anywhere else. This time we were only in Vegas for one night ,since we were coming back from our vacation in Utah, but we needed a place to stay for our flight out the next day. Having stayed in strip casino hotels before we didn't want to deal with the hassles of lugging our suitcases through a large casino and waiting in the endless check in line for a one night stay but we wanted to be close to the strip. This hotel is the best of both possible worlds. You are a five minute walk to the corner of Flamingo and Las Vegas Blvd. (this corner has the Bellagio, Bally's, and Caesar's), so this is about the best possible location you are going to get if you are not staying on the strip The rooms are spectacular. Full kitchens with a separate living room and bedroom. The bedroom is far enough away from the door you don't get any hall noise at all. The bathroom contained a shower and a whirlpool along with double sinks. We paid extra for a strip view and while you do get a view of several hotels along the strip, I'm not sure it is worth the extra cost. This hotel is not as tall as the strip hotels, so your view is blocked by the taller hotels . Also, since you are located behind the strip hotels, your best view is of the parking garages and monorail located behind the strip hotels and not the strip itself. The only thing we weren't crazy about was the mandatory valet parking. It is free but as is typical of most valet parking you always have a wait for your car and it would just be a lot easier if you could self park.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, attentive staff and fabulous spa.”
Reviews.Author: trixyrixy23
Reviews.Content: We found the Platinum Hotel fantastic for the most part. It was quiet and the staff was extremely polite and helpful. The room was beautiful and the view of the Strip, especially at night, was fantastic. My husband and I also each got a massage at the Spa by Shelly, the masseuse, and she was wonderful, extremely knowledgeable. The only critiques I have for the spa are that the shower curtains in the showers had lots of soap scum which is a personal pet peeve of mine. On the surface this hotel looks beautiful and clean but I saw small areas where it could be cleaned/maintained a little better (one is the caulking by the jet tub in the suite). Parking is by valet only. The valets were friendly and helpful, so although we tipped about $2 each time (both bringing our car in and taking it out), I didn't really mind spending the money. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The pool was heated and clean and there are fire pits for night time enjoyment of the pool. Pool food/beverage service is slow but room service was prompt and delicious. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to any who want a non-gaming hotel. Also, they strictly enforce the non-smoking aspect of the hotel which I appreciated but any who smoke may not appreciate!

Reviews.Title: “The Platinum Hotel and Spa is pure gold!”
Reviews.Author: Wendyful
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about the Platinum Hotel and Spa. From the moment we checked in until I was put in a cab to the airport, every aspect of our stay was ideal. The rooms are not to be believed: spacious and well-appointed, comfortable and posh at the same time. I was worried that the beds wouldn't be that comfortable, but I slept like a log the entire time. The water pressure in the shower was fantastic, and the jacuzzi tub was a welcome respite after long days of walking around. Maid service was impeccable, and it was wonderful to have a fridge and microwave available when we needed them. It would be great if there were an actual grocery store nearby, but the 7-11 out the back door was one of the best-stocked I've ever seen. The facilities in the public spaces of the hotel are gems as well. The pool is small but uber-clean, and lounges are well-placed and comfortable. Food and beverage service are available, and let me tell you: the restaurant is great. It's very casual and low-key, but everything we ate there was delicious. The spa is small but homey and relaxing, and the services provided are a HUGE value compared to the larger spas in Las Vegas. But what really makes the Platinum THE best hotel in Vegas is their staff. From the folks at the front desk to the waitstaff at the restaurant to the therapists at the spa to the guys out front who get you cabs to the bartenders in the lounge (ask for Matt Taylor. He is by far the best bartender I've ever met, bar none. Ha ha), every single person who works there is friendly, professional and eager to please. The Platinum IS a non-smoking, non-gambling property, but how awesome is it to get a break from the hustle and bustle of the big city?! And it's a short walk to the monorail at Bally's; from there, you can get almost anywhere. Cab rides aren't that expensive if you want to go from point-to-point, but I would NOT recommend walking around in that neighborhood at night; it's a wee bit sketchy. The Platinum Hotel and Spa is ideal, plain and simple. Enjoy the ridiculously cheap price and spend your money at the restaurants and spas (and at the casinos, if you like throwing your cash away).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaTravelgal
Reviews.Content: I booked an over night at this hotel through the hotel booking club SinqueAway for a ridiculously low rate and was a little surprised to actually find myself in a beautiful, tasteful hotel just off the middle of the Strip that was as good as the pictures on the net. Staff was helpful and friendly, starting with the valet who had to wait while we sorted through the piles of stuff that had accumulated in our vehicle over a 10-day driving tour. Our room (a Princess Suite) was huge (about twice the size of my first condo), with a full kitchen, washer/dryer, separate huge bedroom, usable balcony, and enormous bathroom. It was beautiful, quiet, and comfortable with great views over the city. I wished I had booked a week! As a bonus, the bar Stir, has a fairly long happy hour that includes 1/2 price on all drinks and tapas - and the pours were generous and the food very good. It was a great way to have an affordable, bu t really fine diner. Wifi is free in the bar and available in the room for a relatively reasonable charge. An excellent experience in all ways.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: snowbirdwannabe_11
Reviews.Content: If you want a little piece of heaven to come back to after the craziness of the strip - this is your place. The rooms are great, the pool is lovely but the staff are outstanding - especially Matt.

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative to the strip”
Reviews.Author: cpmj
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many hotels in Las Vegas over the years - usually on the strip. Once agan this year we decided to pick something different. Due to the overwhelming positive reviews The Platinum received we decided to stay here (we also got a really good deal on the rate). The hotel is on Flamingo and is only about a 10 minute walk to the strip and less to Bally's if you go in the shops door. We took a strip view room and were impressed with the size of the room. It was great to have so much space. The only negative was one interaction with front staff when we asked her to make a restaurant reservation for us - she definintely seemed completely put out by the request - but all other staff were very good and hotel follow up has been impressive. The location of the Platinum is not an issue unless you really hate to walk and if you've been to Vegas a few times a non-casino location is a nice change. If you've never been to a Buca di Peppo there's one located a 10 minute walk (away from the strip and across Terrible's) - take time to go there - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Great”
Reviews.Author: chrsmith0575
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Platinum Hotel if you are visiting Las Vegas soon. It is only a quarter mile from the strip and offers you rooms larger than anything you'll get on the strip for three times the price. I was pleasently surprised with not only the size of the room, but with the contemporary decor and amenities. Additionally, the shower is one of the best I have ever used anywhere! Additionally, they have a great happy hour (5pm - 8 pm) everyday and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly! I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and great service”
Reviews.Author: awisemd
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our experience. We have two small children and the hotel is within reasonable walking distance of the strip. The staff was all very friendly. The restaurant was excellent: reasonably priced and good, simple food. The room was a superb value and the housekeeping was quick and responsive. The pool was warm and great for kids, but also relaxing for adults. Overall, the value was excellent and we would highly recommend the hotel for anyone who wants to have fun but return to stay in a place without smoking or constant slot machines.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms with washer and dryer!”
Reviews.Author: cogagni
Reviews.Content: Price - $129 Parking - valet parking only, but it was quick Internet - speed was great Kitchen - beautiful kitchen Bathroom - biggest jacuzzi tub Beds - two queen beds very comfortable Pool - indoor and outdoor - it was very sunny and there was no shade outdoors - so the connected indoor pool was nice Noise - I was woken up two or three times by other guests making too much noise in the hallway. Washer and dryer in the room - this was a nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room for the price”
Reviews.Author: brokenwing65
Reviews.Content: I wish the lobby was bigger and label better. The room we stay in was very clean and nice. Very quiet and relaxing. Book direct and you get a late check out and complimentary internet. Remind them when you check in or else you will be traveling to places you may not feel like going to even if its in the hotel. I think the Westin beds are better but, they are still decent here. The Westin is very expensive and you don't get a room like this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value if you don't mind being off of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: gl0betr0tter24
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Spacious and nicely appointed rooms 2. Away from the Strip (very quiet) 3. JIMMY the Valet 4. No casino/no smoking 5. Great suites with comfortable beds & incredible bathrooms 6. Nice pool area Cons: 1. WiFi never worked (help desk was of little help) 2. Rarely saw housekeeping 3. Too far to walk to the Strip 4. Constant valet parking was a bit of a pain 5. Area around the hotel was a bit sketchy 6. No store/gift shop in the hotel 7. No concierge to help with suggestions/arrangements/recommendations

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE ROOMS!”
Reviews.Author: JohnPoShao
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very, very nice. The rooms are spacious, very accomodating. The room I reserved came with a full kichen (which is a big plus for some light cooking), a private balcony, and spacious living space. The staff was very friendly and helpful as they made our stay very comfortable. I work in a hotel myself and this hotel went above and beyond my expectations. Would definitely come here again everytime I come back to vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Customer Service and Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Brie27
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect when I arrived at the Platinum since no one had heard of it (and I asked a lot of people who frequent Vegas) and you can only tell so much based on pictures off the website. However, let me just say that I was amazed upon my arrival. My shuttle pulled up, the door man helped me with my bags, check-in was smooth and my bags were delivered to my room just moments after I arrived in the room. My room had a view of the strip (I stayed in the princess suite) with a balcony that was amazing. Since I was here for business, I had several packages shipped ahead of my arrival. All packages were delivered to my room within an hour of my arrival and the staff remained professional and curteous throughout all deliveries. I had the pleasure of experiencing room service and the spa. Both were amazing and their spa is so relaxing (way beyond belief). When I booked a dinner on their 17th floor for my team, the service just got better which left everyone amazed. The proof of this hotel is truly in it's name: The Platinum. Here you are treated like you are the only person in the world and you see nothing but smiling faces, which is always a plus in my book. In fact, I was so impressed with everything, that I'm changing hotel reservations in December that I made at the Cosmopolitan to the Platinum. If you're going to Vegas and want an off-strip hotel, stay here! IT'S WORTH IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “ONLY PLACE TO STAY - WISH WE'D STAYED LONGER!”
Reviews.Author: L0ve2Fish
Reviews.Content: CHECKIN: a very warm welcome from Brittnee who really went the extra mile looking after us during our stay! Not only did she upgrade our room, she also sent a surprise acknowledgement of my husband’s birthday. ROOMS: very spacious, luxurious, well-appointed, great view of the strip (especially at night). Bed was very comfortable, massive hot tub for 2. Handy having access to a washing machine & drier in the room. Non-smoking! EXTRAS: Wifi connection good. Nice pool. Didn’t use the kitchen, gas fireplace, restaurant or spa facilities. LOCATION: A 10min walk to the Boulevard / also on the bus route. Wonderful not being part of a Casino. Great location just back from Ballys & Bellagio. TRANSIT: $6pp shuttle from the airport. Grab a 24hr bus pass and head to the Northern Premium Outlet shops. THINGS TO DO: Bellagio water show, Old Vegas & the light show at Fredmont St. People watching! CAR RENTAL: Fox have the best deals (although they are pushy upselling). From the Hotel travel direct to their depot Sth of Boulevard. A huge thank you to Brittnee and the Platinum Staff for making our stay so enjoyable. We look forward to coming back and wish we’d stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain201011
Reviews.Content: It was excellent. I am totally impressed with Oscar, the housekeeping, and Gita, the concierge. Fantastic service! DEFINITELY a super special hotel. I have never seen such a good level of customer service. I was a bit annoyed with the waitresses at the WYNN since I spent some considerable time there. Eating shows lounging shopping and etc. As far as customer service goes, this hotel is far more superior than WYNN. For ladies: Go to the Qua Spa at the Ceasars Palace. Body Treatments was out of this world!!! Get a Helıcopter Ride with Sundance. All of these can be arranged with Gita while you are there!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Lots of bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: ramanora
Reviews.Content: I'd highly recommend Platinume Hotel. Celebrated my 50th w 5 girl friends. Lots of space in the suite with a balcony (nice to get a little fresh air in vegas) .Fantastic spacious suite with a full kitchen (we stocked up on groceries at Albertson's about a mile away) decent pool with poolside service, no smoking, no casino., right behind Bally's. About a 5 minute walk to the strip. The staff was very quick and very helpful. Gita, the concierge, was amazing. She even had chilled champage and chocolate covered strawberries in the room for us. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “The best Gem in LV”
Reviews.Author: Razasa
Reviews.Content: I´m 30 years old and Love Platinum. If you want to visit Las Vegas, enjoy all the attractions, even go party all night and at the end of the day go back HOME, this is your place. I mean Home, a huge, quiet, non-smoking, clean and comfort room. Also have Balcony (in las vegas) waiting you. Every place on trip is crowded and noisy, all the hotels, the pools and the restaurants, Platinum is the paradise, just one block or 10 minutes away. Staff was brilliant to do reservations and help me with everything. The only complain I have is the internet taxes at the business center and they forgot to clean my room in the first day. But this is unimportant things in compare the rest. Moreover, very good rate. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We learned about this excellent firm via SniqueAway”
Reviews.Content: SniqueAway offered us an opportunity to try this hotel. It was a great experience. Some positives include: lots of ammenities including restaurant, fitness area, and spa; it is near to the casino opportunities, but it is a non-gaming hotel; there was a fully functional kitchen area in our suite; there was even a dishwasher, clothes washer, and dryer provided in our suite; the various las vegas transist systems were nearby, including a bus stop right at the hotel; the staff, both in person and in electronic communication, were friendly, helpful, and thorough. I was very impressed with the valet parking and checkin/ reception staff. The firm is located on a busy street which has many shops, restaurants, places to visit, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Condo”
Reviews.Author: azjd17
Reviews.Content: Returned this year for 3 nights and couldn't be happier w/ the Platimum. The customer service from start to finish is top notch! Well-trained employees, always smiling and willing to speak with you, always trying to help in any way they can. Your wish is their command is the best way to describe it. We were treated like we were "special", the best staff in any hotel/condo/motel we have ever stayed in. The condos are lovely and very clean. Love the non-smoking, no casino, off strip, near the airport saves in taxi $$$ and quieter area. Give it a try, you will not be disappointed and we have stayed in 95% of Las Vegas' hotels/condos throughout the years. This is the greatest!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding+Extended Stay= Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Taze319
Reviews.Content: There are not enough positive adjectives in Roget's Thesaurus to express how wonderful our stay was. The Platinum was the site of our wedding and reception, we and several of our guest stayed for approximately 4-6 days. Every member of the staff bent over backwards to fulfill any requests we had and made our stay amazing. Most of the staff knew us by name and went out of their way to make our special day a special week. The rooms were tremendous, especially being there as long as many of us were. Nicole, the Catering Manager was especially awesome. Bad weather descended upon our outdoor ceremony at the last minute and she transitioned our ceremony to a beautiful venue indoors without a blink or any stress whatsoever. Nicole then stayed on through the entire reception to ensure everything was done exactly as we wanted and no detail was overlooked. And believe me, we had some very out of the ordinary details! The Platinum ensured our wedding and reception was one our family and friends will be raving about for many years to come. If you want a really nice place to spend your time while you are in Vegas, it is impossible to do better than the Platinum. If you or someone you know is planning a Las Vegas wedding, certainly there are a lot of decent places that will accommodate you. But if you want true value, an excellent event, and to be treated like royalty, I highly recommend you go to the Platinum and all its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, refreshing Oasis by the Strip”
Reviews.Author: alfibet
Reviews.Content: The service here was fantastic. Matt, at check-in, upgraded us in order to get 2 Queen beds instead of one King bed for my cousin and I. Internet is free when you book online. I love the lack of resort fee. The room was very modern, the beds were extremely comfortable, bathrooms were amazing, and it was quiet. It's a short walk to the Strip. No problem at all to walk. Returning to this hotel after a long day in the smoke and noise was so refreshing. I loved having a balcony to sit on, with a view of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: keith1974
Reviews.Content: stayed 11 days could not fault this hotel great suite great pool(shame it closed at 8pm). staff great.had princess suite with wash/dryer this is great now that you cant take as much luggage.we were worried about staying off strip but its only 5 minutes walk and even at 2 in the morning did not feel at all worried.pool was great very quiet not crowded like at the big hotels,plenty of space to relax and also the pool is heated which you dont get with alot of hotels.room superb large bathroom with double jacuzzi bath and shower, fully fitted kitchen large living room with flat screen tv,separate bedroom with tv, plenty off cupboard space. good food and bar.hotel staff great.good view considering your off strip. what more can i say this is our 4th visit it las vegas and we now dont want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service for modest prices”
Reviews.Author: mrjeff007
Reviews.Content: Except for not getting a taxi the moment you walk out the door, everything at this all suite hotel was great. Taxies may take up to 10 minutes, but the service was beyond just good. Every single person there seems to take pride in their work and makes an effort to make your stay a great one. We called for extra bedding and housecoats(gratis) and they came in less than five minutes. We called with a very minor fridge problem and the fully equipped servicemen, two of them, were up in less than 3 minutes. We ordered room service. It came up quickly and was good, hot food.Beds were extremely comfortable and I'm a very picky sleeper with a bad back! I would stay again and recommend this hotel. You must/should look for room specials/deals though.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - Excellent Staff - "Seedy" Area”
Reviews.Author: castaways01
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Palazzo or Venetian, but was traveling with my non-gambling sister this trip, so decided to stay 3 nights at The Platinum, since it was quiet and off the strip. I have absolutely no complaints about the hotel. The suite was very comfortable, lots of room, and my sister really enjoyed the Jacuzzi tub every night. Having the refrigerator for drinks and snacks was a big plus. I was playing in some tournaments at the Venetian, so walked there and back every day via the strip. It was a pleasant walk and I didn't think it was far. However, the neighborhood is somewhat seedy. I could have taken a taxi but like to walk so I chose to do so. I didn't feel real safe on the block between Ballys and the hotel, which is mostly deserted. We also walked to Ellis Island around the corner and had to walk over and around some of the men sleeping on the street near the 7-11. So, that's the only drawback of this otherwise classy hotel. We saw Jubilee at Ballys while staying here and it was a great show. Just one long block from the hotel. If you enter Ballys at the sportsbook, its a shorter hike.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - wouldn't hesitate to return!!”
Reviews.Author: burbSt_John_s_NL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 12 night stay at the Platinum Hotel & Spa. We were very pleased with the Hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. From the doorman who greets you, to all staff - the service was superb. We were upgraded to a suite that had a washer and dryer because of the lenght of our stay. We did have a couple of minor glitches and the only reason I mention them is the way they were handled. Within minutes of reporting the glitch there was somebody there to solve the problem for us. I did avail of the Well Spa which was excellent. Pool area was nice and Kilowatt restaurant was great. The 10 minute stroll to the strip didn't bother us, it was worth it to stay off the strip in a quieter, non-smoking, no casino hotel. Can't wait to return to the Platinum Hotel - would hightly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Platinum is AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: GBMAC
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I stayed at The Platinum on a girls weekend trip. It was beautiful. The room was wonderful, the spa was terrific and the staff was fantastic. If you stay here make sure you visit the bar at happy hour. Great food and drinks for half price. Also the bartender, Matt, is the nicest guy who makes the best drinks I've ever had. Make sure you ask Matt for the "Smoov". It's fantastic. We had very good service everywhere we went in the hotel. I couldn't have asked for a better stay. It's not on the strip, but close enough to catch a quick cab or monorail ride. You can walk there, but it's two long city blocks. We had a great trip and I recommend this hotel to all. And last ,but certainly not least, I also want to thank Jimmy, a very nice man who works at the hotel, for taking us back to the airport. :)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: AnnetteB_07
Reviews.Content: Extraordinary!! The staff went out of their way to be helpful. Veronica, Ledo, Mat, Danny, Alex all went the extra mile for us. The 2 room suites are large and comfortable with contemporary décor and a full kitchen. Great value!! We will definitely stay there again. The restaurant served us one of the best meals we had at very reasonable rates. My only suggestion would be to add a shuttle service to the strip. The hotel is 2 long blocks off the strip. After walking so much around the casinos and up and down the strip, getting back to hotel ended up being a cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy non-casino, non-smoking hotel with responsive staff”
Reviews.Author: BCH9449
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful low-profile hotel about 2 blocks off the Strip. The suites are very large with full kitchens, big spa tubs and a balcony. We hosted two conference events there and found the staff to be accessible, responsive and very pleasant. Close to the Strip, but not right on it, which was perfect for our business meetings - and no smoking! Nice pool deck, lounge and small restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: kgilbert001
Reviews.Content: Generally a very good stay. Staff were very pleasant, from check-in to restaurants to valets. The pool was wonderfully heated and the indoor/outdoor arrangement was great for those cool spring mornings that warmed up when the sun arrived. The suite was large with a nice kitchen area and pull-out couch. The king-size bed in the bedroom was comfortable. The shower and Jacuzzi tub were both awesome. Food we ordered from the 5th floor restaurant was quite good and not overly expensive. Happy hour drinks and tapas were good value too. The gym was really good for a hotel of this size. Just a few minor downsides: 1) Very little cutlery and very few dishes in the room (and no pots or pans). I know we could have called down for these, but it then becomes rather inconvenient. 2) Free internet in lobby and around pool area, but not in rooms -- would have had to pay additional $10 daily. Why not just make it free everywhere? And faster please! 3) Valet parking was generally convenient, but a self-parking option would have been preferred on some occasions, especially on days when we wanted to go in and out a few times. I don't mind tipping the valets, who were very pleasant, but I would prefer not to do it multiple times in one day. 4) The climate control unit in the room was noisy and the only way we could get any sleep was to totally turn it off. Even then, there was an odd dripping noise from the unit. 5) I appreciate having a non-smoking hotel, but why not allow smoking on the balcony with the door closed? I actually like a cigarette with a beer or glass of wine and the balcony view would have been a great place to enjoy this. Instead, I had to find the benches by a couple of ashtrays in the parking lot. So, overall a fine hotel that I would return to and, if you are not troubled too much by my concerns noted above, I would be pleased to recommend the Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “Why is the Platinum So Highly Rated? Here's Why ...”
Reviews.Author: Misc4Paul
Reviews.Content: If you haven't been there, you may be wondering why the Platinum continues to be so highly rated on Trip Advisor, especially when there are so many places to stay in Vegas. Here's why people like the place: 1. The rooms are huge (starting at 950 square feet!), with kitchens that you can actually cook meals in (and there are three mini-marts very close to the hotel, which is a nice plus); large showers and tubs; very comfortable beds; and excellent views from the room balconies (be sure to ask for a view of the Strip). 2. No casino and no smoking = a great place to relax and get away for a while from the craziness of the Strip. :) 3. The prices are great -- you'll get value for your money. 4. The spa, called "Well", is fantastic. 5. The service is great and responsive. 6. It's a very short walk to to Ellis Island (best inexpensive steak dinner in town -- ask for the unadvertised special!) and Lawry's (best expensive prime rib dinner in town). Yes, the Platinum is a "long Vegas block" off of the middle of the Strip (it's behind Bally's and Paris). So, you won't be right in the "middle of the action". However, considering all you get, I think it's worth the walk. And there are some advantages to the location -- for one thing, you won't be far away from the Bally's stop of the Las Vegas Monorail. Also, because of its location, taxi rides can be quicker because the Strip can often be avoided. All in all, a great place!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, spacious suites and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: annieCaerphilly
Reviews.Content: We flew into Las Vegas because we wanted to see the Grand Canyon (wonderful trip - be sure to include the helicopter and boat ride). We chose this hotel because it didn't have a casino. Good move. The suite we had was very well equiped with everything we needed on hand. It was light and airy with a hugh bathroom and bedroom - it even had a small balcony. It was a 4-5 minute stroll to the corner which seems to be at the middle of the strip. The Bellagio fountains were across the road from this corner and the moving walkways made it easy to cross. The staff at the hotel were really helpful and the valet parking was complimentary. There was a 7/11 store next door and the bar by the lobby has a genuine happy hour from 5-8pm where everything was half price. We enjoyed the food in this hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “You will not find better”
Reviews.Author: darryltribe
Reviews.Content: The holiday starts as soon as you walk through the door, fantastic one bedroom apartment - surpassed our expectations. The non-smoking, non-gambling atmosphere really makes a big difference. Gambling is easily accessible elsewhere (same with smoking in most hotels), it's nice to have the choice of peace and quiet. The most remarkable thing about the hotel is the level of customer service. We have travelled around the world and this has to be one of the best, if not the best, customer service orientated hotels. A special thank you to Brittnee for sorting out maps and all her kind attention. Gita and Brianna were also very helpful. In fact, show me a member of staff that wasn't, they are a great bunch of people. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: appo02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum for a recent girlfriend's getaway weekend. It was a perfect choice -- located just 2 blocks off the Strip, the hotel was clean, quiet, with all the amenities. The room was huge, a complete one-bedroom suite with full kitchen, living room, large bedroom with lots of closet space, big bathroom with spa tub, and a balcony with a fabulous view of the Strip. It was hard to leave the room! We had massages at the Well Spa on-site, and it was a lovely, relaxing spa experience (MUCH nicer than Canyon Ranch, which we also tried during this trip). All in all, it was a great place, especially for the reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection. I'll never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: trvljunkie_11
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reviews and they were SPOT ON. First, I had some trouble booking the stay through expedia and called the hotel directly. Claire helped right away and was very friendly. Then I consulted with the concierge about shows and what seats were the best for what show and she was also a huge help. She really went the extra mile. What I loved about this hotel is that we never felt like just a number here. It was small and we got lots of attention. Everyone was always friendly and smiling. The suite was huge, clean, quiet, and very comfortable. The kitchen had everything we needed and more. The jet bathtub was enormous. The bar downstairs had 1/2 price drinks and appetizers from 5-8 and were really tasty. The spa was lovely and relaxing. Shelly and Dawn gave great massages and my husband enjoyed his pedicure. At one point we went out and needed a cab. One of the valets signaled for one a couple of times and then just ran straight out almost to the middle of the street to reel one in when he was ignored! Another time it took a bit waiting for a cab and they just offered to load us up in the hotel's SUV and take us where we needed to go. Room service was yummy and speedy. Housekeeping never banged on the door. Ever. The balcony overlooking the strip was a nice touch. The strip is within walking distance. Between the hotel and the strip is a dated, cheesy-looking casino called "Ellis Island". It was like something from Swingers and we LOVED IT. It had low minimum bet blackjack tables, a sports book, pizzeria, restaurant, karaoke bar, and patio. It was great for when we still wanted to stay out, but be somewhat close to "home" if we got tired or went broke! It was awesome and there is no reason for us to ever stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: oak123
Reviews.Content: I booked it through Snique Away for $69/night, so don't know what normal rates might be. We had a huge princess suite-full kitchen, washer/dryer, jacuzzi tub and separate shower, two large closets in the massive king room, balcony, two large flat tv's, fireplace...WOW. All very nice, newer, and clean. All staff members were friendly and anxious to please, from valet to front desk to restaurant. We requested no feather pillows-immediately changed. Requested pots and pans-arrived within 5 minutes (all non-stick, even a cookie sheet). We even received a follow-up call to make sure the feather pillows had been removed. Super quiet, no smoking or casino anywhere. Nice first floor bar, with free wine and snacks on Wednesday evenings from 5-6, which we just happened to catch. Half-price happy hour every evening. Very nice breakfast in the lovely restaurant overlooking the pool. Simple pool (indoor/outdoor) and spa, but nice and clean and quiet. Great fitness room. Superb sugar cookies in the lobby some evenings, along with ice water. I would kill for the recipe. Free newspaper in the bar and restaurant every morning. Just a few blocks east of the strip on Flamingo. Some traffic in the evenings. We saw people walking to the strip, but we drove. Only drawback-free wifi only in a few locations. You have to pay for it in your room or the business center. We spent $12 on 20 minutes. Ouch. The room charge is less, but we didn't have a laptop. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service and GIGANTIC Room”
Reviews.Author: Annsianne
Reviews.Content: I booked the Platinum Hotel & Spa and got a super discount, so I was worried about the level of service and what the rooms would actually be. It turns out that there was no need to worry - our stay was fabulous. The staff at Platinum is absolutely the best! They were friendly and super helpful. Our room was huge! It was called a "Princess Suite" and we felt like Queens! We had a large living room, a full kitchen and gigantic bath with soaking tub and two queen beds in a separate bedroom. I have stayed in high end 'Condo' properties before, with higher end finishes, but what sets the Platinum apart is SERVICE and the size of the property. We felt that EVERYONE we came in contact with was taking excellent care of us. The property was small enough that we didn't feel lost there. We had a wonderful spa experience - body scrub and massage - and were surprised and happy that the cost of the service was reasonable. We spent time out at the beautiful pool. My only criticism would be the food at the restaurant /lounge "Stir". It was not high quality and a disappointment. Their drinks however were excellent. Breakfast was good at Kil@wat - the restaurant by the pool. Again, service was fantastic at both spots. The Platinum is a non-smoking/casino Hotel and is located about 2 blocks off the strip. It was an easy walk to the strip and the night we were dressed in heels, we used the hotel' s transportation on their recommendation. We loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm next to the strip.”
Reviews.Author: okamilobo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in a Princess Suite. This is not one of those huge monster casino / hotels in Vegas because it doesn't even have a casino and is much more intimate. The suite was really large with a pleasant design and well furnished. There is a strict no-smoking policy in the hotel and therefore the room was not only clean but seemed fresh and relatively new even though the hotel has been open for 5 years. We didn't use the spa, pool, bar or restaurant but they looked nice. They conquered my heart with their awesome cookies every morning. To confirm what another traveler wrote, the internet in your room is not free (but it is in the lobby and in other public areas;) there is only valet parking, which was staffed pretty well most of the time, but we had to wait an extended amount of time twice; there were not enough hangers in the room. These imperfections, however, were very minor and we would be very happy to stay at the hotel during our next trip to Vegas. For the price we paid it was 5 star all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: vquintero595
Reviews.Content: The Platinum Hotel was one of the best Hotels that I have ever stay in, wonderful property, comfortable units, clean and great service. I will definitely visit this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent again”
Reviews.Author: cypruslover7
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay at the Platinum again after staying there last October for our daughter's wedding at the Bellagio, glad we did as we had a wonderful time and was well looked after once again. If you want a hotel thats just far enough away from the hustle and noise of the strip but near enough to walk to this is it, also if you want great rooms with even better service from the staff again this is the hotel you must stay at, Just like to say a special thank you to Steven Owens for his assistance and all the front desk staff during our stay. Will definately be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A NICE HOTEL MADE A PLEASANT STAY”
Reviews.Author: dbrow30
Reviews.Content: As soon as I stepped on the property the staff treated me very well. They open the doors for you and if you decide to take a cab they call them and even put the bags in the car fopr you. I tried to tip the guy and he just walked away. The room was off the hook. I mean, full kitchen, flat screen, fire place, jacuzzi tuz with jets. What more can you ask for? I actually stayed on the 5th floor which was right by the pool. It was even nice enough to take a swim. The hotel is a block from the strip, a longggg block but it is walkable. You could either take a cab or the bus. Which I paid $7 a day to ride for 24 hours. The only thing that bothered me was the deposit for the room. They wanted $100 per night, which I thought was insane. They had Elis island whcih was right around the corner to eat ate. Try the barbeque spot. Good and cheap food. They also have their own brewery. Drafts only $1.75.. Take a chance and stay off the strip. You will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zebra71
Reviews.Content: My 22-year-old son and I stayed at The Platinum for four nights the first week in March. Everything about The Platinum was even better than I expected! Since it is a relatively small hotel (for Vegas), we were treated like family and got lots of personal attention. The staff members were friendly and helpful; we felt right at home. We had the Princess Suite with a Strip View and it was beyond amazing! It was like having our own apartment! Our suite had everything one could want--plus it was very quiet, clean, comfortable and spacious, too. The extras were nice, too--electric fireplace, washer and dryer and a private terrace overlooking the pool and the strip. We absolutely loved it and would highly recommend The Platinum Hotel and Spa to anyone traveling to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tkertise
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in Feb/March 2011 and had a great time in Vegas. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the strip and despite what anyone else may have said I did it by myself several times - including at night and never unsafe. The hotel itself is awesome, every other hotel that we visited and walked through, all I could think of was man I"m happy that were staying where we are. Very clean, huge rooms, awesome kitchens. We used the pool every day with our young son and he had a great time. I would never stay anywhere else in Vegas - and the price is great too. The valet while it might be viewed as a pain is great compared to other hotels. When I used the self park at the other major hotels, you had a 20 minute walk to the hotel, this one was dropped off right in front and never took more than 2 minutes to get your car. I generally tipped a dollar or two, but not always, depending on if I had tipped the guy that day or not.

Reviews.Title: “Mah-ve-lous!”
Reviews.Author: Newport2me
Reviews.Content: We were immediately impressed! Eco, green AND Non smoking!! What more could you ask! We were here for a board of directors meeting. Check in was smooth, friendly and easy! Went up to our luxurious room and could not stop walking around and saying that this is better than any 5 star we have stayed in! Princess Suite is large...let me say this again! L-A-R-G-E and it comes with a washer/dryer, huge bathroom, bedroom and kitchen/living room area! Couch in living room converts to a bed so there is room enough for four (4). Better living than our timeshare!!!! Oh, we cannot forget: 1) wonderful service in the restaurant. Great Breakfast! 2) fabulous valet! Greeted us each time by our names! How many hotels do this! 3) a few blocks off of Las Vegas Avenue (main strip) yet close enough to walk to: Bellagio, Paris, Caesar's Palace, Aria, Venetian...to name a few. 4) Great meeting rooms and food.

Reviews.Title: “Not one single complaint”
Reviews.Author: Jenepher76
Reviews.Content: The Platinum was the perfect place for us to stay. It's a short walk to the Strip if you want to be in the middle of everything, but if it's an oasis of quiet you want, the Platinum is for you. We had a beautiful suite facing the Strip, so we could look at all the lights whenever we wanted. We didn't try the restaurant, but we did sit by the pool. We thought it was a little too chilly to swim, but there were a couple of hardy souls in the water. The pool surroundings were very nice and included an open fire pit. The staff was the nicest, most helpful and friendliest of any hotel we've ever stayed at. They answered all of our questions and greeted us each morning or evening with a friendly hello. The free valet parking was handled very efficiently even when it got a little busy. We had a bit of a wait for our airport shuttle and while we sat in the lobby, we were offered cold water and when our airport shuttle didn't show up, a taxi was there in less that 5 minutes. I don't remember ever having to open a door. One of the staff was always there to greet us. The cookies in the lobby were delicious. A very nice touch. The suite was cleaned daily and it was beautiful. More room than we knew what to do with. and the bed was super comfy. See, not one single complaint. Stay at the Platinum if you can.

Reviews.Title: “im always at home when i stay at the platinum hotel”
Reviews.Author: scott1961
Reviews.Content: hi all,im in vegas again and yes im staying at the platinum hotel and im actually at the hotel now.as soon as i arrived at the hotel after my 10 hour 45 min flight i felt at home straight away.check-in took 3 mins and i was in my suite 2 mins later.the rooms are not just rooms they are all suites fully fitted,the only thing you have to do is when checking-in request some pots and pans and then just fill the fridge with food.now im in a suite with a strip view but you can request a mountain view suite.now as the hotel is a none gaming and no smoking hotel it means that its generally quiet and it dont stink of smoke but if i wonna gamble im 10 mins walk from the 4 corners of the strip(the bellagio--ceasers palace----ballys and the newly renamed but still the same barbury coast).i did forget that most suites have a balcony.as for the people that work here they are the best and i should know because i worked in a 4 star hotel in london as a concierge so i do know how hotels work and this one works very very very well.now if you are a repeat customer then yes im sure that a rate can be arranged but you will have to speak to the hotel about that.now if i was to compare this suite to what id get on the strip then id be paying 3 times as much but id also have to put-up with the smoke-----the noise----and the generall hastle that comes with staying in a hotel that has anything from 1500 to 5000 rooms,i like my service with that personnal touch and you cant generally get that on the strip,thats unless you are a high roller when youre bank-roll makes them remember you.i should point-out that each suite is very much like an apartment,fully fitted,so my advice is just get youre butts to this hotel and use the others for what ther are---casinos with some very expensive shops and shows,untill my next trip over here,have a great day and stay at the platinum hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SImply A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrissss2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the princess room and I loved this hotel, it's very nice however what I didn't like was the fact that the bedroom door doesnt have a lock especally if you have children with you or anybody else sleeping in the living room you always have to worry about someone just walking in and seeing you, also one of the doors on the bathroom also does not have a lock. My jetted tub wasn't working and then Alex came and fixed it right away at I was surprised because it was late at night when I called. I also got charged twice for the internet in which I only ordered the net for one day, I noticed the charges after I checked out so I never got the chance to tell them. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of a three week trip including two weeks on Kauai”
Reviews.Author: Cosmochippe
Reviews.Content: A business trip with conference at nearby large casino/hotel. I could't get out fast enough after one short horrible night. Platinum staff accommodated me in everyway and made me feel like I traveled from hell to heaven in just one hour. The princess suite is incredible. If I'd had this accommodation in Hawaii, I would never have left. This place is more than awesome. If you love smokey, dirty, loud, ugly rude cheap accommodations, don't come here! These people know customer service and how to meet any needs.

Reviews.Title: “Better than staying on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Roma033
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas. My husband and I had checked the reviews on Tripadvisor prior to our trip and sure enough the Platinum Hotel has great suites for the price. It was so nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and come back to the hotel for an afternoon swim in the heated indoor/outdoor pool and hot tub. It was a short 5 minute walk to the strip but far enough away to relax. We had a strip view which overlooked a substation but at night made up for it with the beautiful strip view. The kitchen was great with everything I needed including many of the comforts of home. The bathroom was beautiful with a very comfortable whirlpool tub. The staff was great. Always a doorman to open the door and even chocolate covered strawberries on my birthday! One of the best rooms we've stayed at in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum is all that.”
Reviews.Author: jacksbobjam
Reviews.Content: Just a little off the strip is one of the best values in Vegas. The Platinum Hotel was better then expected. With heated indoor/outdoor pool, workout room, rooms with views of the strip, in house restaurant and some of the friendliest staff around. Great stay. Would most certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: ColoTrav80517
Reviews.Content: To find a world class hotel in a quiet location off the strip with huge rooms, HD TVs, jucuzzi tubs, fireplaces, fully-equipped kitchens, excellent restaurants, complimentary wi-fi, and a staff that seems to truly care about each and every guest is rare in intself. But the rates are so low (room and food) that they are obviously 'introductory'. . . . Providing probably the best travel bargain I've ever encountered. (The Reidel-quality wine stems they use are, indeed, an indicator of the class and style of this comfortable oasis.)

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect place to stay for a business traveler in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ceilie
Reviews.Content: A quick freeway trip to downtown, and near the professional complex at Howard Hughes Parkway, this hotel offers great service and the perfect home-away-from-home for a long term business traveler. Having a full kitchen and, in my Princess Suite, a washer and dryer made my two-week business stay convenient and comfortable. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and attentive to any needs. The fitness center is well equipped and never crowded. While it's not the fanciest hotel, and it would be a hike to the Strip, it's convenient to several good restaurants and gives you the freedom to prepare your own food. I will stay there again any time I'm in Las Vegas for more than a couple nights.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing, a joy to return to after a hard day at a trade show.”
Reviews.Author: sfdc_11
Reviews.Content: A non-smoking facility. Excellent taste in decor. Staff that goes out of their way to be helpful. The hotel is always immaculate. The apartments are spacious, with elegant bathrooms and huge kitchens. The restaurant on the fifth floor provides breakfast and lunch with a view of the pool area and the skyline. We have stayed at the Platinum 6 or 7 times and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: cghelani
Reviews.Content: These guys got it right all the way around. I am a fairly critical traveler and couldnt find a single gripe about this hotel. They did an absolutely flawless job of providing excellent service, and maintaining the hotel to impeccable standards. The indoor/outdoor pool is great. They even sent up a bottle of champagne and strawberries when they found out it was my mom's birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite Family spot in VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: leeCheermom
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for 4 nights for a cheerleading competition. This was our 4th trip to Vegas and my cousin who lives in Vegas suggested that we try the Platinum Hotel. I was hesitant, but thought why not?! We normally stay at the Bellagio. Boy were we pleasantly surprised and we absolutely loved the Platinum. We have crowned it our new hot spot for our family. When you walk in the door, you are taken away by the size. Full size kitchen, washer/dryer and the bathroom is gigantic. Walk in closets too:) The rooms are very clean. We didn't get to use room service, I cooked breakfast lunch and dinner. Something that was great for our family, since we travel so much with cheer and we get so tired of fast food. Albertsons and Vonns is right down the street. The staff was prompt with anything we needed and even called to make sure we got what we called down for within in 10 mins. We did miss one day of cleaning service that was requested. It was a litte disappointing to come back to an unclean room. But ither than that 1 day, the room was serviced every day. We ate in the hotel the last day we were there and the staff were all super friendly. Although we did have to valet a park. Valet was super prompt and vert friendly. We never waited long for our car. WE PLAN TO ALWAYS STAY AT THIS HOTEL FOR OUR YEARLY CHEERLEADING TRIPS TO VEGAS. I an already trying to book our room for next Feb 2012. Hope this system allows me to soon.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL YET!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rosalind24522
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas. I was a little skeptical, being that it was off the strip. Before I booked, I looked at the reviews on tripadvisor.....No complaints!! I was only a 5 minute walk from the strip, and the service at the front desk was excellent! The people at the front desks were very pleasant, (I had to call because I had gotten lost on the interstate going to the outlets). They gave me excellent directions to and from the outlets minus the freeway! The service was A+++! !! I'm hooked. I will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KBC5
Reviews.Content: The rooms are amazing and the staff is very acccomodating. Great location and lots to do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience from Start to Finish”
Reviews.Author: BFDizzle
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this hotel and I have to say it was a great experience. Room was massive and had everything you could possible need to make for an enjoyable stay.
