Workout room had great new equipment and you could tell that it wasnt an afterthought (like at most hotels). Kudos to staff, as well, very quick and efficient. Thanks so much

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip and worth it”
Reviews.Author: Ltiggertaz
Reviews.Content: The rooms are amazing and huge, the towels could be softer but love the balcony. I booked their 21 day in advanced and unlike other hotels they only charged me for the first night instead of the entire stay which was nice. By booking online I got free internet.. The staff is extremely nice, you can walk to the tram at Bally's or walk to the strip. I loved not having to walk through a casino and smoke to get to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't clean this time . . .”
Reviews.Author: hikingforreal
Reviews.Content: actually it was THE dirtiest room/ rooms that I have have ever walked into! Stayed here last year ( great suite, clean, comfortable bed, great location, very attentive staff etc., etc. ) but such was not the case this time! Even RAVED about The Platinum via Tripadvisor only to be mortified this time about how filthy the first suite was. Was relocated to another suite on another floor and it too was filthy which should have prompted me to relocate to another hotel . . . shame on me. Voiced my housekeeping concerns with the hotel via the survey that they send to each guest's visit and have rec'd apologies. Word to the wise; check the room out before you unpack your bags.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel just a short walk from the strip.”
Reviews.Author: kennethnoisewater
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and massive, the staff was helpful and friendly, and, most importantly, I could stumble home easily without concern for my safety at any hour of the night. Major bonus points for in-room washer and dryer, too. Small points deduction for charging for the internet, though. For a slightly different Vegas experience, try the smaller casinos next door that locals frequent for a couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect, the wonderful staff and low-key environment made it very relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: jaholman
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Platinum on the basis of tripadvisor.com. I didn't see until arrival that I had inadvertently made the reservations for the previous week. I panicked but the manager immediately took us aside, found a room with the proper accommodations, and even credited the "no show" charge to our current stay. In addition she called and helped us get reservations to "O" when everything showed it sold out. Everything thereafter lived up to our arrival treatment. The hotel is small enough to feel friendly; it was great coming back to a no-smoking/no-casino environment, and all the guests were very polite. Food was excellent, heated swimming pool and hot tub easy to use. I would absolutely stay there again and recommend it to friends. The short walk to the strip is no problem

Reviews.Title: “Terrific option in Vegas and great value”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the Platinum Hotel in Vegas. This property was built as condos before the crash so rooms are essentially decent-sized apartments with full kitchens, washer/dryers, and spacious closets. This is a GREAT property if you are traveling with any kind of team (soccer, cheer, volleyball all there during our stay) and need space for stuff, a place for kids to hang out, and kitchen facilities. The pool area is small though the indoor/outdoor is fun, restaurant was good, room service a good value and very quick, Spa facility small but nice, and a special shout out goes to Matt the Bartender who makes outstanding cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live here!”
Reviews.Author: furmin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here to celebrate his birthday. We're locals, but we wanted to spend a night away from the monotony of home, and we also had tickets to a show on the strip. The strip is wonderful in its own way, but sometimes you feel like just a number due to the high volume of travelers on the strip. We were looking for something that was quiet and romantic with a more personal level of service, and Platinum was just that. The rooms are huge for the money you spend. We were upgraded free of charge to a Princess Suite. It was 1100 sq. ft. of bliss. The jacuzzi tub was wonderful, and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The front desk staff even called us shortly after we checked in to make sure everything was up to par. We got the chance to use the pool, and it was nice to be able to swim in a heated pool in February! Unfortunately, we didn't have time to use the spa services, but I'm looking for a reason to come back and try them!

Reviews.Title: “The only place for us in central Las Vegas! Excellent in all ways.”
Reviews.Author: Robin081
Reviews.Content: This romy, clean, quiet spot on Flamingo made our businees stay a pleasure. No casinos inside, but all very close. Secure efficient valet parking a big plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous clean quiet accomodating place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dundeal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend. We were in one of the smaller suites and loved it! The price was right and was exactly as was advertized. No bed bugs, clean, friendly, accommodating and quiet as it is not directly on the strip but about a 10 minute walk from the strip (behind Bally's) and was central to all the hotels. We even enjoyed the jetted tub. It was easy to get around from here too. The monorail was about 3 minutes from the building or we could call a cab for transportation. We loved everything about this hotel and would definitely return and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JLH1984
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a non-smoking property with balconies, no casino and good value for our money. We found all of that and more at The Platinum! The suite was beautiful, spacious and sparkling clean, with a full kitchen, fireplace, and even a washer/dryer! The bathroom amenities were wonderful, the furniture comfortable and the TV's (2) big and easy to navigate. The staff was the nicest we have ever dealt with and rewally made the trip special for us - we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and my husband's birthday and the champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries they sent up were a classy touch. We enjoy going to the casinos but wanted a quiet place to return to at the end of the day - this was it - no walking for "a mile" through a smoke-filled casino to get to an elevator to go to our room. It was a 1 block walk to the monorail station at Bally's or another 1/2 block to the strip - no problem at all. We had breakfast in our suite and both mornings tried something different - the food was excellent, the service prompt, and the food was piping hot! We will never stay anywhere else in Vegas and look forward to returning when the weather is warmer to check out the beautiful pool area! We highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is, "Wow! I will definately stay here again!"”
Reviews.Author: Iloveoc40
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! I travel to Las Vegas twice a year for business and I will definately stay here! I am not a gambler, smoker, or drinker so I loved this peaceful hotel. The staff was super friendly and helpful and the room was fabulous. It was like I had my own apartment for the price of just a room. I look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “SO GOOD TO COME BACK TO A QUIET AND CALM LOBBY”
Reviews.Author: Queeny
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Princess Suite with a strip view with husband and teenage son. We all loved the hotel and the fact that the suite was so big, clean and comfortable with a kitchen and washer and dryer. The walk to and from the strip was not a problem, just so good to come back to the peace and quiet of the Platinum and the lovely heated pool. The staff were all fabulous. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, huge suites, all non smoking which is why we stayed there again!”
Reviews.Author: robert_j_11
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the Platinum, Las Vegas. The first & second times were only a week apart as we decided to go back there after our first visit instead of spending some time in Los Angeles. It was the right decision as it was great to relax there after a few days of driving & sightseeing. We love that it's a non gambling & non smoking hotel which is well located for getting to the 'Strip' either by walking or by a very quick Deuce bus ride. So when we decided to go to Las Vegas again this year(3rd time) there was no question of where we were going to stay. We were very well looked after in terms of a free upgrade of our room(great view especially when everything's lit up at night), free high speed internet, complimentary breakfast and a fantastic daily happy hour! Our suite was spacious, very clean and our king size bed was extremely comfortable. The Kilawat restaurant was great for breakfast/brunch every day, in room dining service was quick & we love their delicious Stir burgers and the happy hour was fantastic value for food & drink! The only negative was on the morning of our departure when our wake up call didn't happen. Luckily we also had our own travel clock alarm as we had an early morning flight to catch. The Duty Manager at checkout was very apologetic, asked enough questions to be able to identify who'd made the mistake & said he'd speak with them. He also immediately gave us a discount on our final bill which we really appreciated. We will definitely be back again - we love it!! Thank you Claire & all the staff at the Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “What a hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: LolaObi
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to Vegas for my best friends wedding. I booked a one bed suite and it was huuuuuge!! Very clean and well maintained. Breakfast is great and restaurant is open the majority of the day. I purposely chose a non-smoking and Casino free hotel and was so glad I did. The gym is great and I even had the pleasure of sharing the Gym with 'Juan Manuel López' Boxing camp. It was a nice 5 min walk to all the craziness of the strip. So was nice to retreat back to the hotel for a lil sanity. The downside is that the Spa was hardly open if at all, for the 6 days we stayed there. Other than that I have no complaints. I would recommend this to anyone who likes the option of either a bit of peace and quiet and a choice of entering the craziness which is Vegas on the strip. Oh yeah, pay a little bit extra for a view of the strip. Sunrise and sunset is absolutely gorgeous! Ps shout out to the Guys on the door for giving 5 crazy uk chicks and a dude a ride in the Hotel jeep to Ciara's birthday party...really appreciated Mwah x

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Sin City”
Reviews.Author: whirledgirl
Reviews.Content: If you want a spectacular lobby and/or a casino, this is not for you. If you want a convenient place to feel relaxed and comfortable, this can’t be beat. Pros Cookies in the lobby! Huge double Jacuzzi tub! Full modern kitchen Firm mattress, soft sheets Sparkling clean Friendly, well-trained staff who genuinely want to help Good temperature control Reasonably priced, tasty food in restaurant/room service Around the corner from the best value meals in town (Ellis Island Restaurant. Ask for the off-menu “steak special” if you like steak and are hungry.) Close to the middle of the strip, but a refreshingly distant from the chaos No huge smoky casino to walk through. You get to the front door and can go straight up the elevator to your room. Although you have to walk 10 minutes from the strip, in many hotels you have to walk 10 minutes through the complex to get to your room anyway. Good view of the strip for a bit more in price Cons: Hmmm. Tried real hard, but I can’t think of any.

Reviews.Title: “Just a block from the Strip, but so much better for it.”
Reviews.Author: Engineer1661
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum based on the excellent Tripadvisor reviews. Three of us stayed for 5 nights; myself and my my two sons, both in their early twenties. The hotel rooms were enormous each with kitchen, living area, balcony and large en-suite bathroom. The service was excellent and Clare attended to us as we booked in ensuring we had super rooms for our stay. The valet team were efficient and looked after us well. The maid service was excellent keeping the rooms in good order throughout our stay, no mean feat with my boys! Much was made of the distance to the Strip, but this was only a block and took about ten minutes walk. The advantage was you ended up right at Bellagio in the centre of the Strip. People staying at say the Luxor or the Wynn, by comparison, would have had a much longer walk to the same point. Being from England we appreciated the relative quiet of the Platinum and the no smoking policy. We all found the casino hotels very smokey and also very noisey. Minor comments on the Platinum are: 1. The pool opens at 10am, so you can't have a morning swim. 2. The room service menu is a little limited; see below generally. 3. The party room on the 17th floor gets a bit noisey. 4. The wait for a cab can take a while and because of the road layout it costs about $5 just to turn around! Expect to pay $10 to get to the Strip, again see below generally. 5. The hotel ventilation would benefit from humidification, it's too easy to get static shocks from the doors and lifts. In general I'd offer the following tips: 1. Hire a car, we spent a small fortune on taxis and wore out quite a bit of shoe leather! 2. We hired a car for the weekend and did Death Valley on the Saturday and Hoover Dam on the Sunday. Both visits are excellent and Death Valley makes a great alternative to the Grand Canyon if you don't have much time. Allow about 5 hours for Death Valley and fill up with fuel in Pahrump. 3. We struggled to find food that wasn't potato or meat! Vegetables are an endangered species in the States! Burgers and steaks are the order of the day in most restaurants. 4. The casino hotel buffets are quite good value, but the food sits around for a while. Better at the end of a mealtime than at the start. Also can someone please explain to American chefs that Fish and Chips in England means fish with fries, not crisps (American chips)!! 5. We won and lost money on the roulette table in Ceasars Palace and won in a poker tournament in O'Sheas. Blackjack wasn't worth playing; with a 6 deck shoe and shuffling between hands in most casinos. Considering it was Chinese New Year the casinos were very quiet. Are the casinos perhaps now stacking the deck too heavily in their favour?

Reviews.Title: “I doubt better value exists in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RoySandlapper
Reviews.Content: Unless your thing is to stay in a megahotel where you do not intend to leave the building while you are in Las Vegas, I highly recommend the Platinum. All of the suites are large and include full kitchens. Frequently, suites are available for under $100 a night. There is no need to book the larger Princess Suites unless you need a washer and dryer. The hotel has a nice bar, a restaurant, spa, heated pool, good exercise room, and friendly service. There is no gambling in the hotel, but Ellis Island is practically next door. Ellis Island also has an inexpensive restaurant that is highly rated by TripAdvisor. Although the hotel is only a 10 minute walk to the center of the Vegas strip, the key to getting around Vegas is to rent a car. The Platinum has free valet parking and almost every hotel and shopping area on the Strip has free, self-parking, so it is very easy to move around the city, and without having to walk twenty minutes from your room to your car.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Hotel, truly worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: rocknrolltrouble
Reviews.Content: My parents from Oregon and my wife and child (we're from LA) stayed at the Platinum for a long weekend. We actually stayed one night at the Palms where we were treated like cattle and then came to the Platinum where we felt like royalty. I would highly recommend staying at this gorgeous hotel to anyone we know heading to Vegas and certainly would stay there again myself. The facilities, the room, the room service and the staff really are outstanding. Their kind smiles and hospitality exceeded our expectations and truly made us loyal customers!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Half_runner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!! The personnel is really friendly and helpful. We had a strip-view suite and it was huge. The fully equipped kitchen was wonderful also. The first night after dinner, they left a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries--that was a huge surprise. The strip was a little farther away than I expected, but the walk wasn't bad and I always felt safe walking around. Getting a cab was easy and fast though if we didn't want to walk. I had breakfast everyday in the hotel restaurant--the service was excellent (also very fast) and the food was good and reasonably priced. The pool looked lovely, but I didn't have time to go. I can't say enough good things about this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: rfamerson
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel for the travelers who are not consumed with gambling. Great staff and great food and drinks at the two restaurants. Quiet location right of the strip. Close enough to quickly get to all the action but far enough away to relax and enjoy the peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault the The Platinum Hotel”
Reviews.Author: K_BZAK
Reviews.Content: We stayed her over the New Year’s period. The Platinum hotel is a great place to stay when you don’t want to be in the mayhem of the strip. It was refreshing not to walk into a smoke filled lobby but you are still only a block away from the heart of the action! The staff were polite and helpful. We stayed in a princess suite which was huge!! As this was the end of a 4 week trip it was wonderful to have the luxury of our own washer and dryer!! Could not fault the The Platinum Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not even there yet, and impressed”
Reviews.Author: MedicmanOttawa
Reviews.Content: I am staying at this resort this coming week, but I felt compelled to write an appreciative note for their in-house reservation employee Angela...I was perusing the hotels website and noticed a significant price drop since I had made my reservation in Sept. 2010...I called the Hotel and was immediately given the promotional rate with absolute efficiency and courtesy..looking forward to staying there next week...so far very impressed..If Angela is any indicator of the staff in general, it will be a vacation to remember :)

Reviews.Title: “Restful spot off of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Bondsammax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Platinum for 4 nights at Christmas. We chose the hotel because it was off of the strip and had large rooms at a good price. It was worth paying for a room with a strip view. It’s not a great view (see picture), but still nice & the balcony would be a fine place to have a drink when the outside temperature is right. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the strip (things are far apart in Vegas). You can get to the strip faster heading to the MGM grand by cutting through Bally’s on the left and then through Paris; cuts about 15 min off of going to the corner (Bellagio & Ceasar’s at the corner). You can also get to the Venetian by walking up the back road across from Bally (you pass an old Italian restaurant on the left. We were told to not eat there). It is a bit deserted, but go straight up the road with a slight curve to the left & walk through the Venetian parking garage and take the elevator up and presto you are in the mall; this saves about 30 min. The hotel was fine and the staff pleasant. I thought the corridors needed a serious vacuuming, but otherwise the place was clean. We did not use the pool, but saw a lot of families using it in the cool weather. We did eat our breakfasts in the restaurant and they were much better than expected; pleasant staff there too. With so many choices we would probably try another hotel next time (we’ve stayed at the Venetian twice and Treasure Island once). The walk to the strip is too long for many people and we did have to pass some questionable types on the way. The place looked like it was great for kids though as the pool was a big hit. It is way too quiet for Vegas, but that is the attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Funcoola
Reviews.Content: Room was large and spacious and the staff was great. A bit of a walk to the strip with young children (7 & 11) though. I think we got the worst suit in the hotel. Entry light switch didn't work and wasn't fixed two room lamps also didn't work, the dishwasher leaked water over the floor when used and there was no hot water in the sink. The toilet was easily blocked and the shower and bath hot water took a long time to warm up. Also no free wi-fi in room and if you need cooking equipment it must be asked for as there is none in the room. And lastly the bathroom wasn't cleaned very well at all.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking, you just found the BEST HOTEL in Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: AudioSoundVA_com
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews on this site and i don't regret it. When we arrived at the hotel Nathan upgraded our room to their 1150Sqft "Princess Suite". I was like..WAO thanks! We had our suite on the 16th floor overlooking the strip which was nice. The rooms were nice and clean and they looked brand new, The kitchen had very nice black granit counter-top, the bathroom had a large jacuzzi and a shower and it was HUGE! The beds are very comfortable. The staff was always extremely nice and very helpful. The valet parking guys are super fast to retrieve your car and are real gentlemen (please tip them, they deserve it!). The rooms are very quiet and we did not hear any noise from the outside at all.Internet connection is kind of slow (just like in every hotel) but it is free so I can't really complain. It also might be the fact that we were on the 16th floor where the signal is weaker. Anyways, 1 thing is sure that at next year's CES I will be staying at the Platinum Hotel again! Keep up this great quality and your hotel will be full of happy guests! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: starlil2000
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Platinum Hotel and Spa for three relaxing nights. The hotel is off the strip and therefore is very quiet. It is also a non smoking hotel and if you did feel the need to have a cigarrette they have a designated area by the parking lot where you could go. The room are very spacious and each room has a full kitchen as well as a jacuzzi and stand up shower in the bathroom. There isnt really anything nearby except for a 7/11 where you can run and get any quick snacks or beers. Room service was a bit pricey ( about $40-$50) for breakfast for two people but they did arrive in a timely fashion. I also had a spa treatment (scrub and 50 min massage) which wasnt very expensive. The spa is very small and I didnt see any steam rooms or saunas available. My only complaint is that since the hotel is off the strip it becomes a bit difficult to catch a cab. My fiance and I waited about 10-15 min to get a cab on a Friday evening when we wanted to go out to dinner. Overall the hotel is very nice and roomy if you are travelling with a large party.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury just off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: lazydaze22
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved everything. The room was huge, it was wonderful having a full sized fridge, oven, stove, and microwave. We were able to bring back leftovers or order pizza in and then have an oven to reheat it the next day so it was actually edible. My younger sister enjoyed cereal and milk in her pjs watching TV each morning. It was a pleasant surprise to have a washer and dryer in the room so we did not have to cart home all our clothes smelling like casino smoke. The bathroom was amazing & the jacuzzi tub perfect after a long day. We loved looking out at the mountains each morning and night on the balcony. Internet connection was very fast & free since we booked online. All staff were so accomodating, even printing out our show tickets for us. There was never a wait for anything, which can take hours at other hotels in Vegas! The hot apple cider each evening was a wonderful, unique touch, especially since it was chilly. We are not coffee drinkers so it was exciting to see something we enjoyed as well! It was my 30th birthday and my sister's 16th. There was a nice note on the counter and chilled champagne and giant chocolate covered strawberries waiting in the fridge upon our arrival. All the little touches made it an amazing stay. Will stay here for all future trips to Vegas & have already told all our friends and family about it. It was a short walk off the strip, quiet, new, no loud casino attached, no smoking, & an incredible price. There was a gas station next door for snacks & the Tuscany behind the hotel with a 24/7 restaurant. The spa looked lovely, though we did not have time to enjoy it. Our only problem- it was so nice & beds so comfortable that we never made it out of the room before noon!!! Thank you for a wonderful birthday, and especially to the staff who did not believe I was 30 years old! Oh, how that made my day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BMS27
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Xmas. Large appt with view of strip. We were on flamingo road side (not koval road) therefore had view of stratosphere and mountains .....very beautiful first thing in morning. Huge appt with jacuzzi bath. Lovely new kitchens with black granite tops and stainless steel appliances. Crockery, cutlery and glasses all good quality. Customer service best we have had....nothing too much trouble. Problem with air con sorted within minutes of phoning...then they phone you back to check you are happy. One block back from strip but it is a big block..it is on the road directly opposite Bellagio so you come out right in the middle of things. We found it easier to go thru Ballys and come out the back, pass the employment centre, car park, then cross road and hotel on corner. Just a little bit too far when you are coming back from day on strip and feet are aching. Hotel very quiet must be soundproofed because we never heard any other guests. Heated pool and wooden loungers on roof of 5th floor. Wifi free at pool but not in rooms...$10per day in room. Note....only valet parking at this hotel which is a pain...If like us you are in and out of car several times per day it gets expensive tipping the guys who get the car in and out. Only minor irritations, wi fi & valet parking, but would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: nharem
Reviews.Content: A must!! Loved the indoor/outdoor heated pool. The room service was great. Meals were worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “best of vegas for family”
Reviews.Author: familyfencetampa
Reviews.Content: great room ,private bedroom,balcony,great bathroom jetted tub /full kitchen,washer dryer with soap . you gotta be kidding me ? no serious. coffee in room ( 20.00 for a pot of coffee at vetetian room service or walk 1/2 mile, 3 elevators to get some) staff was great to deal with had a last minute cancellation on room and they worked with us ,what a concept . old school service .stayed at venetian too pretty but not practical.wished we stayed at platinum whole 7 days .nathan at front desk was the man! great guy very helpfull. if we ever go to vegas again no doubt platinum is it .thanks mike k.

Reviews.Title: “a gem in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Pam-Ruislip
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a week at the Platinum hotel. This was our first visit to Las Vegas and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to a little haven from the frenzy on the strip. The hotel is only 10 minutes walk away from the strip and we used to detour through Ballys which we found was a good way to get onto the Strip. The staff are so helpful and were really responsive to our requests for info. We went on a trip to the Grand Canyon and when the bus was a bit late picking us up, the reception staff were on the phone to make sure we had not been forgotten. Our suite was wonderful with lounge and kitchen areas - so useful when we wanted a rest! We had a great time in Las Vegas - hope to return and would certainly come back to the Platinum hotel and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for New Year's Eve!”
Reviews.Author: vbaby
Reviews.Content: We live in Henderson Nevada but wanted to stay on the Strip for New Year's Eve. This hotel was recommended to us and it did not disappoint. We stayed a Princess Suite Strip View and it was fabulous! What a room! Full kitchen with all necessary amenities including an icemaker in the refrigerator door, fireplace, balcony, flat screen tvs to name a few. We would suggest to anyone coming to Las Vegas to choose this hotel because of the location as well as all the perks. Thank you for a wonderful way to bring in 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Relaxing Smoke Free Quiet Stay”
Reviews.Author: deep68
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Platinum Hotel for 3 nights over Christmas. There was one valet person when we arrived he seemed very stressed out and a little rude when we ask for help with our luggage, he said he did not have a spare cart. So we just emptied the car ourselves and carried our own luggage in. This however was the only small glitch in our entire trip and really not a bit deal for us. Check in was quick and we just had to take 2 trips in the elevator to carry our luggage to our room. We were upgraded to a strip view room. The room is wonderful. Huge kitchen, nice living room, large bedroom and huge bathroom. The balaony was a nice bonus too -at night we would see the strip in full colour!! Ww asked for robes when we arrived and they arrived in our room before we managed to get there from reception. We also has a broken hairdryer and the electricity went off (tripped breaker) - both situations were handled within minutes - could not ask for anything more. The best thing was how quiet the rooms were. We never heard anyone the entire time we were there. We went swimming one morning which was nice and warm with only 1 other person in the pool. We ate in the hotel restaurant for breakfast it is a really nice room with a view over the pool with contemporary decor - very calm. We would definately stay here again. Loved the off strip location and that the hotel was non smoking

Reviews.Title: “Like a rental condo with valet parking”
Reviews.Author: ToddNugent
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the Platinum, it has everything you need if traveling with your family. Nice large kitchen, living room, separate bedroom, large bathroom with shower and jacuzzi tub, 2 separate HD TVs, balcony. Parking is valet only which is nice since you don't have to walk far. It is located about 2 blocks away from the Strip. Good for avoiding the noise and commotion. Great place, friendly staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Truly luxe rooms - a fabulous Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: brisbane21
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Vegas I wanted to stay somewhere close to the action but far enough away that we could rest and relax in style. The Platinum Hotel certainly fit the bill. The walk to the strip is about 10 minutes, which is a small price to pay considering the hotel is non-smoking, non-gaming and blissfully quiet. Considering we stayed in the the base level suite, I can only image how beautiful the more expensive rooms are. The suite was beyond spacious, inviting and comfy. The bed was one of the softest we've ever slept in, and the hot tub was huge. The bathroom was very roomy, with two sinks proving most convenient. The lounge room had a large flat screen TV, and all the appliances and fittings in the kitchen were stylish and new. As far as the shared facilities go, special mention must be made of the heated pool, which remains open during winter and is fringed by large deck chairs and lounges. On our first night fire torches were lit outside, adding that extra bit of ambience as we looked on to the strip (it feels like a roop top pool, although it's actually on the fifth floor). The indoors / outdoors nature of the pool area is great, and the public hot tub is also excellent (very warm). There is free wi-fi in the restaurants and also in the pool area. I happened to check in on the eve of my birthday, and within 30 minutes of our arrival the check in staff member had sent a bottle of sparkling wine to the room, which was a nice surprise and a great start to our stay. Room service will bring up basic toiletry items (razors etc) and other things like laundry powder (if you have a washing machine in your room) free of charge. The hotel prides itself on its service and when you do ask for something, they ensure you receive what you need promptly and even ring the room shortly after to ensure you received it. We had a problem with the safe in our room and a staff member was upstairs within five minutes, even refusing a tip when I offered one. I also asked them to arrange our airport shuttle on departure and this was done without a fuss. The gym is very clean and has a great range of equipment for a hotel gym. You really could put in a proper work out there if you desired. We ate at the restaurant once and, being the only ones there, service was prompt and friendly. The food - while not stellar - was decent value. The only negatives were that the on-site day spa is closed several days of the week, and when I did go in to enquire about their services the receptionist was a touch frosty. That was a shame, as the prices seemed low for Vegas and the spa itself looked nice from the reception area. The business centre computer charges are also on the expensive side, and it would've been great to have free wi-fi throughout the hotel. I am already planning to bring a group of friends to Vegas in the future and will certainly be booking rooms at the Platinum Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip/Swimming Outdoors in Winter? Yes!”
Reviews.Author: dianedennis55
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Platinum on Christmas afternoon and were permitted an early check-in. Wait in line: 3 minutes. We were given an upgrade to the highest floor with a washer/dryer in suite. Unlike most casino hotels, there is a coffee pot in the room. We loved the full kitchen although this trip we only used it to reheat the pizza we ordered. (Order from Metro Pizza at Ellis Island--they have specials on Sundays & Thursdays, buy one get one free). It was nice to have the mircrowave to reheat as desired throughout the day. I might add that Ellis Island has a great barbeque restaurant and it's a very quick walk around the corner from Platinum. We also used the washer/dryer (they furnished pack of detergent). My mom is a swimmer and really enjoyed the indoor/outdoor pool. The water was really warm (almot too warm) but it was fun to be swimming outdoors in late December with the air temp around 46. The pool is very nice. They have fire pits and plenty of seating. The strip hotels can be seen from this area and it's beautiful in the evening. We spent alot of time (both day and night) swimming. The fitness center had nice equipment and I only saw one other person use the facilities when I was present. Of course I did wake early (6:30am) so I assume most people are not so crazy while in Vegas and would prefer to sleep in. Speaking of sleep, very quiet hotel and peaceful sleeping conditions! Anyone that is coming to Vegas with a family, this is a great place to stay--close enough to the strip, but far enough away from the craziness. We asked to see a two bedroom/two bath and it was huge, with an enormous dining room table. We may be returning in May for a family reunion! Oh, and the rate was fantastic--approx $109 a night.

Reviews.Title: “RETURN IN A HEARTBEAT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jumpstart15
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness and service are high priorities to me. The Platinum met these requirements in spades! The parking attendants were quick, knowledgeable and helpful. Front desk responded to my requests in a timely manner and the room was very clean. I will return just for the service - IT WAS GREAT!!!! Oh, I forgot about the cookies in the lobby - they were warm and SO GOOD.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a family”
Reviews.Author: PB1Oxford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over Christmas, We all had a lovely time. The Platinum is a clean, bright, safe place to stay. This is not a luxury hotel with all the glamour that Vegas brings, but it is a great hotel away from it all. I would recommend to anyone with children as the rooms are massive. They got our reservation mixed up, but upgraded us to a larger room, so we were happy. The view was of the mountains, which I have to say was one of the nicest views we have ever had! We slept with the curtains open & just watched the sunrise, AMAZING!!! Service was fabulous, so fast, could not fault! Would go back next time we visit Vegas if we take our children.....

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious - Definite stop for families”
Reviews.Author: GoSeePlaces
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean atmosphere and friendly staff. Jet bath tub and full size kitchen amenities pays for itself. Strip view balcony was too good. Only item of shortcoming, was delayed housekeeping schedules, not sure if it was due to holiday rush/crowd. Couple of days the room service was done late in the evening around 6pm.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Rory68
Reviews.Content: Everything about The Platinum is amazing. It was refreshing to be away from the noise and smokey atmosphere of the strip. The staff are overly kind and go above and beyond. We even got a call on our first night asking how our room was! Incredible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: cornish24
Reviews.Content: Based on previous Tripadvisor reviews, we decided to stay five nights at the Platinum and are extremely glad we did. After the short cab ride from the airport, we were warmly welcomed at the front desk (no tedious line-ups) by Nathan, who showed a genuine interest in why we were visiting Vegas, etc., while at the same time maintaining a very professional demeanour. Throughout our stay, all front desk staff and valets greeted us in a friendly manner, and we really liked the personal touch. It was wonderful to return to a more sane, peaceful environment after the hustle and bustle of the Strip, yet it was barely a ten-minute walk away. Granted, as others have mentioned, the vacant lot strewn with beer bottles en route isn't very appealing, but all one has to do is to walk on the other side of the road to avoid it! And we never felt unsafe walking back from the Strip at night. We didn't hear a sound from any other guests during the entire stay, even when it got busy around Christmas Eve! Our suite was on the twelfth floor with a lovely mountain view, which we enjoyed from the balcony. The suite itself had a fully equipped kitchen with breakfast bar, a living room with flatscreen TV, and a separate bedroom with its own TV. as well as a large bathroom with whirlpool and twin sinks. The beds were super comfortable. We encountered a small problem with the kitchen light not switching off, but it was dealt with immediately with a follow-up phone to call to check if it had been satisfactorily resolved, which I thought was a nice touch. My only complaint is that while the bathroom was sparkling, the bedroom and living area didn't look as if they had been thoroughly cleaned prior to our arrival. There was a layer of dust on the coffee maker, the telephone, and the clock radio; and I had barely taken a few steps on the carpet before the bottom of my black socks became totally white --nothing that a good vacuuming wouldn't cure, however. Apart from that, everything was tidied up and towels etc. replenished daily. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Platinum, and it will definitely be our first choice if ever we return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: giantsno1
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about the entire staf especall the Valets, They where all around a great group of people they went out of there way to help very friendly and The Valets would talk to you like you are old friends ( i liked that) i was there to get married and me and my wife where very glad we chose Platinum and look forward to staying there again, The suits where excellent size furnished very nicely, and where quite clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, spacious room and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: J0-chan
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in my lovely suite right now after having a delightful first night's stay at this hotel. This has been a nice change from staying at a noisy, smoke-filled strip hotel where you have to walk 5 miles just to get from where you parked to the check-in desk. Every staff member we've encountered has been very gracious and professional. Got room service for dinner last night and the food was delicious. The room itself is huge and a great value for what you get. We brought some of our own food and cooked ourselves breakfast this morning in the fully-appointed kitchen. Everything has been wonderful so far and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Emerald3
Reviews.Content: What a great stay - friendly and efficient staff. Wonderful suites with great housekeeping. Lovely indoor and outdoor pool and for us a great location. We love the fact that it is non smoking and no casino noise. We will def. be back and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You MUST stay at the Platinum!”
Reviews.Author: 1Monica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum in December, 2009. I was looking for a non-smoking facility as we were in town for the Las Vegas Marathon. Didn't want smoke filled lungs before we started the race! I could not have been happier with my decision! I will never stay anywhere else. We've decided to try something different this year, and are heading to Vegas for Christmas. The Platinum is the ONLY place I would ever consider for a stay at Christmas. The level of service we received on our first visit was unsurpassed. Eva was amazing and was so helpful in every way, thank you! I am completely confident that our upcoming stay will be perfect. Can't wait to arrive on 12/23!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Off Strip Option”
Reviews.Author: bryancox08
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a week in Vegas celebrating my 50th Birthday, I have to write to recommend the little known jewel that is the Platinum Hotel. We were looking for a centrally based hotel but just off the strip without living in a casino. This non smoking spa hotel met all our needs and more. Located 5 minutes walk east of Bally's and from the monorail at the back of the Flamingo the location was perfect. All of the staff were friendly and helpful, no queues at check in and the rooms were large and spotless. On arrival I mentioned I was here to celebrate my birthday and to my surprise a complimentary bottle of Champagne was delivered to my room 15 minutes after check in (a very nice touch). This was just an example of the superb customer service we received during the whole of our stay. The front desk and concierge staff would go out of their way to be helpful including making reservations for dinner at other hotels despite the fact they had a very acceptable and reasonable restaurant of their own (we ate there 3 times 1 Breakfast a Mid afternoon light meal and once in the evening and on each occasion the food and service was excellent). There is no casino in the hotel but you are only 100 yards away from one if you really need to gamble 24/7. There is however a fully equipped gym, top class Spa offering a wide selection of treatments and a heated swimming pool that is half indoors and half outdoors making it ideal the whole year round. we went swimming in the middle of December and the pool was a really pleasant temperature. Although It has 16 floors with about 20 rooms to a floor you are made to feel like an individual and not a number. For anyone who wants to relax at their hotel when not involved with the madness of the strip this is an excellent choice for a quality hotel without any gimmicks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: joehansen1949
Reviews.Content: We booked the Platinum based on Trip Advisor reviews. The staff are very friendly and attentive. Check in was a breeze. THey have only valet parking but it is free. The suites are spacious and well appointed. Full kitchen; nice living room; balcony with table and chairs; bath has double sinks, nice tiled shower and large jetted tub. Very good value for the money. 10-15 minute walk on E. Flamingo to the strip. Biggest bummer with walk is having to walk past Ballys sorry excuse for grounds maintenance. We had only breakfast in the restaurant but they had very attentive servers and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Ourstanding space and value”
Reviews.Author: Jake44106
Reviews.Content: Just two long blocks from the strip, the Platinum Hotel is close enough and far enough away from the craziness. The rooms are spacious....I've lived in smaller apartments!.... clean and well appointed. The staff is uniformly courteous and the complementary Sunday NYT is an added feature. Would definitely stay there again.... The only amenity missing was bathrobes!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vancloninger
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located 2 blocks off of the middle of the strip. A 10 minute walk is worth it. Everything else about this hotel is fantastic. Great room, all suites, kitchen, granite countertops, flat screen TVs, large bath, balcony, great service, nice restaurant, quiet non-gaming. We have stayed in Vegas 3 times prior but this hotel is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Would be hard to stay anywhere else in Vegas after spending five days here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ellie_123_777
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Vegas with my 2 year old daughter to meet my mother and sister. We stayed four nights at the Platnium and loved it. The bell hops /vallet were great...they always called me by name and would talk to my daughter and ask her about her day. They really went above and beyond to make us feel special. I was worried about only being able to vallet park, but I never had a problem getting my car. They were super fast and very friendly. There is hot cider and homemade sugar cookies in the lobby and the front desk staff is very nice and helpful too. Each room has their own full size fridge, microwave, dishwasher, stove and oven. We went to Vons and got a bunch of groceries so we didn't have to eat out every meal. The pool was great...it is heated and was the perfect temperature. My daughter loved swimming between the indoor and outdoor pool (it is connected). We had the whole pool to ourselves. It is a very easy walk to the strip. We had a beautiful view of the mountains facing Flamingo (we didn't pay to have a strip view and I am glad because the mountain view was so nice). At 2am I realized the sensor in the light switch was broken and I couldn't turn off the kitchen lights....they had maintance in the room within minutes and the switch was replaced. Very fast service at such a late hour. This is a great hotel and I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly efficient service Made us feel valued”
Reviews.Author: cookiecalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days before and after our 8 day trip to Death Valley. We had done a lot of research on hotels in Vegas before we made the reservation as there seemed to be issues with every hotel. We were very happy with the quality of the room, a one bedroom suite with kitchen, balcony and huge bathroom with jacuzzi tub and view of the strip. It was quiet and clean. We arrived late and were concerned that our room would not be what we were expecting but we were very impressed that we could make some choices to have the quietest room possible. We were celebrating our 36 wedding anniversary and were very pleasantly surprized with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries provided by the hotel. The front check in staff Eva was sure listening to our conversation. When we walked thru Bally's Hotel there was a huge lineup and people behind the check in desk sure weren't smiling like the staff at the Platinum. The staff showed an interest in our stay. When we returned from Death Valley we wanted to drop off our luggage and the valet staff was great with helping us park the RV and with our luggage. The fellow also took the time to enquire about our experience at Death Valley. The location of this hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the strip which may not be to some people's liking but the fact that it is non smoking and there is no gambling sure is a pleasant surprize and adds to the quality of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: danny358
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many top hotels around the world, but our stay at the Platinum was the best we have ever experienced. The hotel is great and the suites are superb. However its the staff that make this hotel what it is, without exception they all treated us like we we were family, nothing was too much trouble, one day when we were waiting for a cab, they offered to take us for free in the house car and then gave us the number to collect us when we were ready. Fantastic service!!! Do not stay anywhere elese in Vegas, this is the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sruffs
Reviews.Content: As this was our first trip to Vegas I spent hours looking at which hotel to stay in. We thought the strip might be too noisy so we opted for the Platinum. I nearly changed it to a strip hotel at the last minute, I'm really glad I didn't! Check in was very easy, the staff were all incredibly polite. Even though we got there early there was no problem going straight to our room. The person who checked us in commented from my ID that it was my birthday during the trip. I said it was and didn't really think any more of it. The valets were also always polite. After the first day, each time we went to get our car my husband (who did all the driving) was always greeted by name. We had a princess suite with strip view. The room was enormous! There was a nice large kitchen, large sitting room with a huge TV, large bedroom and a huge bathroom. The bathroom had a big whirlpool bath and separate shower. We also had a washer and drier which came in very handy. We were supplied with washing powder and drying sheets, once we'd used them we asked for some more. They arrived at our door within minutes of asking. We then got a follow up phone call to make sure we had everything we needed. We had free internet access for the duration of our stay as we'd booked via the internet. We were happy with the location as we were only a few minutes from the strip but the hotel was nice and quiet. On the evening of my birthday we had gone out to a show. About half an hour after we got back there was a knock at the door, my husband answered and there was a member of staff with a birthday card and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries. I thought this was a really nice added touch. We didn't eat in the restaurant but we did order room service on a couple of occaisons. The food was very nice and promptly delivered. One evening we stayed in the bar and the staff were very attentive and friendly. There was a swimming pool that was both indoor and outdoors, it looked nice but it was a bit chilly so we didn't use it. We absolutely loved this hotel and really cannot think of any negatives to comment on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....but.........”
Reviews.Author: scubatimm
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this place except the way the internet reservation system is set up to deceive you into thinking the Manicure, Pedicure and massage are "included" in your reservation by listing them on your reservation as three line items as a "0" unit cost and a "0" extended cost WHEN THEY REALLY MEAN THEY ARE NOT INCLUDED AT ALL! Those either should not be on the invoice AT ALL or it should be listed as "none" I am a General Manager of a retail outlet and work with invoicing daily so I'm not unfamiliar with clear invoices and I'm thinking that this is trying to get you to use the listed services and then get billed for them when you check out. We, fortunately, asked at the spa check in counter BEFORE we used the "included" services! Great hotel......beware the "included" spa services.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!! What a great value!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrapp123
Reviews.Content: Great Rate.......Just like a high end apartment ...washer/dryer...Full kitchen....super nice ..But....the staff were great.....so nice ....so helpful...I just can't say enough...No smoke ...no noise...no casino...no drunks that just lost $2500 that they didn't have...I'm only staying here every time in vegas...great pens too

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...every second!”
Reviews.Author: jammex88
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here once before and really liked it. It did not disappoint this time either. Location is great...walking distance to the Strip but not on it. Rooms are very nice and comfortable. You do not hear noise from other rooms or the street. Giant room, Jacuzzi tub, full kitchen, flat screen tvs. The whole hotel is NON SMOKING! Love it. No casino (which I like). Complimentary Wifi, complimentary use of the exercise room. On and on...great stay!

Reviews.Title: “A terrific find in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: screen_nameMidwest
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our way to Death Valley National Park - and wished we could have stayed longer. Upon our arrival, the front desk spontaneously offered us a room on a higher floor. We ordered room service for dinner, and the server was very friendly. The food was reasonably priced, too. We had the two room suite (900 sq. ft?). I was impressed that I could even stretch out on the sofa in the living room. We were not in Vegas for gambling, and don't smoke, so this hotel was perfect for us. I'd absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: happy619
Reviews.Content: Great if you are looking to be away from, but close enough to, the strip. Wonderful location, as I had a car and Platinum Hotel is in a very central location. Upgraded to Princess Suite, which was large and view of strip. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic non smoking suite alternative to a stay on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: vander5
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our early check on Thanksgiving day with Eva, upgraded to a princess suite with extra room, visiting family in Las Vegas. Platinum Hotel suites is a great way to enjoy Vegas without the craziness of hotels on the strip, it's a pleasure to enter a hotel without the smoke filled chaos and casino distractions. Everyone from valet to the service in the lobby bar, to Eva at the front desk were friendly, courteous and helpful. We will stay at Platinum again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! This will be our new place to stay in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Alimom15
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice over the Thanksgiving week, on our way to and from Zion National Park in Utah. Appreciated that the hotel was casino and smoke-free. Enjoyed the spacious suites and made use of the pool and fitness center. Willl definitely stay here again the next time we are in Las Vegas. Only negative is that you have to valet park.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for huge suite off the strip”
Reviews.Author: ckwrsr
Reviews.Content: We booked four nights at the Platinum the week of Thanksgiving. While there were many great things about it, I thought a couple of things were disappointing. If you just want the bullet points: Pros: Huge suites for the money Great location, not far off the strip No smoking or casino Friendly,helpful staff No resort fee Free valet parking (obviously not including tipping) Free wireless internet due to booking online; otherwise you have to pay for it in your room Cons: Other areas of the hotel were a bit weathered Maid service was disappointing as we had to ask daily for things that should have been restocked (see below) Spa not open every day No concierge the whole time we were there The suite: Stayed in the princess suite strip view. At check-in, I asked if we were in one of the upper floors. No, but she easily put us in the 16th out of 17 floors. We had a great suite which was at the end of the hallway. We were never bothered by any noise or other people. In fact, I never saw anyone else up on our floor (or on any of the floors except for the lobby). Great kitchen, full oven/stove, full refrigerator. Also stocked with plates, silverware, etc. No pots and pans, but they'll deliver them if you ask. Small dishwasher which didn't get the dishes incredibly clean. Washer and dryer were very helpful (soap supplied.) Also coffee maker, coffee, etc. Granite countertops and comfortable stools for the counter seating. The living area was nice too with a flat screen TV, fireplace, and balcony. The bedroom was big with another TV in it. (not flatscreen). The bedding was nice enough, but the mattress itself was a bit hard. We asked for more blankets and pillows. The bathroom was huge: double sink, shower, huge bath tub. Also the room was supposed to have robes which we had to call for. The robes were awesome! The lighting in the bathroom was a bit lacking which didn't matter to us, but I know that it does to some people. The suite was over 1100 square feet for about $124 per night. We used to stay at the Signature MGM and the rooms were much smaller and more expensive. The service: Valet guys were very nice. They gave us a ride a couple of times when we asked for a cab ("as long as you take care of the driver"). There was often only one front desk person which meant that we had to wait in line about 80% of the time. When calling for something like extra towels, they were very friendly and prompt. They'd almost always call back to make sure that the item had arrived. The room cleaning service was the most disappointing. The bed was made, but often the towels were not restocked (although the used ones were taken away), the dishwasher was not started, and dishes were left in the sink. Coffee and dishwasher soap not restocked either. Although I didn't mind calling for these things, it would have been nice if they would have been here already. Plus, it seemed that there was always the expectation that you tip for them bringing things up which should have already been here. Also, the garbage was not often emptied unless I left it out. My adivce on the missing items: once you arrive, take stock of what you'll need: robes, towels, dishsoap, pots/pans, spatulas, knives, etc. (these were among the items we had to call for). Call once. Daily, as we left we stopped at the front desk to ask for missing items. The pool: Part indoor/part outdoor. We didn't use it, but it looked nice. The workout room: Nice machines. Room itself looked weathered. I used this several times, and there was never anyone else there. Also, the "complimentary headphones" were never available. Sanitizer cloths to wipe things down were dried out. Guess no one exercises much here? Overall, we would definitely stay at the Platinum again. If you are looking for someplace very glamorous where you will be constantly catered to, this is probably not the place. However, if you would like the full suite for a good price, off the strip with no casino or smoking, it is perfect. My main disappointment was the inattention to detail when it came to the gym and the room ammenities. Otherwise, great place!

Reviews.Title: “You must consider this hotel as a serious Vegas option”
Reviews.Author: janemc315
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews before we travelled, I had to admit I had high expectations of this hotel and we were not disappointed. On arrival we were told that our room had been upgraded to a strip view suite on 15th floor. As we were there to celebrate my son's 21st birthday, this was a real bonus. The attentiveness of the staff on the first night was exemplary-nothing was too much trouble. The room was overly spacious with a beautiful kitchen (fully equipped), a massive bathroom with huge shower and separate whirlpool bath. The lounge had a sofa bed which we used as well as a separate bedroom with 2 queen beds. The view of the strip was beautiful especially at night. The walk to the strip is something you do have to consider seriously as it does impact on how you plan your day. We ate in the restaurant once for breakfast and I have to say I was disappointed with the service as we waited for over 40mins to receive our food whilst other diners who arrived after us received their food ahead of us. However this didn't detract from our enjoyment. Thank you to the manager and his staff for a memorable Vegas experience!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel, staying here every time I come to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lsapp
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very large, full kitchen, bathroom w/ hot tub and shower was a great treat. Welcome reception w/ wine and cheese was a great start to our trip. Perfect location. Clean. No casino in the hotel was a plus!! Free valet parking - wow!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great quality, would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: banker201055
Reviews.Content: Just off the strip, this location was fabulous. Close enough to walk to everywhere we wanted to go after business meetings during the day. The Platinum Staff was the best in providing our meeting place. Food and Beverage was a delight to work with! I realize we got a killer of a deal, but I would definitely recommend this place to others looking for a great place just off the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our family reunion trip here-- was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: katinSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here previously during the summer and enjoyed our stay, so recommended the hotel for our August Family Reunion trip. The management (I think his name was Nathan) and front desk did an outstanding job taking care of our bookings for 5+ rooms, despite all of our potentially confusing telephone calls to them (we have too many chiefs and no cooks in our family). The actual stay was really quite perfect- great, easy check-in, friendly and efficient front desk staff (surprising how so many hotels don't have this), spacious rooms with real kitchens you can cook in (instead of "kitchenettes" that are meant for looks rather than real cooking), and top-notch housekeeping (I'm a clean-freak, and boy-- housekeeping should be rewarded here because the rooms were super clean despite their large sizes!). Room service was also quite good and affordable. Gorgeous view from the pool area, and especially for the small kids in our group-- it was nice to have indoor and outdoor pool option. The only disadvantage to this pool is that it's not on the strip and not quite close enough to walk if really hot outside, so you'll want a car (which we had- so easy enough) or at least be OK with taking cabs around Vegas. Oh- and if you like parking your own car-- forget it, this hotel is valet-only. So-- just make sure that you give yourselves enough time to get your car and you won't be frustrated. The hotel was quite booked when we stayed but we didn't have any problems with the valet service taking too long. They do work fast there. One final thing- don't even THINK about staying here if you are a smoker. It's a total non-smoking hotel, which is actually the #1 reason why we chose to stay here in the first place. We have babies and toddlers in our group and really liked that the air was clean here. And because of the spacious room sizes with great lay-outs, it was easy for different members of our group to babysit the kids while the other adults went to shows, etc. We hope this place stays competitively priced- because would like to continue staying here for all future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Our Permanent Hotel Of Choice In Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MachineMac
Reviews.Content: Wonderful accomodations. The location just off the Strip avoids the noise and traffic, yet is close enough to be able to hoof it there if you want. The staff is always friendly, courteous and helpful. Not having a casino in the hotel is a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Non Smoking, Spacious Rooms, 2 blocks from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: RussellMD
Reviews.Content: Great service. Checked in fast. Large two room suite with kitchen and huge bathroom. Very quiet rooms. Fifteen minute, two large city block walk to the Strip. My medical conference was at the Flamingo... was I ever glad I stayed at the Platinum. Hotel rooms are actually small condos owned by individual investors. I was told this by the porter who drove me to the airport in the "owners SUV." They couldn't get a taxi fast so they just drove me in the hotel SUV. What a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for special occasions~”
Reviews.Author: CougarCrone
Reviews.Content: My friend, and her sister and I, drove in from San Diego, to celebrate a big birthday weekend. This was Halloween weekend, and we were quite excited, albeit dangerous;) The desk staff was very efficient and courteous, and honored my request for a high floor room. The suite was spotless, the bathroom, kitchen, living room all in great condition, as well as the bedroom and nice blacony for many photo ops. We stowed our wines, cheeses, and cold drinks in the full sized refrigerator, and put things away in short order. I was most impressed by in-house reservations, who went out of their way to make our stay relaxing and a real bargain, yet a quick cab ride or stroll, to the strip. Bravo! We will be baccckkk!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: telapi
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The suite was very luxurious, I feel like I was living big, but not with a big price tag, it was extremely reasonably priced! Had a full kitchen with stainless steel appliances, granite counter tops, living room, balcony, large bed room, large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. The staff was just great, so nice and very helpful. They saying "ask and you shall receive" fits this hotel perfectly!!

Reviews.Title: “Platinum hotel is a great non-gaming hotel near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: helenmwilson1
Reviews.Content: I simply love the Platinum Hotel and Spa. It is a great deal and has fantastic personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional suites, value and service. Friendly, professional staff who go above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: janice12371
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Platinum and were very impressed with the hotel. We stayed in the Princess suite which was very spacious and clean. Loved having a kitchen with a full sized refrigerator, stove, and microwave. It even had a dish washer. It was great being able to bring back leftovers from dinner and having them for lunch. The bathroom was huge. Our suite had a washer and dryer. It was really nice coming home with clean clothes! We enjoyed having breakfast on our balcony. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. We cannot say enough about the excellent service we received during our week stay. The staff was ALWAYS friendly, professional and most accommodating. On a scale from one to ten, we would rate the Platinum a ten! We are looking forward to staying here every time we visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Karen R
Reviews.Content: I happened across this hotel on a travel website on which the Platinum Hotel & Spa had a promotional special. Thought I'd give it a try. It was a great find - the room was so spacious and luxurious. Slept very soundly on the oh so comfortable bed. Although on a major street, the room (on the 5th floor) was quiet and restful. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, spacious room, away from the busy strip but within easy reach when you want it”
Reviews.Author: Tenerife106
Reviews.Content: We found the suite ideal, we had a huge fridge so cold drinks were easy to get, the dishwasher and washing machine and dryer we weren't sure we would use but they all came in so handy, the staff were friendly and helpful. The walk to the strip is easy but if you don't fancy it the bus stops outside and takes you straight there, the $7 for 24 hours Deuce card can be used on this bus too so that was really handy. Next time I am in Vegas I won't look anywhere else, by booking direct we had free wi-fi too which was a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: Enouy
Reviews.Content: Excellent apartments. Superior staff. Top notch in every department. Ten nights not one complaint

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in a city of fauxs”
Reviews.Author: KentArno
Reviews.Content: This is by far the nicest hotel in the city. A royal treatment, kind, friendly, amazingly comfortable, spacious, a beautiful spot amid the gaudy glitz. You cannot go wrong unless you pass this one up. And it's smoke-free - THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! Not only do I recommend this spot to travellers and business folks, I'm going to go back just for a weekend retreat with my wife just because it's there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice price for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly W
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my sister Oct. 26-30 and I was amazed. I previously stayed at the Bellegio, but after looking at the Platinum I get twice as much for less. When I arrived Matt upgraded me to a princess suite with a washer dryer and nicer view. Was in room 918 and it overlooked the pool and directly at the strip. Nice rooms, only issue I had was on my second day housekeeping didn't clean my room. The third day when they cleaned my room, they didn't leave washclothes or handtowels. Also the site said no pets, but I saw a man with a dog in the lobby?? Other than that had no issue or problems. There are some hidden gems for deals at ellis island and tuscany next door, and terrible's down the street. Walk to the strip is not that far. Also recommend Hash house a go go a imperial palace beside the flamingo for breakfast/dinner.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis just off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: jms1121
Reviews.Content: The Platinum is an excellent quiet non-gaming boutique hotel just off the Vegas Strip. We have stayed there several times, particularly when they have specials for ~$100 per night. The rooms are immaculate and gigantic, with full modern kitchen, living room, bedroom and huge bathroom with shower and jetted tub.The fitness room is one of the best I have seen in a hotel and has ellipticals, treadmills, a stair climber, free weights and weight machines. The only downsides are location (it is a bit difficult to navigate into the lot and too far off the strip to walk anywhere), requires valet parking, and does not have free internet in the rooms (available in public locations). I highly recommend the Platinum if you are looking for an escape from the lights and noise of the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettyirene
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this casino-free hotel. The lounge is small, intimate, comfortable and has great service with Happy Hour every day. There is a Reception every Wednesday with wines and snacks. Every employee is attentive and interested in the guest's comfort. The hotel is modern, clean, quiet and smoke free. The rooms are large with separate bedroom, large bathroom with wonderful big jetted tub, a very comfortable seating area and large, stocked kitchen. The Strip is within walking distance about three blocks away. There is an indoor/outdoor pool that is clean and is separated from the restaurant by large glass windows for viewing. And, best of all, is the restaurant!! Great food at good prices. It is not a rushed atmosphere but the service is prompt and the food is delivered in a short time. Ya gotta try the FRENCH TOAST!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent escape just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: jammies
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at The Platinium in a suite and could not be more impressed. This hotel is located one block (about 8mins walk) from the strip but is a complete escape especially with it being a non-smoking non-gambling building. Stayed midweek (weekend rates much higher unfortunately) in a suite that was furnished with absolutely everything, 2x Tv's, washer/dryer, microwave, dishwasher, halogen hob,massive fridge freezer (with door water and ice dispenser), loads and loads of cupboard/hanging space and best of all.... two person jacuzzi bath. The suit consisted of three rooms, spacious lounge/kitched area, very genourously sized bedroom and massive bathroom with the jacuzzi and a seperate shower. On top of all of this was provided a small balcony with furniture. The accomodation has no resort fee unlike many other Vegas hotels but internet was not included and cost and additional $10/day. They do have free wi-fi zones including the restaurant, lounge and pool area. It was possible to crash the pool free wi-fi from the balcony but it was cold sitting out there during our stay. Free water from the fridge saved us about $10 day and also provided free of charge was washing powder for clothes, dishwashing detergent and ground coffee the in-room coffee machine which was a lovely touch. Re-fills for all the above were available at any time with a simple call to reception and delivered in minutes not hours with a follow up call from reception to ensure delivery which was excellent attention to detail. We can afford to travel extensively by picking great hotels at resonable prices and The Platinium has gone to the top of our list. Unless you want the ultimate Vegas experience and can afford it then go to Wynn, Mandalay or Bellagio etc... otherwise forget the cigarette smelly noisy strip hotels and try Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nellie019
Reviews.Content: After much research on trip advisor the Platinum was our choice of hotel for a two day stay in Vegas. It did not disappoint! The suite was spacious, clean and very well appointed. It was also so nice not to have the scent of cigarette smoke in the bed linens. We took advantage of the happy hour drinks and tapas in the bar one night which we found relaxing and good value. The short walk to the strip was not a problem and to have the option of a quiet retreat from the chaos was a bonus. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas with a Grand Child - Just Right”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonFive
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this Hotel after visiting Disneyland with our Grand Daughter. We wanted to show her Las Vegas without the "Magnificient Nightlife Scene'. We were guided to this Hotel by TA's, and simply what a gem. The gentleman who man the valet parking were awesome. We had 6 suitcases, 5 carry-on bags, 14 Disneyland bags and 6 bags of groceries. Nothing was a bother. Certainly an appropiate tip was given however the service was 5 star. My wife lost her camera in the confusion, and this was returned within 15 minutes from the cars valet location. They would not accept another tip. The suites are large, and the view of Las Vegas was indeed worth that little extra. A 7-11 is nearby, and for fellow Australians it is reasonably priced compared to home. The kitchen was excellent, the location just a (las vegas) block from the strip, and a short walk to the monorail. Remember kids 5 and under travel free. We really enjoyed the stay at the Platinium, and to quote my 5 year old Grand daughter, 'the pool that goes inside and outside is simply the best ever'. I sensed that the hotel as after the young business market, however for a young family it is strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Jamie2601
Reviews.Content: The room is amazing. Has everything and more you would want from a room when you have spent a crazy day or night on the strip. We holiday 4 times per year and it is by far the nicest room and has the nicest staff that we have ever encountered. From the breakfast waitresses, reception, bar staff and porters all polite, friendly and helpful. A porter even weighed our suitcases for us before we left for the airport as I didnt want our cases to be over the 23Kg limit. The only thing that really spoiled our experience was the WAKKA weekend in the middle of our holiday. After a day on the strip, we had got into a routine of going back to the hotel at 4 ish and spending an hour by the pool relaxing and then spend another hour or so at the bar having happy hour. However, on Friday 8th October, all hell broke loose. At 4pm there must have been over 100 young, loud, drunk, boisterous people around the pool. We abandoned the pool and tried to get in the lift to go to our room. No chance. The lifts were being used as a good game, by going up and down with loud, laughing people in them and the lift never stopped on the 5th floor to let us in. After 5 mins we found the stairs. Thought we would go the the bar lounge and have the happy hour before we ventured out for the night. The happy hour had changed to accommodate the WAKKA weekend. No half price drinks. Our usual round of 1 glass wine and 1 bottle Coors lite was usually $5.75 now was $9. We complained, but got nowhere. No where to sit, was completely full of people. For 3 days we had to put up with this. Was soooooooo glad they had all gone by Monday 11th October, but we were leaving on the 12th. I am aware that they were paying guests like ourselves, however, I thought the managment should have informed us that we could experience a lack of facilities on 3 days of our 6 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: KristiG98
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with husband and three kids & the hotel was great! The rooms are spacious & allow for the kids to run around & be kids. Pool was great & the hotel location is not far from the strip. The only down side is that you must use Valet parking which equals you need to tip everytime you go somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: KyFoodGuy
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay for 4 nights. Suites are as advertised, very roomy and excellent bathrooms. Slept like a rock on very comfortable bedding. Just a short 10 minute walk to the 4 corners at Flamingo & LV Blvd. (Bally,Flamingo, Ceasars, Bellagio). Staff are very courteous and helpful. My only concern was quality of water for shower/bath and tap water (refrigerator is filtered) , but this is probably true in almost all Vegas hotels. Free Wi-Fi in publc areas is nice and the extended happy hours are also cool. Nice pool area but not a lot of direct sun this time of year. AM-PM and 7-Eleven are next door and Ellis Island and Tuscany casinos are a next door also. Lawry's and McCormick & Schmick are also just a short walk. With continuing low rates this place should be a favorite for travelers not wanting the full strip experience for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “It was great - will go again!”
Reviews.Author: Ckolody
