Reviews.Content: We enjoyed it at the Platinum. I hate casinos, so it was nice to stay in a hotel without one. We were just 10 minutes from the strip (or you can take the bus) so we were close to everything. Loved the pool area. They gave us the wrong room the first night, but they fixed things the following day and comped our breakfast. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Top class place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brisbaneblue
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the absolute pleasure of staying at the Platinum for 3 nights (10/14-10/16).As many have said before me , the rooms are fantastic for the price you pay , its very close to the strip and everything one could need is close by. My biggest praise however has to go to the staff at Platinum who really do ensure that you have the best stay possible. A special thanks must go to Nathan in valet and Steve (Manager) who went above and beyond what I expected , it really was appreciated by my wife and I....thanks to ALL the staff for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: SmallBuisnessTravel
Reviews.Content: We chose the Platinum Hotel for our conference in Vegas because a non smoking, non gambling hotel was very important to us. We brought along a nanny and small child and didn't want them hanging out in a casino. I was pleasantly surprised by the size and luxury of the room we stayed in. The king bed was so comfortable and there was a pull out couch in the living room. The double bath tub was amazing after a long day on our feet, and the extremely large bathroom made it feel very extravagant. I was a bit worried about the location, but it was a very easy walk from the Ballys Monorail stop. I would, and have, recommended this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel 5 minutes walk from Strip”
Reviews.Author: Highland2
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Platinum Hotel in late evening by taxi from the airport (only 10 minutes drive). We were welcomed by reception staff and after enquiring about an up-grade (I noticed this had been done by previous guests on Trip Advisor reports) we were offered a Corner Suite, which was huge, and had a balcony overlooking the Strip, all for an extra $20 per night - well worth the additional cost. Our 3-day stay was terrific, - all the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and they organised an early-morning taxi for us on our departure. We didn't try the pool, and only had continental breakfast, but the whole property can be highly recommended and it is a non-smoking hotel with no casino, yet just a few hundred yards from all the action of the Strip. The 7/11 convenience store just outside the property was very handy. The highlight of our visit was the helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon - a must!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION TERRIFIC VALUE”
Reviews.Author: FamAdventures
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that didn't have a Casino and was non-smoking. I came across this hotel on TripAdvisor after looking online at many of the vast choices in Las Vegas. It ended up being an excellent choice for us. It had everything we needed and was literally a 5 minute walk to where the Bellagio is on the Strip. We booked a Princess Suite, mainly because it had a washing machine/dryer. It was immaculately furnished with a full kitchen (for those who wish to eat in). The suite was extremely spacious and comfortable. The staff were friendly and the hotel provides complimentary parking. The breakfast choices in the morning were excellent. The restaurant is located next to the pool. The pool is partly indoor and partly outdoor which provides a wonderful relief from the hot sun. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and highly recommend it to anyone traveling with children. The hotel is close enough to the action, but far enough to provide peace and quiet to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cypruslover7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from attending our Daughters wedding at the Bellagio where they were staying and would just like to add our comments. We chose the Platinum hotel after reading the reviews and was not dissappointed. The staff are a credit to the hotel and i wish i could remember all the names but unfortunatly cannot but would like to mention Matt on reception when we checked in who made us feel very welcome also the young lady on the reception at the spa on the day of the wedding last Sunday who repaired my nails at the last minute, thank you, also the two waitresses at the restaurant who were so cheerful and freindly. We had a wonderful week and really enjoyed our stay at the Platinum and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, would definately stay here again if ever we came back to Vegas. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Rooms and value”
Reviews.Author: TSExpert
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend. Very friendly helpful staff and quick check-in. Valet parking only is kind of a pain, but delays were not bad. No Casino, which helps traffic, and the nearest casino is only a 100 yards away. The room was fabulous. Huge, open suite, full kitchen with a full fridge. Separate bedroom and bubble tub in the bathroom for what you's pay for 4 walls anywhere else. Noisy when the drunks came home, but this is Vegas. Just two short blocks off the strip. I'd go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: csquire4
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel a nice distance away from the intensity of the strip. The suite is clean, spacious and well equipped. Staff are friendly, helpful and the hotel was nice and relaxing without a Casino contained in it which was a relief. The bar is very chilled with happy hour (half price drinks) every day between 5pm to 7:30pm (I think) which makes it a great place to start your night out., You won't be disappointed with this place. unless you want flashing lights and slot machines.

Reviews.Title: “no problems with this hotel great location!”
Reviews.Author: fillywidnesuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the platinum for 4 days and had no problems with this hotel.Having stayed at the Bellagio and Mgm grand their is one advantage the platinum has over hotels on the strip.......You choose when you take part in the madness!!!!....you do not always have this choice with strip hotels.When you want to party simply take a 5min stroll to the back door of ballys and its play time!!!!Pool area is totally chilled,everything is spot on,look no further for your vegas stay.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: heppy1239
Reviews.Content: Very quiet and nice! The colors are soothing. The room I stayed in which I think was the smallest was PLENTY big. The bathroom was great too - double jacuzzi tub! The bar in the lobby was great - great decor and friendly service. The pool area was beautiful - definitely somewhere you could relax

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly Hotel-Clean and close by Strip”
Reviews.Author: vlkt
Reviews.Content: My husband, infant son, and dog stayed here. There is a $75 non-refundable dog fee. It maybe $80 now. The lobby was nice, the rooms were spacious and we had a nice view of the Las Vegas strip. You could walk to the strip, if need be. We also went to the pool, which has an outdoor and indoor area. Valet Parking only. Overall, we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrmrshuff
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and had a great time. Check-in was granted early, large spacious apartment-like room was wonderful. Full kitchen, great mattress, great spa tub, separate shower, all very clean. The staff was also very accomodating and helpful. Walk to the strip was also safe and not too far - 10 minute walk or less. Our one suggestion would be that the concierge or front desk have access to the Well Spa appts. Had we known we couldn't get in on our last day (our Anniversary) until the last minute, we could have made other plans since Spa was closed the majority of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not your usual baby shower.”
Reviews.Author: Frances1652
Reviews.Content: A mutual friends daughter and son-in-law just had their 1st beautiful baby girl. Son is stationed outside of Las Vegas, with friends and family many miles away. So after 4 of us ladies decided to fly down for the celebration of this new little on, next came the "where do we stay" delemia. After much looking...we liked what the Platinum had to offer, pricewise, nonsmoking & nongaming. We weren't disappointed. The suite was spacious, clean, and very quiet, (considering the airport is so close). Great space for the 4 of use. Parking was free, valet, and friendly. The restaurant was reasonable, and the food was to par. Location was easy to get around to/from. And the pool was just what the 4 of us northreners need to unwind and enjoy some much need R&R.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BET in Las Vegas-Spacious, Clean, Amenity-filled Hotel and SUITE, Pleasing SERVICE Override the Walk to Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirly1
Reviews.Content: All of the Platinum Hotel and Spa's mostly positive reviews that my husband and I read on TripAdvisor.com ( thanks to the best travel website on the "Net"!) proved to be very true! TripAdvisor's numerous reviews added to the extensive research before our first vacation to Las Vegas- with so much to do there! Please read the wonderful reviews about the Platinum Hotel and now that we are home a few days after staying six nights, I will add our review..First, to the people who made our stay so special, I have to mention some names (ala the "Academy Awards"): HUGE THANKS to the Platinum Hotel General Manager Dennis Gradillas for the generous guestroom upgrade! Front Office Manager Nathan Rex for arranging the spacious, beautiful Princess Suite w/the private terrace Strip view on the 11th floor, the jacuzzi, fireplace, and the surprise gift of yummy chocolate- covered strawberries and champagne. All of these added to our romantic wedding anniversary celebration! Again thanks to the conscientious concierge Dita for highly recommending and last minute arranging a tour to a hidden gem-amazing, mystical Valley of Fire National Park! Our knowledgeable tour guide Mountain Buck of "Annie Bananie's Wild West Tours" made this particular tour far surpass any we have taken anywhere! Appreciation and thanks go to the smart Claire Nagel, office manager, for being so helpful and informative about great restaurants in the area. Many thanks to Barbara, our competent housekeeper who made our suite fresh each day for us! Thanks also goes to Michelle, the nice waitress in Kilowatts Restaurant where we enjoyed delicious breakfasts with a lovely pool view(Strip buildings and mountains in front as a backdrop!)! Thanks to all the friendly valets in the lobby entrance who opened, held the front door, and hailed cabs for us and of course all the other "behind the scenes" hard workers who keep the Platinum Hotel in tip- top 5 star shape for us to enjoy! We don't think you can get this level of impeccable and personal service in any mega hotel on the "Strip" in Las Vegas! Our feeling is that the Platinum Hotel and Spa's management and employees will try and keep guests extremely satisfied throughout their stay! That is why Platinum Hotel and Spa, you are really worth the 10 minute walk(not that bad a neighborhood- a well-traveled Flamingo Rd.) to the best-located center of the Strip , we found that out by walking through the mega hotels on the Strip, those are even longer walks just to get from your room to the front lobby! Another important perk to mention- NO annoying ala carte Hotel or non-optional "fees" to use the Platinum Hotel's up- -to- date gym equipment! So don't hesitate- book this truly quiet Oasis in the land of Las Vegas Overwhelming smoky Casino Hotels! We would definitely return and stay at the Platinum Hotel and Spa anytime! P.S.Also for gambling , we advise the small Tuscany Suites and Casino just east (next door on Flamingo) of Platinum Hotel for some actual winning slot action!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_traveller032
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Las Vegas. Not a casino but close to the strip. Excellent value for money and really friendly staff. We'd definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet for a Suite with full Kitchen”
Reviews.Author: pulitzer
Reviews.Content: Was in Vegas for a conference for a week. Had my family (including 2 kids) join me for the last 3 days of the trip. We are a little finicky about kids food and wanted something with a full kitchen and the Platinum exceeded our expectations. There were a few minor issues that were resolved within minutes of calling the desk. I doubt they will be able to maintain this level of service at the price.....so get it while it lasts! On a side note...you have not really visited Las Vegas if you do not go to the Red Rock Canyon and hike the Calico Tanks trail.

Reviews.Title: “perfect vegas get away”
Reviews.Author: daveros79
Reviews.Content: this place was amazing, we could'nt believe the room we were given was a suite it was just fantastic and perfect for a couple like us who were traveling on a budget and weren't expecting as much 5 star treatment we were given by all the staff there during our stay,for the small price we were charged . it was only a ten minute walk to the bellagio fountains as well ! i probably would'nt really recommend this if you are looking for a bit of a lads rowdy holiday though! LOVED this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this place!”
Reviews.Author: bosaknm
Reviews.Content: Wow! I booked the Platinum based on TripAdvisor reviews and a recommendation from a friend. We were blown away. The one bedroom strip view suite was fabulous. I echo the comments of many other guests in saying that this place is a steal. Great to have a kitchen, huge bathroom and space to sit out and enjoy the view. There is no way we could have gotten a room like this on the strip the days we were there for anywhere near this price unless we were big time gamblers getting our room comped. We enjoyed to pool area and the wonderful circular day beds - perfect for lounging. The walk to the strip was not bad at all and I never felt uncomfortable with the area. The valet staff were always very pleasant an quick to retrieve our car. It was our anniversary and the manager sent strawberries and champagne for us to enjoy - what a nice touch. Next time in Vegas this will be my choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant alternative to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Vancouverisrainy
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel with attentive staff, quiet, clean, with Internet, and not too far away from Caesar's Palace where I had 6 days of training. The Platinum is everything I was looking for. I didn't try the spa, but would have if I had more free time. Had several breakfasts at the Kil@watt and the staff and food were excellent. Ordered in-room dining several times and was very pleased with the main dishes; the salads and desserts were very small for the price, but overall the meal was very satisfying. What I liked about this hotel is the quiet, non-smoking and the quality of the room was almost as nice as my condo at home. I was able to take a cab to Albertson's grocery store at the beginning of the week, stock up on some food items and save money on dining. If I found I needed something, I just called the front desk and it was whisked to my room in a few minutes or less. Two minor things that could have been better: the skillet the hotel supplied did not sit flat on the stovetop (the bottom was warped like a potato chip); and I was hesitant to use the large jacuzzi tub because I feared the water jets would have bacteria in them. But aside from those two minor items, the room was very clean, very well apportioned and the staff very friendly and helpful. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: yajagoo
Reviews.Content: This place is a condo building with amazing views and clean rooms (very clean rooms). The staff is excellent, and service is even better. There is no casino so you do not have to travel through a casino filled with smoke to get your room. I highly recommend this place. Oh yeah, the pool is great!!!! My 15 month old son loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, near the strip”
Reviews.Author: Pjay78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in Sept 2010 & thought it was a good value for Vegas. It is not directly on the strip but is within a reasonable walk (or taxi ride if you do not care to walk). I found no issue at all walking from the hotel to the strip. It’s not far to the Bellagio (maybe a 10min walk). There is no casino at the the hotel so it would also be ideal for those who want to go to Vegas but wish to leave the noise of Vegas behind at the end of their long day. I enjoyed a very nice 50min massage at the hotel spa and it was wonderful. Their spa is very warm and welcoming. We stayed in a two bedroom suite that was very roomy and felt like being at home. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious suite for the same price as a nice hotel room”
Reviews.Author: feebles07
Reviews.Content: From when we arrived, well before check-in (and were checked in anyway by the lovely front desk staff), to when we left our spacious, elegant 'princess strip view suite', this hotel was an oasis in our travels. The suite is huge, and felt like a small apartment. We were comfortable, the kids loved the pool, and the breakfast was good too (not free). The only negative thing I have to say was that to walk to the strip, you could choose to walk on the same side of the road as the hotel (passing an empty parking lot and an unemployment centre), or to cross over an walk past other hotels/motels - my husband ignored my suggestion to cross over, and then we were hassled (just a few drunken comments called out - nothing serious) by a few drunk guys hanging out just in front of an unemployment centre. This was in the daytime. Coming home after dinner that night, we took a cab, just to be sure, as we have two primary school aged children. Overall, I would stay there again, as the suite was so good and at a great price, and the hotel, staff and facilities were excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room - very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: ravenfeeder
Reviews.Content: A little bit off the strip but worth the short walk. Very friendly staff and beautiful rooms. If a smoker, be aware that it is not allowed to smoke on the balcony. I you would like to be near everything but not in one of the big hotels, choose the platinum.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum Hotel - BEST Property & People in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: GoTexansFight
Reviews.Content: The Platinum Hotel is Incredible! The rooms are Huge, the Location is perfect (1 block off the Las Vegas Strip & in the middle of all anyone could want!) The Platinum People are true professionals & Claire is THE BEST, 1st class in service & care of her Platinum customers. I've stayed at the Platinum Hotel for the last 8-10 trips to LV & will continue to return to the JEWEL of the LV desert - The Platinum Hotel!! Thank you & keep up the Best service & care in the desert!! Your friend & loyal patron, rwr

Reviews.Title: “Wow! 100%! Best hotel in las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Noyo4012
Reviews.Content: I was in las Vegas for some business this week and needed a place to stay! Now off the strip is where I want to be! I decided to go on tripadvisor and I found the platinum. So where do I start! Well I want to thank the valet staff for an awesome job. Nathan greated me and my husband and helped us with our bags! He also told us he likes to think of the platinum ad close to the attractions without the distractions! The resturant was great! Food was yummy! Even got my husband to say yummy. Now the room! As the song says OMG! Hugh spaces and fully loaded with a washer and dry, dish washer, two person tub and a view of the strip! Which I might add is just a stones throw away as Nathan would put it! I am making this my home for now on! Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Best service, value and accomodations EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zentennis
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for my daughter's tennis tournament and discovered this hotel through tripadvisor .... booked a one bedroom with full kitchen and I was STUNNED at the amazing personal service and care the staff provided! Upon our late-night check-in we found two candy bars and a Good Luck card signed by all the staff written out to my daughter! What more could one ask?? In addition, as she was injured during the tourn and had to withdraw early, the manager allowed us to leave with no penalty for last-minute cancellation. Amazing all around. Our breakfast waitress was cheery & very service-oriented, the maintenance man in the elevator asked us how our stay was going and checked to be sure everything was OK, the valets were quick and kind and amazing... i just can't say enough about the staff and management at this hotel. Dennis was SO responsive by email and very attuned to our needs. The rooms? You CANNOT do better!!! HUGE, just like staying in a lovely apartment. Large bathroom with jacuzzi tub, nice view of the strip, large granite kitchen, two COMFORTABLE queen beds, clean clean clean .... if you are traveling to Vegas and prefer to have a kitchen, this is IDEAL. STAY HERE and you will NOT regret it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to escape the smoky dinging craziness that is Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Earth_Pal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another stay at The Platinum. Our first visit was May 09. The hotel has held up well. Great service from Nathan on finding me just the right room which ended up being the same as my previous visit, 1415. It is on the strip side and can see part of the Bellagio Fountains show thru the gap between Bally's and Paris LV. I enjoy walking back into the hotel after being in the smoky dinging craziness that is Vegas. It is a bit of a walk but you get used to it. Enjoyed being able to have breakfast or a drink at the end of the day on my balcony while watching the strip. This is a very relaxing hotel and I really appreciate how clean it is. My friend used the pool and enjoyed it for doing laps. I recommend this hotel for LV visitors like us... prefer to sleep in a quiet non-smoking room after enjoying the many shows in Vegas. We both look forward to returning someday soon!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: leakrepair
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay: 4star accomandations. Not on the strip but close enough. SMOKE FREE!!!!!!!!!!! Personell very accomadating. Not a HOTEL room but much more. Makes you feel like you are at Home. Exercise Area is Great! Wish it was open 24/7. I will stay here on both my business and leasure trips to Vegas. Need to have Free internet in rooms not just lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: molliescotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not have a Casino, so if you are looking for one of those then don't go to this hotel, we chose it because it would be quieter and also near enough to the strip to enjoy that side of Las Vegas. We chose a room with a balcony overlooking the strip, what a great view and lovely sitting out there looking at the sights of Vegas, especially at night when all the lights are on. When I say we chose a room, it is actually like a one bedroom apartment, fully fitted kitchen, open plan lounge with balcony, separate bedroom and hugh bathroom. The beds are superb and the hotel is very clean. All the staff at the hotel are very friendly and attentive, If we are ever in Las Vegas again we would definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best little secret in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DawnPierce
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from our stay at the Platinum. I do not have a single complaint about this Hotel. If you don't smoke, enjoy beautiful rooms and fantastic service this is the place for you. I do like to gamble but we like to stay for a week so I don't need a casino in my Hotel. There is a nice Casino at Tuscany right next door on Flamingo. Walking distance to the strip is only 5-10 mins. I would suggest going thru Ballys. I wish I remembered the names the staff, because I would have to compliment every single one we encountered!! Valet staff was excellent! We never had a wait to find one or get our car. The lounge was fantastic. I loved the pool because it was quiet and no problem with seating, plenty of it. I do not like to have to fight crowds just to find a seat. We did not use pool service because we brought our own food and drinks down with us. The rooms are even nicer than the pictures, and the jacuzzi tub was to die for. A very elegant and mostly quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pert near perfect”
Reviews.Author: JS27
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe this hotel was for real (non-smoking AND non-gaming in Las Vegas?), and was pretty nervous to see it. Turns out I was nervous for nothing: the staff was friendly and accomodating (sp?), the rooms were clean, big, and (mostly) quiet. And the location was as advertised, just quick walk (took approximately 5m) to all the sights and smells of The Strip. The pool/poolside area was clean and quite nice. Finally, the fitness room was spacious, clean, and had newer equipment in good condition. I would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax, and enjoy Las Vegas with my colleagues!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniellie143
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Platinum was so amazing. We spent our days relaxing by the pool with some delicious cocktails and were more than refreshed by our spa treatments at the Well Spa. The customer service of the team at the Platinum is more than accommodating and courteous. It was also so cool that all of our rooms came with a full service kitchen. Having the option of eating in instead of spending all our gambling money on restaurants was awesome. I would highly recommend this hotel to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: sylvia089
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing. The employees were very curteous and helpful. It was my first time going to a spa and the staff were really nice and made it a wonderful experience. The rooms and pool area were very clean. The restaurant was beautifully decorated and, again, the staff were great. My only problem with the restaurant was that it seemed a bit limited; they didn't "carry" certain drinks, they were "out" of certain foods. All in all, I had a great time and would defiinitely recommend The Platinum Hotel & Spa to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Lotus Ladies Went Platinum”
Reviews.Author: Catvision
Reviews.Content: I was totally impressed with my hotel stay at the Platinum. My room was exceptional, extremely clean and I loved the jacuzzi tub!! We had a wonderful business dinner at the main restaurant that was just delicious. We were also treated to a few the spa treatments, in which I was very impressed. The service, as well as the overall atmostphere of the Platinum was added bonus to our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: xxredstarxx
Reviews.Content: I thought it would be like any other hotel, I was amazed with the room and the service and the food. My weekend stay was fabulous. The food was delicious and the those who brought it were very nice. My room was very nice, had a huge tub in the spacious bathroom that was so relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a place I'd go back to”
Reviews.Author: F10NAL
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not look as glitzy as all the other hotels in Vegas, but once you go through the doors into the lobby, quality is apparent. My children (aged 10 up) all said they prefered that the Platinum was a quieter, non-gambling hotel. We were upgraded to Princess suites which are one bedroomed but slightly bigger than the entry level Solitaire suites (there were 7 of us in total and two suites were ample) although all the rooms in the hotel are suites anyway. The door into the suite leads into a fully equipped kitchenette - black marble work tops, breakfast bar with stools, dishwasher, fridge with ice dispenser, coffee maker etc etc. There is a large lounge area with double bed settee, large flat screen tv and hidden in a cupboard is a huge washer drier (if you fancy doing the laundry whilst on holiday!) The bedroom has two double beds, another tv, plenty of cupboard space. The bathroom has a double Jacuzzi bath and a separate walk in shower and his and hers washbasins. The pool is on the 5th floor and overlooks the Strip - it was spectacular in the evening, when we had the pool and hot tub to ourselves. After a day walking around the Strip, (its about a 5 minute walk to the Strip from the hotel, which brings you out in front of the Bellagio) we made use of room service; the portions were big enough for us to share a meal between two, which made it good value. We were given complimentary 'continental breakfast' for one morning, although in truth this comprised of a piece of toast, some fruit and a cup of tea. Las Vegas was our last leg of a tour of the USA that included NY, San Francisco, Monterey, Pismo, Los Angeles and the Platinum Hotel was the only one that we all said we would definitely go back to again and it compared favourably on price with all our other stops in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: SisterBeach
Reviews.Content: Held my wedding at the Platinum after visiting several locations (including the Platinum) in March. In addition to the wedding venue, I wanted a very nice place with space for my guests who would be traveling to Las Vegas for the wedding. The Platinum did not disappoint! I answered the question of "How did you find this place?" so much I wanted to put it on a T-shirt. :-) Most of my guests agreed it was well worth the off-strip, no casino aspect and loved the service, room size and overall feel. We held a welcome reception in one of the Marquis suites (2 bedroom/2 bath/living room/dining room) the night before the wedding, the wedding and reception in the Misora Room and a brunch in the Kil@wat restaurant the morning after the wedding. The catering department and Kathryn Knapp are wonderful to work with and very accomodating. My guests are still raving about the entire weekend and like my husband and I, can't wait to return. A few additional items worth noting: The food in the hotel delicious AND reasonably priced which is saying alot for a hotel. The happy hour every evening in the Stir Lounge is definitely worth catching. On more than one occasion there were hotel/catering staff who refused to take tips. This speaks volumes to the level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!! Off Strip, but really doesn't matter!!”
Reviews.Author: sair1985
Reviews.Content: Ok so our choice was on strip but at one of the ends, or off strip but centre. As you can tell we went for centre but off strip! 4 girls staying 4 nights at the Platinum. You are a block behind the Bellagio. Now i've been to Vegas I think we made the best decision. We have the privacy of our own hotel (we had no casino or nightclub, which means we had no flow of people coming in and out) - also in Vegas hotels are quite a walk apart. So either way you are going to walk lots! Which means the fact we were a block away didn't really make much difference. Our room was IMMENSE!!!!! Suite - kitchen, living room, bedroom and bathroom (shower, 2 sinks, toilet and a whirlpool bath!) - Best room i've ever stayed in. Bargain price too!!!! (I booked with ASDA Travel) Staff were good also - as it's off strip the cabs are a bit harder to get but the porter will nip out into the sun and get you one which means you can appreciate the air con a bit more! Also on our last day they got us the hotel car to take us to the airport rather than get a taxi - that means you just pay what you think is right. Pools were nice... one indoor and one outside - but they are connecting so you can still be near to your family and friends even if you have difference preferences!! FABULOUS!! Would recommend to anyone... lovely hotel to end our trip with!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: armymom123
Reviews.Content: Our son booked this hotel for us as an anniversary present. This was our first time to Las Vegas. There was a slight problem checking in; the hotel could only charge his card for one night of a 4 night stay (8/30-9/03) and needed a copy of his card to charge the rest. This might have been a problem since he is in the military and not always easy to get a hold of. Nathan Rex, the mgr. on duty, emailed him and took care of the whole thing for us. Then they had a bottle of champagne and a plate of the most delicious chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room to make up for the problem. The room was the most beautiful room we have every stayed in. We had a Princess Suite on the top floor (rm. 1715). The view at night was spectacular. We got some great pics of the strip. There was a table and 4 chairs on the balcony. We could also see the strip from our bedroom, which had a king size bed that was so comfortable, we almost didn't get up after a nap to go out to the strip. The sheets were so soft. The bathroom was pure luxury. First there are double sinks with granite countertops, a beautiful shower with a rain showerhead and then the two person jacuzzi tub. The kitchen was top of the line granite and stainless steel and all you need is right there. That opens onto a huge living area with a flat screen tv over an electric fireplace. The balcony opens off of the living area. I can't stress enough how clean this room was! We did eat at breakfast there and it was quite good and reasonable. The pool is great. You can swim from the outdoor side into the indoor pool, but that was a little chilly from the a/c. Plenty of outdoor beds to lie in and you can use the phone there to call in your order if you would like food or drink. The only drawback to this hotel is the location. The walk to the strip was a bit much for us. I have serious back problems and the walk did take us 20mins each way. One evening we needed a cab to go to Fremont St. and the doorman couldn't get one for us, so he offered to take us in the hotel car. The next night, we asked if he could run us up to the strip and he did. (Didn't mind giving a tip for such great service.) In the morning, they had cabs waiting to take you to the airport. Both the AM/PM mini market and the 7/11 are right next door. So is the Ellis Island Casino and behind the hotel is the Tuscany hotel and casino, so you don't need to walk to the strip for gambling. This hotel is on Flamingo Avenue, so when you walk straight up to the strip Bally's is on the left and Bill's Gambling Hall and The Flamingo are on the right. I would highly recommend this hotel. It may not be in the middle of the strip, but you can take a cab up to it and the room is absolutely gorgeous for such a reasonable price. The staff was so friendly and courteous and really made it a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute Best...Hip, stylish, brand new but Family friendly..Quiet, ooh so quiet...”
Reviews.Author: mp1NYC
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Bellagio for a few days we decided to extend our trip over the long weekend by another 3 days...Bellagio wanted $500 a night for what I consider a safe, overly pleasant, quiet, tiny drab room with a beautiful view(see my Bellagio review)..We decided No way and by pure accident found the platinum hotel via Google..The reviews were so perfect it was hard to believe..the website showed impossibly large well appointed rooms with an abundance of amenities all for $120 a day, that one would find in a upscale NY apt.. So we gave it a shot..Compared to the $500 a night we had just experienced we were still hesitant... We took a cab from the Bellagio to the Platinum($9) and yes its off the strip(not quite way off) but not so far off that you cant simply walk the very very long block to the strip(less not forget the heat(115 average we we were there and humid(not typical) but it was)...or you could always just cross the street and take the monorail which stops inside the Bally's..mind you there was no signage for this inside the hotel or outside the hotel..so Google and Jesus helped us find the fairly priced monorail... Back to the hotel, first impression, this place is new and while from the outside not super uber fabulously flamboyant like the rest of Vegas, it looks strong and beefy like something you would find in a earthquake zone better said, like a made to last upscale NYC apt building..the driver pulled up to the entrance where you could see the valet's hustling to move some cars into the valet only parking lot..so much so they were no where to be scene for luggage assist(but then again, I could carry the 2 carry-ons myself and didn't feel as if I needed to tip for this, so..) The lobby feels more modern than the outside and the staff was very pleasant as expected. We checked in early(2pm) and thus no wait..went up to the very large room(princess suite) and just WOW unbelievable.. ...the suite was the slightly higher princess and was not in front of the hotel but wow..you even get the impression that if the hotel thing doesn't workout they will sell these off as higher end condominiums(each room has individual breaker, heat, air, etc setup..yes I looked) the list of amenities is ridiculous...fireplace, washer/dryer, 55" mounted/swiveling flat screen, an abundance of channels(abundant by any hotel standards), Free High-speed internet(free w/online booking), full balcony with patio table and chairs, separate living room(sofa, love-seat, desk), full kitchen, bathroom with separate shower and spa tub etc etc...just amazing especially considering we had just left the Bellagio where something remotely like this would have cost several thousand per night...the fridge was immaculate as were the stove and everything else..they even include cookware, utensils and other kitchen like amenities..oddly enough no vending machines that I could see..so had to go outside to get some food supplies..we did change rooms 20 minutes later after deciding we wanted a strip view..the front desk lady was very accommodating and helped us get moved within the hour(when a room was available) no problem..We ordered room service for dinner and the service and food were quick and really good..unlike house keeping which seems slow as if they have maybe 1 or 2 persons(that day..sat) even though we didn't need it..Overall the staff seemed sparse..Our tray from room service literally sat outside our room for a day+ and i said nothing, trying to see when it would disappear(never did)..aside from that the pool was smaller(not tiny) and cozy with lots of chairs and seating and umbrellas..and very quiet as if no one really used it, a fluke perhaps.. The one bad thing, yet a good thing is the price point...its soo low for the area that it tends to draw a particular younger(crowd) that i'm sure during the week is non-existent but on the weekends(especially at night) they're everywhere...thus I noticed the increased amount of plain clothed(black suits)security..this seemed more of a deterrent for the drinking bunch and not for any other reason. But at times there was some noise in and out elevator and in halls but it was always passing and nothing really to complain about..never felt unsafe or remotely un-secured, just not the case..very modern, very clean, very secure feeling throughout... As to the area, well its in development..this is what I believe most of Vegas must have looked like at some point over the last 20 years when a new hotel was in construction..literally right in front of the hotel is a gas station and a 7 eleven, across the street( in front there appears to be a very large old parking lot/development space)..(on the right side is a small transformer(not the robot) power plant), behind the hotel is another family friendly 4 story villa type Howard Johnson-ish hotel..on the left is the pool setup which is tastefully setup in front of the hotel restaurant(all of which is elevated about 6 stories up and sits on top of the hotel parking garage(you would truly never know this)...this perspective from the strip view... The surrounding area feels like it should be sketchy because the hotel is mostly alone amongst some empty development, 2 gas stations, 7 eleven and 2 hotels...but really its not, surprisingly enough there's foot traffic on the walk (where it gets and can feel really lonely) at night going towards the Ballys for the monorail..but again area is development..You almost get the feeling that the Platinum developers have first dibs on the immediate gas station property in front of the hotel should they ever go bust... All in all this place is beyond fabulous, a diamond amongst zirconias and arguably the best family affordable hotel in Vegas. I don't expect there rates to stay this low forever, the hotel is still new, with some popularity and good word of mouth, I see price increases in the future...if your not into gambling, partying, drinking, etc..and no that's not sarcasm..Vegas is an adult city but not all adults want to be constantly surrounded by slot machines, vendors, bars, clubs, unspeakable busyness/loudness(and I'm from NY) and no this not a Buddhist thing, just a "I likes me quiet time thing"...this is the place for you..once you get past the I have to walk, cab or monorail to the strip thing..you'll find that you have hit it bigger than anyone else staying Vegas...seriously PS I do not normally write reviews but in this case much is to be said...and I wish i had more information about this place prior to...would have been less hesitant to book..

Reviews.Title: “Apartment home close to the Vegas Strip!!”
Reviews.Author: NanaBeeTampa_Florida
Reviews.Content: We selected the Platinum Hotel and Spa based on other reviews from this Trip Advisor website. We were not disappointed. Our suite was like an spacious 1-bedroom apartment with full kitchen and a washer and dryer and fireplace. The bathroom was big and beautiful with a 2-person jacuzzi tub. The room was a great value for the price. We were able to cook breakfast and make lunch at the hotel and ate dinner out. The hotel was quiet and is a 3 block walk to the Vegas Strip and we had a great night view of the strip from our balcony. The room was very clean and the staff very helpful. My only complaint was that at registration they put a $500 hold on our credit card for the period of our stay although we had prepaid the room for out entire visit. Make sure your credit card can handle this "hit" with enough left over to use for shopping and other fun in Vegas. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel very close to the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: trippinNy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Platinum hotel & Suites for 2 days. Such a great hotel! It is 2 blocks off of the main strip. The front desk staff and valet were all very nice and extremely helpful. It's such a quiet hotel and a nice retreat when you are done gambling/partying and just want to hit the bed- no loud and smoky casino to pass through before getting to your room. It was like we rented an apartment -each room has a balcony that you can sit out on. Huge bathrooms with his & her sinks, a shower stall and huge whirlpool tub that can probably fit 4 ;-) The pool area is super quiet and laid back and has indoor and outdoor areas. We weren't looking for the lively pool scene that Vegas is known for so this was great for us and would probably be good for people with children. We didn't get a chance to try any of the restaurants in the hotel, but all had interesting menus and were very chic and trendy. Overall super clean and relaxing hotel that comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Squidster
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay was great. Non-smoking, non-gaming and very quiet hotel 1 block from strip. Easy walk even in August heat. Room was very large with washer/dryer and fireplace. Front desk staff were friendly and accommodating. Valet parking staff were excellent. Did not try restaurant or lounge nor did we use the pool. Only minor complaint was that housekeeping was a bit lax with vacuuming and replacing toiletries. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm just away from the strip - excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: baloobear
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a number of reasons: 1. Its about a 5-10 minute walk from the Las Vegas Strip 2. Its an all suites hotel 3. It has no gambling facilties 4. It has an indoor/outdoor pool only accessible to residents 5. The price of the room!! Amazing Value!! I booked a 21-day non-refundable room rate and made a slight error which Claire helped me with. Upon arrival at the hotel we had been upgraded to a Strip View Princess Suite which was 1,150sq ft. Huge!! The suite comprised of fully functioning kitchen, with oven, hob, fridge/freezer, microwave, dishwasher and coffee machine. Crockery, Glassware and Cutlery/Utensils were all provided but if you wanted pots and pans you had to request from "Service One". Lounge comprised of fireplace and 48" plasma TV as well as balcony area and washing/drying cupboard with complimentary washing detergent. Bedroom was very roomy with the usual requirements and bathroom was amazing!! Twin tub with whirpool, shower and twin sinks for washing which really sped things along. "Service One" system failed the hotel as often the hotel operator/staff didn't know the answers to your questions. Frustratingly, there is no guest services directory in the room which could have answered the questions I had. Phone calls from the room to local or toll-free were exorbitent when compared to chain hotels. So didn't bother. Loved the pool area, some areas of shade (particularly in the morning) but afternoon it does become a bit of a sun trap. However there are automatic sunblinds/canopys that come out if you just ask "Service One" or you can swim/walk through to the indoor pool area which keeps you nice and cool. The pool was a good temperature as was the spa pool. If you want any pool service you do have to call service one, so we didn't bother, but compared to other Las Vegas hotels, no room key no entry. Really enjoyed my stay at Las Vegas because of this hotel, was really great to get away from the chaos of the strip, and would certainly stay here again on my next trip. Rates again reflected the off strip location and you would not get a room on the strip for the price of this suite!! Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Platinum Hotel and Spa Las Vegas is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: sheri140380
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for our honeymoon it is an amazing hotel. I loved that it was away from the busy life of the strip, the rooms so spacious and beautiful views, but close enough to the strip to walk quite easily about 5-10 minute walk and you are in the centre of the strip. The staff were so friendly and made us feel so welcome Brianna, Cecillia were fantastic and helped us with our first visit by offerring recommendations of places to go and things to see as it is sometimes hard to know where to start and appreciated this so much. The hotel was great the room OMG was wonderful, we could see the strip and the Bellagio fountains from our balcony, fully airconditioned, so clean, the useful facilities of a full kitchen which was great for having the choice of eating in or out, and the washing machine great to do all the washing before going home but also so that we could take less with us to bring back more, the swimming pool we could also see from our room open till 11pm both indoor and outdoor, the bar open till around midnight and just everyone even the valet staff always first to hold the doors open, wish you a good day/night and give the hotel a most special feel about it. We are already planning our next visit and if you want a hotel that is full of luxury, friendly staff, in walkiing distance of the strip but far enough away for a peaceful night, then this is really the hotel for you. Walking to the strip from the hotel and back is great both day and night and another benefit is it really helped me in working off some of the food you eat during your stay as well as helping me lose a stone in weight which is always great news. I am sure that you will enjoy your stay here and the beds are so comfortable you really need some good nights/days sleep to enjoy Vegas or after a busy day walking the shopping mile or the strip. My tip for anyone see as much as you can, make the most of your holiday but ensure you take some great walking shoes with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, kitchen; location and pool not perfect”
Reviews.Author: GD2004
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge, the kitchen is fantastic. The staff is very, very nice. The balcony is a really cool idea - don't see a lot of them in Vegas. The pool however is not boutique hotel, more like Marriott or nice Best Western. Small, when we were there no pool service, no shade to speak of which is problematic since it is on the 5th floor and lots of sun glare. The indoor portion is overly chlorinated. The pool restaurant was also closed. Had it been open, the experience might've been more enjoyable. The valets were fantastic and no long wait for car; but imho one does need to drive everywhere, the property is two long blocks off the strip and there are a cluster of unpleasant homeless dudes who hang out near the back of Bally's. In short: the kitchen, the room size, the staff friendliness : awesome. Value (got special thru travelzoo) also awesome. Balcony is just plain cool. If you want to walk to/from the Strip easily and/or you want a hip happening pool scene that's not this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a good base for visiting LV”
Reviews.Author: WymeswoldOFB
Reviews.Content: Our first stop on a three week holiday and arriving after a long journey from UK. Check in was very quick and easy and iced water was very welcome. The staff were very helpful and professional throughout our three night stay. Our family room was massive and extremely well fitted out, espcially the kitchen area and the bathroom, which included the biggest bath I've ever seen in a hotel. Beds were very comfortable. Hotel facilities included gym (all the normal machines and long opening hours) and swimming pool (good size but tended to be dominated by groups of late teens) and restaurant (we ate out whilst visiting the sites, so can't comment on this). Hotel location was convenenient: one block back from Strip, close to Ceasers/Ballagio but one block is some distance in LV, especially given the heat. Overall, highly recommended and exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Highly recommend to everyone. Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: Carolinelomeli
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to everyone!! Check in and check out were a breeze. The decor is modern to trendy. The suites are enormous and tastefully decorated. I had not one issue with any type of noise. The beds were very comfortable. All staff were polite and helpful. I really can't think of one negative thing to say about this hotel. I loved my stay and will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Baby”
Reviews.Author: sfc007
Reviews.Content: We had a blast staying at the Platinum. The staff there practically move mountains in order to make you feel welcome. From the front desk, to the valet guys, to housekeeping. They were all good. Especially management. This was one of the best places Ive ever stood at for Vegas. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay I've had in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: huntdogg
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent upon check-in everything was in order and its place. The cleanliness was immaculent and would stay here again as well as recommend to all my friends. Had a truly amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms a stone's throw from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Poliwhirl
Reviews.Content: If you want a quiet place to stay within very easy reach of the Strip then this place is perfect. Arrived by car and car was parked by friendly and very polite valet. Check-in was friendly enough too. Our suite on 14th floor had a good view of the Strip (we booked a Strip-view Princess Suite) from the bedroom window and from the balcony accessed from the living room. My sister was also staying in a Solitaire Suite at the same time, the only differences between the Princess and the Solitaire Suites that I could see were that the Princess Suite was slighly larger and contained a clothes washing machine and a tumble dryer (one sachet of washing powder and two dryer softening sheets provided, additional free supplies also available on request). The washing machine and dryer were a godsend after two weeks on the road in Utah and Arizona. The Suite had a fully equipped kitchen with large fridge/freezer (with ice maker), dishwasher, full cooker/hob, microwave oven, coffee maker, toaster, kettle (useful if you like tea!), crockery/cutlery/glasses/cooking utensils and granite worktops. The washing machine and tumble dryer are housed in a cupboard. In the living area there is a sofa, desk, large flatscreen TV, Bose CD player/radio, fireplace and patio doors to the balcony which has a table and four chairs. The bedroom had 2 queen beds, a TV, radio, safe and telephone. The bathroom is very large with 2 sinks, a walk-in shower, large jacuzzi bath, hairdryer and bathrobes. Suite is air conditioned throughout of course. There is no free internet access in the suites (it costs $2.99 for 2 hours of $9.99 for 24 hours) but is free in the lobby and by the pool on the 5th floor. The location of the hotel was fine for us, a short walk to the Strip made easier as you can walk all the way through Ballys Hotel (one block) which is also directly connected inside to Paris, Las Vegas both of which provide direct access to the Strip. We used the pool, it doesn't have the same atmosphere as some of the larger Las Vegas hotel pools but was a nice place to relax in the sun and cool down in the water; there is a also an indoor pool directly connected to the outdoor pool if you want to swim out of the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - except for the staff!”
Reviews.Author: marae87
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my wedding, and had all the wedding party staying there. Loved the location - close enough to the strip for walking but far enough from the chaos of casinos. I booked these rooms well in advance and all together - my husband and I were paying for all the rooms, but they made us put down names of the guests staying in them which is fine. We wanted to check in all the rooms prior to our friends arrivals since they would all be arriving at different times and we didn't want them having troubles checking in. I left keys at the front desk for two of my friends. When they arrived the front desk told them they could let them check into the room and we had about five very confusing phone conversations between our friends, and different workers. Finally they allowed them in. (The next morning I saw the packet with the keys with their names written on them sitting on the front desk....must of gotten misplaced?). The staff wasn't particularly helpful or friendly to anyone all weekend. They also split all of the rooms up - a room on every floor - instead of grouping them together (since we were a wedding party) like asked. Very weird. I will say the valets and bellman were exceptional - if all their staff worked as hard and were as nice as them it would be a superb hotel. The two times we went to the pool and ordered drinks by the time we got the drinks (I'd say 30+ minutes of waiting) we had to take them to go since we were in a time crunch. Since there were probably only 20 people at the pool, I didn't think it would take 30 minutes for a drink. I only recommend this hotel because the rooms are awesome, especially if you are traveling with kids. Loved the full kitchen. Our photographer also got them to open up their conference room to us so we could take pictures on the rooftop. If you are mellow enough to withstand their service, I would try it out!

Reviews.Title: “Do you really need a casino in your hotel???”
Reviews.Author: AllAboutBreakfast
Reviews.Content: The Platinum Hotel and Spa is a fantastic hotel. Period. It's not flashy but slick. There are no enormous neon signs or gambling devices of any kind and the place is 100% smoke free! In fact there are signs on the sliding glass doors that lead to the private balcony that warn occupants of the $500 fine should evidence of smoking be found. Their "low-end" rooms are 950 square feet with full kitchens, massive bathrooms and comfortable living rooms. We paid an additional $10 per night to upgrade to the "Strip View" which enabled us to gaze upon the north end of the strip. My wife and I were especially impressed with ability of the air conditioning system to drop the room temperature in a flash. When we requested extra towels, cooking equipment or info on other hotels the staff was prompt, courteous and more than helpful. We did not try the restaurant but while out for a morning swim in their indoor-outdoor pool, I noticed a couple of ladies having breakfast brought out to them poolside. The omlete looked well portioned and the standard breakfast seemed very adequate. An easy 10 minute walk and your at the intersection of the Bellagio, Ceasar's Palace, Bally's and the Flamingo. There is a monorail stop in the back of the Flamingo which can zoom you down to Mandalay Bay or up to the Stratosphere, which is even closer. All in all, this hotel is for the person that wants to experience Las Vegas up to 16 hours a day. The town is crazy and people everywhere. What better way to relax then to head back to your massive room, have a dip in the pool or soak in the in-suite jaccuzzi tub (big enough for 2)? If this hotel was in any other city it would be twice the price! My wife has been to Las Vegas before and stayed at several different hotels but she and I agree that when we go back we will call the Platinum our home.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Hotel in the Heart of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wertzburg1
Reviews.Content: This being our first trip to Las Vegas we were pleasantly greeted by the hotel staff. The complimentary valet was convenient. The staff were always friendly. Upon arrival we were upgraded to the top floor with a perfect view of the strip. The room was spacious and welcoming. It was nice having a full kitchen to put our leftovers in the fridge. The bed was extremely comfortable. It was also nice not having a casino inside and the whole hotel being smoke free. Only about a 7 minute walk to the strip. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wow yes”
Reviews.Author: frankiejulie
Reviews.Content: So this is my first time that i have ever really booked a room out side of driving with my boys out to vegas on a boost of spontaneous dudes let's go get layed knda thing. But let me just say this was absolutely the best place me and my girl friend has ever been too did not want to leave one block off the strip berry classy she wants to go back i do as well i perposed to her their.and she said yes are planing to go back thank you so much platinum hotel u rock. Great people. Fast service berry kleen perfect price reminded me of a loft i used to live in new york. Great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, friendly and smoke-free”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Sir
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the very friendly valet "Kevin" He advised us where to buy a few snacks gave us directions etc. Checking in was a breeze and for booking on line we were offered free WI-FI. Great view from the suite overlooking the strip. The valet staff was very fast bringing the car. The concierge suggested a few shows and got front row sitting. Amazing seats. Also we found out that by booking on line you may have early check-in and late check-out. The hotel is only a block away from the strip walking distance to everything. Yes there is pool and its wonderful. As far as food we did not eat at the hotel. We valet parked at the Mirage and it took them 45 minutes to bring our car. The maximum wait for the Platinum valet was two minutes. There is a spa there and it seems very nice but it was booked solid. Book that as soon as you get there. Everyone at the platinum was very friendly and very nice. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service and good location”
Reviews.Author: mcgahat
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at casino properties but during this trip we could not get a decent rate over the weekend at our usual places and this property was running a special on travelzoom for $99 per night with a midnight late check out. Since our flight out was at 11PM this worked out perfect for us as we only needed to buy two nights instead of three. Arrival: I am familialr with the area and remember this place being built so it was easy for me to find. Upon arrival we were met quickly by the valet (it is vale only for parking) and equilly as quickly we were checked in by a very friendly check in person that explained the property etc and told us our room was upgraded to a high room with a view of the strip. The room: Well, you have seen pictures already and they are all accurate. The room is clean and nice and BIG. I dont cook when I am traveling but this place has a great kitchen with everything you would need to put a meal together. The living area has a LCD tv and couche and chair etc. The bedroom is similar to what you would find in a standard hotel with a bed, chair and tv and a couple of nightstands. The bathroom is huge! It has the jacuzzi big enough for two medium sized folks and one if you are a person of size and it fills up qick and has good enough pressure on the jets. I like having a seperate shower also and of course double sinks with plenty of counter space. Also, there are lots of closet space with is nice. One of the best things for me though is a balcony as I love to sit out on the balcony at night. Restuarant: We only dined at the restaurant Kil@wat (I think I spelled that right) for breakfast and it was great. I hate buffets that you get at a lot of hotels and I hate even more bad hurried service and this place has personal and unrused service. Sit there and drink coffee till you explode if you want to. Very nice ladies working the breakfast area. I also thought the prices were reasonable. You can find the menu online. The people working the restauant also work the pool area so take your breakfast out at the pool for a really nice relaxing breakfast. Bar: We did not try the bar area at the lobby level called Stir but it looked like a nice place to have a drink and I know they do have a happy hour so if you are here on biz this could be a nice place to chill and finish up some work and have a drink a meal (I am assuming you can get food). The place was never really that busy. Valet: Ok, let me start off by telliing you that I hate valet services. It is not that I mind tipping but I hate waiting for my car when I can just go get the thing myself in half the time. We did have to wait sometimes and had trouble finding an attendant at times but it was nothing serious so I am not saying they were terrible just gets a little quiet there sometimes so I think they get lost sometimes. It is valet only here and no charge. Internet: It is free at the restaurant and pool on the 5th floor and the lobby and lobby bar. In the room it is $9.95 per 24hours for wifi from your room and same for wired. Our wired access did not work so not sure if that is the same for all rooms. They do seem to limit the internet speeds by session if that is important to you (if you work in tech like I do) but I understand why they do this but it is frustrating if you need to download a large file etc Location: Ok, I know everyone says this location is sooo close to the strip and although it is close....a block in Vegas is much different than a block in NYC. If it is 110 degrees outside it can be a long walk to the strip. I suggest going into the Bally's sports book and walking through Bally's to reach the strip. It is not a five minute walk at all. The only time I dislike making the walk is when I have had a few and then it is a taxi. It is about $5 taxi from Caesars. I like the location but I want people to understand it is not a quick stroll to the strip. Pool: I really liked the pool. It was busy but not so busy that you could not find a decent seat. It does not get sun early but there is sun in the afternoon for those that want to bake. Nice jacuzzi with strong jets and there is rarely anyone at the indoor pool so you can head in there and get some short laps if you like. Most strip hotels that pool is so busy you cant find a spot to lay out and that is not the case with this place and that is a big plus. Would I recommend this place to a friend? Absolutely. Would I stay here again? Most likely but it really depends on our needs.

Reviews.Title: “tranquility versus chaos”
Reviews.Author: hhf86
Reviews.Content: The absolute best hotel for relaxing. If you want the chaos and constant bells and clangs they are but a short walk away. This place is amazing, excellent people at every position in the hotel. It reminds me of being a kid when my mother changed the bedding and my room smelled so fresh and clean, well the Platinum smells fresh and clean as soon as you walk in the front door.We had our grandson (9) with us and he enjoyed the pool and the walks we took to the monorail and to the shoppes in the area all close to the hotel. When my wife and I come back we will DEFINITELY stay at the Platinum

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: luisamesones
Reviews.Content: The Platinum Hotel was a pleasant surprise from the moment I walked into the door of my ample suite. The kitchen area was perfect with the full size fridge and ice maker. The stovetop worked great. The spa tub in the bathroom was wonderful, and the beds were very comfy. I will definitely stay at this hotel again next time I am in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excellent Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SEGA_MARK
Reviews.Content: Im a professional Poker player so come over to Vegas every year for the world series. Ive stayed in most of the better known Vegas Hotels but based on reviews here I decided to give The Platinum a try this time around. Its a 7 minute walk to the centre of the strip so very close by, but also just far enough away from the madness. I cannot fault this place, everything is perfect here. Service is the best Ive experienced anywhere in Vegas, rooms are very clean, very big and food is very good and its great to have a full kitchen so that I can do my own thing if I want to. I highly recommend The Platinum - I came alone but its perfect for couples with a big jet tub ;-) Have fun

Reviews.Title: “Great room, even better staff.”
Reviews.Author: Dave86
Reviews.Content: We loved our 5 nights at The Platinum. We are a family of 4 and the space and the kitchen and especially the 2 big TV's were much appreciated. The walk up Flamingo to the strip is about 5 minutes but then you're right in the main part of the action. Walking is unavoidable in Vegas anyway, and the Patinum is worth it. The friendly and attentive staff blew us away. One night my daughter had a blister on her foot so I had to piggy back her, it was very hot and I guess I looked like I was dying because one of the staff was waiting with the door open and a bottle of cold water for me. we enjoyed the 2 for 1 drinks in the afternoons and the pool was lovely. If I was rich and could afford a suite at The Wynn, I'd probably stay there, but until then, The Platinum is my place in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - couldn't ask for better!!!”
Reviews.Author: katinSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mirage for the first night of our stay. After enduring the super-crowded pool area, walking through the smoky casino, and paying exorbitant prices for substandard pool-side food, we escaped to the relaxing and smoke-free Platinum Hotel. I had booked one night at the strip Mirage hotel, and two nights at the Platinum Hotel. Although the Mirage was conveniently located on the strip (and the rooms were nicely renovated and discounted), we DEFINITELY enjoyed our stay at the Platinum better! It was such a pleasure to have all the space (especially since we were with young kids), full workable kitchen, FANTASTIC housekeeping services (and I am a clean-freak), and no casino with smoke and noise pollution (we weren't there to gamble- just to see shows). The pool was simple, yet wonderfully uncrowded- loved the patio furniture. Although the room had a nice strip view, my toddler son was most enamored with the view of the monorail- he loves trains! The room service was efficient, the food was delicious, and the prices were reasonable (not cheap- but not stupidly expensive like the strip hotels-- they were priced just right so that we were inclined to use them despite having a full kitchen). I liked the free internet in the bar and pool area. The icing on the cake? Well, I didn't tell them that we were there to celebrate my husband's birthday, but the front desk person who checked my husband's ID at check-in must have noticed that it was his birthday, because when we returned from lunch, there was a delectable plate of chocolate-covered strawberries and a nice note from management wishing him a happy birthday! The only negative was the valet service. For the most part, they were great- but one guy was TERRIBLE in his attitude. He was so rude that it could have colored our experience and ruined it for us but I was able to ignore his misbehavior (although I saw another couple who was really turned off by his yelling and rude behavior). Thankfully, we only saw him a couple of times. Because of our great experience, I've convinced my family to celebrate our parents' anniversary there this upcoming weekend! Hopefully, it will be just as good of an experience. Pros: Size and cleanliness of rooms, non-smoking, no noise pollution because no casino Cons: Price isn't as good as strip hotels (when they have significant discounts), not located on the strip (but not a problem if you have a car)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing way to start our marriage and Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: VanderMeer
Reviews.Content: Our stay was perfect. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone...Single person, couple, family(non-smoking and non-gaming yet close to the strip) or international traveler. Upon arrival the valet was helpful, welcoming and informative. They learned my name and used it the rest of our couple day stay. Several of them went out of their way to congratulate us on our wedding (Don, Joel, Col. Jimmy, Marco, Princeton, Tom and Kevin were just to name a few). The front desk was very helpful and warm as well. We called months in advance to make our reservations and spoke with Claire over the phone. She was extremely attentive to our needs which was important to me as this was for my wedding night and beginning of our honeymoon. Gita helped us book our spa appointment. The WELL Spa at the Platinum was absolutely amazing for us. We booked the couples Platinum Paint party, a perfect spa appointment for any couple that wants an intimate setting, professional staff and beautiful facility. We had a few questions and Nathan was very informative on some of the hotels other amenities. Our room was the middle size room, which is still bigger than my first apartment, over 1000 square feet. We were leaving for europe the next day for the rest of our honeymoon and we took advantage of the washer and dryer located in the room. I think the two larger size rooms have these, with complimentary laundry soap. We ate at the restaurant as well as used the inroom dining. Matias was our inroom server and he did an amazing job, as this was a special dinner for us because we had another newly wed couple joining us. It was close to the strip and fine dining, as well as next door to one of las vegas' local breweries with cheap good beer and great pizza. Upon checkout, Matthew, Briana and Eva were very helpful in getting us to where we needed to go next. The General Manager, Dennis was in the lobby and made sure to take some time to ask us how our stay was and make sure that our new life together and honeymoon started out well. For the last month we have been traveling through Europe and have stayed in Budapast, Vienna, Prague, Berlin, Paris, Monaco, Cinque Terre and Rome and the Platinum has been our nicest hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basics”
Reviews.Author: bunky-68
Reviews.Content: Good location , walking distance from the strip . No casino , so you do have quiet and no clutter ! Super clean suites , with all the amenities ! The big plus for me is that this is one of two hotels in all of Vegas which has a balcony which you can actually sit outside and take in the view . My third time there I got a little more personal service . My thanks to the staff . Has full kitchen , fridge , washer , full bathroom with jacuzzi , flat screen tv , iron and board , in room safes - free of charge ! Nice view or the strip .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing and brilliant service!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisam89
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel from the 4th July - 8th July. This has to be one of the best places I have stayed and the comfort was amazing. Not long from the strip and relaxing and quiet. Staff were friendly and when we visit Las Vegas again this hotel will be where we are staying. Beautiful!! Lovely views from the balcony of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDvm
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay. Enjoyed the hotel and ameneties. Rooms are large and spacious. Great accommodations away from home. Close to strip and yet far away enough from the Vegas hussle. Employees are top notch. Special thanks to Manager Nathan. Easy valet parking and service at front desk very accommodating. Highly recommend this hotel. Would not hesitate to stay here again. D & J from CA

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort; non- smoking/non-gaming hotel relaxing atmosphore right off the center of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: kgut89
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a Non-gaming suite Hotel 1 major block off of cwnter of the strip, this is a recommeneded place to stay. I stayed 3 nights for biz, then joined for 2 nights with my wife and 2 kids (11 and 12) . From a biz standpoint, real nice location to everything, but in a quiet envirnment. Kids loved the 5th floor pool area and TV in both rooms ! Free Valet Parking, so once you park, can be up in your room in 3 minutes ! So no long 15 min. walk that I am used to at large Casino hotels in the area. I am a Biz consultant that helps companies with group hotel planning, and I would highly recommend this hotel- for its; location, value, suites with full kitchen, and nice clean appointed rooms. ***Largset Suite Hotel standard rooms that I have seen in all of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: Trina81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights from the 26 April 2010, stayed in the strip view princess suite. The rooms are huge apartment style, full kitchen, washer/dryer, lounge room with electric fireplace, big flatscreen tv and a balconey with nice view of strip at night. Bathroom has double vanity seperate shower and huge bath. Bedroom had 2 queen beds and flatscreen tv and big window facing the strip, also had free wireless internet. Found the rooms to be very modern and clean, hotel is non smoking and non gaming and was very quiet did not hear any noise at all during our stay. Hotel is just off the strip approx a 5 to 10 minute walk to ballys, also close to the ballys monorail stop. Nearby is a convenience store and ellis island casino. Only a few minor disapointments during stay, we were not offered any help with our bags on arrival and had no help with opening the door etc, also room was not cleaned on one day however when we called up they were quick to respond with clean towels etc. Also when we walked from hotel to the strip we were approached a few times by homeless people asking for money, we did not feel threatened however on the third occassion one of these people was very threatening towards us and it shook us up alittle bit, at night we ended up getting a taxi to and from the hotel. Overall a positive experience, I think the rooms are their biggest assest, not many hotels on strip have balconeys or are so roomy. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and delightful experience and the service was great.”
Reviews.Author: GrandCany0n
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. we had a few minor glitches with a tv not working and a safe not working but the people did everything possible to remedy and we were highly satisfied. Rooms are clean and spacious and we even sat out on the balcony. Pool was nice and the restaurants had good food. we are husband and wife and travelled with out 12 year old daughter who also enjoyed it. I would definitely stay there again. Very convenient to all areas of the strip where our other relatives were hanging out and staying. It was also quiet at night and if there were other activities they were very discreet.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hidden Gem in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: izzyd121
Reviews.Content: We booked the Platinum last minute for July 4th weekend because it had the best deal available. We didn’t want to get stuck at the end of the Strip, like MGM or Mandalay or TI, because the walk would’ve been terrible. Even though the Platinum isn’t on the Strip, the walk is not that bad, because it is only about 10 minutes to Las Vegas Blvd (and even closer if you cut through Bally’s). If you need a cab, the valets easily flag one down for you, and there is no long wait (like other hotels). We’ve never heard about this place, but based on reviews on TripAdvisor, we had high expectations for the Platinum. The hotel definitely exceeded anything we had expected. For a busy holiday weekend, the Platinum was the best choice for us, because after partying and clubbing, we were able to return to a nice, quiet room. The non-gaming, non-smoking was a plus for me. The full-kitchen had appliances that looked and worked like new. We were able to store drinks in the fridge with an ice dispenser (VERY CONVENIENT!), boil hot water on the electric stove, microwave food, and had plenty of utensils and dishes for dining and glasses for drinking. The living room area was spacious and had a pull-out sofa. We also had a balcony, which overlooked the Strip. It was amazing, considering we had a great view of the fireworks show from Caesar’s Palace and was able to avoid the crowd that gathered in the street. The balcony had a table and chairs, so we were able to sit out and drink and just enjoy the fireworks in our own privacy. Even without a view of the strip, we were told we could watch the show from the pool or the rooftop, which they opened specifically for the event. The bathroom was HUGE. There were his and hers sinks and a standing shower, plus a giant whirlpool tub big enough for two people to lay side by side. There was a bathroom closet in addition to a closet in the bedroom. There were also two entrances to the bathroom, one from the living room and one from the bedroom. That way, people staying in the living room could have access to the bathroom without walking through the bedroom. The suite was very spacious and clean.
