Also helpful was that it was almost soundproof. When we closed the door to the bedroom, the tv playing in the living was almost negligible. For those that need internet, there is free wi-fi by the pool and at the bar. Not to mention, the service here was amazing. Everyone, from the valet, the front desk, room service and poolside service, were friendly and helpful. The gym was state-of-the-art. The pool was average, but still nice with a firepit as well. The prices were especially reasonable. Where else can you order beer for $4 and a chicken quesadilla for $8 POOLSIDE?? They even let us bring our own drinks to the pool, which other hotels would never allow you to do. They even had spa services that had decent pricing which I would have loved to try, but just didn’t have enough time. The Platinum made this trip to Vegas the best I ever had. For a holiday weekend, I was expecting to deal with crowds and long waits, but staying here I was able to avoid all of that! The walk may be a bit of a hindrance, but all the perks of the hotel make you completely overlook that one minor thing. I would love to stay here again. I can’t believe I never knew about this place before. It is an amazing find! I wish I could keep it all to myself, but I can’t stop telling people about my great experience here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oncde again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bartondarr
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time coming back to the Platinum, and love it! The suites are good size, free valet parking, and the staff are amazing. Coming here is like coming home, and you are made to feel that way as well. They have pool side happy hour every day from 10am till 3pm, and then in the lounge from 5pm until 8 pm. The pool is very nice, with a portion of it being inside, as it has a tunnel through a glass wall you swim through to get out of the sun if you wish. The hallways are patrolled with discreet security (bonus) , which makes ones sleep just that little bit better. Kitchens are fully equipped, and they will bring you more utensials, pans etc if you want. Full size Fridge has icemaker, mid size dishwasher works, etc.........everything is great! Supe for those whom want to save a few dollars on meals, yo can just cook there instead, and then eat out on special days. 7 minute walk off the strip right behind Ballys, but once there you are right in the heart of the strip. Go next door to Ellis Island to their restaurant and have plentiful, good food. Nice and quiet, no smoking allowed!!!

Reviews.Title: “I have travelled the world - This is the BEST hotel in which I have stayed”
Reviews.Author: jenninberks
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 5 star properties around the world as my passion in life is to travel. This hotel has something like no other and it's hard to describe....it's like staying in your own personal condominium with your own staff to smile and greet you each day. I leave here, go to the Strip and do the tourist thing - and I CANNOT WAIT to get back to my home away from home at the Platinum. The non-gaming atmosphere is a big part of what makes this hotel great...no noisy machines, just peace and tranquility with some amazing views. My fiance and I got engaged 2 weeks ago and decided to do the cool thing and fly to Vegas..we could have stayed anywhere...we are so glad we chose this place! The huge tub, space of the room (we are staying in the Princess Suite), views and wonderful staff (particularly Matt at the front desk) have made this an experience we will never forget..... Stay here. You won't regret it :)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Platinum!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emma1975
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been travelling to Vegas for the past 11 years and have always stayed at the larger hotels on the Strip. We now have a 1 year old and found that staying in a standard Vegas hotel room was no longer an option for us. What attracted us to Platinum was the fact that it was non-smoking and non-gaming ... a better environment for our daughter to be in. We figured that 11 years of staying where we wanted was good enough for us. This trip was also partly business in Henderson and we had a car, so the need to stay on Strip just wasn't there either. Upon arrival we found the valet staff fantastic! They were very attentive and very prompt. As we were staying for two weeks (with a weekend break in better), they got to know us, and more importantly, they got to know our daughter and just loved greeting her back each time. The first room we were given was on the 16th floor, unfortunately you can hear the airconditioners on top of the hotel which made this constant buzzing sound. We asked to be moved and were given a Strip view room on the 6th floor. The only set back with this room was the fact that the pool is on the 5th floor and when there is a function you sure can hear it. Luckily the only function was a wedding on our first night and it ended at midnight. The sound was nearly unbearable, but short-lived. The customer service at this hotel is second to none. When we had a request - whether it be housekeeping or maintenance, we were seen to promptly and a call from the front desk always followed to ensure our requirements were met. The room itself was huge. We had a princess suite as we thought the washer/dryer would be handy (which it was). It was a real benefit to have the separate bedroom/living area and 2-way bathroom - particularly with such a young child going to sleep quite early. Our daughter had a lot of fun running around the apartment opening doors, turning on the bath taps and hiding in drawers (we really didn't need to bring her any toys)! The only set back with the room was the bed, it wasn't very comfortable and quite squeeky. One of the benefits of the larger/newer hotels (ie Wynn), the beds are sooooooooooooo comfortable! The kitchen is large, well equipped and very handy (especially with a young one) and you are supplied with all your cleaning needs - washing power, washing liquid, dishwasher tablets etc. We found Platinum to be our home away from home and will highly recommend it to anyone - whether you are in town for business, pleasure or with a young family. It was a nice change to be off the Strip, but still close enough to walk it quite easily (10 minutes to Planet Hollywood). Don't let the "valet only" service deter you, these guys have a system and they are fast! We never waited more than 5 minutes for our car, even less if we called down before! They run a very tight ship at Platinum and we can now see why they get such great reviews! Keep up the good work!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great holiday experience in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravellers75
Reviews.Content: A great holiday experience in Las Vegas! We stayed for a week and by the time we got there it was the end of our long trip and we had stayed in quite a few hotels. It was great to have a place that had a separate lounge room and bedroom as well as full kitchen, large bathroom and laundry facilities in the room. We loved the fact that it was off 'the strip' but so close that it didn't matter. It gave us peace and quiet when we wanted it but was only a few minutes walk to the heart of 'The Strip' when we wanted to go out - we had absolutely no problems with this. The rooms were always clean and we had a fantastic view of The Strip from our balcony - it was amazing to see at night. The pool was great and we also enjoyed having a drink in the bar as well. The staff were really friendly and always obliging - even going over and above in helping us get to the airport in time. This was our first trip to Vegas and we enjoyed our time there so much that we will definitely plan a trip back soon and we when we do we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very kind employees and nice off site location”
Reviews.Author: GRtravel
Reviews.Content: We loved our Princess Suite and especially the washer/dryer as we were there in the middle of a very long road trip. At check in we were initially told we were getting a king bed but when I told her we reserved two queens she said that wasnt guaranteed but she'd check. We did get our queens but couldnt believe they would think it was okay to give a reservation for two adults & two teens a king bed. Most staff we personally dealt with were exceptional, including the valets, but I was a little disappointed with the cleanliness. We chose not to use our tub because of how it looked and the floors hadnt been vacuumed well. The pool area wasnt maintained quite as good as I wouldve expected. It would seem an employee could walk through every 1/2 hour or so. Had to call on a phone you couldnt hardly hear through to get pool service and there were dirty towels to the brim in the bins. We would still definitely recommend this hotel, but I think they need to be careful to maintain the beautiful property they have.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: johnnlisa
Reviews.Content: As a first time tourists to Las Vagas, we did our research. This hotel was just as advertised on tripadvisor. We originally had a reservation at the Encore, but changed our minds to The Platinum, based on the reviews: New, clean, quiet, great service...the hotel had it all. The staff was extremely friendly, either during check-in/out, or merely making conversation in the elevator. Awesome strip view from a huge room (and we were only in the standard room), large and comfortable living area, more than adequately sized kitchen (with all the appliances), enormous bathroom with a separate shower and two person hot tub, double sinks and thick towels. The beds?...Like being back in the womb... The separation of the bedroom from the bath and living room allowed one of us to sleep in while the other got the day going with breakfast and coffee on the balcony. The grocery store was a mile walk and made using the kitchen easy. As the hotel was a 5 minute walk from the strip, it was a great place to get away from the sensory overload of lights, sounds and smoke. One of the best evenings was sitting by the gas fireplace at the pool, sipping a beer and relaxing...a pool that you did not have to pay an additional $20 to enjoy. If we had one complaint, it was the business center: Internet was charged by the minute and the airline check in kiosk was a per use charge as well. I can understand that hotels need to generate revenue. However, perhaps a five minute daily comp to check e-mail or print a boarding pass would be nice. Not a huge deal, but beats dragging the laptop on the trip. They do, however have free Wi-Fi, so we can't blame them for our packing choices. We would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone, with or without children, and positively stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to strip, perfect for couples!”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Vegas for three nights with my fiance in February. It was unfortunate that it rained for most of the weekend but even so we had such a pleasant experience with the Platinum that we will no doubt be returning someday. Got an excellent rate -- about $360 (tax included) for three nights and we got our room upgraded to include an awesome view of the strip. That was much appreciated since it was my fiance's first trip to Las Vegas! The one element I cannot comment on is the food, we didn't try the restaurant. But the pool, fitness center, public areas, and the room was excellent, first class. Room is spacious, has everything you could want including a garden whirlpool tub, spectacular view, flat screen TV's, refrigerator and ice maker, etc. Beds are spectacularly comfy and the shower is one of the best I've ever seen plus the plush towels and nice minty tea leaf shampoo. Valet parking was courteous, fast, and complimentary (although providing a small tip was appreciated). It really felt like we were on a honeymoon or something. We just had a great time and would recommend the Platinum to anyone heading to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place that's not on the strip”
Reviews.Author: SuziAU
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that is not on the strip. It was great value for money when booked with someone like Expedia. Huge rooms with a kitchen and large luxury bathrooms. I stayed in a Princess Strip View Suite. Included with this room was a washer/dryer which came in extremely handy. There is no casino onsite, but the walk up to the strip is not too far. Get some groceries because room service is very pricey. I didn't eat in the restaurant so I can't say what that was like. Plenty of closet space if you are staying for a while. Although there was no complimentary breakfast a quick walk away were plenty of places to have a meal at a reasonable cost. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Is For Real”
Reviews.Author: Florida-Traveler-888
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a terrific stay at this hotel and can't could not have been more satisfied. Every staff member was helpful and positive. After observing the hour long check in lines at some of the huge casino hotels, I would stay at the Platinum for that reason alone. Check in and out were both less than five minutes and there were no lines. Try the restaurant for a really good breakfast or lunch and make your reservation on their web site for a little reward.

Reviews.Title: “Around the corner from the heart of the Strip, this this is the perfect spot to get away from all the Vegas chaos.”
Reviews.Author: PlanetJLM
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Platinum and I was thoroughly impressed. The rooms are huge (with full kitchen, washer & dryer), clean and comfortable. And the staff is really great. Everyone was very friendly and really made me feel welcomed. The pool is nice but there's no action at this non-gaming hotel but it's a great spot to start and end your day's Vegas fun. A short walk to the heart of the Strip it was so nice to be able to get away from all the fuss at the end of the night back to a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel ~ Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: CaliQueen33
Reviews.Content: This truly is a hidden treasure right off the strip. My husband actually picked this hotel because I didn't want to deal with the traffic and the noise of the strip. We both 30 so its not like we're old, we just wanted some quiet time at night. I would have given this hotel 5 all around except, when my husband and I went down to the restruarant the door was closed yet when we walked in there was a sign that said, "Please seat yourself". We chose a table and no one came out for 10 minutes. We immediately left and went down the street to Bucca Di Peppo. Other than that this hotel was great. The price for what we experience was incredible. I've attached some photos of our amazing suite 1504 that over looked out to the LV Strip. This will be the only place we stay at from now on!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zamilah
Reviews.Content: We could not fault this hotel, the staff where always willing to help. We had a one bedroom suite, it was large, modern, clean, quiet and had a relaxing feel. It’s was nice to be able to escape to our hotel and get away from the madness of The Strip. It takes about 10 minutes to walk to The Strip or the bell boys were more than happy to get a taxi for us. The kitchen with all facilities, washing machine and dryer and internet was great to have. 7-Eleven is around the corner which made it easy to grab a few things. We ate in the restaurant a few times and was rewarded with meals that tasted like the menu said it would. It was great to get a good quality meals at a reasonable price. This hotel met all my expectations, it would be our best hotel we stayed in; We visited Miami, NY, San Francisco & LA on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel you select when you are responsible for booking your own travel.”
Reviews.Author: alwaysmeeting
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Platinum. I travel to Las Vegas 3-4 times per year, and have stayed at some of the better-known properties. The Platinum is by far the best value, despite its distance from the strip. When the weather is good, the walk is good. And when you need to take a taxi, the bellmen are quick to secure one for you, and there is usually no waiting line . The best features are the full kitchens (refrigerator/oven/sink/microwave) and jacuzzi tubs (all rooms), and the fireplaces and washer-dryer units , and balconies (ask which rooms feature these). To top it off, there is a Bose radio in the living area, and an additional CD player/radio in the bedroom area.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum Wedding”
Reviews.Author: bestmomever59908
Reviews.Content: My son and daughter-in-law's wedding was held at the Platinum. It was perfect from the word "go" - perfectly orchestrated by Katherine, the events planner. It was held at sunset by the pool and then a fabulous reception and dinner in the Kil@wat restaurant. The food was outstanding. I would highly recommend this venue for an event. The rooms (suites) are so spacious and comfortable. Worked well for hosting the extended family and friends in town for the wedding. It's not too far of a walk from the Las Vegas strip either. Overall, a very enjoyable time!

Reviews.Title: “A great Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: Naddy016
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for my birthday vacation and it was a great choice. My best friend and I had an easy check in got our room right away. I would have loved a room upgrade as some of the others on this site but the strawberries and wine for my birthday was great as well. The spa was so great, good people there and I felt so relaxed once I left. All and I would say I am glad I listened to the reviews from the this site and stayed at the Platinum I will be back for sure when I return to Vegas again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, excellent amenities, perfect for our Vegas getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Ness074
Reviews.Content: Why hadn't we heard of this place before? This was our 7th or 8th time in Vegas and we'll be back. Firstly; every single interaction with the staff was over and above our expectations. From check-in to valet to room service I couldn't fault the staff; they were incredibly helpful and courteous, nothing was too much trouble. The room itself was well appointed and ideal for our needs. LOVED the pool, it was so nice to be in Vegas pool that was free of thumping music and hugely overcrowded. Spa was wonderfully relaxing. The hotel is located approx 1.5-2 blocks off the strip; behind Bally's; perfect if you're looking for someone a little quieter and/or smoke/gaming free and kid friendly. Well done staff of the Platinum; you all deserve a pat on the back. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...”
Reviews.Author: kre111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several days, along with having a wedding reception, and a brunch/lunch for the bridal party and groomsmen. The experience was excellent. The rooms are spacious, quiet, and well equipped. The food for our brunch, lunch, and reception was excellent. All staff members were very helpful and accomodating. Kathryn, who organized the reception and other activities was excellent. We had our reception of about 58 people on the top floor (Misora Room). The view was outstanding and everyone enjoyed the night. I recommend the Platinum for standard visits or special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “jewel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: michael209959
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel in the ideal spot in vegas.i had previously stayed in planet hollywood and this hotel is located just behind the las vegas strip and is in a really quiet spot which is perfect for getting some rest after the noise and hustle and bustle of the strip. i emailed the platinum before i left ireland and explained that i was going to vegas with my wife for her birthday.Claire a manager in the platinum kindly gave us an upgrade to a princess suite strip view room and also the hotel kindly gave my wife a bottle of champagne and a card .what a gesture from Claire and the hotel. All the staff are very polite and attentive to our every need.the guys at the front door opened doors for all the guests got us taxis and also just made pleasant conversation with everyone. The rooms are massive and very well equipped with every thing you need.having a washer dryer was really handy and i would advise anyone in town for more than a couple of days to use this type of room.At the end of our visit the amazing Claire had our boarding passes printed out for us for our return journey. We really enjoyed the platinum it is the perfect hotel for a vegas trip and i will never stay anywhere else as the platinum has it all.

Reviews.Title: “It is very service oriented with knowledge of the area, a great pool and lovely design.”
Reviews.Author: chelseamadden
Reviews.Content: Great drive up service, knowledge staff at concierge of the area. Great lobby bar with fun events are night and good specials. Nice design. Love the front door handles. Spa and pool were good. Great afternoon sun at pool and yummy breakfast there starting are 6am. Just a block off the strip, easy to walk to. beautiful, roomy princess suite with comfy bed, fireplace, 2 tvs, large bath, wonderful shower head. A great room experience with good view of Vegas. A must stay!!! classy and not super touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum just book it”
Reviews.Author: Tigbox
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Bellagio & Mirage in the past we decided on a smoke free, casino free hotel. The PLATINUM is just 1.5 blocks from the strip an easy 10 min. walk. The pool is good & heated, plenty of towels & sun beds. Local mini-mart is just past the 2 petrol stations on the right, the nearer ones are okay but more money. If you need to change your own local money to dollars go to the Fashion Show Mall, Amex is there on the second floor & a local company in the food hall area. Do not forget your Amex card & photo ID. So book it & enjoy a healthy holiday at the Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of peace”
Reviews.Author: ciderapple
Reviews.Content: Short walk away from the Strip and the monorail. We got upgraded to a "princess" suite and our jaws dropped when we saw how big it was and the facilities, such as a double jacuzzi bath. Beautiful views from the balcony. We only stayed one night so didn't make use of the spa. We wish we could've stayed longer, it's convenient for driving back to the airport and it's free valet parking. Wifi internet was not free however. We would definitely stay here again if we had meetings in Vegas, it was an oasis of peace just far enough away from the noise and crowds of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Made me feel right at home...”
Reviews.Author: R23x
Reviews.Content: I was on business and stayed at the Platinum Hotel from 02/15 - 04/30. I stayed in the strip view princess suite the entire time. For almost 3 months away from home, this turned out to be the perfect place to stay. The room was spacious, clean, everything you needed to cook was already in the kitchen or you can easily request it, washer and dryer in the room was amazing, the view was great, and the staff were more than excellent. The hospitality that the staff provided, especially Nathan Rex, was above average as they each made me feel right at home. Many friends came to visit and did not want to leave. To this day, I still receive great comments about how great my room and hotel was. I have already receommended this hotel to fellow co-workers and I am certain that they will not be disappointed. The Platinum Hotel will definitely be my destination when staying in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice non smoking hotel”
Reviews.Author: turtle040
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum for two nights. The rooms were nicer than I thought, but I was a little disappointed when I first drove up to the hotel. It is right beside a gas station, and a big empty lot across the street. It was a short walk to the strip, which was fine at first, but it added up back and forth, which eventually took away from the entire experience. We moved over to the Wynn for the next two nights and it was just so easy to get around in that area. Its a nice non smoking hotel with no casino which makes it very easy to navigate, but the pool is nothing special, and its not a typical Las Vegas hotel, It does not have any of the glitz or bells and whistles of the other hotels, except that you are getting a suite, with a full kitchen and balcony. It would be great for families and people that are there for business, but I would not return to this hotel if I wanted the Las Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good but take care to your reservation !”
Reviews.Author: Arnaud007
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel 4 month ahead and had to pay one night in advance but even in that case the reservation is not garanted.....then I had to spend my first night in a suite but on a unconfortable sofa (no discount for that problem) :-( The rest of the hotel is good and confortable Good swiming pool , Good breakfast The Platinum is located in a quiet place. 20 minutes walking distance from Las Vegas Bvd.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis”
Reviews.Author: KEVCO36
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at the Platinum , myself, wife and 14yr old son. We arrived mid afternoon having travelled that day from Valencia California.We found it very easy. From the moment we arrived and left our car with the valets who were very helpfull untill we left every thing was perfect Check in was very easy , and Gita was so polite and very helpfull. Our room on the 16th floor was amazing everything you could ask for with a great view of the strip, Paris, Ceasers, Ballys and Flamingo It was our wedding anniversay while there and when we got back to our room that evening there was champagne chilling and chocolate covered strawberrys.Nice touch. Having stayed previously at the Signature in Vegas this is as good as if not better.

Reviews.Title: “Well decorated, clean, quiet, and helpful staff and well priced establishment.”
Reviews.Author: revitrabbit
Reviews.Content: Laundry, kitchen, spa tub, comfy bed, roomy, helpful courteous staff with smiles. Couldn't have asked for anything more! If you don't want to be in a casino environment the whole time you are at Vegas, this is the place for you! Easy strip access but no crowds or hassle. Very happy we stumbled upon this place for our stay in Vegas. We have already decided we are coming back any time we happen to be in town!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were Great - But Service Problems”
Reviews.Author: Jez&Carly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum Hotel & Spa in Las Vegas for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was because it is a non-gambling, non-smoking hotel (unlike most, if not all, of Vegas). This hotel is in such a great location though (about 2 blocks from the Strip), that it was great to be able to explore the Strip all day and night, but then only be a short distance away from our no smoke and no slot machine sanctuary! However, upon arriving at our room, it was clear by the number of cigarette butts on and over our balcony that alot of guests don't abide by this no-smoking policy. Our room was great - each of the room were large, the king size bed was very comfortable, it had 2 TVs, a self contained kitchen, the bathroom was huge, and it had a washing machine as well. Having said all that though, we weren't all that impressed with the service/front desk staff at this hotel. It appears to be the sort of hotel that isn't sure what it is - it tries to cater for business travellers, but then it also tries to cater for honeymooners like us, as well as young people - without really having the level of service to satisfy anyone. There were a few occasions where we found the front desk staff to be generally unhelpful and unresponsive to our queries, and the service in the restaurant/bar was also very average. Unfortunately they only had one poor girl serving a bar the night we were in there, and she was struggling to cope. At first we put this down to the teething problems of a new hotel, but then we were told by a doorman that the hotel had been running for 2 years! As an aside, one night we took the sunset helicopter tour of the grand canyon and Strip - which we would HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Overall, the rooms at this hotel were very nice and spacious, and the hotel was in a very good location. However, the service really did let it down, and I don't think we would stay here again unless it markedly improved.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vegas All Suite Hotel Option, Smoke Free”
Reviews.Author: LynnSD83
Reviews.Content: Prior to my awesome experience at the Platinum Hotel, Vegas was completely off my list of desirable destinations. The Platinum is a smoke-free, all suite hotel with an excellent staff, excellent food & beverage, great bar, beautifully decorated large suites with kitchens plus a convenient location. You can get your fill of the strip’s entertainment and slots then escape back to the peace and quiet of the Platinum. How often do you get to meet the VP of Sales and the VP of Operations enjoying some down time in their own hotel’s bar? This is a fantastic Vegas hotel option if you enjoy leaving the smoke behind at the casinos. Go hang out at the 5th floor pool and say hello to Kasia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: Marcy0405
Reviews.Content: I visited the Platinum Hotel and Spa for a small training conference. The rooms were beautiful and clean. The view was great! All staff was curtious, friendly and timely. Casia, one of the poolside servers, truly understood customer service and exceeded all expectations. All services including sales, bellman, engineering, reservationists, bartender, and food service was great. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to experience Las Vegas but with a little down time as well. Perfect Experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vegas Suites Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Babs6915
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to attend a small conference and stay 3 nights at the Platinum Hotel in Las Vegas last weekend. It was a WONDERFUL experience. Every staff member that I came in to contact with was extremely friendly and helpful as they made my group and me feel pampered at at home. The location of the hotel is just a short walk from the strip and this worked out great for our conference. We had quiet and cleanliness in a non-smoking and non-gambling facility, and yet we could walk down to the crowds for evening entertainment - if desired. Even though we were in the heart of Vegas, our conference group spent many, many hours on property due to the amenities that were offered us in the restaurant, lounge, and pool side. Our overnight rooms were large suites that were larger than many of our homes. Our entire group, including me, were simply speechless at our accomodations and we all spoke about returning happily to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Platinum Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phatty1483
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to celebrate one of our friends' 30th Birthday. No one in the party had ever been to Las Vegas before so we weren't sure what to expect. The moment we arrived all concern was lost. The cab ride to the hotel ($15) was enjoyable. The driver was great and even gave us VIP tickets to a club. Check-in at the hotel was seamless. We mentioned we were celebrating a birthday and they Upgraded us to a Princess Suite and sent complimentary champagne and strawberries. The room was beautiful. We had 5 girls in one room and there was more than enough space for everyone to be comfortable. The bathroom was huge with a jacuzzi tub and separate shower. We never had to wait long for cabs and were always greeted when we got in from days/nights spent on the fabulous strip. I previously read some reviewers comment on the distance of the hotel from the strip and was amazed how people could think it was too far to walk. Your just 5mins from the entrance to Bally's and if you wanted to walk all the way to strip would just take 10mins tops. I will admit there was construction on Flamingo but it looks to be nearing it's ending stages and wasn't too bad for the cab rides. All in all the trip was great and I can't wait to come back and stay with The Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Platinum. If we go to Las Vegas again we will definitely stay here.”
Reviews.Author: tomandjerry32
Reviews.Content: Staff extremely friendly & helpful. Food, drink, pool, rooms are great. Twelve minute walk to the Strip at an average pace but you can go in the back entrance of Bally's (directly below the monorail track) and then go thro' to Paris or out onto the Strip. We had a very comfortable stay and the Concierge gave us a lot of useful information which saved us much time. We would readily stay here again, the rates are good compared to the larger hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jim_MA77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Las Vegas so she could attend a conference for her work. The hotel for the conference was booked (The Westin), so I did my research here on Trip Advisor, and we booked a room at The Platinum. The location was perfect for her conference, but it was great for me, too. I spent most of my trip visiting the casinos on the strip. It's only a short walk to the strip; maybe a 7-10 minute walk to Caesar's Palace or the Bellagio. Bally's is only about 5 minutes away. What a great place and experience! We were initially attracted by the good reviews, and the fact that it is a non-gaming and non-smoking hotel (bonus!), but the room, service, and amenities far surpassed anything I would have expected. When we arrived, we were pleasantly greeted and they told us they had us in the Marquis Suite. I knew all of the rooms were suites, so this didn't mean much to me at the time. We got our key and headed to our room, only to find a set of double doors leading into our room. We entered the room, and we immediately felt like we won the jackpot! Our room was gorgeous, with a HUGE living room with a "fireplace", a FULL kitchen (yes, full sized stove, real coffee pot, dishwasher, FULL sized side-by-side stainless refrigerator, and a washer&dryer. We had 2 large bedrooms, with their own large beautiful bathrooms, EACH with their own large jacuzzi tub, and a large balcony with a view of the strip. We had only booked a standard room, and they gave us a major upgrade! Their restaurant, Kilawatt, was very good and very reasonably priced. For example, a very good breakfast sandwich with 2 eggs, ham, and cheese on a croissant was $5. Their lounge, Stir, was excellent as well, with an inexpensive happy hour. The staff was fantastic as well. I wish I could remember the name of the gentleman that checked us in when we arrived, but he was very professional and friendly. At the time of checkout, Brianna was very helpful, and she offered to check us into our returning flight, and she printed out our boarding passes. Charlie in Stir provided great service as well, and she was helpful in recommending wines, as their stock was constantly being updated. All in all, this was one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had. The next time I return to Las Vegas, I won't even think of staying at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Reprieve Just Off Strip”
Reviews.Author: THTechnology
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to have a full suite, just off strip, non-smoking, NO CASINO hotel in Vegas. This is just the reprive I need when on a working business/conference trip. Managers and staff were exceptionally accommodating during the "volcano-cloud" period where European travelers were stranded due to flight delays. The rooms are huge, the full kitchen very welcome for a single traveler wishing to avoid the conference meals. Plenty of space to spread out and get real work done. Fitness room and pool are clean and perfect for business travel as well. I personally like the off-strip location - about 1 block off, behind Bally's - others may not. Yes, you can get cheaper rooms in Vegas .. but what are you getting? Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, clean rooms. Great Las Vegas Option for Families”
Reviews.Author: emkel98
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas and I honestly had no idea what to expect. Initially, I was disappointed that the hotel is located slightly off the main strip. However, it took me about 5 minutes on the strip to realize that for a person who wasn't in Vegas to party of gamble (we were in LA for medical treatment and drove to Vegas to see a Cirq show), this was a truly perfect option. We had a Princess Suite; it was huge. There was a full kitchen and a washer/dryer. We had more than enough room. The only parking is valet, but that was not a problem. The wireless connection in the room was free and fast. We found it easy to drive to the strip, park at any of the free lots, spend the day amid the chaos, and return to the calm of the Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: RDN6915
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Close to the strip, but yet quiet without all the hustle and bustle. If you go you need to take advantage of the spa. Service in the spa was second to none! Great room, wonderful service for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for a Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: Jules3002
Reviews.Content: A+ service. Rooms were very clean. Beds comfortable (I can't sleep anywhere but my own bed and I was able to sleep here!) I like the fact that it was a little more private and just walking distance from the strip. I would recommend this hotel for everybody, couples, families, etc. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay at The Platinum Hotel again”
Reviews.Author: PBJDStevens
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas several times and have stayed at many different hotels, but I can honestly say The Platinum Hotel is by far my favorite. It is only one block away from the strip, so it is secluded enough to have the peace and quiet everyone loves when on vacation, yet within walking distance to the main strip. Every single employee I came in contact with was friendly and very personable. Not once did I walk out of those main doors and not have the door held open for me. Fantastic staff! The rooms are amazing as well. To start, the kitchen was so convenient and great for our breakfast and lunch. That alone was a money saver. We were also able to save the expense of renting a car because the strip was so close to include many restaurants for a nice dinner out on the town. The beds were quite comfortable and the bathroom was huge enough for four of us girls to get ready all at the same time. The cost of the hotel was absolutely reasonable and also helped save on expenses. The Platinum hotel is what made our trip even more enjoyable and relaxing. I will proudly recommend this to many friends and family. This is my future hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “excellent suites”
Reviews.Author: UkShony
Reviews.Content: The suites were excellent , the Jaccuzi was a swimming pool to me as i am 4`ft 11. The suites are large and roomy with a washer/dryer that came in handy. service was excellent from opening doors to cleanliness. ITS JUST THE LOCATION, walking by the local drunks all day is very off putting, they keep asking for change. Was torn between marriot grand chateau or here cannot say wether it was the best choice as will try marriot next as its on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “excellent extended stay Re. volcano!”
Reviews.Author: maxineLondon
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the platinum for the first four nights of a touring holiday. The first room we were allocated was disappointing as it has no view (620) However the patio door would not lock and we were given another room no problem.The staff in this small (by Vegas standards) hotel are some of the friendliest and helpful I have come across anywhere in the world. Being full suite rooms they are excellent value for money ideally located 10 mins from the central Strip. Due to the Icelandic volcano we booked in for a further 6 nights at the end of our holiday. The hotel were very accommodating with room rates and essential internet access.. We walked along Flamingo Road each night for 10 nights and never once felt threatened or unsafe. The garage Deli over the road does great subs etc. I would not hesitate to recommend this modern,clean,friendly hotel to anyone - but say you dont want 620.....

Reviews.Title: “Average - at best”
Reviews.Author: mustgetaway
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at this hotel, having read the comments from other travellers. I have to say we were disappointed with the quality of service. When we arrived - at about 4.30pm - we were left to take our own bags up to our room and were given little infromation by the front desk. Then, at breakfast the next morning, we should have been given a ticket for the breakfast package we had paid for but these were not made available until the following day. We found the whole meal experience very confusing - you had to choose one drink and one meal from their 'value package' and everything else had to be paid for as an extra - even a cup of coffee!! The hotel is also a good walk from the strip and late at night you have to go through an area of town which we felt was a bit dark and possibly dangerous - most nights we took a cab to be on the safe side. All in all, we felt totally anonymous during our three day stay and were rarely acknowledged by any member of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service with Luxury”
Reviews.Author: dtomar
Reviews.Content: From the first step in the door, the staff was wonderful. We were greated pleasantly, all the additional requests to celebrate a special occassion were already taken care of. The hotel is very pretty, the bar is upscale modern, again great staff...yummy homemade potato chips as a snack and the happy hour is worth enjoying. Our room was as we expected, very very nice. Exceptionally clean and roomy. The first night we did have a problem, the a/c didn't work properly but by the next morning repairmen were sent and we thought was fixed but later in the day we noticed it stopped working again. A bit frustrated, the hotel acommodated us by moving us up to a Princess Suite, the bellmen were right there to help us move everything. The new room was fabulous, great view and even bigger than we expected...we were spoiled. When we called to request additional towels, housekeeping was there within minutes. The hotel is about 2 good blocks off the strip, but a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the strip. The pool was very nice, great seating, but it did lack poolside service which was disappointing, we had to find someone from the restaurant to serve us. The jacuzzi tub in the room was huge, easily could fit 2 people very comfortably. Overall we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms great view of the Strip, Staff second to none!”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddyTheWoodlands
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms great view of the Strip, Staff second to none! What else can you say.

Reviews.Title: “Met all Expectations...and then some!”
Reviews.Author: NorthYorkian
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family vacation to Las Vegas to celebrate a wedding anniversary. It was our first time to Vegas and we did a lot of research on Trip Advisor beforehand. We wanted a location that was near the strip, clean, pool, suite and above all great value. The Platinum Hotel met all expectations. When we arrived at approximately 5:00 pm we were met by the valet/bell hop and were pleasantly surprised at how friendly and courteous they were (which remained throughout the week). At reception we were met by Brianna who was polite and efficient. We mentioned our anniversary and received an upgrade even though it was not expected. We got a strip view room high up on the property which was fantastic. Our room was ready immediately and our bags arrived promptly. First impression of the suite was large, bright, tastefully decorated, very large flat screen TV above the fireplace, massive bathroom with an excellent shower and soaker tub, and clean. We made use of the modern kitchen facility and the laundry - everything worked well. The front desk was very responsive to any needs that we had, from calling for our car to requesting a late made service to finding extra dishes. The two queen beds were excellent and we all had great sleeps. The shower is a separate, walk-in style with a large glass door and a powerful showerhead. My wife loved the large, thick and fluffy bath towels that were always replenished when requested. Only criticisms have been mentioned before and they are the distance away from the strip and the outside noise (E. Flamingo Rd. must be on a ambulance/fire route). However, I will say this - we expected to walk. And when you consider the walk from the MGM to Treasure Island, the short walk from the Platinum to Bally's (strip) is minor. Even with children, we did not find it unsafe to walk on Flamingo Rd. Finally, when sitting on the balcony enjoying the lights of Vegas it was a little noisy for a property off the strip; however, the hotel had very good windows and there was no problem sleeping. As an aside, we found the entire hotel to be very quiet but we were there early in the week and not on the weekend. All in all, my expectations were exceeded by this property. I would come back again in a heartbeat and would strongly recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind the quiet nature of the hotel (no casino) and its location (one block E of the Strip).

Reviews.Title: “Wow!Amazing accommodation and great service!”
Reviews.Author: tuichic
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent,I carefully picked this accommodation since I was travelling with a young family and wanted to be able to escape the hectic Strip and have plenty of space in our room to relax in. The suite was amazing-huge in size and really well equiped and spotlessly clean.It ticked all the boxes ! The staff went out of their way to please us and I would especially like to mention-Fred,who served us a great breakfast each day ! The location was approx a 10 minute stroll to The Strip(Ballys) and was a peaceful escape after our busy days out and about! I will not hesitate to recommend the Platinum to friends,family and customers at work. Thanks Platinum Hotel for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: adotan
Reviews.Content: This off strip hotel in Vegas is peaceful and quiet, the service is amazing. Mary was outstanding, she gave us great tips and a warm check in. The room is huge, newly decorated and very well equipped. We enjoy staying in the hotel and for sure we would highly recommend this hotel!! A.D. from Israel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if traveling in Vegas with kids or non-gamblers”
Reviews.Author: ocsummerfun
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Vegas with my husband and 2 daughters: one tween and one teen. The room was GREAT! Full kitchen, large bathroom, balcony overlooking the mountains and the strip. They seemed a little short staffed but everyone was VERY accomodating and went out of their way to be helpful. I liked that it was a non-smoking, non casino hotel. Very nice pool area (combo of indoor and outdoor). Free valet parking. Fantastic fitness center. It's a block from the strip (a long block). We walked it all the time but I probably wouldn't walk it really late at night. Easy enough to grab a cab from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “boutique quality and service at reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: tahoetom
Reviews.Content: I attended a seminar in this fantastic hotel. The suites are large and well appointed.It has a nice woody feel in the decor.Staff over-the-top friendly. Good food, nice spa and pool, and convenient location.If you want to escape the noise and senseless high prices of Vegas, this is your place.The room rates are a flat out bargain for what you get: a suite bigger than most apartments. After disappointing experiences in other over priced and over glitzy Vegas hotels, this is the only place I will stay from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Saltchucky
Reviews.Content: My trip to Vegas started with a travel offer I came across on the internet while researching accommodations. I had never heard of the hotel, however I had been looking at the MGM Signature and found the Platinum’s description to be superior. I decided to take a chance and booked the hotel looking forward to St. Paddy’s day week and hopefully a fantastic time.I was not disappointed. We rented a car at the airport and drove to the hotel a little worn out from the long trip. The portable GPS we brought with us made finding the Platinum a snap. Coming down Las Vegas Blvd from the south it’s just behind Bally’s and a couple of blocks from the strip. It’s a very convenient location actually. Far enough from the strip to be away from the large crowds and noise, but close enough to access it quite easily. A monorail station is located in Bally’s which can take you as far as the MGM Grand and the Deuce bus stops in front of the Flamingo nearby.When we drove up the valets were there right away. They were super efficient and polite and made an effort to learn our names. Whenever we needed our car it only took moments for one of the valets to retrieve it. We never had to wait long even during the busy times.The front desk clerk was very friendly and polite and upon learning it was my birthday the following day, upgraded us to an amazing suite with a stripview on the 17th floor. We were very grateful as it was an amazing suite. Our first morning we noticed that there were no bathrobes in the bathroom , so I let the front desk know and they assured me that someone would put them in the room later on in the day. We were on our way out to drive to the Grand Canyon. On our arrival back that night, the bathrobes had indeed been brought up as promised.In my opinion the reality was even better than I had expected. We opened the door to a 1150 sq ft one bedroom suite on the top floor which overlooked the pool and the casinos along the strip. The suite was supplied with an oversize whirlpool tub, king bed, 42” plasma TV in the living room and a smaller TV in the bedroom. It also had a washer and dryer with soap and fabric softener supplied. A stainless steel fridge with an icemaker and a stove with oven dominated the kitchen. Past the granite countertops were a microwave oven and all the kitchen utensils necessary to eat and drink with. The bathroom in addition to the enormous tub also sported a glass enclosed granite shower, two sinks and a separate closet. The other closet was located in the bedroom. The Platinum has a pool on the fifth floor which was adequate for the number of guests staying at the hotel at the time. The pool staff were very helpful and attentive and the Kil@wat restaurant offered great value and quality for the price. We had the chicken pesto burger with fries which was delicious. A convenience store right next door to the Platinum sold beer which we could enjoy cold in our room and Elis Island close-by has a pizza place that makes a perfect pizza for those late nights when most of the restaurants have closed in the casinos. It also has a microbrewery and cheap beer. I noticed a lot of locals frequenting the place.The atmosphere and friendliness of the staff at the platinum made our stay there a pleasure. It was a perfect retreat from the craziness of the strip at the end of the day and a wonderful environment to unwind in. We would stay there again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: wishicouldgonow
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice and large. The service was outstanding!!! Everyone was friendly and helpful (front desk, valets, maintenance). I look forward to coming back to Vegas and staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: korfitness
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and 2 kids. The first thing, from the onset was the service from the bell, valet, and staff. Very warm and friendly. The weather was a bit cold, but the indoor pool hit the spot. The water wasn't really that warm, but was warm enough. The breakfast was inexpensive and we enjoyed the hostess, Cecilia. She was very sweet and helpful. The valet is very nice and really tried to memorize my name. We went in and out, and tipped the valet and everytime, they remembered my name. They made it personal. The hotel was clean and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Juliana049
Reviews.Content: It's a great place to stay away from the maddening croud of the strip. It was just a fresh air feeling as soon as you enter the lobby. I enjoyed being in an environmentally friendly place. Being one block away from the strip, made it more enjoyable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Eclectic_Grammie
Reviews.Content: From the moment we approached the front desk to the time we checked out we had a great experience at the Platinum Hotel. It was wonderful to have so many dining options. We had a special meal in the suite, a catered meal for extended family and were able to go to the fridge for veggies and snacks instead of roaming the halls looking for pop and the ice machine. The suites are very well appointed and are large enough to entertain. We appreciated that the bedroom had a door since most accomodations advertised as "suites" are really one room. It is the nicest place we've every stayed.

Reviews.Title: “most incredible room ever!”
Reviews.Author: peachy6500
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed recently at the Platinum and it was one of the most incredible experiences l have had. First let me say the room was amazing...it was a beautiful suite with all the luxories. What l liked most was the fact it was just off the strip so you didn't get all the noise but it was close enough you could walk anywhere. The staff and valet were awesome, so friendly and most helpful. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel and l would diffently stay here again if l was to visit vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: medler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Platinum Hotel for the weekend. We were celebrating a friend's 40th birthday...from the meet and greet, the amazing room to brunch in the cafe...my expectations were far exceeded! I can't wait to go back! Amanda Meddock

Reviews.Title: “I Flatened Them at the Platinum”
Reviews.Author: WestCoast45
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled with my buddies to Las Vegas for the NCAA tournament. Upon arrival, the staff at the Platinum treated us great. The reception/check-in process was pleasant, professional and efficient. As for the rooms, we really couldn't believe that they were so nice (and big)! The rooms are basically like condominiums -- complete with a full kitchen and living areas to comfortably eat. There is a giant flatscreen over the fireplace so you can watch movies or the game. The bathrooms are new construction with granite, great showers and a huge spa tub. Our rooms looked over the pool and hot tub on the fifth floor below - which looked great but we didn't use it because we were too busy betting on the tournament. Because of the space, the Platinum would be a perfect place to hang out with a large group of friends or bring your kids. Having a working kitchen (with plates, cookware, glasses and everything else included) really provides flexibility for your group. The location is about a five to six minute walk to the heart of the strip. If you are worried about this being an issue - you shouldn't be. We grabbed a drink at the store next door and walked to the casinos with no problem. You can't beat this hotel and I can't wait to come back next year. Oh yeah, the work out room is free and the equipment is new. There are plenty of treadmills and weight machines. A great hotel with great service and a great price. What else do you need? I am coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great food all Over the Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: showwtime
Reviews.Content: I had the honor to stay at the platinum Hotel and Spa just last week. We had a 3 day trainig and that required us to be in doors all day long. Luckyly, the accomodations and food were absolutely outsanding! I love food and from breakfast to dinner, from tresentation to taste ware absolutely 10 Stars ot of 10! The rooms were much more comfortable than any hotel room I have ever had in Vegas and the short, almost refresshing walk to the strip was no more than a minute. It was nice to retire from the noise and constant action of the strip to my quiet, fresh and very modern room, just a minute walk away. The hotel staff were the nicest and the banquet servers made us feel welcome from sunrise to sunset. Great job All!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: djpotts
Reviews.Content: Everything a traveler requires in one conveinent location. Exceptional service and large elegant suites.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel amidst the clutter in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TravelsalotMa
Reviews.Content: I really loved my stay at the Platinum Hotel especially since I was looking for a non-smoking location that was easy in-and-out. Valet Parking - Staying for business training in Las Vegas can be a hassle if you stay elsewhere and have a car, but the quick and efficient complimentary valet parking was a key asset to this hotel. The men were courteous, helpful and never expected a tip although I did anyway since they truly hustled to get your car and keep the patrons moving. Thank you Donn and Julian for excellent service. Hotel - Clean and well maintained. None of the room service remnants in the halls like you see at so many other places. There was night roadwork going on in the front of the hotel during my stay so that was a bit distracting since the hotel itself is very quiet on the floors. The room was extremely spacious and I loved being able to sit on the balcony in the evenings to people watch and get some fresh air. The kitchen was very well appointed and I felt guilty not using it, but it would be great for a family to save some money by eating in here. This is actually a perfect hotel for families with no smoking, no gambling and plenty of room space. Location - Very easy access on the corner of Koval and E Flamingo Road but it is a bit of a walk to the strip as a solo female and I did not feel safe doing so alone and elected to drive up to the strip and park in self-park at various hotels to walk around there. When I go back I would ask for a room on the side facing Koval/Strip side if on the lower levels since the lower levels on E Flamingo face the electric substation which is not such a great view and more street noise. Otherwise the view from probably 5th floor and above would be comparable from anywhere I would think. Pool/Hot Tub - Loved this setup with the indoor/outdoor heated pool surrounded by comfortable lounge seats and couched seating areas surrounding fire pits. Plenty of places to stretch out. Very clean and warm even for March which still has cold nights. The hot tub was well maintained and clean as well with some seriously powerful jets and plenty of space for sitting and meeting new people. Would have liked to have seen the waitress more often and have her actually acknowledge me on at least one pass by my chair. When I finally hailed her to order a drink she forgot about me and a gentleman in the hot tub had to remind her about my order. Not too impressed with the wait staff up at the pool, more interested in the large groups of "men" than actually attending to patrons. Restaurant/Bar - Thank you to bartender Dale at Stir for great service and keeping the quiet bar interesting in conversation on St. Patty's Day. The food was presented well and served with a smile but it was only OK and nothing to write home about for dinner. Did love the creme brulee for dessert though! Breakfasts were very good at Kilawat and the hostess was perfect for the job, very friendly and inviting. Well Spa - Yep, I took advantage of everything this hotel had to offer and really loved the Spa for a 50 minute Swedish Massage. Tracey did an excellent job and the whole experience was very relaxing. Would have liked to have spent more time to enjoy the steam room and lounge area but ran out of time that day. My only change would be to remove the piano soundtrack from the massage rooms, each time that set of songs cycled through it built up such a crescendo in the music that it was not necessarily restful, although the other tracks were very pleasant. Overall it was my favorite hotel experience in Las Vegas. If you are looking for something well appointed and not a haven for Spring Break raucousness than this is the place for you. If you are looking to be a party animal and rock out at your hotel, there are plenty of other choices to consider elsewhere. For business travelers, couples looking to enjoy the strip but have a relaxing hotel to rest or a family looking to have space then this is the right spot. I will definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: teamcolumbus
Reviews.Content: I planned a 40th birthday for my best friend and stayed at the Platnium Hotel. I love this hotel! I have already booked a retrun trip. The rooms are amazing, they all have suites with beautiful kitchen's and huge bathrooms! A balcony that you can sit on in the morning and have coffee either looking at the mountains or the strip or at night with a glass of wine while you watch the lights. The Spa is both reasonably priced and top notch. The staff is friendly, curtious and willing to do what ever you need for a great stay. The pool is quite and relaxing. Just steps from the strip you can enjoy the best of both worlds in Vegas. I really felt like a princess in the princess suite!

Reviews.Title: “great non-smoking hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: sandysal
Reviews.Content: great staff, lovely property. NO STINKING CIGARETTE SMELL. I don't care how big the HVAC systems are all the casino hotels still stink of cigarettes. this property doesn't.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: bbshop
Reviews.Content: Our hotel was GREAT! ROOM: First off.. when you walk in it smells clean (always a good sign). The kitchen is State of the Art, complete with a compact dish washer. The living room is comfortable and the flat screen TV is very nice. The weather was iffy in March when we were there so having the balcony to walk out on daily to check the temps and get some fresh air was well utilized. The beds are very comfortable. The bathroom has a HUGE two person whirlpool tub, which after walking almost a marathon daily on the strip was a nice perk to come home too to sooth your weary bones. The shower is very nicely appointed and roomy with a "rain" style showerhead. Blow Dryers are supplied but are kept in the closet in the bathroom (there are TWO closest one in the bathroom, one in the bedroom, so the husband and I did not have to share... nice!). We mentioned on check in that we were celebrating our Anniversary and got a very nice card from the staff and bonus surprise. The only negative was a couple of stains in the lviingroom carpet and some wear on the wallpaper beneath the TV in the livingroom - we were in room #514 which was at the end of a hallway and VERY quiet. We had a mountain view (not strip) and this didn't really matter to us or make a big difference. GYM: I used the gym one day (state of the art) a good selection of equipment and four flat screen TV's to choose from for your viewing pleasure. POOL: We were the only people in the pool and hot tub the one day we took advantage of it (our pool is heated and is 1/2 indoors, unlike most of the strip hotels which only have outdoor unheated pools and are not open this time of year). MANAGER RECEPTION: They had a Manager's reception on Wednesday night with free cocktails and appetizers (scallops wrapped in bacon among other items). Martin van der Laan the Manager and his Sales Manager were there and spent quite some time chatting with us, gave us a tour of the Spa (very nice - but we ran out of time to utilize it) and were very accomodating. They take customer service VERY seriously. RESTAURANT: Unfortunately we did not try the Restaurant or the Lounge off the lobby so we cannot comment. We would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “My top pick in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RoySandlapper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a Solitare Suite with Strip view one night, then returned the next week for four nights in a Princess Suite with Strip view. Both suites are one bedroom condos with full kitchens, separate showers and two person jetted tubs. The only significant difference is that the Princess Suite has a washer and dryer (the hotel provides soap and fabric softener). Everything about this hotel is first class, but it is quite affordable. Indoor-outdoor pool, breakfast/lunch restaurant, affordable room service, exercise room, spa, and a bar/lounge on the first floor with very good 1/2 price appetizers from 5-7. Manager's reception on Wednesday. It is a 5 minute walk to the tram station in Bally's; 10 minutes to the middle of the Strip. There is no casino in the hotel, but there is one around the corner at Ellis Island, which also has two very good, inexpensive restaurants, as other reviewers have mentioned. In fact, TripAdvisor reviews of Ellis Island place it in the top 20 restaurants in Vegas. The hotel is especially convenient if you have a car. Rental cars in Vegas cost less than we would have spent on taxis or the tram ($13 a day per person), and almost everywhere in Vegas has free self-parking available. Some reviewers have complained about the mandatory complimentary valet parking. I asked why self-parking was not an option and was told that the parking garage has sharp turns that some people would find difficult to navigate. Our experience with the valets was very positive. On the Saturday night before St. Patrick's Day, the hotel was packed and everybody seemed to be going or coming at the same time. The valets fell a little behind then, but otherwise they were available and fast whenever we needed them. They did not seem to be looking for tips, but they did appreciate it when they were given. One suggestion. We paid a little more for Strip view rooms, which was nice, but if I was going to be there in hot weather, I would opt for the other side to have shade, rather than sun on the balcony in the afternoon. If you want sun, you can get all you want at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Restful, enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinItsy
Reviews.Content: We are just completing a 4 night stay at the Platinum Hotel. We checked TripAdvisor reviews before making the arrangements. We are a considerably hard to please average income family. With that said, we have not been disappointed with the choice. We found the staff to be helpful and friendly. Instead of blowing you off, they followed through with seeing that things got done right to make the stay special. The rooms were clean and comfortable, easy to move around in given the extra space. They are tastefully decorated, no unusual wear. The bathroom was great. The washer/dryer was a nice perk. We bought some food at the grocery store and ate breakfast in the room, sandwiches and snacks,etc. It was nice to sit down after walking a lot, watch a nice flat screen t.v., rest and eat a snack. Even though the parking was valet only, it actually was kind of nice having them take care of the car. You can't expect everything to be perfect, but the staff went above and beyond to try to be accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas' Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: kumtux
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay at The Platinum and I am almost reluctant to brag about the property for fear that it will become noisy, crowded and run down. I have always like this place, but the staff were notably friendlier, rates were great, breakfast at Kilowatt was an outstandng value, and Well Spa maintained its fine reputation. I have no complaints! What a great escape from the madness of The Strip. I rented a car this year and never had to wait 10 seconds for valet service coming in or out! This place is first class all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Great Meeting!”
Reviews.Author: LindaMks
Reviews.Content: Our group loved this non-smoking, all-suite property. The meeting space was great with windows that faced the Strip. The food was good. The suites were very spacious with amazing showers. The staff was pleasant to work with and eager to please. Central location and easy walk to the strip. I would definitely recommend The Platinum for a business meeting or for a pleasure stay.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE and gorgeous suites with high-end kitchens”
Reviews.Author: glamour_bunny
Reviews.Content: I am a well-traveled individual with expensive taste and the only hotel room I have ever stayed in that surpassed my suite at the Platinum is the Westin in Valencia, Spain ($600+ a night). The suite was absolute ENORMOUS and slept 6 girls comfortably with three queen beds (two in the bedroom and one in the living room). Balcony with table and chairs was great for pre-gaming our nights out (complete with a beautiful sunset over the mountains). Bathroom also was HUGE with a shower and a jacuzzi tub (that three girls fit in comfortably at once... but that is another story) AND a separate shower, as well as a two sinks with a huge mirror... it was very easy for all six of us to get ready at the same time. Kitchen was huge (big double door refrigerator with ice machine, full sized oven, silverware and stemware for 4) and had a nice bar with stools. The room initially only had enough towels for four people, but housekeeping quickly brought us three more as soon as we asked. The restaurant in the lobby does 1/2 off drinks and appetizers from 5-7 every night. Three of us each had 2 vodka tonics, one meal, and we shared 1 appetizer... I paid a total of $14 not including tip! Grocery and liquor store was a quick cab ride away which was great for stocking up on food to save money all week. Pool area is very classy, quiet, and well-kept. Overall, the hotel surpassed all of my expectation and is just far enough off the strip so that you hear absolute nothing! We didn't even hear the other guests for the duration of our stay. A+ all around.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Vegas experience I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: brisbanemac
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel as terrible because my experience was nothing like those listed here. Upon review of the site I decided that the Platinum sounded like the great spot for my wife and I to stay during a recent trip to the states for a conference I was attending. I had made a reservation for one king however at check in was told none were available and we could move the next day but had to take two queens for the first few days. Breakfast service through the restaurant and room services was extremely slow and at times no one was around but they still expected a tip at the end of the meal. Fitness center is nice but several machines were broken during our stay. Valet parking is nice and free but get ready to tip, every time you take your car out. On one night our heater went out and when we tried to call the front desk no one answered the phone for ten minutes and it took almost two hours for someone to come to the room and fix the problem. At check out our card was charged a wrong amount and two weeks later were still trying to get someone from the hotel to respond to our request for assistance to get it fixed. Overall, just a terrible experience for the week we stayed and had I not prepaid for the reservation prior to arrival we would have surely moved to another location with better service and standards.

Reviews.Title: “I came back!”
Reviews.Author: al4175
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2009 and without hesitation stayed here again for 5 nights this February. Great location, easy in and out if you have a rental car. Walked over to Hard Rock, Tuscany, and Ballys when I wanted to gamble or enjoy an off property meal. Fully equipped kitchen, stopped by a grocery and liquor store and stocked up on a few items. Convenient and saved some money. Nice having the in-room coffee maker in the morning. Dishwasher and washer/dryer a nice touch. All the rooms are large as well as the balcony. This trip was a little cool and damp overall so didn't get to enjoy the balcony much. Two double beds with comfortable bedding. Large bath and really enjoyed the jetted tub. Staff was very pleasant and professional. Got to meet a couple of the sales and marketing folks at the Wednesday manager's reception. Nice touch. Only thing that slightly bothered me slightly was that the valet was inconstent at times in terms of waiting and I rarely saw the same gentlemen (or lady in one case) on consecutive days. Even though I recognized one fellow from last year it just seemed like they don't do many shifts so you don't build up as much of a personal interaction. Anyways, definitely looking forward to staying here again. It is a tremendous bargain when compared to the likes of Signature.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get a better or more personal service, just amazing”
Reviews.Author: Missyparrot25
Reviews.Content: I have visited Las Vegas on 9 occasions and stayed at the Platinum for the first time this visit. Out of all the hotels that i have sampled the Platinum has really is a market leader & has set a great example. This hotel has really got a lot to offer and the staff go the extra mile to offer a fantastic service. A quiet, non casino hotel, just off the strip, with an image of sophistication and calmness. A hidden gem away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. The heated indoor and outdoor pool never closed unlike many of the casino hotels, and the hotel bar Stir has great deals on and is quite busy. The room was really spacious and the tub was great! We had a fabulous holiday at the really affordable, and enjoyable hotel and would like to thank the staff for a great stay in which they made us feel really welcome. Thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Best View of Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: lel737
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels in Las Vegas, The Platinum Hotel and Spa has been the best so far. Would recommend as a leisure / romantic hotel stay. Short walk from strip results in a beautiful view from the balcony. Suites are reasonably priced and resemble an apartment with full size everything.

Reviews.Title: “The Platinum staff were outstanding and the service was exceptional !”
Reviews.Author: 666sue
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Platinum was extremely satisfying, relaxing and a pure enjoyment. The Platinum team really knew how to make us feel special, from the Valet who always remembered our names to the super efficient front desk agents who were always friendly and offered up to date information and assistance. No request was too much to ask, the Front Desk manager made sure of that, she always took time to speak to us and offer us suggestions for dinner, nightclubs etc. Happy hour at the Platinum Bar - Stir was great. The bar was quite busy but not rowdy and the half price drinks and appetisers got us into a fab mood! The room was really spacious & clean with a balcony with views of the pool and the Las Vegas Strip. Housekeeping were very efficient, when we asked for extra linens and towels they were with us within 5-10 minutes, and we received a follow up phonecall to ensure that our needs had been met. We have stayed at many Vegas hotels, but this sort of exceptional service really makes the Platinum stand out for us. We will definitely be going back !

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Tansz
Reviews.Content: I originally planned to stay at the Trump Towers for my visit to Las Vegas. However, the reviews were too inconsistant. I noticed the Platinum on the hot sheet for Travelzoo, and decided to try it out. They offered the same rate (minus the resort fee of $15 per night), the Platinum is better located, and the suites were twice the size. The Platinum was also offering a $99 per night rate. I will always book the Platinum! The hotel is gorgeous for one thing. The front desk staff (esp. Mary) was very friendly. We were upgraded to a Princess suite with a strip view upon arrival. The room was spotless! I am SUPER picky, and I was totally impressed! I have travelled all over the world, and this was the cleanest hotel room I have ever stayed in! The princess suite is over 1000 sq. ft., we had two comfy queen beds, a huge living room area, a spotless kitchen (included utensils, dishes, coffee pot, towels, stove, and a dishwasher). We had a huge flat screen TV in the living room, a big one in the bedroom, a nice balcony, and a Bose stereo! The bathroom was flawless! So clean, with marble, and a seperate spa tub! They offer a good happy hour in the Stir lounge on the first floor. Great prices and food (esp. the spinach and artichoke dip). There was a minus at Stir. The waitress was very nice, but clueless about cocktails. They appeared to be short staffed in this area. I tried to book a last minute massage, but they were booked up. They only offer spa service from 9-5 Thursday-Sunday. There is only valet parking. They were fast and courteous. A cab ride to the strip was about 7-10 dollars depending on traffic. I will ALWAYS book the Platinum when visiting Vegas! It is a great place for families, friends, or singles. Close to the action, but a quiet oasis to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “I Knew I Made the Right Choice”
Reviews.Author: KaneTheUndertaker
Reviews.Content: In Picking a place to stay for our trip to Las Vegas we looked at many hotels and nearly booked with MGM Signature, But at the last moment this place caught my eye and it had excellent reviews, So i went ahead and booked a Princess Suite with Strip View, From the moment we arrived we were treated as 1st class guests. Its really nice as you have a 15 hour flight from Sydney, The staff were very professional and friendly, Nothing was too much for them, As for the room, If you are going to Vegas stay here!! The Room is outstanding, We had a kitchen, A Beautiful bathroom with huge tub, A Great bedroom with TV, The living room is outstanding with Huge TV and seats and the patio with awesome strip view with the Nevada Mountains in the background. I have noticed alot of people complained about the walk to the strip, Im telling you here and now its nothing at all, You just walk up into Ballys enter from the back and walk thru to Paris and your there on the Strip in under 5 minutes. The Place is really good, No Waits, Friendly staff and Excellent rooms, I will only stay here when i return to Beautiful Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Simply AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Storm_Chasers
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay on the strip, but when traveling to Las Vegas with your 5 year old - that is not usually the best option. After reading through reviews about hotels off the strip, the Platinum Hotel & Spa immediately caught our eye! Could all these fantastic reviews be true? YES!!!!!! From the moment we checked in, we were greated with smiles and excellent service! Mary checked us into our room and right away started chatting with our daughter. Our daughter told Mary that she was a real princess, and that name stuck during our 3 night stay. Everytime we crossed the lobby, Mary waved and said, "Hello, princess!"
